column4: What a treat to be able to escape the bustle of traffic and city noises, a short hop away. Just take the Toronto Island ferry at the Toronto harbor and enjoy the serenity of the lovely lagoons and greenery of Toronto's Islands.
We rented bikes and biked around the island for an afternoon. Great views of the city from the island. It is very quaint. Beautiful cottages and beaches.
I tell visitors to Toronto that is the best of the city. The gardens are well kept and you can walk or cycle. A real pleasure

After many business trips to Toronto that I had stated I would visit, I finally took the time to visit. To be honest, I did not prepare well. Next time I will take a bike and also a backpack with food to have a sunset dinner pick nick.But even with prepartation, I had a great time. On the way...
A great place to spend some free time during the summer. It's OK all year round, too, but during the summer it's bursting with life and fun!

Just a short ferry ride (10 minutes) from the hustle and bustle of the city are Toronto's 3 Islands - Hanlon's Point..a rustic green space featuring beaches, plenty of walking and cycling paths and a well hidden nude beach. Centre Island is very family oriented with a small and charming amusement park, petting zoo, snack bars and picnic areas. Ward's...

A good place to get away from cars and crowds. There is a lot of green area to sit around, read a book or play some games, bike (can rent on island too), take some beautiful pictures of Toronto skyline. Some very important tips:1. Go during summer. Fall and Winter can get very cold and windy. We went in...
Wonderful place to visit for the day in the summer This is a place for families and couples. There are places to sit on the beach and rentals for boats

Not gonna lie, we picked the wrong time of year to come to Toronto; it was bitterly cold and windy. But even though almost everything on the islands is closed in the winter, it's still completely worth it to ride the Wards Island ferry--nowhere else can you get such a spectacular view of the iconic Toronto skyline!

Great place to spend the whole day. You begin with purchasing your ticket and boarding the ferry. A short ferry ride brings you to the three islands. Bring your bikes bring your strollers bring your picnic baskets. Petting zoo bike trails and amusement park or just a few of the many things to experience.
Great family and couples picnic location. Ideal spot for active young couples. Very peaceful location to relax and reflect. Captures Toronto's shore line

My husband and I first visited the Islands at Easter, when there were absolutely no facilities open, so it was only possible to walk around. I therefore recommend, especially if you have family, to visit in the Summer when it's warm and everything is open. It is still a very beautiful place whenever you visit though, with amazing views back...

The Islands is a break away from the commotion of the city. I usually stand on the back deck of the ferry just to watch the city recede and feel the promise of a separate peace whether you're alone or in company. It's also the best place to observe the Toronto skyline especially towards the end of the day when...

On a nice summer day Toronto Islands are a walkers dream. There are 3 basic "islands' all joined by one continuous strip of land. You can take a fairy ride to any of the 3 islands and then walk across to the either another island or all of them.The fairies get busy in the summer, so the earlier you...
This was a great trip over on the ferry and although there's not a lot open on the island in the winter it's still very pretty and well worth a visit.
We met as a group here for a picnic. Just a few of us decided to do this but it soon became a big group picnic.It was fun and I will recommend this to everyone
Marvelous place to visit in all seasons. Forecast 1 day at least to visit each attraction. Take some good shoes to walk all around the islands. Nice people to meet.
In Toronto Island I have seen one of the most beautiful sunset, all the experience was amazing, the ferry, walking around the Island, Toronto view.. and of course the SUNSET.

We visited off peak in a very cold March. As such the islands were effectively closed and people were few and far between. Either way we walked around almost all of the islands and could clearly see there would lots to do in Summer.Recommended to visited and you will get great views of the city once there.

It is a beautiful place which lack maintenance. Garden can be beautified. More adult spaces. Bikes are easy to rent; takes half an hour on the bike to tour the island. If you are a picky eater like me, bring your own food. Bring a hat and a towel to relax. Summer can be very hot in Toronto. There is...
toronto is a great place and this island is a great place to hang out with your kids or someone you love

The Islands are a mini escape. Take a boat, disembark, bike the carless roads under tree canopies, stop for an espresso or a beer, relax on the sandy beach watching the rippling waves or gaze at the skyline. Best summer excursion in the City.

We are fortunate to have a boat, that allows us virtually every weekend to tour the inlets around the Toronto Islands. Its a great place to check out. Children have a great time at Centreville....ok adults can enjoy it as well. The island is huge and is great for cycling, walking, picnicking, etc. The south side of the island has...
Excellent place for a day trip with family or friends.Take lots of food, drinks and enjoy whole day.It has ferry travel, beach and gardens for enjoyment.Places for kids are also plenty.

While living and working in the 1970's Toronto, long hours and weeks in the animation industry, we were occasionally lucky enough to escape, by ferry, to Centre Island to feed the ducks and try to avoid those damned domestic geese.The contrast of sitting and drawing hour after hour versus tossing corn and running frantically from those attacking birds from hell,...

With all that there is to see and do in Toronto, some visitors might not make time for a day on the Toronto Islands. Just a 20 minute ferry ride away from the Big Smoke, you can find a serene oasis, a lovely place for a long walk or bike ride - and a great place to take your young...

A world away from the city. A short ferry ride transports you to another world. Great beaches, although the water is brisk, and fantastic facilities make a day trip worthwhile. The quirky houses, lived in year, round invite a leisurely stroll through the neighbourhood. Great views of the city afford great photos and the night view has to be seen...

Coming to Toronto and not taking a small boat trip to the islands is missing a spectacular view of the Toronto Skyline. The islands have more to offer young kids but also a break from the hustle and bustle of any big city.I recommend taking a harbor tour that stops on the island (Center Island) giving you a better...

I usually head to Toronto Islands when there is the first glimpse of good spring-like weather. Walking along the waterfront is a real treat. If you head for Wards Island or Hanlan's point you can bypass the tourist attractions. Bringing your bicycle is also a good option or renting a bike.

This trip is a wonderful way to see the best panoramic picture of Toronto! The tour goes around the small group of islands that make up Toronto's harbor so it's not a long tour. The guides are informative and the views are great!Strongly recommended!

I've visited the Toronto Islands every summer for years. It's a welcome respite from the wretched humidity that engulfs Toronto every summer. It's great to go very early in the AM. You can bike around safely. There are 3 islands -- Ward's, where residents live; Centre, where there is a zoo and a kind of fairgrounds; and Hanlan's, where there...
3 generations had a great time on the. Islands. Went in August, 2016 and will be back again this year when my grandkids are in town. Great fun for all.
Great amusement park for kids, walking around. bike rentals and beaches. Catch early ferrie to skip the lines which get big

Great place to visit for the first time, but after going over for over than 30 years and finding everything looks exactly the same every single year, it's not a great place to revisit more than a few times. Especially if your children get bored easily.
Great inner city getaway with centreville theme park a lot of park space and beach area. Lots of great picnic space and perfect for the whole family

The islands are now a large park across the harbour fromToronto. One smallish part is residential, but one can walk or bike around, and one end is a small airport. The rest is parkland - very agreeable on a summer's day, for biking or walking, and there is a beach with lifeguards (and a nude beach a bit farther out...

There's nothing like seeing Toronto from the Island. The skyline is beautiful viewed from Toronto Island and you can really escape the City in an affordable way in the heat of the summer. Maybe try a water taxi instead of the ferry. Maybe try The Rectory Cafe for a culinary treat while you are there. Maybe ride a Centreville ride....
Beautiful spot to picnic, cycle or just stroll and people watch in the summer months. Awesome views of the Toronto skyline.

10-minute ferry ride can make a world of difference with a trip to Toronto Island. The frantic pace of downtown traffic and crowded sidewalks gives way to acres of parkland, beaches and boardwalks. A couple of nice cafes offer simple but good food at pretty reasonable prices. All in all, a great way to add a relaxing vibe to your...
I love the Toronto Island. It's so totally different from the downtown Toronto core. Escaping via ferry to the Island takes you to a place that could sixty years ago when things were slowly.
Whether you are going to bike, hike, swim, read, or just literally doing nothing you will find peace in this place surrounded with their natural and artificial views amazing landscapes!

Went in winter , so everything was lovely and quite and hardly any tourists, went for a walk, round to the beach and coast, hard to believe you are so close to city! Also- fantastic views of skyline of city on ferry, definitely worth the $7.50 ticket

I love the entire experience on the island... getting there on the ferry is always fun - fantastic vantage / views of the city. I prefer to roller blade here - no cars (minus potentially the fire truck / ambulance), and very flat! The west end near Hanlan's Point is a bit bumpy (not flat pavement) but it's still fun....

Despite picking a very windy day, it was great to walk along the boardwalk and then along the paths and roadways around the island.Great views back over the city skyline and fabulous photo opportunities for the CN Tower.I can see the huge appeal for the summer months but don't deny the beauty of the Island in the other...
It was nice to go onto a ferry and goto and around the islands. A fun afternoon trip over in Toronto.

Walking or biking there are countless spots to picnic, play, have a group game of soccer or football.There are the amusements of the island centre but lots of natural places to enjoy.Swimming at the north side is lovely.If you like boats there are hundreds at the marina.
Loved the tranquil islandCost 7.50$ return via ferryWould have been better on a warmer day.Would have been better if hired a bike.Well worth a visit.
Love this place. So many different things to do. Kids can run around as there are almost no cars. Crowds can get a little crazy but once there it's all good
What a breath of fresh air to spend a day on Toronto Islands in the summer!!! You feel like you are million miles away from the city yet you can see the beautiful city scape in all its glory!!

The Island are spectacular and give you such a beautiful view of the city,but away from the hustle and bustle.Beaches were beautiful and well kept and there was cafes and restaurants too so you could spend the whole day!
It's an amazing place. You can see the sunset there and the Toronto downtown turn on. It's beautiful
Center island is my favorite, amazing skyline, great for families, solo, couples, you don't need to plan ahead, ferry run almost until night. You must watch the sun set! Want to go again!

A perfect place only a short trip away from downtown toronto. A favorite summer visit for locals and tourists. Love the 20 minutes ferry ride. Can be reached easily by public transit. Plenty of activities in the island, children love the amusement park and the petting zoo. Renting a bike and tour around the island is so relaxing. Can't ask...

Beautiful parks. Play sets and beach. The farm animal zoo is clean. Easily viewed and well stocked with adorable animals. Food for purchase available really good and Centreville a terrific amusement park surrounding a giant splashing pool. Really kid friendly!

The ferry across and the islands themselves provide very good views of Toronto. Because we went in winter, the islands were fairly deserted, but still nice to have a walk along, especially to see the lake.
A full day of sunshine and great views. A lot of space and things to do. Start and finish your day on a relaxing trip on board a ferry that takes you there.

Took the 13:30 ferry over to Ward's Island today (the only ferry across this time of year). Thought I would spend an hour having a look round. Once you get away from the ferry terminal it is remarkably peaceful and totally chilled (mean't metaphorically although there was a chilly breeze!).Ended up walking all the way round to the airport...
This was my first time visiting the islands. Its a great place to get away from the city while being in the city. They beaches are great with a lot to do from BBQs to ice cream and beer.
If you like to ride bike that can fit 6 people, other rides, just a picnic or spend time on the beach or nude beach. You can find it all on the island.

You can easily spend a full day on the Islands, and I'd say that's the best way to do it. The ferry is a nice ride, though it can be crowded, you get a great view of the city skyline. The Islands contains beaches, waterside boardwalks, a small fair ground, a farm-style petting zoo, and a frisbee-golf course. There's a...
Year round, access by ferry. However, it's more people friendly on a summer day in good weather.It's Toronto's getaway place - tourists love it too.

A fantastic meal at the Italian restaurant at the #grandparkroyalcozumel. Irene had the lasagna, we had ribeye steak cooked to perfection! The antipasti variety was great! The deserts of canolli, panacota or tiramisu and pavlova all excellent! However the banana with cinnamon syrup with banana liquor accompanied with a sweet perfectly coked Tartlet and vanilla ice cream topped with his...

I've lived near Toronto all my life but have never been to the islands as an adult. The view of the skyline was spectacular. I was in awe. We went in October on a sunny day and there was no better feeling than riding a bike to explore the island. I don't remember the exact price for rental but I...
So beautiful so stunning so much to do and see have a paddle go for walk tent bikes go to the pet farm bring a picnic or grab lunch there amazing for family's

Visiting this place in winters is as satisfying as is during summers. Quite island, scenic views, serene shore sounds along the walkway and above all, the colours in the sky around the sunset were majestic! #nofilters and #nodslr
Can start from Cherry Beach where there is free parking. It is a very nice day to bring a kayak and paddle around the islands, however need to watch the weather and the ferry boats.

Loved Ward Island. Perfect storm of beautiful weather, out of season and an early ferry made this a trip I could enjoy without many others around. I can imagine it is tourist hell when the season opens. I didn't venture much further than Centre Island which was disappointing, but Ward's Island was full of charm. Well worth the $7.50 return

Un lugar muy bonito para pasar el rato y salir de camping, brinda variedad de actividades para familias y grupos de amigos, se puede alquilar un bote o una moto acuática, tiene playa propia y es un lugar perfecto para dar una caminata.A very nice place to hang out and go camping, it offers a variety of activities for...

Been to the islands more times than I remember and always a good experience. Wish they would increase ferry service during the summer. Lots of picnic tables. Loads to see and do for adults and kids. Lots of space and amenities. Toronto skyline at night when returning to harbour is amazing
nice quite place, it is an ideal place to spend time with your family.If you are visiting toronto, you have to visit Toronto island.
Was a wonderful experience for my Granddaughter beginning with ferry ride over then rides, games and the wonderful animals ? The employees are super sweet!

It takes only minutes - 5 or 10 - to cross the harbour on a decades-old ferry. Take your bike or rent one over there....park on a beach (nude or not)...take your kids to the amusement park...take a picnic or eat a fine lunch at the waters edge at the parsonage on ward's island....You'll go back time and time...

Incredible place - it's amazing to think it is so close to the city and yet is so peaceful and (during the winter months at least) is incredibly un-crowded!The farm on the island is a must see - the staff there is very friendly.You could spend a couple of days exploring all the islands, but I'd say you...

Really beautiful place to relax and unwind with the family on a weekend. Has something for everyone. Joy rides, bicycling, tandem cycles picnic and BBQ spots too. We had a wonderful and memorable time with friends and family who were visiting.

This is perfect for whole family. There is a petting zoo and a kids amusement park along with being surrounded with beaches, paddle boats, an airport and barbecue areas.You also get a spectacular views of the city of Toronto.

Toronto Islands do not feel like part of the city, as it is so calm and quite. I found it refreshing to be there. Any visitor to Toronto must make a day's plan to visit the islands. They are so good. One of the best places to relax.
I love going to Toronto Islands. Love the Ferry Ride and it's nice to walk around and enjoy the scenery!Highly recommended!!
Lots of places to hang out, move away from the central area near the main ferry terminal to get some space and less crowds. Great beaches at Wards, Center and Hanlan's.

The islands are a quick trip across the harbour. I tend to start at one end and walk to the other end - alternating city and open water views. When there's snow, the cross-country skiing is very good. There are places to eat, but I usually take my own lunch. Swimming at the west end is very good, with broad,...

Enjoyed the ferry ride to the Islands, walked through the entire islands, visited the farm. It was so enjoyable because it was relaxing, away from the city and the rushing, Barbecues set up so you can spend the whole day,

Always a pleasure. Well kept and fun. If you want to skip the crowd you can go and relax, sit and have something to eat, visit other islands, etc. it always brings me back to my childhood d en though it looks very different from then. Just love it still.
An unusual trip to the 'countryside' just minutes on the ferry dock in Toronto harbour. Majestic view of the City once you're there.

This is truly an experience for the whole family. If you are going in the summer , don't forget your swim suit. There's a children's area called Centerville with rides and a petting zoo. Lots of places to picnic and also restaurants. You can go early in the morning and spend the day there. The kids will love the ferry...
We love to hope in the ferry with our bikes and ride the paved car less roads. There are beaches, children's area with rides and picnic areas.

Spent the afternoon there when the dragon boat races were on. Lots of room on paths for everyone to walk around. Glad we had hats to protect from sun because it got a little hot waiting in line for the ferry. There wasn't any trees or cover along the dock. Nice view of the Toronto skyline form the island.
grew up in the city and have spent a lifetime using the islands downtown, this has always been an escape from the hustle and bustle of the big smoke

Forget about car fumes and buzz of the city! A great outdoor experience, amazing views of the skyline, beautiful beaches and wonderful parks. Very well maintained environment. A must-see when you visit Toronto.
Beautiful island near Toronto. Lots of fresh air, trees, flowers and beautiful trails. It is easy to get there. The only thing we did not like is the airport.
Nude sunbathing and swimming, bring your own beverages to the beach. Centre Island fun for kids and families. Ferries run frequently but weekend line ups can be long.
Love this place ? can't wait to visit this summer. It's so much fun. The view of th city from the island always fascinates me.
You will be amazed at all there is to see here.It is a must see.You will feel so relaxed ,you can't leave Toronto with visiting here.

There will be cruise fromToronto downtown which will take you to the Toronto Islands, we went for the visit in fall which I think is the best time to visit Toronto Islands, the island was so clean and houses were beautiful and scenery were breathtaking, not sure how many people actually lives there as we were able to see only...
Fun Day on the last weekend of Summer , my 3year old son loved the Centre island train, and antique car rides

I've been to the island few times, and each time I go I discover better spots for... you need to invest tone and go around and discover your favorite spot, whether you want to chill, tan, run, read, or just walk.I would take my water and food with me because you don't many options over there
Overall good relaxing place for Sunday afternoon, need some more adventurous planning to be done by city of Toronto to make it more exciting
amazing place to visit a must see in the toronto area . It is a beautiful place for the entire family to spend time and just enjoy nature

Toronto's waterfront development has obscured it's Great Lake maritime past which is captured in one of its largest parks, the Toronto Island archipelago. Served by three ferry boats providing regular service to this interconnected chain of islands, the Toronto Islands are a waterside get-away for Torontonians and visitors alike. Sun, swim, sail, canoe, bike or walk -- enjoy the outdoors...

A great way to spend a day, esp in the summer, with young kids - playgrounds, splash pads, bike rentals, and not much to spend, but you can spend more if you want as well with the small amusement park.

There's no better way to spend a hot summer day than on Toronto's Islands. Take the ferry to one of 3 landing spots, depending on what you'd like to do. Hanlan's Point is good for swimming, walking or a picnic, Centre Island is good for children (with rides that require pre-purchased tickets) while Ward's Island is good for a quiet...

A ferry ride away takes you to some peace and serenity. Ferry toll is for a roundtrip so you dont have to worry so much and just enjoy the escape as long as you wish. Summertime is busy as it should be/very cold during winter but beautiful nonetheless! Love it there. Wards is mostly houses and centerisland is where centerville...
A great day with plenty to do. Finished exhausted at the end of our day but, that is a sign that it is a great place to spend the day with family.
Lovely open spaces beautiful landscapes and excellent view of the Toronto sky line, the ferry is very close to union station and the ferry ride is great I just wish it was a liger ride
Took a family new to Canada with kids from 5-17 yrs plus Grandmother in a wheelchair. Everyone loved it!
The Toronto Islands are beautiful and tucked away from a very bustling city. Also a great way to see the city view.

The old fisher's houses from the 30s or so, all tiny and quaint, wonderfully colourful, were refuges during the Depression. They were to be torn down, as were the substantial cottages of the wealthy on the south shore. Our visitors love the ferry ride, with its view of the city when returning, and that of the islands when approaching, and...

Very good for a day out with the family,especially with young kids and energetic children who wants to bike around the island.There is also a beach at the other end of the island from the ferry terminal.Which is good for beach activity....sunbathing,swimming etc.A little fairground to keep kids happy from the age of 3 to 10 year olds.

Not to much to do on the island, but nice view of the city...I ould like to see more attractions in there. Food quality is not too great so is better to come prepared specially if you are going with small kids

Great way to spend the day. Begins with a short ferry ride with an amazing view of the City. Enjoy the beach at Wards Island (beware this is a clothing optional beach) or spend the day on Centre Island with. Petting zoo and rides for the kids.

I visited the islands during the summer months. We had lunch on one of the islands. It was a charming afternoon. Nice place t walk around. accessed via ferry boats. Great way to spend a morning or afternoon.

Unique island park in Toronto reachable by a cool ferry across the bay.island is a mixture of amusement park open parkland wading pool and a residential neighbourhood and beaches on lake Ontario.plan on taking whole day there walking or biking picnicing

Take the Ward's Island ferry and wander the year round community of charming little cottages. Stop for a swim at the sandy beach. Eat at the Island Cafe, great drinks and food and often live music.If you have small children, take the ferry to Centre Island. There is a small collection of rides like the swans on the pond...
The beauty of Toronto is amazing. If you get tired of the city--like anyone ever could--swing over [during warm days] to the islands and take a bike tour.

Best spot in Toronto to take a break from all the hustle and bustle and get relaxed amongst natureDon't forget to bring a picnic and maybe even rent a barbecueIn addition this is the best spot day pictures of the iconic Toronto skyline
It is so wonderful to have the Toronto Islands to go to. So close yet a whole different world that is great to see in any season.
Beautiful spot to visit any time of the year.Lots of fun for the whole family.Centerville has rides for the very young.Bike rentals make it easy to explore all three of the islands.

Highly recommend a day at Centre Island if you are spending a summer day in TO with kids under 12...they have Centreville which is an adorable little theme park that has been there since the 60's...great park and swimming on the island as well!

An excellent place to visit if you are visiting Toronto! Take the ferry to the island for the day... Kids can go on rides with a day pass... Can swim at the island beach... Picnic on the island grounds! So much to do... A fun place for adults and kids! My favourite place to visit during the summer months!

Taking the ferry across to the islands is well worth it whether you live in the city or are visiting from afar. There's a great trail that connects all the islands. Note that it can get pretty busy on a summer weekend. You don't necessarily have to take the Centre Island ferry. There's always less people on the ones going...

This is a great place for tourists to visit in the summer Only a short trip over from Downtown Toronto to the Islands. Good for kids also they have a small amusement area. there is a nudest beach for those inclined but I can't rate that as I never went there
a wonderful walking day. pack a lunch and stroll along the lake shore. on a sunny day people are out on bikes, boards, and walking.

Great place for a bike ride, picnic, or beach without driving for hours out of Toronto.Do check of there are events going on at the island so as not to get caught in a pile up. The water taxi's can also be a good way to avoid the crowd.

This is a very nice place to confirmation dayntrip. Nice liesurly walks or bike rides. The water ways and shorelines are very beautiful. I wish I had have taken my snorkel equipment with me...Next time :) Would also be a nice place for canoing or kayaking. The small theme park is a little dated but we weren't there for that.

we have our Staff Day at Central Island and it was great, activities, great bbq lunch, and had a liquor license. We were catered to all food groups. A private spot was arranged. The view of the city of Toronto is amazing.
A great place to get away from the city.Nice beaches and trees, lots of green space, clean bathrooms and places to eat.Always a bit cooler in the summer months then the city!.

If you want to see the city and on water then the toronto Island is where you want to head to in the summer time. Beautiful view of the city, 15 mins ride to the island. There are 3 islands. Centre Island takes you back to the olden days rides, food, etc... wards islands and there is a nude beach...
Nice escape from the city. Great beaches and beautiful walks. Awesome skyline views as well. Make sure you go on a day with no precipitation to get the most of the islands.

I love taking visitors to the Toronto Islands in the warm weather. All Toronto, all kinds of folks, get on the ferry for the trip over. There is fun and diversion for all ages and interests. It's a great adventure and I highly recommend it to first-timers. I love the view of Toronto from the water--it gives you a unique...

Love Toronto Islands, it's so nice to get away from the hustle of the big city. The ferry ride is always fun and we like to walk to Center Island from Hanlan's point. Lots to do with the playgrounds, biking and walking trails and feeding the ducks and swans....beautiful spot where you don't have to worry about cars and other...

We visited the Toronto Islands in June 2016. The weather was pleasant. We were able to walk for several miles throughout the island. We arrived in one corner of the islands and departed from another ferry departure point. There are ample entertainment for people of all ages including children.
Visited it on lazy summer weekend, great place to walk around, bicycle around. You can get excellent view of the city from here
It's a nice place to spend the day, you can enjoy it walking through the island or just resting and reading a book in the park.

I LOVE the islands! My favourite thing to do is take my bike to Ward's Island and make my way to Hanlan's Point on one of several paths. Ward's Island is magical, with it's quaint cottages and terrific views of the city. The Rectory Cafe is probably the best place to stop on the island for food or drink, if...
Great place for some family fun. Lots of green, playgrounds, a little amusement park for the young ones. It is well worth the time spent and A must visit.
Great for family activities, and to bring your dogs to play on the beach. Also the little cafe here has really great food

Definitely a must see/do if you would like to escape the crowds and go for a walk while enjoying the view. It can get quite busy on weekends if you don't get the ferry before 11am, so try to get there early and take the ferry to Ward's Island, it has a small beach and is near the cafe which...

Toronto is a great dining, shopping and theater city but if you need a few hours of tranquility in a natural setting visit the Toronto Islands. A short ferry ride from the city they have fun venues for kids, restaurants and beaches, however, check water quality before diving in. Lake Ontario beaches often get closed for high bacteria levels on...

Really pleased we visited for skyline views and to see a more arty and quiet way of living so close to the city. A lovely insight. Great walking and on the other side of the island you feel like you are so far away from the city. Lovely. Enjoyed the rectory café too.

The Toronto Islands are another great reason to visit Toronto! Beautiful beaches and one nude one as well (Hanlan's Point). Good for parties, family trips (center island), water activities, biking riding, boat tours around islands....there's so much to do! Love the islands.
An amazing and inspiring place to go with friends or family. Enjoy a barbecue by the lake while you play volleyball. You can spend the whole day there.

column3: Washington Dc, District Of Columbia, Usa
column4: The only ferry running in winter goes to Ward's Island which I believe is the residential area, however don't let that put you off. It was incredibly beautiful and silent. An absolutely stunning day.
We were able to catch one of the last rides on a ferry and witnessed one of the most beautiful sunsets ever. It was a blissful evening and just watching the sun fall behind the city was mesmerizing.

Love visiting the islands, but on a non-event day. Any concert or run (ahem the Nike run) and you can wait hours to board ferries. I usually opt to grab the ferry to wards island and take the centreville ferry back as they run more frequently. Love visiting the restaurant on Ward's and spending time at the beach. Looking forward...

The Toronto Islands are a break from the city. The air is cleaner and fresher.Centerville is especially for young kids. The rides are safe. The bumper cars are a blast. There is a splash pad to cool off in.It's cheaper if you get the all day play band. There are some rides for toddlers. Far away farm introduces...

Centre Island has some of the best beaches in Toronto! Be sure to pack a picnic because the food on the island is overpriced and not very good.Pro-tip: Go to St.Lawrence Market first to pick up some food before heading over to the Island!You can rent regular bikes, tandem bikes, and quadracycles (4 people) bikes on Centre Island....

The ferry terminal is a bit of a civic embarrassment - which we're working to change. The boats are nice and afford great views of the ever-changing skyline. They can be very crowded on summer weekends and holidays. If you're not on a tight budget consider a water taxi - at the shore just west of the docks - fare...

Couldnt believe these islands existed only for we were being brought around by a local. I was visiting friends and wouldnt be a huge city type of person so it was amazing that i could get a small boat journey out to the Islands and completely relax. There are park benches around the Island to sit on and enjoy the...

I live in Toronto and have been to the Islands many times. Your best bet for a nice trip out is to go to Wards Island. Centre Island is the amusement park but unless you have kids it is not really worth it as it is mainly a children's amusement park.If you walk down Oneida Ave to Seneca Ave...

Yes you have to take a ferry over. Yes the lines can be long. Get there early if you want to make it a full day trip.This park is beautiful and amazing for spending a nice sunny day with friends or family. Many open spaces, a beach and swimming for summer days, frisbee golf course, amusement park, a farm,...

If you have the time and like the outdoors, no visitor to Toronto should skip a ferry ride and a day on Toronto Islands. It can be very crowded on weekends as locals from within the city and the surrounding area love it too but many families tend to congregate specifically at Centre Island. When you arrive at the ferry...

Toronto island is a great place to visit and spend the whole day with your family or friends, you can bbq or take your own food I believe you can find fast food restaurant there. It's a great place to go cycling or do other activities, you can take the ferry there but be aware that on holidays it's very...
A pleasant idyllic settings at the south of Toronto. Pleasant but short ride from the docks to the Islands. Nice just to sit and view the Toronto skyline. There are activities for the kids.
It was really nice to go and check out the TO islands. Easy to get to and inexpensive. Beautiful scenery and a great view of Downtown Toronto.
Lines for the ferry were HUUUUGE, but the islands were beautiful. Loved the maze!!! Felt like kids again. Good picnic spot
The island is great for family, friends or lovers. It offers great food stands and a diverse culture for the people watchers out there.
Serene, peaceful and absolutely breathtaking... Many activities for all ages, and most of all a unique and calming experience

Get away from the city in the city, beach after beach, swimming, gardens, great shade from large trees, rectory cafe, beautiful city views at dusk, electric island and other music events, enough said, get there this summer!!
What a place. Beautiful. We spent a sunny sunday over there it was great. You dont get tired of walking. Ideal of picnics with a great view of Toronto skyline and great outdoor place
I took a hop on hop off bus which took me around the city unlimited rides for 2 days, one free boat tour either day will be included into the fare, with your guide on the boat

The 4 of us packed blankets, towels, balls and a basket full of great food and drinks. Left early parked close and walked to the Ferry, decided to take a water taxi which was so much fun, it was like our own boat!! Once we got to the Island we figured out where we wanted to set up which was...
Absolutely beautiful, and it has a great little restaurant called The Rectory Cafe. Easily one of the best patios in the city

Even for locals!This is a fun outing to"get out of the city" so to speak! Catch the Ferry from Toronto heading to WARD Island & plan to have lunch or dinner at the Refectory Cafe. They have great outdoor garden space as well as indoor if it rains. The menu has very good choices. After the meal from their...

Great place to ride your bike, take walk, rent a boat. Easily accessed by the ferry. Great with little kids or couples finding a little respite from the hustle and bustle. I even sent my kids to camp there at the YMCA Toronto Island Camp and they loved it. Cannot miss if you are passing through, its our Central park!

Get out of the city without leaving. Toronto island is as good as it gets. Find a spot on the beach or private place to picnic with great view of the city.Best place to watch the air show in September!

Absolutely beautiful. Makes you feel as if you've left the town far behind... Lots of fun and things to please different people of different ages and walks of life.The cafes are quite a treat... the beaches nice and clean

My husband and I love biking.one of our biking destination every year is in Toronto Islands. We bring our own bike to go around the island, but then you can rent a bike in your own choice, single, double....Very relaxing place especially if you are a nature lover.

Toronto Island is an oasis a short distance from downtown Toronto. There are beaches, trails, a children's amusement park, bike rentals, and restaurants available. The view of the city skyline is incredible. If you're going, especially on weekends, aim to arrive before 10-11am, when the crowds arrive. The restaurants on the island are not very impressive, ranging from awful (Toronto...
Cruising around the lake and seeing the beautiful scenery is relaxing and inspiring.Nice staff and meeting nice people made it even more fun!!

You can do a lot of things in the island. You can bring your own bikes (you can also rent them), rollerblades and scooters.There are picnic areas around the island. You can bring your soccer ball, frisbe, volleyball and badminton and play.There is a small amusement park for kids.You can walk around, enjoy the view and take...

A great get away to get a quick reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the city. Each section of the island offers a unique experience. Take a bike over by ferry to Ward's Island or Hanlan's Point and ride from one end to the other. Along the way explore the many paths and discover the residential neighborhoods of Wards...

Toronto Islands are always a good day outnandnabout at a much slow pace than regular work week. Take an island cruise, ride a bike, check out artists and some of the original homes. Nice break away and for peanuts.

Where else can you take a day trip and go from skyscrapers to island lifestyle, with a short and sweet ferry ride (with big lineups on holidays but they move quickly usually)? Take a bike and peddle the island -- arrive at Ward's and leave from Bell, or Centre Island. Stop for a beverage at one of the restaurants or...

We often take our bikes on the ferry and hop over to the Toronto Islands for a picnic in the summer and fall. Its a wonderful way to relax and feel like your at the cottage when you are actually on a 15min ferry ride away from the busy centre of the city. Excellent opportunity for great panoramic photos of...

We rented a 4 people bike and had a lot of fun, we visited everything and spent the whole day, a little tired after that but was a lot of fun. It was summer in a hot day, maybe it is better to go when there is mot much heat

Toronto Islands is a beautiful way to spend a day. Fun singles, couples, kids and families can enjoy without spending much. The beaches are beautiful and the water is warm enough for a swim on summer time. The ferry transfer is convenient, quick and provide great views of the Toronto's waterfront in transit to the islands. A must see if...

A group of islands off Toronto harbour, accessed by a 15 minute ferry ride. Acres of parkland, a small farm, amusement park for children, pony rides, beaches, bicycle rentals including bicycles with 2 rows of seating for 4, bicycle trails, boardwalk along the shoreline, light house, gardens, plenty of picnic areas and bbqs, tram $ ride around island, snack bars,...

This is really a great place to visit in the summer months. Its just a short boat ride from the Ferry Terminal at the foot of Bay St. Centreville has gentle rides for smaller kids and some great beaches are close by. Either singles, couples or families can spend hours in the beautiful gardens with splendid views of the Toronto...

The Toronto island is a great place for couples and families to speand the day. A short ferry ride will make you feel like Gilligan getting lost on an island that allows you to escape the busy city life. With amusement parks, pools and waterfront activities, there is always something to experience at Torontos island.

This is the place everybody will enjoy. Best times to visit is from the end of May to middle of September. Family with kids will love amusement park with lots of rides.There is something for anyone. You can swim, walk, rent the bicycle or boat. There is even nude beach. Great view of Toronto skyline day or night. Plan to...

With everything from an amusement park to a nude beach, there is something for everyone. Centre Island is a great place for families, Ward's for the more artistically inclined. Hanlan's Point should do it for history buffs. Don't forget to view the TO skyline wherever you are. Eat well & enjoy the calm.

Toronto islands are a must see for any visitor to Toronto. You have a great view of the sky line, lots of nature and a neighborhood of quirky houses to stroll through. Well worth the ferry ride across the harbor. A perfect place to spend an afternoon away from the noise of the city but still in view of the...
Ideal place to go without breaking the bank and tiring drive.pack your picnic baskets,ride a ferry,bring your bike if you like,bring your swimsuit. Its a day trip for the family

Lots to do on the islands. You can rent paddle boats, canoes, bikes, etc. You can hike, jog, sail or swim on or around the islands. The ferry costs to get out to the islands are super cheap and I recommend returning to port at night to catch the city lights on the way in. I recommend carving out the...
Beautiful island to spent the whole day. There is a lot to do. The sunset in the evening is priceless and relaxing.
Get off to go around the island, there are local eateries, roller coasters, walks, lake side views, swimming,

I love visiting the Toronto Islands especially Ward Island where you can walk along the boardwalk with a beautiful view of the water, go for a swim at the beach and enjoy a lovely lunch at the Rectory Cafe.You can also enjoy a bike ride from Ward Island to Centre Island. You can rent a bike down by the...
Relax, walk, enjoy nature and revamp - Toronto Islands are a stone's throw from the busy city life where one can appreciate taking a break for a few hours to take you to a very positive mindset.
We always enjoy visiting the islands each year. Always something new to see No problem getting on the ferry. Excellent for children who like to play on the beach. Good place to take grandchildren.
Funny, love and pictures. Families, dates and bbq's. festivals. swimming. Smiles and kisses, walks and holding hands

We spent our first day here and it was by far the best day of the holiday. Although we didn't spend the whole of the day here if we were to go back we definetly would do that and would also hire bikes as the island if quite a treck to walk around. The view as seen in the photo...

I love the Toronto Islands, so much to see and do. I like visiting center island it has rides and a little train that you can ride through the park a ferris wheel and the fun log ride and haunted house. Beautiful View of Toronto from the Island
Go, go, GO, either for a walk in the park, to hang out on the beaches or to take the kids to Centreville. You won't regret it.

Kids enjoyed the amusement park, we enjoyed the relaxing time on the beach looking at Toronto's skyline, and all enjoyed the cruise on the lake! Great spots all over the island for a picnic. Iconic to Toronto for sure and won't disappoint for any age for a great day out!
Take a quick ferry ride to get to the best view of the city. Great place to take kids as they can't get run over by cars. Centreville is perfect for toddlers. Great to rent a bike or paddle around.
Lots of activities to do. Picnic, rides, bike rental, beach. Kids always have fun on the ferry. Overall a nice place for a relaxing summer day.

It's definitely an interesting place. We rented bikes and saw small cozy cottages, went on rides and the nude beach....well maybe that was one area where we could have not gone to and wouldn't have missed out on anything, but overall a good day and the kids were happy having fun.

We visited on our last day. On the ferry over you get a great View of the Toronto skyline. At the other end it's very scenic. There is a beach and nice areas to walk although in the day we visited it was so cold (-8) we literally didn't 30 minutes wandering and taking pictures and got on the ferry...

I can't wait to go back here it's beautiful. I went in May and quite a few of the places there were not in season, if you want to make the most of it I'd advise you go in summer. I went in May and still had an amazing time here.

I have been going to the Toronto Islands since I was a kid. There is always something to do for every age level. Pack a picnic and go walking for a day, hit Centre Island, relax on the beach, rent bicycles and ride around. Ferry ride is always a hit with the kids :)
Been there few times and enjoyed it every time! The place is usually busy in summer and I don't think it is a relaxing kinda beach but I think it is a great place.

Toronto island is an incredible place to spend a day or evening...we pulled our boat into the island for an evening of great food; exceptional service;great people ; and live music; it was magical; I would visit Torontoisland again and again; next visit will be during the day

One of our favourite activities is taking our bikes on the ferry to Toronto Islands. There are miles of bike paths across all the Islands. Beautiful sites and no cars! While there, it's always nice to stop for lunch on the outdoor patio at the Rectory Cafe. As with any visit to Toronto Islands, get to the ferry early as...

One could probably write some king of psychological analysis linking the Toronto Islands with all that is wrong with Toronto. It is interesting though as the islands represent somewhat of a microcosm of Toronto in itself. They are packed in all the wrong places, and it represents the willingness of most Toronto to wait in long lines and through traffic...

Going over to the islands is a great way to spend a hot summer day.Centreville for the kids and the usual fast, greasy food along with icecream and other sweets. Little rides, lots of crowds and walking. Go to the beach or the splash pad for more of a relax.You can also take a picnic which is fun...

We visited on honeymoon in September '16. Took the ferry to Hanlan's Point and walked to Centre Island, had lunch, visited the zoo, hired bikes and rode to the beach for the afternoon. This day out was my favourite part of our honeymoon, you could easily spend a few days on the islands exploring and relaxing. Beautiful scenery and views,...

A excellent place to spend a day out relaxing in Toronto. Get the ferry over, enjoy the park, take it easy.Great views of the city on one side and great horizons of the lake on the other.Some great restaurants on the island itself, hire a bike is a great way to get round the island.

Although the ferries don't run as frequently, you'll get a different perspective in winter. We loved walking through the residential area and along the boardwalk. The Rectory is the only year-round restaurant and we enjoyed soup and coffee there. Residents were friendly. One even invited us in for a coffee in their home, but we had to decline due to...

During the summer of 2016, my family and I went to the Island, to check out the childrens amusement park. It was a great day, with lots to do and see. You can do so much there. I want to go back and rent bikes to tour the whole island. A great HOT day activity.

Love this park, so happy that it is far from all traffic, lovely place to just go and chill the entire day, bring your own food, $$$$ hella expensive on the island, ferry is $7 to and back, amazing place simply

As a Torontonian, this is my faveourite activity to do in the summer. The ferry ride alone to and from the islands are picture perfect. You can also rent a bike/quad bike on the island and ride around. This is the best way to see the island in one day. There is also a nude beach and a regular beach....

Always fun ride across and back on island ferry boat . Great parks bbq and picnic areas . Can buy your food petting zoo rides swan boats . Go to the beach on south side . Great view of Toronto it's great for family's couples .
Great place to visit though I didn't have time to explore it at length. Difficult to stand on a cold day but otherwise perfect view of the skyline.
We really felt in a romantic Hollywood movie, a lovely place far from the noisy city, warm locals and a great place to think, talk and bond with your beloved one.

Try visiting Toronto Islands during winter time. You will be surprise how enjoyable and having the fresh air passing through your face is amazing.Make sure to go early morning to avoid long line and able to get a good view. Also you can rest as there are benches that you can rest.Bring water and snack as the store...

column3: Santiago de los Caballeros, Dominican Republic
column4: Getting to know the island, the beaches, the weather, it was fantastic, watching over Toronto city was magnificent!

I can't imagine our stay in Toronto in summer time without going to the Islands! The place is gorgeous, clean & the boat ride is so picturesque, you'll lose your mind! The islands have beaches for families with kids, no kids, nude beach & regular beach! A lot of water activities beside being lazy on the sand!
Amazing my first time. Our in-laws have visited the islands many times. Was a wonderful plethora of things to do for all ages.

I was there 2 years ago and it was great!I visited it with a bike,which I hired at my hotel(Chelsea) and drove to the boat wich carries you across!But now to the main part-the island...You can see wonderful houses, sweet rivers(in winter tey are frozen) and stuff like that!I recommended to the ones who like to...
We been there over 50 people in group for summer party, enjoy all day with good view of air show. Perfect place for family or group. lots of activity and nice view.

This was my first visit in 30+ years.Came in from Pearson airport on the UP train; walked through the rowdy crowd around Air Canada Centre, then on to the ferry. The 5 minute or so ferry ride took us far away from that frantic activity back on the mainland.We stayed for 2 days on the island while attending...

What a great afternoon we had! Got off the ferry at the Centre Island Dock, then walked all over, past the Carnival area over to the Pier - admiring the gardens, enjoying the greenspace and restful atmosphere with lots of benches provided in shady spots, pausing at the ponds with ducks swimming about, then the coup de grace of all...

I hadn't been to the Islands in about 20 years.A Friend invited me to go for a bike ride on the Island.It was such a lovely getaway from the city and it was nice to cycle around at a leisurely pace with no traffic. It was so nice and relaxing and would do it again.Had lunch at...

I was there in August during my Canada trip. I took a ferry from Jack Layton ferry terminal in downtown Toronto and arrived in Ward's island around 20 minutes later. The fare trip is 7.50 CAD as far as I can remember and unfortunately it is not included in your CTC pass. Talk a walk through from Ward's island to...

Every time me and my friends are in Toronto we go there.This summer I have visitors from Europe and Australia and we went there.They just loved it. It is amazing. Exceptional views of CN Tower and downtown Toronto.You can have a picnics over there if you like to do that or just wonder around and explore.

I was prompted by Trip Advisor to review the Toronto Islands. I'm writing this because, although I've lived in Toronto for over 20 years, I still find each visit to "the islands" to be a great get away. You'd hardly think that you could find such a change of pace so close to downtown; it's a beautiful world of its...
HiWe liked the place very much.ai my husband and my daughter went there last September. It was fun.Nice view.I recommend this to everyone.ThanksAsma
One of the best place in Canada to visit. Clean Water , clean beach, and people there are also very friendly. Good small joints for snacks to munch.

There are three islands groupings, each quite different. Centre Island has all the buzz and fun of activities for the whole family. Ward's Island to the East is still populated year round with quaint cottages. You feel you joined a real community when you visit. Hanlan's Point to the West provided open spaces and long walks. (There are great fire-pits...

It's hard to believe that you can take a boat ride for a few minutes and end up in an oasis like the Toronto Islands where there are barely any cars, tons of walking trails and a close-up view of Downtown Toronto. This really is the country in the city.
On our way back from Quebec to Toronto, this beautiful place is located. You have to go by cruise for an hour only. 1000 Lovely tiny Islands... beautiful weather and love to see..

A great place to go for either a day trip or to stay overnight if you arrive with your sail or motor boat. You can dock at one of the marinas or at "the wall" on Hanlons point. Play tennis, go swimming at one of the many beaches or visit one of the restaurants for food and drinks. You also...

We took the fairy to the islands and it was a fantastic summer day trip! Great to walk around and also a nice beach (for toronto!) right in the heart of the city. Went with a baby and stroller and found the area easily accessible.

The summer season and water all around with some lush green parks to sit , relax, or barbeque with friends or families .This is the Islands beauty which is fun filled for kids with rides and bicycle tracks for young adults.The only camouflaged FERRY RIDE which is just on the water with too high priced tickets for 30...

When you go for a walk around Toronto Islands and see a sign instructing you to walk on the grass, you know that you are experiencing a place that has really got its act together. After a short trip out to the islands my wife and I spent the whole day happily strolling around people watching. Hard not to envy...

Fun destination for an entire day out. We go to the beach first, but there are lots of walking and bike trails. There's also Centreville amusement park with rides, and lots for little kids, fave one is the gondola chairs that take you across the park. Prepare to walk a fair distance when here, so bring strollers or wagons for...

This is wonderful island to have downtown.Any city in the world would live to have this island.There is boating and yacht clubs, as well as world class picnicking :). Great Disc Golf course and theme park with rides BUT best of all there is not a better spot to lay around and be lazy on a nice summer day with...

A great place to visit in the summer. Take the ferry across to the Island. The ferry runs regularly during the day and evening. Lovely way to see the sites of Toronto from the island. Great for tourists or locals. Beach available in the summer. Playground and rides available in the summer and vendors for snacks.

The island is an amazing place to get relax and enjoy quiet atmosphere. It is one of the few locations where charcoal BBQ is allowed. Grills are available but you need to get there early to reserve them. Washrooms are clean but you need to take your soap and napkins.There are many activities that you can do while at...

great place to go with kids, but also a great date place, the beaches are nice, the paths are great, there are so many things to see and do, you can rent bikes, and it's generally just a great day trip.

A short ferry ride from the Downtown of Toronto and you are in another world. A step back in time. Also enjoy spectacular views back towards the Toronto skyline. The ultimate way to experience it is by bike. NO cars so a very safe leisurely bike ride of discovery. Bikes transport at no extra cost on the ferries.

I love the Toronto Islands, you can go walking, biking, and the amusement park is amazing! Lots of fun food treats to eat. All ages will have a fun time. Take your family to play and have a picnic! It's not expensive to take the ferry. I also took the boat tour to see the islands from the water. You...

A great way to enjoy Toronto's outdoors and waterfront for an entire day. Take a picnic lunch. Rent a bicycle or tour the entire island using the open tram. Quiet areas with beaches too. If you bring along kids, you have lots of activities. A big playground with water park, as well as Centreville with its fun rides. A family...

I took my 10 yr old to the island to spend the day at centreville and it was amazing. The rides were great and we didn't have to wait in long lines. My daughter enjoyed the train ride through centreville so much that we had to do it twice. The surroundings are beautiful and lush. Great place to spend a...

The Toronto Island is an amazing place to spend the entire day with friends or family or even by oneself. It is a peaceful place if you explore it and find the hidden spots. ?? Bom dia com uma paisagem quase monocrática ?You can take your own bike in the ferry and start exploring right off the boat. Bikes are...

I love coming here. Getting away from the city and getting a great view of it at the same time. Three islands to explore. Wards has lots of cottages and two good eateries, Center is the activity island with a children's farm and fun rides, giant hedge maze, swimming, and offers canoes, peddle boats or four person bikes rentals. Hanlan's...

I love the Toronto Islands as a quick get away. It can be accessed year round- check the ferry schedule. There is plenty to do, or take time doing nothing at all. Love Ward's Island biking and exploring- Visit the Island Cafe midmorning for fresh made muffins and coffee, yummy lunches and warm summer evening dinners when there is live...

Three islands in Toronto Harbour reached by ferry. Centre island has an amusement park with lots of rides for kids and adults. The other islands are more rustic and very flat for easy walking and bicycling. Bikes not allowed on the ferries on the weekends.Picnic tables available and also lots of stands to buy food. The islands are beautiful...

Centre island is a good spot for your picnic with your family. It may be busy on the weekend but there a lot of space on the island for you.The best way to explore the island is to rent a bicycle and ride on the island.

One of our favourite places to visit in Toronto. Once you get on the ferry and pull away from the terminal you feel as if you are going on a great trip. Love it upstairs where the stunning view of the city can take your breath away. The islands offer a wonderful amusement park for the kids and lots and...

We go here basically every long weekend or anytime we are all free to do a bbq ..nice quiet ..either head to the main picnic area of choose ur own spot, picnic tables and grills everywhere...or walk to the other side and check out the beach ...yes part of it is nude..yes there are people fornicating in bushes ... but...

Toronto Islands provides a wonderful patch of verdant green in close proximity to the concrete edifices in the downtown core. Set right opposite the main Financial District, the Islands are an ideal place to kick off the stress of a busy working day. It also gives an unparalleled view of the Toronto Skyline in a really beautiful and serene setting!

Just minutes from the Toronto shore by a leisurely cruise...takes one to the Toronto Islands. Its a place of solitude in Downtown Toronto. Great place for the kids to run free, there's a kids petting zoo, kids rides...one can have a relaxed picnic.
Visited Toronto Islands for my first time this Summer was amazing! Like being in another world! I recommend it for everyone as all it costs is your ferry ticket!
This Island has a lot of different attractions for all four seasons. Especially, summer would be the great to visit this area and uptown Toronto too.You will never regret.
Went there on a week day in October when the sun was shining. Lovely walks and great to be away from the noise of town. Fantastic views of Toronto. I imagine it would be very cr
A good place to spend a summer hot day. All you need is your bicycles and some cash...the rest is all there...
Great place for whole family.Arrived on our own boat , Docked for the day for good price and have lots of fun.
It a nice place and something new to do at GTA area.Different activities and nice views..Will go again soon :)
A friend held a birthday (her son's) family and friends get together on the island and it was awesome. We brought our own games and bicycles and picnic baskets etc... Awesome place with loads to do.
Something for everyone and always a great time. Start with a fun ferry ride then perhaps rent a bicycle and travel the island. Tons of fun and random activities
Nice place to walk around. alone, with your significant other or with friends.I'll recommend to bring water and food, the selection on the islands is average.

Wknd are very crowded and busy. Buy your ferry tickets online. go early!Beaches on Handlans points are very nice, water gets pretty warm comes late July & Aug. During the week much quieter & nicer! Very nice to tour the islands with your bike... also bring some food & drinks with you. Its very limited services on the islands.
There is a nude beach which is laid back and a lot of fun... I recommend this on hot summer day. You can bring a picnic lunch and enjoy the day in the sun.
It's amazing also in the winter!I want to back there before I leave Toronto, the Islands have washrooms working in the winter too...
It's an easy ferry ride to Toronto Islands. If you don't want to walk on the islands, bring your bike to the ferry. It is a great location to take picture of CN Tower from the Ferry or the islands.
This is such a great place to be in the summer! So many cute beaches. This something tourists must see in the summer.

if you are allergic to crowds, use the Tiki taxi that are located to the west of the ferry docks. Pay your way to the island, and come back for free on the ferry. Or pay again and go back on the Tiki taxi.
A great place to enjoy with your family and friends.Beautiful breath taking views , Nice and Clean washrooms.
If you love walking then by all means this is the place to go. But there isn't much to do unless you own your own boat or canoe.
It was beautiful and so many different beaches and so many things to do. I really enjoyed and would love to go back to Toronto just to do that again.

Spent the day here and loved it! We rented a 4 person bike for the day which was great fun and well worth the money as we had the freedom to see the whole island and soak up some great views of Toronto. We didn't eat here, but could imagine that it would be lovely to bring a picnic. Just...

Toronto island is accessible by boat with tickets available at the terminals. Best to buy a day pass on public transport and it will include this ferry. Well, an island away from the main city; with a nude beach. Most days, it is is kind of empty because the weather is cool to cold. Not sure if children are allowed...

I would have rated this 5-star if the bike store was open when we went there but it was not.At any rate, the ferry to the island was great. The island itself was a very nice place to do a long stroll. From the center port, we walked to one end and then turned to head to the other...

We went here in the early fall (Labour Day) and it was fantastic, I wish I went earlier in the summer and it would've been even better I am sure. We took the ferry to the Islands and there was sandy beaches, lots of green area, a soccer court. Overall it was just great vibes and the views you get...

Toronto Islands are a great place to visit on a bright and sunny day. There are a lot of picnic spots available. These spots can be reserved in advance for big groups. Barbecues are also available. Small bonfires can be lit to add to the fun. There are a lot of fun things to do for families and young children....

Toronto Islands are one of Toronto's gems - an attraction for both tourist and locals.On a hot day, being surrounded by water, it can be much cooler than on the mainland.The amusement park is great for smaller kids (better than Wonderland) or rent bikes and ride around all the islands in a couple of hours.Well worth a...
Landed atToronto Island. Very impressed with the tunnel to get across, very bright, efficient and fast to get to your transport.
An annual even for our entire family. It is a beautiful view of the city and the amusement park is always a huge hit with our small children!

it is a really nice place to go if you are looking for something outdoor and is away from the busy day to day life. it is nice to visit in the summer to try the tandem with families and friends, enjoy the water and the little farm and children's playground with the kids.

Take the ferry from Jack Layton ferry terminal (5$), after a few minutes you are in a completely different atmosphere from the city of Toronto, ideal to spend some time walking or cycling in a green and quiet area. Been there in early November (only for Ward's Island ferry terminal during winter), enjoyed the calm and nature, but also the...

Been living in and around Toronto pretty much my entire life, and I never knew Centre Island had a beach, let alone a really nice beach. The break wall keeps the water clean(er) than other Toronto Beaches and beaches around Lake Ontario, as things can get washed into shore that are not so pleasant at times. The wall makes such...

The islands allow us to visit nature and enjoy the waters of Lake Ontario while not leaving our home. Many ways to reach the island, all give a bit of excitement. Share in the adventure whether it be center Island, boating or just taking a quiet stroll.

This was such a great day trip! I got a cheap ferry ticket and hopped onto one of the three ferries that head to the island. I recommend the line all the way to the left or right. That way you can walk towards the middle of the island once the 10 minute ride or so is over. There are...

Ward's Island offers a cottage-like charm, with outdoor cafe, a beach, playing field, picnic tables, public washrooms, a boardwalk, many photo opportunities, and there are bike and trolley-cycle rentals from Center Island, which connects with both Ward's Island and Hanlan's Point, which offers both a regular beach, plus a clothing-optional beach. There are amusements & rides offered at Center Island.

Had enough of the city? Take a short boat ride to bliss town! You can look back at the amazing sky line whilst hearing the birds and the lake shore crashing onto the sand. The crystal blue waters lap at your feet as you then walk through what feels like empty forests in the safest place ever. You can walk...

The islands have a gorgeous view of Toronto and they offer a great place for a walk. The ferry is frequent and quick. Its a great place to spend time with friends and family. Nice in summer but in winter it could be chilling.

Ideal place to relax. one can take water taxi or ferry. Reading book in open garden or playing with kids is popular activity out there. For photography there are many natural spots for birds or even capturing Toronto skyline.

So all I got to offer as advice. Bring a lunch. Set aside cash for kayaks, canoe, boats, bikes, trains. It's pricey but good for a blaze, beer, BBQ, music. All ages can fulfill some entertainment. Don't forget about the birds.
Even though visited in November when a lot closed, including the toilets! A great escape on a sunny winters day. One restaurant open for brunch which was very good.

A shot $7.50 ferry ride from Downtown to a secluded paradise. A nice stroll through foliage along the lake. I can imagine summers are a bit different. Nice for a nice stroll or bike ride.Definitely worth exploring for the amazing city views.

An almost instant escape from the city's hustle and bustle, with a great view back to the city. Especially in the summer, there are few better ways of spending a day (or part of one) in the country without leaving town. Excellent beaches, lovely walks, and easy biking.

A great place for young families to spend time in the Park. There's something for everyone from renting a bike 2 amusements scared for young kids a Petting Farm and a ferry boat ride. A great place to have a picnic. Where to rent a boat. There's something for everyone at the Toronto Island. There are a lot of things...
A trip with the boat takes you from the busy city to a nice and quiet living area. The view from here is really beautiful

If you have never gone, go. The ferry ride is fun, the island is beautiful and there is lots to do, or not do on the island. Great view of Toronto, fun amusement park open in the summer (which they are improving) and a great tram tour of the island.

One of us had never been to the Islands, the other hadn't been there in decades, so we went recently on a layover in Toronto. Being November, the summertime crowds were gone and yet the weather was decent. The Islands seem to be a rather special place, so close to Toronto, and yet it seems frozen in another time entirely....
We visited Ward's island, as the other two were closed for the season. It was a beautiful place. Very relaxing and interesting. The ferry ride was convenient as well $7.50 CAD per adult- round trip)
Toronto Island is so good! We took our bikes over and had the best afternoon in the sun! Must go in summer. Can't say I'll be going in winter.

Lovely and relaxing in the summer. My partner and I went to the Toronto Islands hoping to walk around, we ended up at Ward's Island beach with our toes in the sand, walking the beach hand in hand. You have to go here no matter what time of year-just dress for the weather! You'll never guess you are in a city of 3 million when you settle on the island. Great with kids, family, date or solo.
A great place to visit, and not just for the fabulous views of the Toronto skyline. The islands have a great vibe and its great to wonder through the quirky homes.

A short ferry ride will bring you from the hustle and bustle of downtown to the peace and quiet of one of Toronto's nicest parks. With beaches, plenty of open space, and bike rentals it the perfect place to get out of the city for a day without having to go far.

Yes it's a must see! The Toronto Islands are not only a touristic attraction, but a picnic place with a nice beach and, for me, the greatest pic of the CN Tower!!You can take your friends and family and enjoy the day there, ride a bike or just walk around the Islands...
We visited by ferry for a few hours and found this to be quite a pleasant park, clean and tidy, with views of the Toronto skyline. Worth a visit in good weather.
A nice day trip especially if you have young children. I would recommend it on a nice summer day. You will not be disappointed.
A great morning out to walk the paths on a perfect November day. As everywhere in Toronto people were so friendly.

The Toronto islands offer one of the best views of Toronto. Plan on spending a whole day here, weather permitting. Start with a ferry ride to wards island. We went to Toronto Islands for the day with Luke. It was a beautiful day. Rode the ferry over and walked around and just enjoyed the beautiful scenery.
If you are looking for a nice place with an amazing view of the city, this is the place. Very convenience location, take the ferry in downtown and enjoy this place (walking, picnic, beach day).

This is a great place to bring the kids for the amusement park and rides. It's a great place for couples to bike ride around the island or even rent a tandem bike. It's a great area to kayak or canoe around the island. It's good fun for all walks of life.
The island is great for all ages. Nice walk and lots of things to see for the little ones, the far enough farm is a hit and center island can be fun too.

Cycled along Lakeshore Blvd. ,then took ferry over to the Island . Lots happening over there and very pleasant cycling from one end to the other. Ferry back is all included . Very nice and safe area to cycle in. Very enjoyable day.

We traveled by car. Found parking nearby. We walked onto the ferry. Reasonably priced. Enjoyed guided tour. Watched planes land on the island. Saw lots of boats and wildlife. Got amazing photos of the Toronto skyline.

What a wonderful day to get on an island Ferry or private water taxi to one of the 3 separate islands to choose. The islands are all interconnected once you are there. Biked over to the islands twice over the summer. Both were wonderful riding the bike paths around the island, however you need to pick time of day as the crowds on Center island can be tricky to ride around. This one of Toronto most unique place to visit with friends, family and children. Lots of entertainment for the children and great pinic grounds. The ferry ride to the is nust awsome and can be very entertaining. A must see when you visit Toronto
I went there to see the sunset and people had set up beach fires...And you get to see the whole Toronto Downtown and the west side..Breathtaking

This is usually one of the cheapest outing that you can have in Toronto including a nice boat ride and nice sceneries.

trip ride on the boqat to the island and watching the city is wonderful experiencethey have enormous picnic spots with ample of facilities specially the neat and clean washrooms restaurants...amusements for kids and adults...boating experience...food...food at a reasonable price...kids rides....summer is best place to visit and enjoy...we take our visitors from abroad to show them and also...

Wonderful place to visit!Clean, natural, island!Grew up there when I was a kid.My dad had a boat parked there at the marina and we had free rain to ride around anywhere we wanted on the island.What an interesting place!!

Toronto islands is a great escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. I recommend going on a hot, sunny day when you can try out the beaches.The islands are great for cycling or just walking around. There are a few restaurants to try.

This time on the islands were very fun and cool. I would reccomend it mostly to kids for the amusment park named Centrevile. I wound also reccomend id to people who like to look up in to the sky or down at the trees. so be sure to bring your children if you go to the islands.

The size and diversity of the Toronto Islands makes them usable for anyone.Any Season, anytime, you can make the Islands be whatever you need them to be.Going solo, date, group, photography, sleep. anything can be done on the Toronto Islands. Make the Islands yours and enjoy anyway you want...
The islands are so unusual and unique to Toronto; a visit is worth the ferry ride any time of the year. Be sure to get around and explore by foot or bike or x-country skiis.

Toronto Islands are a short ferry ride (20min) from the foot of Bay Street. If you want a lot of green space for a picnic, a family reunion or throwing the frisbee around, this is perfect. Want that awesome view of the Toronto skyline? Go to the island. You get that plus it feels like you're on vacation. From the cute homes on wards island, to the blue waters at Hanlons point, the island is nice for the kids but also a romantic and fun place to be and explore as an adult. So good.

Great place for a date or a trip with friends. A bunch of different beaches to choose from, ot a bunch of grass parks, some with great city views. Two cool hippy settlements, with little cottage houses, to wander through. Loved this place.
Take the time to visit just a short ferry ride. Awesome views of the city and good walking paths, open year round!
Nice little island that has a nice beach and you can go fishing on a boat and so many others things great for families with kids all ages

When you get off the boat first thing you see is sign: "Please, walk on the grass". Big surprise to many. Rent a bike and ride around, Great children playground. Nude gay beach. Airport. Yacht clubs. And residential area. And most important, my daughter was married there with a great view of Toronto waterfront as a background.
Absolutely loved the islands; easy to walk most of it, had lunch at a terrific restaurant while there and the boat ride was enjoyable too. Loved the boardwalk along the lake.

The Toronto Islands are a unique treasure, a short ferry ride away from downtown.With acres of manicured parkland, a petting zoo and rides for the kids, clean beaches, and unparalleled views of the Toronto skyline, the Islands are an ideal getaway that offer something for everyone: ride your bike, go for a long, quiet walk and enjoy the views...

If you are looking for a summer getaway in the city the, Toronto Islands are the place. Yes, there is more than one island. The islands are a great place to get away from the business of the city, see some amazing views, and enjoy the beach.

We try to get to the island at least once a year. Taking the ferry is quick and easy and allows great views of the city. Great place for adults alone or with kids.
