Toronto Islands had been my favourite place to visit over the number of years! Its like a small hidden gem right outside the downtown core! 3 beaches to swim, great centre island for kids and families and amazing skyline view of downtown Toronto can't beat it!
One good sneaky advice!If you see the ferry packed take ward island ferry........you have to walk a good mile to TO Island.....same island....daaaaa

One of our favorite places to take visitors to Toronto is the Toronto Islands. Without exception they enjoy the short ferry boat ride, the view of the harbour, the airport and the skyline of Toronto. My brothers and sisters worked on Centre Island as kids going through school. A great place to visit and brought back many memories. A wonderful place to visit a step away from downtown Toronto. Bring your camera and walking shoes!
It's the most beautiful place you can enjoy in Toronto. Good to walk, enjoy the nature away from the close city. Ferry fee is CAD$7.50.

It was my first time visiting the Toronto Islands and I can't believe it took me so long to get here! Even in October the trees are brimming with colour and you can still stop for lunch at the Rectory Cafe.I'll be back in the Spring!

Take the ferry from downtown Toronto and be prepared to walk once you reach the island. This was my favorite part of our trip. It is such a quiet little place in the middle of all the hustle. Beautiful to walk, cycle and go to the beach. The island gives you excellent skyline views of Toronto! However, make sure to do this on a day it's not raining to get the most of it!

Such a beautiful little island we went back twice in one week. Best way to spend a hot sunny day in the city. Good for people of all ages. Several different beaches to check out, all offering different views and activities.

I may be biased because my brother and his wife live on Ward Island at the east end. Short boat journey from the city center but it seems like you are so far from a city, great spot for a picnic. I recommend renting a bicycle as you will be able to spend more time on each island that way. There is a small cafe there and I think 1 or 2 restaurants.

A subway or tram ride to the Ferry with a choice of three destinations. Incredible haven of peace and beauty. Lovely walks and facilities plus only a ten minute regular ferry trip. You would not believe you were so close to a city.

A great way to spend the afternoon and you should take the ferry as it is a very reasonable price. We walked around the entire island but you have to watch out for the cyclists.

A must see in the summer time when visiting Toronto! Beautiful beach and gardens! Taking the water taxi for an extra few dollars will definitely get you across the water faster than the ferry and good views of the CN Tower.
Going to the Toronto Islands is always a great time. I usually pack a picnic with my girlfriend, find a nice spot to chill for a bit, and enjoy eating,drinking, and people watching.

Enjoyable short trip around the islands with a guide talking about them. We booked it and it was an additional tour on the City sightseeing on- great value for the day

Take the regularity scheduled passenger ferry for an escape from the downtown madness of Toronto. This place is an idyllic respite from the city only a kilometre away. A nice escape from the city, a September visit is not busy or with all the attractions as during the summer but a great walk, interesting little nooks and crannies to explore.

Just take a ferry and visit there then you can see beautiful scenery of entire view of the city. And simply walk and talk with your family and loving people.... nice place. Take picture if you want some rememberence.

traveld to the island,,rented a bike ,,was wonerful experience ,plus they have the Centerville amusement park,,great place for the day ,,picnic ,rides etc ferry tide is modest priced,,,great place to spend the day

We had a lovely day visiting Toronto Islands.Very peacful,calm and if you like to walk as we do you will love this island.You take the ferry over,which gives you some fantastic views of Toronto.

Taking the short ferry ride to Toronto Islands is well worth the time and money! It offers a lovely spot to explore nature, walk for hours, play on a variety of beaches and see the Toronto skyline. Recommend it if you want a break from the city.
I spent basically a full day here. Most of my time was spent just wandering around and hanging out at the beach. There are some great views of the city from here.

We left Toronto in 1971 and boy has it changed but then so have I. Geting a ferry over to the Islands was alwasy a summer thing and it was great to do it again. Do the bordwalk along the seawall, fantastic.

Although I have been to Toronto several times, I had never done this trip. I went there with family members and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Took an unplanned trip out to the island during our visit and the views from the ferry back of toronto where worth it. Then we stepped onto the island and realised it had 100% been worth it. Do visit the islands! It's beautiful and offers a great view of Toronto skyline. The ferry ride over is nice too. Not too long to get boring. The Toronto Islands are a must see while visiting Toronto. They lie in the middle of the harbor between downtown and Lake Ontario. They offer beaches, theme park rides, parks, fountains, gardens, restaurants and so much more.
An amazing place to visit, especially when the weather is good. Definitely worth the trip on the ferry!
From here you have an amazing view of the Toronto skyline. However, in October there's not much to do. If not for the view I wouldn't go there. Probably there is more to do during the season.

Ferry ride to the Island , walk in the park, bicycle rental, Enjoy the nature, nice view of Toronto harbour and City line.
How could the ferry trip, the beaches, the park and the islands be any better! The perfect summer day . . . every time!

The Toronto island park offers relaxation outside of the busy city. Especially for sports activities or just to free up your mind it worth a visit.It also offers a stunning view on the Toronto skyline.

I took a Ferry and was there from Downtown in Seven dollars. Really nice natural beauty. Some can walk, sit on benches, see water front, Downtown. Really enjoyable.
The place is amazing. Lost of green area, you can bike, run, picnic etc. It worth every minute we wait for the ferry. Watch out for the dog poop cause they are everywhere.

This is a fun trip, with a 10 minute boat ride across the lake. A short ferry ride from Toronto yet the feeling is so different. Best for views of the Toronto skyline. We visited close to Halloween and the preparations on the island were fun and quirky. The islands was such a fun experience! Riding the ferry over was fun and the lake was gorgeous! It felt like I was at the ocean. Lots of fun things to do on the islands and plenty to see. The beaches are clean and the sand is soft! Great for a family outing!

We went here after it was closed for the season and this was not much of a bummer. Of course it must be better during summer days, but our ride was quite beautiful. This place if fantatic for family, friends & couples, its got lots of attractions, just a great place to spend the day and enjoy nice weather !!
A very quiet place to relax and have a nice walk. There are no public cars, just a few public vehicles. Recommended on sunny days.

Took the ferry to Toronto Islands - I believe $7 return. Was a gorgeous day so I am sure that made it better but it was a lovely sail over. Gorgeous view of the downtown. We weren't sure what to expect from the the island. But there was a great amusement park for the kids. We rented one of those 4 person bike cars. It was a great way to explore.
Great break from downtown hustle and a pleasent ferry ride with terrific cityscape views. Not much going on post-summer but still worth the trip. Easy to see why it is super popular in July !
Always wanted to visit Toronto Island. We, my family and I, took the ferry over to the island and we had a great time. What a beautiful island to visit.
Leave the bustling metropolis for the island. Not a bad idea for a day. Many activities and sights available.
great place to spend a day, take out of town visitors, have a pic nic, walk, bike, see a play, hit the beach
Go for a walk, bring some coffee you will not be disappointed. It was worth going off the beaten track to see this unique Toronto park

Perfect for a brief morning or weekend outing.if you just need to get away from the city for a few hours this is the spot!

The islands are great to spend an afternoon wondering around. You can bring your swim suit as there are changing areas. There is a small ride section, mainly for kids and a splash log ride. There are many flowers planted everywhere by a horicultural committee. Bring a picnic as there are many tables around.

Great retreat from the hustle and bustle of City in the summer months.We took a boat tour which allows you see a few of the more exclusive areas of the island complex, Captain Dave was a great host and certainly made it a pleasure.
Visiting Toronto islands with my daughters. The islands are very beautiful in the fall. Ferry service runs frequently.Perfect for a leisurely stroll or bike ride.
Best skyline of Toronto. It's very beautiful, but very cold also. It's important to use hot clothes. Enjoy!
Really great place for peace and quiet. Boat to island is easy to get and it's a real oasis from the humdrum of the city.

Took ferry from jack Layton ferry terminal to wards island. Once on island there's much to do. We did this on our last day - got the ferry down to the bottom island and walked up. It was relaxing, VERY quiet and interesting - although not much was going on. Best bit - the view you get of Toronto on boat back over! It's worth it for a bit of relaxation.

Everything from the ferry ride to the wonderful park and tea at the old vicarage makes this a perfect antidote to the busyness of the city. Walks of varying lengths but you would need three hours minimum once on the island. Perfect in every way.

Save the long drive up North to feel like you are at the cottage without the 2 hours in traffic. Amazing views of the city on one side and an endless water view on the other side. I'm reluctant to recommend this oasis of nature in a sea of concrete, but I need to be honest and share my love of the Toronto Islands. My family goes here every Labor Day to watch the air show and go swimming. It's a peaceful island to get away from the everyday busyness of Toronto. Ferry rides are always scenic. And it goes easy on the wallet.

Probably the best thing to do in Toronto. A very beautiful Park with great views of tge city. If you visit off season make sure you bring water and a bike from the city if you plan to cycle because most things are closed. The remaining open café is worth stopping at for a refuel.
the boat trip gives a good view of the Toronto skyline, and the park is pleasant, with good walks and views

It is so peaceful and beautiful there, leisure walks on the winding paths through the greenery. Dip in the lake from the beaches. Admire the cute little one-of-a-kind...
Busy during the summer months, but will enjoy the ferry ride over. Take your bike and enjoy the whole island. There are beaches and a fun park for the kids. Food and bike rentals.

The first time I visited Toronto Is, it was like I discovered a lost city! You get a real feeling of awe. It's an escape from the city that no more than a 10-15 min ferry ride away, but yet it will feel like much more once you arrive and experience it yourself.

You gotta spend some time to enjoy the cruise on the way to island and back with all the sailing boats around and beautiful overlook of Toronto, especially during the sunset time...the park itself is very relaxing too...wish there were more options to drink and eat there...overall it's a must to visit when you are in Toronto
Serene. Beautiful. Walking biking family friendly kids area have been goin every year foeR 25 years since my kids were young now taking grandkidsGo early to catch ferry
Great place to spend a day with family on Toronto island. The boat trip is nice and the island itself offers many things: beaches, entertainment, food. The views of the city are amazing.

A great place to visit during summer. A 20 minutes ferry ride from the famous tourist spot- Harbour Front takes you to this scenic spot. Full of photo opportunities and loads of fun for children and teens is there.variety of eateries serve to every taste and the souvenir shop has interesting items to take back home. Ferry ticket includes both...
Walk in the park with a great water view in any directionPlants, Trees, Water, Farm animals, Just watch for the goose droppings

I went there so many times, you can see a pretty skyline of Toronto, a lot of trees, beaches, lake! A great place to go play sports, or have a walk or read or have a bbq with your friends and family! It is a must to go if you are visiting Toronto, especially in the summer!

One can take the ferry to Hanlan's Point and walk or bicycle to Center and Ward's Islands, or do in reverse, stopping along the way to sit on the beach and admire the sailboats on Lake Ontario. The Franklin Children's Garden, based on Franklin the Turtle books is interactive and with its bronze statues, a pleasure for adults as well....

Always worth a visit, and next to the Billy Bishop airport, so you get to see airplanes as well. A smallish amusement park, beaches, and a short ferry ride makes it a wonderful adventure. Yuo can take your own bicycles or rent them there. Good eats. Also features the best views of Toronto. Great place to go and go with...

This is a great place to escape the hustle and bustle of downtown, but not in the height of the summer at weekends when it gets incredibly busy too! There are some lovely beaches, nice trail walks and tremendous views of the city and the lake. Plenty of eateries (snack type) in the summer months, and if you're feeling lazy,...

The ferry ride over is great. The amusement park on the island is great for young children. Here you can rent a bike or go on the lagoon in a rented canoe. The Island also has excellant beach so in summer you can go swimming.
Nothing beats a trip to the Toronto Islands for the views especially at sunset or when the lights of the city start to twinkle. So much to do and see for all activity levels.

Either take public ferry or a provate water taxi for a little more money. But so much faster.Great place for kids with Centreville kids area and mini zoo. But great for couples and groups to get away. It's like being out of city without driving far away. Helps if you carry your own bicycle which can be carried for...

Well. We passed the test and didn't crash or go in separate ways. The bicycle was in good condition . Rental process was smooth and didnt take too long. U need to leave a 20 dollar deposit in case . And a photo id. And the paths between the 3 islands was well paved and not busy. This wasn't peak...
The Toronto has the best views of the city! It is a 6 km walk along a great road with no cars. Enjoy the restaurant in the centre. Have a coffee on Ward's Island. Great any season.

Went there with couple of families and kids under 5 . It was a great day for walking and enjoying the local attractions . I would do this againThe only part is the ferry gets so busy that we would have to sometimes take the water taxi

On a week-day morning in August, I took my three-year-old grand-daughter to Toronto Island Park. Took a boat tour of the harbor front and stopped over for a few hours on the Toronto islands. Alot of thing to see and do for both adults and the kids. Alot of walking trails and activities. Nice place for a sunny afternoon to have a picnic in the park and enjoy the beach's. We could have spent alot...
The Toronto Island park is one of the most visually sunning places to view Toronto Skyline. It has bicycle trails, children playground, walking trails and good air and green environment.
amazing day trip for the youngsters! lots of carnival rides, petting zoo.... splash pad.... and the walk through a giant park to get to the other side of the island for the beaches/cottages :)
Great place for the whole family and friends. Lots to do and enjoy the scenery. You can go for a walk or enjoy the rides. Ealso good for all three generations.

Now that my kids are grown, I rarely go to Centre Island. When they were little I took them to the amusement park, buying an unlimited ride ticket, and we enjoyed the gardens and beaches.Today I prefer biking through Wards and Algonquin Islands, which is a much quieter environment. It is easy to get to - streetcar line runs right to the ferry - and well worth it. Give yourself a few hours, and walk out to the beaches on the south side. Wander through the residential area. Watch the folks playing and picnicking.
Great getaway from the city. Fun for the entire family....in the summer it doesn't get better than a trip to the island.
Pirate boat was amazing. The kids loved it so much .it's something that we will have to do again . Also a great place for a picnic for the family
Very beautiful place to be especially on a nice summer day. There are rides for kids. The beach is awesome too. Perfect place to spend a whole day with friends or family.

Summer is the right time to go there, as all the food stalls are open and a good crowd is around. Take your bike there or rent one from the island, its one of the best ways to get around as the walk is long, esp along the boardwalk on the shore of the lake.If you have visitors from...
I would recommend taking bukes and touring all the islands. Watch any food - the geese and ducks are not shy.There are picnic tables scattered around and plenty of places for a pop up ball game.
As a family we take a trip to the island every year. As the kids have grown older I'm finding there is less to do. We still always have a good time. And will probably continue tradition.

The ferry ride to the island is an experience in itself. Awesome city views, great photo opps!The islands offer attractions for everyone.....family at center island, cyclist enjoy the paths from obe end to the other, nice beaches.....(clothing optional)Definitely worth visiting! The skyline on the way back is the greatest plus for this trip !
It was a sunny October Saturday, and what a great escape from the city...yet so close! the park is beautiful

This is a great spot on a warm spring, summer or fall day. Just a 20 min Ferry ride from downtown TO and you could be lounging on a sunny beach, paddle boarding, canoeing or cycling or hiking around the island or taking the kids for an old fashioned merry-go-round ride at the island's amusement park that's just for ki!ds....

Great getaway for a break from citry life. This park has it all. The amusement park is great for the children with rides and a farm. The beaches are great and the water is clean for swimming. A full service restaurant as well many fast food restaurants round out the park experience . Pack a picnic rent a bicycle and...

Took the grandchildren during heat wave in TO.Great breezes. Lots of fun rides.Reasonable amusement ticket rates.Kids loved the flume ride with water splashing up on them.A great day overall. The ferry is always a thrill, at any age!
Nothing better than getting away from the traffic and getting back to nature. Would highly recommend to any visitor to the city. But don't go on a cloudy day as it can get cool around the water.

You need to take the ferry to get to the island. Once on the island, there is a little amusement park for kids, there's a beach for you to sit and tan, you can tandem bike and explore the different paths. Especially love going to the island in late Sept/Oct, when crowds have dissipated, leaves are starting to change colour, and it's still warm enough to dip your feet in the lake or just enjoy the sandy beaches. My husband and I live in Toronto and it's been years since we've taken the ferry over to the Toronto Islands. We finally went over a couple of times this summer and loved it! I absolutely adore the Toronto Islands. We went on a beautiful Autumn day and had the most gorgeous view of Toronto's skyline. Went here with my aunt and little cousin. Its a beautiful hidden gem of quietness among the hustle and bustle of the downtown core.
If the sun is shinning this is a very relaxing and quiet place to spend the day, being so different from the front in Toronto. Green, clean and easy to get about.

We set out to visit the Toronto Island (having been before) but it decided to rain halfway across on the ferry. There wasn't much to see as the mist rolled in too. Fantastic trip to island park with so much to do and amazing views of Toronto skyline. Worth every dollar
amazing place to visit with family and friends,we spend a gorgeous afternoon by the watter!highly recommended

Ferry trip is just 15 minutes and nice. On the island you get a great view of the city from the other side of the bay. Good for cycling or inline skating as the paved roads are wide. We came here mid September and was disappointed to find most things closed. However we hired a bike car thingy, and had great fun bombing it up and down the roads! Very pretty and just a lovely place to spend a day!

I had a perfect summer day here, picnic on the beach and biking through the trails, so fun, anyone who visits Toronto should definitely take the ferry out to the islands! If you don't like crowds skip Centre Island and head to Hanlans or Ward's instead
The best part of a tour of the islands is the view of the city of Toronto. It gives you a good perspective of the size of the city.

My visit took place on a midweek afternoon in October, off-season, so the ferry was on its winter schedule. Never had the time to visit until later into the summer, but it was DEFINITELY worth the visit. Toronto island is a great location absolutely beautiful houses, gardens, and views. Unfortunately we picked a bad day to ferry across. We enjoyed visiting and walking in the park. Toronto's skyline gave us an incentive to have an artist produce a picture for us.

This is an oasis of quiet in the urban center of Toronto. The gardens are lovely. We rented a quadracycle and were able to see a bit more than if we had seen the island solely on foot. But, you could still cover a lot of it at a brisk walk.

Beautiful park and setting. Could spend an entire day out there. Only thing missing would be some better food spots out there. They were ok but nothing special. Next time we visit we will bring our own picnic lunch and bicycle to explore more of the park.

Nice boat ride.Can't remember which boat company we were in.They were fabulous. Explaining all the history of the island. Our kids really enjoyed it.Nice park. Haven't changed much.Rides were fun for the kids.Food was okay. We did pack treats & drinks.Definitely will be going back.

Spent the day here from the city. Caught the ferry over for $7.50 per adult return. Took about 5mins. Great boardwalk between ward island and centre island. A must if visiting Toronto is to take the ferry over to the Islands. Gorgeous views of Toronto and feels like a mini break away from the hustle and bustle of the city. It's Toronto's own little piece of heaven. Loved it here. Stay late and watch the geese gather on . the grass verges of the lake then take...

We enjoyed about 3 hours of walking on the island during mid-September. Easy to notice that we were bit late in season even though the weather was really warm. This is a great place to visit, went over to the Islands and loved it. It was a sunny day and lots to do and see. Highly recommend

From the ferry crossing you have a perfect opportunity for photo taking as your leaving, you have an amazing view of the skyline. When your on the Island, there is a beach if you wish to just relax, a park for the kids to play in. If you are like me and like to walk across the island you will...

i just happen to visit downtown and ended up taking a ferry ride to the island....trust me the ferry ride was amazing the view of city from the freey and the island is to die for,....After i reached it was winters, hence everything was closed looked like deserted island but when i walked towards the beach it was just...
Great day out easy access from the city and lots to do for the kids.Go early - 10am and miss the Qs on the boats back and forward. Take your own lunch too if you want lots of places to have a picnic
A wonderful get away from the city within the city! Great adventure starts with a ferry ride across Toronto Harbour. Walk, bicycle, swim, sun bath, play. Enjoy the greenery or sitting in the sand.
Rent a bike and enjoy the day, cycling around the Island. It was my favourite thing to do while in Toronto.

Visiting Toronto Island Park should be at the top of every visitor's list of things to do.We took the ferry to the island for a round trip ticket cost of $7.50 per person. We were hoping to ride bikes but the bike rental place has already closed for the year. Only one restaurant was open on the island which closed tomorrow. The amusement park was closed. But the farm with farm animals cows, goats, and pigs is open all year around. Last day for water taxis too.
Went there in October. Mainly to get a view over to Toronto, which is great! However even on a Sunday in early October everything was closed! Shame as could've been a great gem.
A lovely space away from the city, good beaches and good walks. Great for views over the lake and back to the city.
This is a lovely place to visit. The ferry journey gives a super view of Toronto and it is easy to walk around or you can hire bikes.
We took the island ferry on a beautiful late summer Sunday and enjoyed the Island Park, especially the views of the downtown TO skyline.

Took cousins from Europe to Toronto Island park as from the boat you can get wonderful pictures of Toronto skyline. A must go visitors. Park is beautiful with lots of old trees and wonderful plants all around. Maze is great for kids. Beach very nice. Highly recommend.

I think this is best part of Toronto. The view of the city from islands is amazing. Ferry was very cheap but if you can, don t go on weekends because islands and ferry are too packed. We visited the islands on a weekday afternoon in August with our 10 and 12 year olds. In the future I would have packed a lunch. We were hoping to eat when we got off the ferry but the options at the food court were not good at all. The kids enjoyed walking around and checking out the animals at...
Take a ferry from the waterfront and within 5-10 minutes you will be transferred to beautiful green park with lots of attraction.

The park is a great place to walk and bike. The restaurant by the ferry dock is way over over priced.The beach is just ok. If you enjoy being bitten by flies then this is the place to go. No matter where on the beach you lay, you will be bitten. Bring bug spray.

We met Toronto locals on a train from Montreal who recommended, in particular Ward Island. We were not disappointed. Catch the ferry to centre island from Jack Lleyton ferry terminal. A series of interconnected islands which is primarily a public summer beach and leisure spot. However ward island has some quirky and beautiful homes. A great lunch stop was the...
It is easy to take the ferry over to the Island from Toronto. Then walk, shop, hit a classy small restaurant, and simply enjoy the afternoon of classic charm.

I bought my ferry tickets online in advance as you can use them anytime any day within the year of purchase. Ferry's run frequently and you can pick up a timetable in the ferry terminal, it's all very easy to navigate around. We boarded the ferry and got off at the first island (wards island) through recommendation of a resident...

No trip to Toronto is complete without a trip to the Toronto Islands. Here, you have several beaches to choose from (nude as well), various activities such as cycling (tandem, single, even 4 people bikes), kayaking, canoeing, etc. I come out here almost every summer just to kayak to have a perfect view of the Toronto skyline. Don't miss out!
A must see in Toronto! A great get away from the busy city. Family friendly with stunning views of the skyline.

I visited the island with my cousin and we had a wonderful time. We hired one of those tandem cycles and went around the whole island.The journey from the port was very cheap around 7 dollars if I remember correctly. Bring some lunch for a picnic.

Well worth the visit just to escape the crowded streets of Toronto. You will need the weather for this one as the breeze from Lake Ontario can make it feel rather cool so chose a sunny day. Nice walking and refresh here, nice areas to relax in.

If you're in Toronto then the island is an absolute must. Bet time to leave is early on 10am first ferry. It gets really busy later but lots of ferry crossings. Our little one had lots of fun with the animals and the fun park. A park island, good for waking, ciclind, seat and appreciate the view. Awesome for families and friends. Bring water and appetizers.
Bike riding, walking, lovely sceanery and a beautiful park experience. This is a must do when in Toronto.

If you need a beach holiday and can't afford mexico, this might just do for an afternoon away. It was a wonderful park to walk around, I found Hanlan's park to be the best for an afternoon away in a lovely park. Took a riverboat tour that included a stop at the islands on a visit to Toronto last week. It was a great day and there was a lot to do in this park. This were some small amusement park rides for kids, a petting zoo with a lot of different animals, beaches, and nature trails. Would love to go back...

Great day out . Lovely park amd fountains The park is beautiful.Well worth a visit , plently of things to do with kids , the lake front walk is super Also getting the water taxi is fun cad$ 10 each way , but ypu can get the ferry .

The park is very peaceful and there are plenty of birds and squirrels. It was a nice change from the busy city. Gorgeous experience with lovely gardens, great little beach on the other side with a pier . Very nice with a children's park. Great for kids. Lots of walking areas.

Went as a family.The shuttle was slow and cramped, but the island park is beautiful and relaxing.The kids enjoyed the amusement park, although I would not drag kids all the way down to that park just for that amusement park.We took a family bike for an hour which was fun, although might be tiring for older people.

It is worth going to walk around, there are several routes you can take and there are cafes to eat and drink. It is good for children as there are rides and a farm to visit.We used the ferry which is cheap, however, it is well used and therefore can be (as we found) very crowded. We noted while...

As other people have commented it's worth going just for the views back to the skyline of Toronto.We got the ferry to hanlans point and walked back to get the ferry from centre island.We could have walked further but that was enough for us.Once you get near to the ferry there is a few places to get...

Great take-off from the city! We visit there two times and it was so nice to get off the city for few hours, just walk on the grass and watch gooses, swans and squirrels. There is some animal farm too where is pigs, goats, donkey and many farm animals. On island there is great view to toronto skyline

Just a 10 minute ferry ride from the heart of downtown Toronto is a series of charming, connected, Islands. There's a 5km coastal path, beaches, little cafes and restaurants, a children's theme park, boat tours, and other attractions. Full of wildlife, it's a lovely, peaceful, easy trip from the city.

Been there by our co-church members and was amazed when I saw how beautiful it was. You felt you are not in the city but in a paradise like place that you can see a lot of views, greenery, sandy beaches, trees, animals and lots more. It seems one stop shop of all recreation you want to do when you...

An island away from the downtown, with a beach, rides, parks, picnic spots, cycles & more importantly, a stunning view of the Toronto skyline. It is an amazing place for the kids and the neat parks and surroundings make it an excellent picnic spot.
A great spot to break away from the busy city. The view on the skyline is amazing from the island. The ferry ride is fun (but windy from time to time)

Fabulous place to go. The ferry was very reasonably priced. Great place to take a picnic and relax. Lovely houses to see. Good spot to have a walk. I would recommend you go if you are in Toronto. Great view of Toronto from the island too.
This iland is for kids of all ages from 1to90. There's lot to do and lots of space to do it in, plenty of place's to eat . Give it a go you will not regret it.

If you are at a loose end for a day in Toronto, take the short ferry trip over to Toronto Island on Lake Ontario. It is a great day out if you just want to take things easy away from the city for a while. So peaceful. Stoll round to the far side of the island and have lunch at...

The biggest Toronto park that includes beaches (also optional closing beach) perfect to leave from noise and stress city and be quiet and relaxed. just think that from one side to other is around 5 km. Nice

Went with a group of old classmates. Took the ferry, about 10 minutes ride, was a very pleasant experience with a great view of the Toronto skyline. We took the ferry to get over to here, very reasonable and well worth doing! This is a really nice area, nice sandy beaches and swimming, and bike rental is 100% worth doing to make sure you see the whole park. There are some brilliant photo opportunities to capture the famous skyline from this area too. Would recommend bringing a...
Great skyline views of Toronto, great place to walk, jog, kayak, sail or any number of recreational things.

Definitely definitely a must see, must do, must go. Love the park and also the skyline views with the ferry. 7,50 return trip very cheap. Beaches, kitesurfing, and much more. We hiked the island, but you can also hire a bike. Day of relaxation. Loved it.

Amazing island getaway. It's mostly about Artist Residencies. I was there in September. I fell in love with Toronto, it is so diverse and yet there's an ease there.So much to do.And Uber plus the public transit makes it the best of both worlds.
A nice place to relax. We took the Ferry. Good value. Plenty of seats.Very peaceful gazing across the Lake and stepping away from the excitement of the big City.
We took the ferry to get to the island. So worth it! Such a beautiful place. There is a nice beach, you can rent bicycles to go around the island. Nice city view.

We visited this island after catching the ferry across to Centre Island. It was a lovely relaxing place with a variety of beautiful landscaped gardens, waterways and then a lovely walk to the beach areas. Well worth a visit and most off all you get a fantastic view of the Toronto skyline when you look back across the Lake.
A park in the city at the fringe of the city, offers opprtunities to chill in TO's extreme summer heat, and the views are amazing.

Took the 1 hour cruise boat around the harour and stopped off at the Islands for a few hours. Beautiful but area around the shore was in need of some upgrading especially the toilets and changing rooms. We hired a bike to get around, which was great as the area is flat. This is an oasis right in the city. First of all, you get an extraordinary view of the Toronto skyline for a $5 or $6 ferry ride (round trip!); great photo opportunities. The whole island has three ferry docks. We only got off at Centre Island. The island, as a whole, has a few residents, no cars, offers several different...

Spent a lovely day here. It is such a quiet little idyll only minutes from a very busy city. We visited off season, and there was not much open. It is lovely just to walk around.During the summer there is a little fun fair and I think they do open theatre as well. There are some play parks and...

It's worth to go just to see Toronto from other side. It's calm and relax. Probably during summer there are a lot of people,but on lazy sunday morning in the end of September there were only few people there.

If you like natural spaces near a big city, Toronto Island Park is a great place to visit. There are several islands, some not permitted to have people (to protect wildlife). Decide to go across to the island on a whim, it was a really hot dayLots of trails for walking and bikingGood ferry connections to the mainland, only takes a few minutesPlaces to get snacks and drinks

I'm skeptical of places that look too "touristy", so I went reluctantly to Toronto Island Park, but it was well worth the visit. Lots of walking trails with bike rentals available if you want to cover more ground. There are a few food choices and lots of green space. Who would have thought that there was a beach over here as well as an amusement park and beautiful flowers and shrubbery! Worth a visit.
We were lucky to have a good warm but overcast day for our trip to the island. Lovely walks and must be the best views of the city you can get from the ferry

Wait for the night to set and appreciate the Toronto skyline from the shores of the island! Visit the beaches on the other side and bring some food and drinks - restaurants and bars only open during summer season.

The park is big and the view of the lake is just gorgeous! There are a lot of things to do as well. "amusement park" for kids, restaurants. I only got to go to the center park, but there are actually quite a few parks. I heard that the food was good too. Unfortunately, the restaurants close so early, before...

We went here on our first morning in Toronto right when the ferry opened up. It is a small island with beautiful views of Toronto and plenty of spots to get photos of the skyline. one of the best park i ever visited i went with my friends we enjoy a lot .it was very romantic park .

Put aside an entire day for this. Toronto Island is a beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle of downtown Toronto. It is almost hard to believe that a place like this exists in the city. It has the absolute best views of the city skyline.Highlights of the Island include Halans Point Beach, the supposedly haunted lighthouse, and Centreville....

We had two hours to kill so we went to the harbor area to take the ferry to the island park. Tickets to the Center Islands were for round trip and costs about $7.50. Seniors and students get discount. The sight of the Toronto skyline slowly expands as the ferry pulls away from the dock and move towards the Center...
Took a boat - just circling the island. Did not get off. The island looked clean, with walking paths and open parks. Nice photo opportunities.

This is an excellent escape at the foot of downtown Toronto. To avoid the long queues, I recommend purchasing the ferry tickets online. Hiring a bicycle is highly recommended and an excellent way to see the Island.
A must visit while in Toronto. The island is GREAT for all activities or even just lounging. Be prepared for a all day event.

I have been going to the Toronto Islands since the early 70s. It's basically the same as it's always been--which is amazing. Probably a lot of visitors give it a miss. That's a big mistake! Book the ferry online to skip the queues on a hot summer day and get over to Toronto island to chill out from the buzz of the city. The boardwalk stroll was so nice, almost romantic. There is lots for families to do, including bike hire, and some quiet spots for friends or couples to relax in the sun or...

The island is accessed by ferry from the quay in Toronto. It is very popular with Torontonians, but even so we found quiet spots on the beaches and parks. A good place to take a picnic, and there are BBQs available to use. Pizza kiosks and cafes are on the island.

We boarded a ferry from the city and this took around 15 minutes each way (I think). When we got there, it was very calming and beautiful. Its very popular for all ages. You can even hire a bike and do a complete tour. It has a beach at the end of a straight walk where we relaxed and chilled...

From the ferry ride that highlights this cities unique skyline to the many open and hidden green pathways on this island. At trip here is a must.The contrast between the municipal open park of Centre Island to the quiet secluded residential parts as you head towards Wards Island, is to be savoured.
Not a lot to say other than the fact that I am always amazed with this beautiful oasis a short boat ride from Harbourfront..Take a day and just visit... you'll go home feeling renewed...

Toronto has lots of parks, but it is a big busy city.Hop on the ferry to the park and it's a whole new world.Plenty of locals with bikes, families, swimming, and green everywhere.There are even signs with "walk ON the grass"
We took the ferry over to the park. It's awesome that the ferry is the only means of transportation to and from the park! I can only imagine this bustling island in the warm months!

When I visited the sun was out and there were very few clouds to be seen; so of course heading to the island and therefore the beach was on the agenda. Admittedly I didn't have the full day to spend here but it would be very easy to take your time exploring the island and having a relaxing full day...

We love the outdoors so like visiting the Island. Great views of the city. We visited on a Monday in sept and the boat hire was closed which was a shame. We hired a tandem for an instead which was good fun and good value.We took the the ferry and the queue back was around 40 minutes.We later...
From the ferry ride to the boardwalk to gardens to the beach to the lunch at the Rectory Cafe it was a very enjoyable half day. Well worth a visit even during a brief visit to Toronto.

Ferry is 7 dollars to go to the island.My partner and i rented a double bike for its 15 dollars for 1 hour its really cool.we love the island nice view so many things to do you can bring your own food and have picnic.

Our friends who live in Toronto said this was a good place to see the city and yes they were right. We had lunch at the Refectory Cafe under the trees. Sailing boats, bikes, swimming... plenty for everyone

We came as a group with two young children on a sunny September Sunday.I feel its a must do for Toronto, you get a great view of the city from the ferry (do this rather than expensive boat tour).The island has lots of mini attractions and its great for kids. The family changing facilities are a bit substandard...

Though the ferry line can be long on some summer days, this is a great half-day trip from downtown Toronto. Short walk from Union stations / downtown. Ferry ride is short with great views of skyline. Best walk is towards the Centreville amusement park, then to the small waterpark and beach. Bring a blanket and snacks etc.

We visited here a couple of days ago. The sun was shining and we had a lovely day. We went over on a boat trip with the option of hopping off and staying on the island. Well I'm glad we did it was worth it. You get a wonderful view of the city Skyline, the Carousel Cafe served good reasonably...

This is a lovely place to visit in Toronto. It has a little bit of everything.Public spaces, lovely gardens, playgrounds, beaches for sunbathing and swimming, rides for small children and even a hedge maze.We went over with two little guys aged 6 and 4. We brought food so I can't speak to the food or prices of food...

Took the ferry across to the islands for the day to relax away from the busy city and really enjoyed the visit. The ferry fee is very reasonable and they have a good timetable to allow you to stay or leave when every you want (every 30mins from the centre island and every hour from other two) the views of...

We went over late afternoon and that was a mistake as cycle hire stops as the bikes have to be back by 5pm. Our advise is go early, take a picnic and children if you have them. Lots of open space and a beach plus garden areas and a family could spend all day here. We walked it in the...

column3: São Carlos do Pinhal, São Paulo, Brazil
column4: You can take the ferry, that is not very expensive and you can discover a wonderful world with different beaches, people biking, which is an excellent option, you can rent a bike first and visit the whole island by bike. There is a cafe where you can buy something to eat, or you can have your own picnic by the...

Loved the Central island Ferry over, only $7 return. Great for families it even has a beach. Very warm day we went over and brought lunch over with us in cool bags. Loads of water fountains to refill our water bottles, bikes to rent out, including 2 seaters and 4 seaters. Noticed boats can be rented but it was closed...

On our visit to Toronto we booked the ferry to Toronto online which worked out well. This Park is absolutely beautiful. The way to see it is by rental bicycle. We walked from Center Island ferry dock to Hanlon Point (we are in our mid 70's) and it took us a full day to recover. We had a beautiful sunny...

My family and I ended up on the island in August 2016. I have not been there in a long while. I must say that the beach and the island have been well maintained and is an absolute great place to hang out with the Family or as a couple. Great for kids. There a few things to do ......
Still the same as when I was a kid! The ferry is only $7.50 return per Adult. The amusement park costs but there are picnic areas, beaches and barbecues you can use.

This is a great place to come for the day. Bring a barbecue, cooler filled with your favorite drinks and good and spend a wonderful day closer to nature. If it's fun your looking for the island has something to offer different age groups. As a child I loved going there with my family and as a teen I loved...

I was born and raised in Toronto and it took me more than 40 years to visit Ward's Island! As a kid, teenager and young adult, I always went to Centre Island where I enjoyed the rides, the farm, the food and the flowers. I knew of Ward's Island, but I always thought it was just where a few lucky...

My hubby and I took the ferry ($7 return each) over to Toronto Islands in extremely hot weather - lovely! Once there we walked over to the bike hire place and rented one. It was great fun cycling round to Wards Island then back. There are some beautiful viewpoints to stop at along the way. Then we found somewhere for...
It is comfortable to get there by boat and you get a fantastic view of Toronto island. We could take great pictures as there were not many people on the spots.

We access the island by ferry on Saturday. Remember to buy tickets online prior to your visit to avoid the long queue if you decide to go with city ferry. Of course the ferry was not looking good but common, it's cheap for that short distance.It took us 3 hours to cycle the whole island (we hired the bike)...

This was one of my family's favorite places that we visited during a recent trip to the city. People of all ages and interestsbikers, runners, walkers, kayakers, beach-goers, picnickers, families or couples or singles, etc.had something to do there. Speaking as the mom of two young children (8 months old and almost 3), it's an ideal place for people with...
It was such an amazing experience. So peaceful and well maintained. The farm, canoeing , swinging... beautiful place and the fairy boat was perfect
My favorite place in Toronto. Highly recommend hiring a bike for an hour or two for a relaxing afternoon around the island. Pack sunscreen!
Fun for all ages. We took a water taxi over which was great compared to the packed ferry on the way back.

we went today September 14th right after CN tower tour.There are many ways to go to the island, the public fery for CAD 7 per person or the water taxi - which we took - cost CAD 10 and the good point is when you are coming back, you can take the fery and it is free!!On the...

Very nice Island. Got there rather late and the boat had 30mins delay. But the Island was definitely worth it!!! If you have kids go early so that they can have fun on site while everything is open. Bring your own food is a good idea...

It is wonderful to get a great new perspective of Toronto from the island. The ferry is quick and reliable and amazing free area to walk around. Its also nteresting to see tht some folk LIVE there and work in the City.

Highly recommend an Island visit, easily accessed by ferry from downtown. Enjoyed getting away from city's busy streets, nice and quiet, stepping back to a more peaceful time...residents quiet, likened to visiting the Vineyard!
Great place for kids and dogs. Grass, water, picnic ares, fast food, rides, what more could you want? Lie on grass, read a book, throw a all, walk and walk, get a ferry ride home. Repeat.

My husband and I visited the Islands about 6 times this summer. We use mobility scooters and this is a fantastic place to spend the day. We packed a picnic most days.I also took my Mom (94) over for lunch at the Island Café one day....we used walkers as it is close to the Ward's Island dock...delicious lunch, great...

It is a great idea to bring a cooler on wheels or a wagon if you have kids. Food can be pricy on the island and there aren't a lot of water fountains. Love getting there before the crowds. Noon the lines are so busy for the ferry. Kids will hate the wait.

Nice visited with family on a Toronto boat tour first and stop over the island, it was very nice walk all the way to the edge of the lake front and back to the boat pick up and continue with the Toronto city boat tour, finished back into the city of Toronto Harbour front. You could spend the whole day...

Toronto Island is an oasis from the summer crowds and heat of downtown Toronto. Centerville on Centre Island is an amusement park for families and tourists interested in a Canadas' Wonderland style experience without the $50.00 admission fee,For people more interested in nature walking and bird watching, take the ferry to Wards Island which features less crowds and more...
Very good place for summer! It is like English Garden in Munich, but only in Toronto :)Of course, with out Munich beer, but with Canadian :)

The view from the island of the city (Toronto) is amazing. Try to go in the afternoon to return at night. It is a magical experience. Moreover, during the afternoon you can rent a bike (or you can go with your own bike).It is good bring some water if you want to safe money ,although you can buy food, beverages...

I spent summer on my boat in Toronto Island Marina.This is an unbelievable piece of cottage country just across the harbour by ferry from downtown Toronto.In the marina there is a nice bar / restaurant with live entertainment most nights, a small chandlery and very friendly people.For non boaters, there is a large park area with a...

Great place to have a day out with the family. From the ferry ride to the farm animals and the amusement park area you a bound to have a really good time. Make sure you visit the beach area to go for a dip in the lake to cool off so you can keep enjoying all there is to offer....
It was a great way to spend a day in the summer with my grand-children - there is something for all ages - including the ferry ride back and forth.
Rode down to the ferry dock and took the ferry to Wards Island. Great place to relax for an afternoon, do some cycling, enjoy Centreville amusement park and swim at one of the beaches on a warm day.

My sisters, nieces and their female children get together every two years. We decided it would be fun to have a Toronto-based trip - getting buses, trams, subways and boats into the transportation mix.The day was fun for everyone, at some point or another. There was a lot of walking to do, so it meant, at times, we had...
Fun to go ride around the islandLunch at the rectory and ice cream on ward islandPoke stops for familiesBeachesGardensDisc golfThe ferry is reasonable and fairly regular

It's been a major attraction in Toronto forever, people live on the Island and there are at least 4 Marina's there as well. You can rent bikes and cover most of the island and never break a sweat.Rivers, paths, lake Ontario, the Toronto harbor, great view of the city especially at night, lots of photo opportunities, take a lunch...

If you want to see another side of Toronto you just have to go to the Toronto Islands. The ferry ride is fun (and you get to see planes flying right over your head as they land/take off from the Island Airport). Go to Centre Island - the plantings are truly beautiful, as are the bridges and fountain. Take the...

This place calms me. Have a friend, like to be alone with yourself to nurture you, spend time with a friend or a lover?! You will be amazed what nature and the city can do together for you! Perhaps it is just me?! No? Yes?! Have you seen the Pepé Le Pew? ;-) Cheers!...

Every summer I take my two grandchildren to the Toronto Central Island.We leave home in the morning, get the ferry and run for the amusement park to be the first ones to buy the day pass. They love to use the various rides, see the Far Away Zoo, go to the beach to find some interesting stones etc.The...
Just getting there is fun, taking the ferry! Lots to see & do. Wish we could have stayed longer. Best part was the play land by the beach and it was free.

This park is heaving when the kids/parents are on summer holidays. We went to this park on our first full day and it was hustle and bustle whilst we were there. The park does have a few rides for the small children but the tickets are very pricey. It also has a small 'vllage' of fast food restaurants. But, when...
Centre Island provides great views of Toronto and has nice beaches and lawns to sit and relax, along with food and beer.

It's fairly easy to get to the island, quick ferry ride and you are there. Once you are on the island be prepared to do a lot of walking. I would recommend this for an afternoon at the beach, of simply a picnic.

Went in the middle of the week so no crowds.rented a tandem bike and rode to wards island.gardens were still well maintained..ferry schedule now on fall timetable, so not running as often..great beaches to hang out and tan.

We took the Tiki Taxi over to the Island. It was Labor day so there were lots of people on the Island. The Island is so big that you never felt like you was on top of one another. We had some great walks and really enjoyed our day there.
Great park a lot to see very greet and a lot of locals also we spent there 2 hour around and could stay more but had to visit other places of Toronto.
I've been to the island for a picnic every time I visit Canada and it doesn't get old. Such a lovely view of the city and perfect for a day out, walk or a bike ride.

The Toronto Islands are but a short boattrip away. Boats go to three different places on the Island. The Islands are perfect for a bike ride or a relaxing walk away from the hustle and bustle from Toronto. Closer to the central Island there are a number of things to do if you have children.
A short ferry ride and the island offers a quiet alternative to the city with glorious views of Lake Ontario along the board walk and central pier. In summer there's even a small beach to enjoy.

I have only been there in the summer and would recommend it. Good to come early as lines for the ferry can be long but not a problem. You can walk, bike, rent a bike (even a bike for 4 people), lay on the beach etc. Beautiful to look at Torontos skyline from the island and the ferry.

Grounds are amazing, lots of grass and birds for children and adults to play on, run around on and look at. Beaches are nice (I didn't swim but apparently you can). Stunning views of the city.Only downside is that ferries don't seem to have a time table.

We arrived to Toronto for the firs time ever, off a rotten overnight flight and of course couldn't get into our hotel room. On one of the only rainy weekends Toronto experienced in the summer of 2016, so we made the best of it by catching the far from full ferry to Toronto Island. Well before the hoards of families...
Was in TO on work and got to visit TIP. Short ferry brings you to restaurants/bars, gardens, bike paths, and so much more. Very, very enjoyable summer spot to visit.
At only $6.50 to get over ( and back), it is a wonderful way to spend an afternoon...We walked for about 4 miles around the islands, and still did not make it round it all...Highly recommended..

We took the Centre Island Ferry to the islands and had a great time. There is a small amusement park located in the center of the island, and the beach is only a 10 minute walk from the Centre Island Ferry landing. There are two other ferries that take you to the islands, however they land at opposite sides of...

The wait to buy the ticket and waiting to board the boat was long, but the boat ride to the island was very fast and you are treated to a great view of the skyline. (If your time is limited and willing to send a few more dollars per person you can use the water taxi to cross the water...

We took off to the islands the last day of our holiday in Toronto. It was a very hot day in September.The ferry ride is great for taking pictures of the skyline.We rented bikes when we arrived and we rode all around the islands. It was such a nice day.Sadly most of the island was closed down...

Visited here during a 5 day stay in Toronto and it was a lovely escape from the city. It was pretty busy - but it was a public holiday! We got a taxi boat over to the islands which seemed to be better than crowding onto one of the larger ferries.There is lots of open space, where there were...

Hiring bikes and boats is good fun to explore. Nice beaches espacially if you go up the trail to the smaller beaches as there are less people on the beach making it less crowded. Highly recommend coming to Toronto island at sunset not only is it less crowded but nice for a swim with a view.

Enjoyed our day at Centre island. My daughter was happy enough to spend all day at the beach swimming. Plenty of space for everyone - didn't think that there would be give all the people coming over on the ferries! Cheap as chips to get over to the island and you can spend and much (or as little) as you...
Make sure you have good weather as it has a beach and bring a picnic as only has pizza and subway easy to get to and board the boat. Fun riding the quadricycle and nice views

My niece and nephew and I went to centre island for the day and rented bikes to go around the island. We spend a good couple hours biking around. The day was perfect to spend at the island. There is also a beach, and another beach for clothes optional.
I've visited the Central Island. Absolutely lovely place to relax after a day of sightseeing.Nice architecture features and many tourist facilities.
A lovely quiet island for a day of nothing. Walking and relaxing after a very busy holiday itinerary.

My visit to Toronto Centre Island was definitely one of the highlights of my visit to the city. Given that the only cost is the ferry ride, this is a fantastic and cheap outing for tourists and locals alike. Skip the touristy amusements and head straight to the wooded park and beautiful beaches. Not to be missed!
Spent an afternoon biking around the islands while visiting Toronto. Terrific views of the city. Take the Tiki Taxi over and the free public ferry back.

Peaceful place for a stroll or a bike ride on the boardwalk along the lake. A few places to eat though I did not try any of them. The waters edge of Centre Island is a great spot to take photographs of the Toronto skyline. We took the ferry to Ward's Island and walked along the boardwalk to the pier...

We walked along the quay and saw a sign for taxis to the islands so we went over to centre island. There is a freed worry service that you can get which we got back and is great.The islands are free and there is lots todoThere are etched with changing rooms and showersParks to walk round etc...

We went here with our teenage sons for the day. Super easy to get to on the ferry and we loved our bike ride. We were sorry we forgot our bathing suits for the beach! Great place to pack a picnic or buy lunch at one of the restaurants.

We hired bikes (from a bike shop next to the Radisson Hotel/ and took them on the ferry to Ward Island. We cycled all around the Island stopping for tea and a cake. You can rent all kinds of water craft including canoes and kayaks to explore the many water ways around the Islands. Bike hire is also available. There...

This island has so much to offer!! It's mostly suited to family's and the play park looks great for kids but us as a couple enjoyed it too. We hired bikes and cycled around the island seeing all the lovely views it had to offer! we would have kept them for longer but they didn't have a day rate only...

The boat trip over is only short but it takes you a world away from busy downtown. The boat trip itself gives you a chance for great photos of downtown from a different angle. The island park its self was clean and very well kept, the grounds are lovely. You can hire a bicycle or quad bicycle on the grounds...

This is just the best place to go on a hot sunny day to escape the city. The view back to Toronto is amazing. There is a free ferry to and from the island and once there plenty to explore. There are many bridges joining the islands so you can go from one to the other and even a beach....

We got the 11am ferry and once we arrived went straight to the bike rental, remember to bring cash as they don't take card! We took the bikes for 2 hours and cycled all around, stopping of for a swim on one or the lovely beaches when we got too hot. We were back on the ferry for 2pm after...
Very nice and interesting place. There are a nice beaches.Lot of fun for adults and children. Recommend to everyone visit Toronto to visit this place too.

Took a ferry across to the island, had lunch at one of the restaurants and wandered the island. Beautiful areas and beaches, bicycles to rent for more touring options. A must-see during the summer and you can take great photos of downtown.
Has a little zoo that's free and rides for the kids. Lots of food vendors. It is like a little fair that keeps growing every year.

The islands are not to be missed - it's a real urban oasis. There's something for everyone here, with heaps of activities and heaps of green to keep you grounded. We took the ferry to Centre Island and walked the 2km to Ward's Island.Centre Island had the beach and the maze, but when we went at the start of...

Great place to escape the noise of the city, offering spectacular views of Toronto's skyline.There's beaches, trees, gardens, children's areas, paths to stroll, canals to canoe, bikes to rent, Centreville Amusement Park, picnic areas, piers....there's something for everyone.Part of the allure is the ferry ride over (from Jack Layton Terminal).Temperatures are always cooler on the island than...

We went here for an afternoon whilst visiting Toronto. We caught a water taxi over to the island and then got the ferry back ( which was free). A very pretty island with plenty of flowers and greenery. Nice " beach-type" area with paddling etc. Views over yo Toronto and the CN tower were fab! There is a kids theme...
spent most of the day there with 2 toddlers n a bunch of teens. lots to eat. many kiddy rides. birds to feed. lots of greenspace. walked from union. took ferry. great day!

We took the ferry over for a day on the island. The ferry ride was very nice and not very long. But once on the island, there are walking/biking paths, a small amusement park for kids, a beach or two and lots of trees to get out of the sun. The views of the city from this vantage point is...
Actually better for kids but even the adults enjoyed the outing. Ferry ride was busy but reasonably fast. Island had fun food and rides. Good place for picnics.

Centre Island is a great place for young and old alike. The landscaping, gardens, education entertainment for the young old, the zoo, picknic areas and beach is incredible. Hard to image this gem exists in the heart of downtown. The beauty on the island and the beauty of the Toronto skyline is incredible from the beach.

This is a must go attraction when the weather is good. For kids there is small amusement park and a littleFarm. A nice beach to enjoy during the summer. Lots of green area, bike paths and everything is so clean and beautiful. There are three options of ferry to go there departing from the downtown. The centre vile goes...

Never went often when I lived in Toronto but it is a great place to run to.Just went with our family and a bunch of our nieces during a family get together. Nice day on the beach.Ferry can be very busy and the wait times long. Trick is to take one of the various water taxis. It will...
one of my favorite place. Love nature and beautiful place for day trip. Anyone can enjoy with their family .

Definitely a must see when visiting toronto during the summer. Stroll through the park or relax on the beach. We took the water taxi over as it is much faster and the ferry back. Lots of activities for kids as well.

Definitely buy tickets online to avoid lining up! It was a breeze to board the ferry to Centre Island. I recommend going to the Boathouse to rent a kayak/canoe. There, you have the option to rent a locker so don't worry about your bags! You have the option to paddle from anywhere between 1 hour to a full day. I...

Took the ferry to Wards Island and walked all the way over to Hanlan's Point--spent all day on the Islands. It was so incredible to be in such a large city yet feel in such a green, quiet, and serene environment. The Islands are a true urban oasis. I was also absolutely floored with how clean and well-stocked all of...
Have been going since I was a kid. Decades between visits since, but a trip to the islands is still a treat.
This was the highlight of our trip- it was so beautiful and clean and the vendors have a variety of food and drinks to enjoy.
Lovely beaches and walks. Take a picnic and enjoy a walk and sit on the beach. Fab views back across Toronto.

What a lovely island! We've been here three times now on visits to Toronto (as we are British, not Canadian) and we loved coming here!Everywhere is so well kept! There is no litter anywhere, although there are lovely grassy areas there, that tourists are free to walk on. You can also hire bikes and quadricycles on the island (four...

What a treasure this is for the locals and visitors alike. After taking a $5 ferry ride, which you can get your ticket online early, we walked everywhere. The signs on the lawns said 'Please walk on the grass". This set the tone for our visit. You can bike, hike or boat with rentals on Centre Island or you can...

On a gorgeous day in Toronto we took the ferry to Ward Island, wandered through the houses and along the shore, with a stop at the Rectory Cafe for a beer and a bite. The line was long at Centre Island for the ferry back, so we hopped onto the taxi. A little more $, but a quick ride across...

We took a water taxi over and the ferry back. It was a hot summer day so we enjoyed some beach time and playing in the water. We also enjoyed a lovely lunch under the shade of trees at the Rectory Cafe. Beach was clean and despite being crowded, everyone seemed respectful of others and their space. I was impressed...

Another great visit to the Toronto islands on a beautiful Labour Day weekend! Brought our bikes over and enjoyed riding around the island. Stopped for a nice picnic lunch that we brought with us. The rides at Centreville are fine for young kids but would not recommend the all you can ride bands for anybody over 4 ft. There just...

We hadn't planned on passing through Toronto. We stayed at the Shangri-La which was a beautiful hotel and were looking for something leisurely to do during the day. We rented bikes and took the ferry over and leisurely biked the island. It was a beautiful day however very crowded for Labor Day, I would recommend this for families as it...
We wanted to see the city from a different perspective. We also love the beach. We spent the afternoon there. We could have spent much more time.

For the cost of 6 Canadian dollars, the cost of return ferry to the Islands, this is a wonderful day out. Loads to do, swimming, kayaking, fairground, Cafes, Restaurants, Beaches, Cycling etc etc. Don't miss out and go may after queue half hour or so for Ferry but worth the wait

I really wish we had more time here as the lake was lovely for swimming in and perfectly safe for the children. The boat ride across was fun, as was the small rides that were on the island. My two youngest daughters (6+8) liked the rides but they were too small and "babyish" for my son...worth considering if you are...

every year they raise the ferry fees. great place to visit during non peak season. I found out you can purchase your ferry ticket online to avoid waiting in line. nice place to visit to get away from the city

We made a short visit to the islands on a beautiful warm sunny day. After walking around the buildings and crowds downtown, the visit to the islands was a welcome respite. As well, the journey to the islands on the ferry offers a great view of the shoreline and cityscape. We enjoyed the comparatively wide open green spaces and lovely...

Toronto islands are always attractive for the visitors... A walk from Ward's island to center island is a nice one on the boardwalk... A nice cafe on Ward's island is the place to grab something to bite.

100% recommend a trip over. I just went there to get away from the city. Even though there was a lot of people (Labour weekend) the atmosphere and beaches were lovely. Amazing idea if you have kids too.
I you want a day to relax the island is a very good place to go to. A decent beach a nice ferry ride.

We took the ferry to Centre Island and rented a tandem bicycle. Perfectly maintained grass lawns "Please walk on the grass!" Great little ride around the island to take in all the sights (lighthouse, sandy beaches with clean water, little cafe)

I love the boat ride ($7.50 return) and the beautiful views of the city day and night.The park has lots for children to do at Centreville but expect the usual expense of a tourist attraction.The Skyride was out of service again this year but the train ride is always fun.Less geese than in previous years so I...

Cheap and Easy Ferry crossing will take you to the islands where you can spend few hours or the entire day. Be prepared to wait in line as the ferry lines are long on Fridays and weekends. $7.50 Canadian dollars will take you there and back - which us way cheaper than cruises. You can take many amazing photos of...
We took the ferry to the islands and had a great time walking around and taking the most amazing pictures of Toronto. It is a very relaxing trip!

Toronto Central Island has been a popular place, as long as I remember, with the locals as well as with visitors to the city, especially families with children. Over the years it has developed to welcome visitors in large numbers. It has lots of attractions for each and every age group to spend time and enjoy.I myself enjoyed with...

Took the ferry over to the island. There are great views of Toronto and the CN Tower from the ferry. There's plenty to do on the island, stroll around and discover the beautiful scenery, spend time on the beach ( although be aware one part of the beach is clothing optional) there is also fun and activities for children. Great...

We went on Toronto Island on a beautiful Day. It is a nice place with a lot of green and beautiful beaches. Especially the Kids loved it very much. They could swim in the lake and run around the Park. From the Island we had a perfect view of the skyline around Cn Tower. A must-see in Toronto.

A great place, either for a day or a couple of hours. Nice and calm vibe, attractions for families, loads of picnic areas, places to chill and/or read a book, and AWESOME view of Toronto's skyline! DO NOT MISS. Also very affordable, Take the ferry for 7.5$.
Easy ferry crossing to a beautiful island. Spend the day walking, eating and drinking. Fabulous views of the Toronto skyline.

Took the ferry over and had a great walk round the island. This place is very special after the fast noisy pace of the main city. It is always a special place to escape and enjoy the simpler pleasures. Well worth visit
Brilliant for a family day out. You can take a ferry to the island in which you can enjoy the beach and amusement park for children. Beautiful.

The trip by ferry was easy although long lines. The walks were not too long and the tram around the park was easy and enjoyable especially with elderly that has difficulty walking. Food was minimal-cash only.

I love everything about the Toronto Islands. Bring a picnic and everything you need for a day outdoors (soccer ball, frisbee etc). Food and bike rentals are available. You can, however, bring your own bike on the ferry. My only suggestion is to buy your ferry ticket in advance. It will save a lot of time!

This island has to be on the to do list of anyone who visits Toronto. Take the ferry from Queens Quay and reach the island in 10 minutes. I took a trip late in the evening and saw a beautiful sunset. The transition of the downtown skyline from dusk to night lights is truly beautiful. The park is huge though...

Toronto Island is a great place to go for the day/part day. Ferry is cheap ($7.50 return) and at least every hour depending on time of day (not so much on the way back so be sure to check times). Three different ferries going to 3 different ports (centre island the main one  obviously..).If you have your own...

This is the place to come when the weather is beautiful... there's everything you could possibly want to do outside, from bike rentals to beaches, and even when the ferries are packed, you can always find a quiet spot on the islands away from the crowds.

The ferry to the island was exceptionally busy both ways, but once on the island it was easy to avoid the crowds. The views of the Toronto skyline were excellent and generated several photographs. Food outlets were good and reasonable value for the location. The day we visited was exceptionally hot, but shade was easy to find when needed. Well...

Spent all my life in Toronto. Ferry can be crowded but the island is nice for a day (or afternoon) outing in the country in the summer. Some ferries do not take bicycles on the weekend. Bring something warm for the winds on the lake (unless the day is really hot).

The beautiful islands are a usual item during any visit to Toronto. This year there is a trolley tour which lasts about 35 minutes and shows how vast and beautiful the park is. Great visit for families young and old. Pick a nice sunny day.... There is a kiddie attraction on the island and a small farm with variety of animals. Food on island need improvement. Not very good food in cafe.

Great place to go to spend a day away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Great walking and biking trails. Fantastic place for a picnic or to hang out at one of the beaches or to just sit and enjoy the cool breezes off the lake.
We took our bikes over on the ferry, which was a great way to see the whole island in a short amount of time. The residential area is beautiful it's like going back in time.

Accessible by ferry, water taxi or harbour boat tour. I would recommend accessing by water taxi or boat tour as the ferry is very crowded. Return ferry trip from island to downtown is Toronto is free. Lots of rides, trees, flowers, spaciously laid out. Restaurants available. Rides are reasonably priced. Location is beautiful.

Toronto Islands are only a couple minutes with a ferry outside of Toronto. The ferry is cheap and with frequent departures.The islands are a total beaut and you definitely forget how ridiculously close you actually are to the city, and yet you feel so far away from all the buzz. Here are enormous parks to kick back and relax....
Nice venue for taking the family out. Will strongly recommend. Lots to see and to do. Will recommend to anyone!
This is a great place to spend an afternoon with the kids. Fun rides, lots of open space, and nice trails for biking. Avoid the weekend mid-day crowds if planning on biking.
It was a good experience. Lots of things to do. Very nice during summer time, Will recommend ant time,

In summer times it is recommended to tkae the water taxi and go for a swim on Hanlan Island. The sandy beach is very nice and the water fresh. From the water taxi it takes you about 10 min to walk but it is worthwhile! An incredible experience, believe me!

We were impressed by the "holiday atmosphere" while being just next to the city centre of Toronto.There are pleinty of activities for childrens and for adults.The beaches are nice and offers à good way to relax.

Wow what a great place in the evening to go and see the Toronto Skyline. The Toronto Island of course during the day has much to offer but don't forget if you're downtown Toronto in the evening and want to go somewhere else after a special dinner...go across to the Toronto Island. Well it is pretty much just a big park.Is it pretty, yesBut that is just about it.I can undertands why locals would go, but for tourists its a bit of a waste.There is a small fair type amusement park for younger kids and a small beach.But on the whole the only thing this really provides...

On a nice day, it's absolutely worth visiting the islands. Plenty to do on the beach, or in the parks. We saw people riding bikes, playing disc golf, kayaking, you name it. Great place for picnicking. Fun for families. Just be warned, the food options are limited.

Great getaway for a day of fun under the sun! Not expensive but make sure to bring cash! Would love to spend my summer exploring this place further. Great for families, couples, and even solo adventures.

Take the water taxi!!!! Worth the $2 extra for relaxing and quick ride over to the island. Walked to the end then rented bikes......be careful to get the correct size...originally had me on a youth bike and my back started hurting. But biked all over the island. Met a very nice family originally from Boston that told us where to...
The best park of going was the taxi ride over to the island, not a lot to do there if the theme park isn't your thing. But was beautiful and worth a few hours visit.

Amazing views of the city skyline and relaxed calm boat trip over to the island which is very reasonably priced. The park is well maintained. I would imagine it is a great place to be once the summer is in full flow as all attractions would be running

A very scenic ferry ride (which was extremely busy!). Cost 7.50 each for return. Nice beach area and many paddling places for small families.
