A nice open space with green parkland, beaches and pools a short boat ride away from the city. Busy at the weekend but a good place for a picnic.

The ferry over was pretty reasonable. It 3only took about 5 mins to get there. This is definitely an all day destination. You can bring bikes ,lunches, kids its great. The rides arent too bad a pass will let your kids ride all day. The food is a bit pricey the scenery is amazing. I would definitely go again.
This is a lovely place to see, so calming away from the city ,It would be worth taking a picnic over and spending the the day,like the locals.

On a really hot day it was a lovely respite from the city bustle to enjoy a walk on the islands before hiring a tandem to explore further. Very scenic and relaxing - particularly if you venture further from the kids attractions of Centreville. Plenty of spots for food and refreshments and lots of activities (on water or land) as...

Beautiful day at Centre Island brought back great childhood memories! It's still a great place for families and friends to spend the day walking around with a beautiful perspective of the city of Toronto. Beach area is clean and well kept. I would strongly suggest packing a picnic as there are not many options for food or a descent coffee.
Plenty of space to enjoy the nature. Beaches, parks, cycling and etc. Such a nice park not far from downtown. Bring your blanket, snacks, books, instruments and just enjoy family and friends time.

Nice, clean and safe little beach. People of all ages enjoying the good weather. Some groups brought their own music, which can be a bit annoying if you're stuck in the middle between two radios.We took the ferry to get there. The line was long but moved quite fast. You can reach this park by Ferry it is quiet and there are bathrooms and restaurants for a quick snack throughout.
We went to the Toronto Island Park on a hot day of summer and had lots of fun there! Make sure you bring your bathing suit since there is a beach there which is perfect to relax and sunbath.

We spent a large part of a Saturday exploring this area. Great place to take the kids and get outdoor. Lots of walking and exploring or a lazy day spent on the beach of the lake. Bicycle rental available or bring your own on the ferry. An amusement park for kiddies take up a good portion on the center island.

The best way to enjoy the island is to take the water taxi there for $10 (vs. $7 for the ferry to avoid the lines). You can still take the ferry back from any of the ferry docks. Centre island is full of kids and has the most people. The more chill spots are on Ward's islands. You can walk...

The ferry ride is great on the way back because you get to see the city from a different perspective. Centre Island is great if you have small children since there are a more attractions and activities for them. We had a great picnic at the Hanlan's Point, even though it was a bit crowded.

What can be better than a trip, a walk in the park and a swim on the beach on a hot summer day? The wait for tickets and the boats was about 30 minuten, so not that bad. One can easily walk from one stop to the next. Free maps available on the island.

We spent a few hours with our two little kids on the island. First of all we took the water taxi, which was 9 CAD per adult and 5 per child. The return with the ferry however is free and therefore it can get a little crowded on that boat, depending on your time of return. In the island park...
Water fountains, nice beaches (both clothing mandatory and optional), kids' playgrounds, great cycle paths, the island has it all!

My biggest tip for a visit to the island is to book the ferry ticket online in advance. It costs the same and you print off a ticket for use any day or time. I printed mine the week before our visit and then when we decided to go we walked straight past a very very long line for tickets....
Best trip of Toronto. Worth the effort to see as one of the most amazing islands I have seen so close to city. No developments on island, all park land and Pickwick spots.

The centre island is packed with families and children on sunny days. If you want more quietness, take the very to Wards Island or walk straight from centre island on the beautiful boardwalk to Wards island. And have a swim there.
Relaxing walk and enjoying beautiful scenery at Toronto Island. Absolutely recommend anybody to visit this beautiful Island in Toronto.

Toronto Island is a place for everyone, young or old, singles, couples and families.Your journey starts with a wonderful boat cruise. To avoid the crowds, go earlier than 10a.m. Your ferry ride includes return trip. We took the ferry to Centre Island, then walked to the tram ride on Ward Island. I wouldn't recommend the tram ride as you really don't see much. The farm and animals were a big hit with our 7 year old granddaughter as were the rides in the Centreville Amusement Park. Lunch at the Carousel Cafe was OK; our server...

Pretty gardens and beaches, nice views of the city, but it was very crowded the day we were there. Buy your ferry ticket online ahead of time and skip the line-up for tickets. It's a beautiful park, the landscape is awesome. Great place to relax or be as busy as you want. Have choice of 3 areas to visit. Bring good walking shoes.

I was amazed by this location, the feeling you get once you are there is sooo relaxing and the scenery is breath taking :) We visited the whole island by byke and I really loved it. You should deffinetly go there and make a barbeque :D or a picnic, the beach is very nice and clean.
The whole family had a great time on the Island it has been 25 years since my last visit we had a great time going on the rides with lots of memories to take home.

If you wanna relax on a sunny day in Toronto, go to Toronto island. It is a really nice place with a good atmosphere. Lots of families hating around and you get a nice view of Toronto from the island.
Day away from the hot busy City. Walking around , hiring a bike then having a beer and burger by the beach.

I loved the park. It's a great place to picnic, to go to the "beach", to ride a bike.. Bring food, a bike and enjoy a whole day or just a few hours. To get to know the whole park, you'll need a bike. The bike rental at the island isn't cheap and the bike aren't very good, so I'd...

After spending most of the day in downtown Toronto. Decided to have a picnic at this park. A short ferry ride brings you to this place. Explore the beauty of this park with a lot of things to do. To find such a big island with so many activities to do for all age groups in the middle of an urban area is just wow. Have 3 grand children and take one for a day with nana. We bring a picnic lunch and spend a day at Centreville. We have a fantastic day. Get a day pass for the rides, best deal on line.
I love the ferry ride to the island!! The view is so beautiful! You can take beautiful pics of the city and is a relaxing experience if you go in a not crowded day.
The island is a great place to spend a day biking, walking, hanging out at the beach. A great escape from the city

This place is very scenic and feels removed from the city. Perfect for the nature trail lover, the picnic lover and the outdoor lover. There are several play toys for adults like bicycles, nude beaches, restaurants and the on and off music festival.

Enjoy the beach, rollerblade or cycle the paths, or just sit and relax - the island is the place to feel the Toronto summer at its best.The only thing missing is decent food, so be sure to pack up your lunch and snacks before you get there!

I brought my son and my niece here for the very first time and they certainly love it from the ferry ride to just watching the loons, swans, and ducks swimming in the lake. I was raised in Toronto and I take all my quests to the Islands as they are a cool, well kept parklands of various attractions which also gives everyone a different perspective of the city .Plus you can enjoy a ferry ride to get their .Highly recommended

We really enjoy visiting here when we travel to Toronto as we live in Hong Kong and don't need to spend time in the city itself. We love the green grass and open space, so for us this is great to relax. The the little theme park is great for us because our kids are at the age for it...

A lovely day outdoors! The ferry ride was a fun way to start the day! We walked around, kids loved the maze, splash parks and the beaches. Adults relaxed in the sun and rode bikes! A great day in the sun!
One of the few things that you can do on your own to relax and reconnect. Take a good book, find a spot and drift.

You take the ferry to the island and you can see the harbour view of Toronto.It has an area for children with rides. For adults you can rent bicycles or just walk around the park. There are beaches also if you want to swim
Nice cruise , kids had fun during the transportation to the island. beach was nice and clean, food was good too
This is a great place to get away from the city without dealing with traffic. There are lots of things to do or just spend some quiet time walking.

Went to Toronto Island for the Dragon Boat Festival -- it was a blast.The island remains a favorite for me and my relatives especially during the summer months. Family friendly spot with lot of activities for kids. Downtown Toronto view on ferry is highlight, if possible wait until late evening for night view of Downtown Toronto!!!
Great place to relax after a visit to the city. A very comforting place to sit,relax and people watch/

Well worth the effort. Beautiful walk , take it slow , and enjoy the scenery , if it's hot , take a swim suit and a dip. I took my dog and he loves it especially ---- taking a dip !!Stunning views of the city. Visit day or night both gorgeous. Picnics optional as there are several places to...

We never tire of coming to the islands!Every year we discover something new.This visit we decided to check out the western most edge and bike across to the eastern most edge.The beach at the west end (wards island) is a great little secret. Loved it,the kids had so much fun,we spend the whole day there,time flies when you are having fun ..not too hot in Sept ...
It was an excellent place to visit with the kids. Relaxing surroundings yet so close to the busy city!!!

I have visited the islands many times over the years, most recently we took our entire department for a fun afternoon. Kids love the rides of Centreville or playing in the sand on the beaches. Adults will enjoy the peace and the trails and activities that are available. There are also a number of good spots to eat and drink.

Went there with all the guys in my family a couple of months ago and we all had a great time. Going by ferry really makes it feel like we're getting out of town, but once we were there we had great view of the skyline and sailboats. This park was absolutely lovely, with lots of amusements for kids. I took the $7.50 (Canadian) round-trip ferry ride on the advice of locals and was not disappointed.

A great and fun escape from the city, located just a boat ride away from the city! Google "Toronto Island Ferry" to buy tickets on line. It will save you along lineup! Take a picnic lunch. Centreville amusements and farm are for younger kids. A quiet, relaxing place if you want that. Splash pool and of course the lake for wading. if you stay until dusk, watching the lights come on in downtown Toronto is truly beautiful.

We often take visitors to Toronto hear..a short ferry ride away - a joy in itself and a great opportunity for photographs of the skyline. It's lovely enjoying the trees, boardwalks and you can even enjoy a lovely meal at one of two restaurants. A perfect respite without the communte and stress.
Very nice place cool beach can have algae on the beach. Nice pier and cool little ride to the island. Take food to the island its kind of pizza and hotdog choice. Lots of water and have fun.
Great place to spend the day outdoors for the whole family, great for biking,walking and relaxing at the beach.Great view of Toronto skyline from the boat
Must see...plan to spend the day..many activities... Just enjoy...take many pictures.. A good day away from the city..yet so near

How can I not extol the wonderful experience of Toronto Island.I was born on the Island and grew up there. No cars just bicycles and Park Land on Lake Ontario, Visitors do not realize that our lake is 400km (250 miles) long and 100Km wide and 100m (300ft) deep right off Hanlan's Point.

Lovely place to stroll and enjoy the peace and quite at Wards Island and Hanan Point. Centre Island let's you rent a bike for one or a 4 wheeled bike for a family. Centre Island also has a fun fair for the kids and is more lively, yet still beautiful. Views of the city are amazing.

The nicest days I've spent have been at the Toronto islands. My wife and our friends bring our bikes and arrive early Sunday morning , 8:30 a.m. We ride to wards island and have breakfast while enjoying the best view of Toronto . I great place to spend the day relaxing, walking and taking in the sights of the islands and Toronto
We took a boat trip to the island and spent the day there. There's brilliant views and ample opportunity to take photographs of the Toronto skyline.Well worth visiting i recommend highly
Get the ferry for £7.50 return and enjoy the park, gardens, rides and retro feel if Centerland. Try a Beavertail too, sticky sweet dessert goodness!!!
Great place to relax when you want a break from the bustle of Toronto, and just a short ferry hop too. We hired bikes to see the whole island. Superb views back over towards the Toronto skyline.
Went across on tour boat and spent an enjoyable few hours wandering around the island. Had lunch which was good looking back across the harbour.
A relaxing day away from the rush of the traffic and endless pedestrians bumping into you in the city.Plenty of beaches and rides for those with small children .

A nice green oasis in Lake Ontario adjacent to Toronto, we took a taxi boat out to the islands, $10 per adult and $6 per child, we walked out to the pier and back and then caught the main ferry back to Toronto. An absolutely must see to give another perspective of this amazing North American city.
We had a nice relaxing day walking through the park, saw the farm - not very big but good for free. The beach area was good and so was the hot dogs from the beach cafe.

This is a picturesque gem of Toronto. Take the ferry out and relax taking in the spectacular skyline of the city from a unique perspective. We tried out the bicycles for four people, and we found it a fun way to tour the island with senior citizens.

Is a short ferry ride from the city centre approx 15 mins. Is a huge ferry that can accommodate a lot of people. I think the ferry will depart every half an hour. Do check on their schedules to be sure. Plenty to do in the island. If you are Travelling with children, a must go place. There are a...

This place is so different to Toronto, it feels like you've been transported. It's so calm and scenic. $7.50 for a ferry from Toronto return. We had lunch at the rectory cafe, which was also lovely, walked along the pier, hired a bike and had a dip in the lake. Great day out.

Looking for a low cost way to have fun in Toronto, and get a little exercise, views, water experience? This is your bet. Very close to the city, TOronto islands are the perfect place for a relaxing afternoon. You can walk, sunbathe in the sand, there are cafés and attractions, you can rent a small boat or waterbike. And the ferry in itself is a very nice moment. When we went, there was an Indian festival : there is always something going on

easy ferry trip over to island and plenty to do there for an escape from the city. Excellent view of the Toronto skyline for those photos - esp as sun going down.If only in city for a few days probably not much point but if longer there then worth a trip
Went on a nice sunny day and glad we went early in the morning as it did start to get busy after midday. We hired bikes which does make it easier to get to explore all the islands.

It was a nice warm day and the ferry was slightly crowded on Sunday when we visited. The view of the downtown was nice. We spent several hours walking and biking. Escape from the buzzing of Toronto and relax at the tranquil island with its parks and beaches. It is another world, and great for relaxation, picknicks, swimming and family time.

I experienced the beauty, authenticity, and serenity of the Toronto Islands. From the mainland, I took an enjoyable and short ferry ride to get to the Toronto Islands. We spent most of a day on the islands. Access is via a cheap and very efficient ferry service. We went to Ward island and walked through to Centre. It is a place of tranquility and quiet in the "heart" of Toronto. it is green and is is beautiful. It has a lot of options on the activities.
Get out and about in 20 minutes. Jump on the ferry and escape. A nice bright crossing, a beautiful promenade and woodland walk, a bit of bird watching, a spot of relaxed lunch and a beer.
Everyone kept telling us how great the Islands where but we found them of little interest and expensive.
What a quiet happy diversion from the gong show across the water.$7 return ferry ride and we walked the entire set of island - except the swim suit "optional" beach. :)

We took advice from reviews and avoided weekends and got an early start. We went straight to the bikes and hired two seater ones, this was great fun, we noticed as the day went on the roads got busier.We loved the views of Toronto, but enjoyed the break from the city hustle and bustle.
Once you are visiting Toronto Islands, this is a great option on a sunny day, to swim or simply to walk by its surroundings.In fact, the whole island worth a full day visit.

Headed over to the island one sunny summer Sunday afternoon and was immediately hit with a huge lineup/wait at the Ferry terminal. Only spent an hour or two here as part of stop over on a harbour tour but was very impressed. Flew into the Island many times but never thought to head over to the Island Park before.Really is like leaving Toronto downtown for a different world. Toronto is a flat city and so is the Toronto Island Park. It can be horribly hot and humid in Toronto during the summer because it it on the Great Lakes of North America. We had a day at the islands and it's a must if your visiting Toronto.we went over in our friends boat ,we had lunch and a walk round ,and we would of stayed longer if it wasn't so hot !!38?

It's a great way to escape the city life of Toronto. The park is massive and there's so much to do. Three beaches (one being clothing optional), bike rentals and endless greenery. There's a rustic petting zoo/farm and a children's amusement park as well

The park is beautiful. We really enjoyed renting bikes and biking the Centre Island. Beaches are nice. The big attraction is the beautiful views of Toronto.
Wonderful place to walk, swim,enjoy a great bicycle ride and tour the island, lovely little cottages, and a very artsy community.

What a lovely place!! It's a getaway without even leaving! The beach is great and you can rent a canoe to row along the river... Fantastic place, would definitely recommend!!

After an easy ferry ride, you will arrive at a beautiful park. The kids will love the entertainment "village". Adults will love being in a place where the sign says "Please walk on the grass." Such a beautiful place. Too bad it's so crowded on the weekend. Avoid the big line-ups by buying the ferry tickets online.

The island is very highly accessible from downtown with ferry`s costing about $8 (per person) or a water taxi which costs $10 (per person). There are lots of green areas to have picnics or BBQ`s and beaches. There`s also a coffee shop and restaurant which is open til maybe 7ish. Worth a visit.
The island and park are not that spectacular, but it sure was a nice getaway from the busy city on a ridiculously hot August day.

Lovely parks and landscaping to explore on a summers day. You could easily enjoy a day exploring the park. Lots of walking to do or you could hire I bike. I suggest just walking. Good idea to take a picnic although you can buy food on the islands. Good ferry service (you have to pay for the ferry).
Well worth a visit if you are in Toronto. Would recommend hiring a bike to explore the island fully, also get there early as the queue for the ferry is long in summer.

We were in Toronto during this summer's heat wave, and visiting the island park was the highlight of the day we spent downtown. Nice for a break in the summer heat. Ferry trip is nice with beautiful view of the city. Enjoyed the maze and the Center Island beach. Very clean and everyone had a lot of fun.

We spent a lovely day on Vancouver island. This is a great get a way for the area. We had one day in Toronto and decided to spend it here. This is a walking, biking place. Wear good shoes. We went to wards island and walked to centre island as others had mentioned on trip advisor. When we got to the harbour the queues were long for centre island and the ferries were really packed. The ferries go every 15 minutes so you don't have to wait very long.

Hard to believe it's right beside downtown. Beautiful park for a walk, bike ride, or beach day with skyline views in the background.

we visited the park while vacation in Toronto. Booked tickets online and made our way to the ferry avoiding the lineup. Happened to come by this place last Summer and loved it! It is nice to see that Toronto has such amazing hidden gems

I liked this placeWould be great for kids. Views are top class and 7 dollars round trip is a steal. Would love the opportunity to return

Beautiful view of the city from the island. Its a short ferry ride. Went there with my toddlers, lots of place for them to run around, we went to the maze, beach, picnic area and gardens. There is fast food and nice restaurants in there. Can rent bike to go around, but walking around is also nice.

There is a ferry that goes from Toronto to the 3 islands. We went around 4:00 on a Thursday and had no lines to buy ferry tickets. The ferry ride is fairly short - maybe 5-7 minutes. We traversed the island from one end to the other. Great walk with exceptional views of Toronto skyline. Saw the largest lighthouse in the Great Lakes. Had a great lunch at the rectory restaurant. There are all sorts of little gems scattered all over the island - you can always discover a new one by just walking in a different direction.The maze is still my favourite thing - but there are tons of things to see and doYeah it can get costly but its still amazing

The Toronto Islands are great, but buy your ferry tickets in advance to avoid long lines. We went to Center Island which has the Centreville Amusement park, a beach, picnic area and gardens. It's worth visiting with kids.

This is really quite a gem as we just wanted to take the ferry to get a nice view of Toronto. However, once on the island park, it was fantastic with so many nice walks along the water, a beach, and a great place overall. Highly recommend!

Get out of the hustle and bustle of Toronto with a 15 minute ferry trip to the 'Islands'. They are lovely, tree filled and peaceful with cafes, children's parks and families barbecuing as well as sandy beaches on the shores of Lake Ontario. Loved it.
It's a lovely place to take small kids and even our big kids enjoyed going round on rented bikes. Lovely Toronto harbor views from the island.

Going to Toronto Islands is a lovely getaway from the city. The ferry is quick and not expensive ($7,50 round trip). The Toronto islands are a very cool place to check out. You can take the fairy or water taxis there. It is an excellent place to bbq with the family or have a few drinks at the bar. There are many cool places to go while you are there. Water park or the pier are a guarantee for a great...

Really easy to get to the islands - if there's a big line at the terminal, just buy your tickets on your phone and go to the online ticket queue (infinitely shorter/quicker moving). I love spending hours on this island, walking around and just enjoying the nature. It is not only a great way to spend a sunny day, but gives you some amazing views of the city sky line! If you feel like relaxing, bbq, biking, or beaching, Toronto Island is the place to be!

The best way to take in the Toronto city skyline is on an aircraft coming into land at the City airport but the next best view is from the Island or the many inlands that make up the park. Sunning views.
Great boat trip around the bay of Toronto with amazing views of the city. Nice to sit and enjoy the water, lots of activities going on in the bay.

Toronto Island is a nice place to escape from downtown and we spent the afternoon overthere with the family. Renting bikes, picniking etc. Nothing really magic but nice place to visit when you go to Toronto

On so many levels, at any time of the year, this is a fantastic park.Cooler in the summer, warmer in the fall and winter. Bright, out of the city just minutes away. The ferry ride is great if you're a tourist or just need a bit of water time.Perfect for families. Kids can run - no cars. Take...

Just a very short ride with the ferry from the Toronto harbour and you are there - pretty amazing island. Took the ferry over and spent a few hours on Toronto Islands while visiting Toronto. It's quite a contrast from the busy city. just outside the rat race of downtown Toronto , its like getting away to country, but only a 15 min ferry ride away are sandy beaches of the ontario lake , activities and side shows were fun to take in and a nice place to unwind have a picnic or family gathering.

Bring a lunch, have a picnic & enjoy Toronto's front door. Great day for all. Boat ride, paths views of the city to die for.

My visit to the island was on a very hot weekend but even though it was crowded it could not take away the utter charm of the place. Families with barbecues and picnics and children playing without gadgetry. It was refreshing and very good fun.

What a contrast to Toronto city is the Island. They are absolutely stunning and a real haven and break away from the hustle and bustle of the city.We spent a number of hours exploring a few of the islands and they have loads to offer. If you're heading to Toronto, definitely make this a priority.
Ideal place for a picnic or hanging out for some good time during Summer. Its such a calm n soothing experience to just be here and spent few hours away from the city

beautiful little get away from traffic hustle & bustle I would go back again and again a great place for the whole family of all ages

The Toronto Islands is a beautiful place to spend the day.It offers the best view of the city and so much to do for families, friends, couples, outdoors people.

Beautiful and peaceful and well-maintained. This is a great getaway from crowds and noise. The gardens are pristine and the beaches are a nice feature, but don't expect Lake Ontario to be any warmer than ice water!

Took the ferry over for an afternoon, was hoping to have a swim but the water was freezing.Beautiful place to walk around, makes it a nice day out, great view of the city.

Help out on a school trip with a grade 3 class, it's nice to see Toronto has such a great venue, the kids love it and so did I.

Our visit to Toronto Island Park was a real highlight of our time in Toronto. Easily accessible by water taxi from the harbour front and plenty to see and do. Incredible views of the city from the Island as well as some small beach areas to relax!

We started to head over on Sunday morning and when we saw the long lines to board the ferries we decided to put our trip off till another day. That turned out to be a good choice as we had no wait to get on the ferry. Beautiful park well kept, great place for family fun.
Ferry to island was a pleasant experience. Wait time was not too long and ride was comfortable and spacious. Many areas for great photographs-scenery was beautiful. Great rides for kids as well.

A fun day excursion. Ferry ride over to island will give you beautiful view of the Toronto skyline. Check out the restaurants or bring a picnic lunch. Amusement park for ages 3-12. Walk and bicycle around. Simple fun.
I love coming here. The ferry is fun but you have to come early on weekends in order to avoid the lineup. Lots of great trails, beaches and snack bars. The view of the skyline at sunset is amazing.
Nice ferry ride to the Island beautiful view of Toronto as you head out and return. Great beach and parks, nice picnic areas. Watch the yachts go by the island.

When you need to get away from the city for an afternoon this is just a lovely parkland outing to visit & terrific for children to expend energy including the kiddy rides. The ferry across the water is always enjoyable & quite exciting for children as well.

a great way to explore the islands and experience the city! A great way to capture some amazing pictures too :)

Excellent. You won't believe you are short ferry ride to downtown Toronto. The Island is beautiful and expansive. Clean and unhurried. You won't be disappointed.

Excellent. Great fun with kids. Get the day rides pass & ride most rides with small or no lineups. Rides are good for smaller kids but fun.

A great place to visit with small kids. You get there by a ferry ride which is not too expensive. The kids had plenty of space run and have fun. We visited in the afternoon and stayed until 10PM. The view of the Toronto Skyline is great from the central Island.

Feeling the pace and the heat in the city? Catch a boat from Jack Layton Ferry Terminal at the foot of Bay Street to the islands and stroll around the green spaces, beaches (yes, beaches), fountains and parkland.

Cottage country right in Canada's biggest city! Definitely take the time to go and check it out via the regular ferry service.

An oasis just a short boat ride from Toronto water front. A great place to bike and lounge around. Grab a bottle of bubbly and a blanket and watch the sunset.

Island parks with plenty of outdoor fun activities for the whole family. Take a water taxi over and a ferry back to the mainland for maximum travel pleasure.

Took ferry to Centre Island. Rode bikes and spent some time on the beach. Wish I had more time to spend. Great place to bring children.

We took the ferry over to the island one night to go for a walk. We had been before for a company picnic years ago but forgot how beautiful this place is - and the hustle and bustle of Toronto seems so far away. We will go back during the summer.

My Mate and I took the StreetCar to the QueenQuay, then got off and took a leisure boatride to the Island. It was a very peaceful ride, the weather was just lovely.

A visit to Toronto would not be complete without a visit to Toronto island it is an amazing place. If you are looking for a quiet mini day vacation away from the city, go to the island. Its so quiet with the exception of the birds. Would highly recommend for a relaxing day walking around or heading to the beach on a hot day. Take a picnic lunch and eat by the water.

Really enjoyed my day on the island as plenty to do only thing i would have liked though is has a nice beach but nothing on it maybe a British thing but would have liked a sunbed if possible as people only had to lie on a towel as nowhere to sit or lie down on the beach at all.

A great place to spend the day. You can rent bikes or enjoy the beach it is a peaceful and relaxing place to visit. They do offer places where you can grab a bite or you can take your own and enjoy a picnic.

A great place to take a group of summer campers! Never a dull moment. The group loved the maze, Franklins garden and walking the pier!! Great picnic areas... We could have stayed the whole day!!

We quite enjoyed Toronto Island. The views from the ferry were terrific. It is a lovely area to escape to from the hustle & bustle of Toronto. The landscaping was beautiful. It was very peaceful.

After taking a ferry from the Toronto Harbor, one can walk for hours, as well as have a picnic, enjoy water sports or go to the beaches. There are several places to eat, but many locals take their own food for picnics. Lots of places to sit and rest. Beautiful scenery and a place to enjoy nature.

Toronto islands (there are a few allconnected) was very cool. We rode bikes around all day and checked out the beaches. There's even a small amusement park. There are ferries that leave from the harbor frequently to go over.

Lots of fun things to do out on the island. Ferry leaves pretty frequently and cost $7.50 per adult. Once in the island there are walking paths that take you all over. We went to the farm and walked out on the pier. There are lots of things for kids to do. Great experience.
Toronto Island Park is a great escape of the city into a nature scene that is both genuine and soothing. Highly recommend it

We went on a beautiful 30 degree sunny day. We waited a long time to come back on the ferry at 630. About an hour in line. Wasn't the best end to the day.

We docked our boat at RCYC and took a bike ride around the island. You would never know you were so close to the heart of Toronto is the treed sanctuary. lots of spots to stop and visit, food and washrooms all good.

Being from Toronto one never gets bored of the Toronto Island. It is a must to see while visiting the city, plus it is a great time out to get away with our great city of Toronto. Super to take the ferry over and one is there within minutes. One can rent a bike and see the entire island or...

We took the Island Boat Ride because it was included in the Double decker Bus Tour. Very nice, short one hour ride in a smaller boat. Nice crew. The Islands are cool. Looks like a nice way to spend the day on/in/around the water. Quiet too! Unfortunately too cold for clothing optional beach nearby unless you're a member of the...

A lovely escape from the heat and bustle of the city. Nice that there is a kids section so the rest of the island is nicely child-free on the whole. Great beaches great dog walking and cycle hire looked fun.

Great centreville kids rides go During the week if possibleGo to the park before you leave just to the right of the ferry docks to take a photo of the cityBring picnic snacks and add other food from vendors
A must on any visit to Canada and Toronto, get on over to the islands for a great day out on the beech
Excellent place to visit. Hire bikes or just go walking. Very little choice for food on the island. So a must is to take a picnic.Very chilled out.

This gem is sweet as it ever was. Beautiful and unspoiled. Island has beaches, fun park activities for kids, bike path and ferry boats. Great day for kids at centre island or just to go for a bike ride. If you ever get a chance to take a waterfront boat tour, do it!
Its hard to believe that you're only a few minutes from a major city, peaceful and tranquil, a must do!

Beautiful peaceful place to visit. Views of the city can't be beat!! Great boardwalk that goes for miles along a sandy beach. Lovely little "town" of cottages you can walk through and feel like you're in a different world. An oasis in the middle of downtown in a big city. Must visit !!

When you visit this island, you can forget that you are close to a major city. It is green and quiet and it has a very cute little restaurant with great food. There is the beach and you geta fantastic view of Toronto without the noise of the traffic. The ferry makes it fun and it is an all round...

The islands are very easy to reach - short ferry ride (8$32ways) ) from downtown Toronto (from Queens Quay) or by water taxi (10$/one way) and they offer lot of activity for all ages: beaches, biking (bike can be rent on the spot), amusement park (not very nice), walking into nature paths and soo much more !Restaurants are available...
Great place to rent bikes and tour! There are several beaches and places for libations and lunch. A great place for couples or families.

I wish every city had its own island. We went over here on a really hot day and were pleasantly surprised. The ferry is only $7:50 return and after a short fuse you are on the island ready to explore. The grounds are immaculate and great for picnics. There is boat hire and cycle hire so you can explore more....
just take the ferry to the island. its very beautiful. I took a bicycle there and it was nice to go around. the view of toronto on the way back from the island its worth it all.

There is so much to do here, you can never be bored. We spent just over half a day here, as we have no young children with us and we didn't want to lie about on the beach.To get to the island you need to take a ferry from Queens Quay, and can choose to go to the left...

well worth a visit and only a short and inexpensive ferry ride from downtown Toronto. Great little eateries with local produce actually grown in the surrounding park. Good walking and lovely views of the lake and across to the metropolis.

The island could have been transformed into an ugly amusement park. A little park went this way. You can easily avoid it ;)The island remains by 90% a natural habitat where you only see bicycles and joggers. Really a great hangout on weekends or for a day off. A small taxiboat company charges 10$ to cross. Ferries charge 8$...
Take the ferry and arrive on a recreational paradise for the family, young and old. Beaches, playgrounds, boats, cafes, wildlife, the list goes on. A complete day out especially for children.

We took a water taxi instead of the ferry to get over to the island; this was definitely faster on the way back since the line for the ferry was over an hour wait. Nice beaches, Lots to see, beautiful parks.

After an enjoyable but exhausting tour of Eastern Canada a day spent walking all round Toronto Island was wonderfully relaxing and peaceful. It was easy to get to via a regular and cheap ferry service (there are 3 ferries but the Centre Island destination one proved best) and the facilities were great. (Public toilets everywhere!). The access to the park is by ferry if you don't have a boat. You can charter a private boat but the old ferry is fun! There is lots to do there. Great beach, amusement park, food, bbq's, and gardens. The kids loved it!
Great place for nature loving people. Accessible with boat aswell. Dog friendly.We were able to picnic. Very tranquil.

It is an excellent spot - only a few minutes away from the city. You just need to get on the water taxi or a boat and you are in a little paradise. You can enjoy an amazing day with kids, family, friends or on your own. You will find a bit of everything for everyone. There are lots of...

We love going to Toronto Island. It's like a mini get away for us. Riding the ferry boat makes you feel like it's far away from the city. We just love the atmosphere over there, the fresh air, the long walks, the bike ride. It gives us the feeling that we are away from the hustle and bustle of the...

The ferry ride from Toronto to the island was easy...gorgeous views of the city and the sailboats on the lake...a new perspective on the beauty of Lake Ontario! The island was serene. The views of the enormous lake (looks like an ocean as you can't see to the other side on the one shore) and the intricate beauty of all...

If you're looking for some way to spend One Whole Day with kids (toddler to school age ) and not have them get bored, this is the place for you. Beach- check. Amusement park rides - check. Maze for hide and seek - check. Grassy fields for soccer, etc. - check. Children's park - check. Water park - check. Picnic...

A trip to Toronto would not be complete without a trip to the Toronto island park. Half the fun is getting there, a quick ferry ride across to centre island. If you have kids you cam keep them amused at Centreville. Rent a bike and ride the boardwalk and trails throughout the island. Lots of beachs to choose from. Clothing...

The best time is close to sunset as the sunstting againt the CN Tower, the buildings and the Rogers centre is spectacular. The best view of Toronto is looking back on it from the water or the island. The island is an oasis just moments away.

Take the ferry to Wards Island & walk among all the lovely cottages which are in a beautiful tranquil setting with lovely views back to the city. Then walk along the boardwalk towards Centre Island stopping on the way at the restaurant for a good late lunch. You can also take a tricycle for 2 or 4 & ride the...
What an amazing way to leave the city without leaving the city! Take the ferry or the taxi and be surrounded by water and peacefulness in just a few minutes !

Had the pleasure of visiting the island to see a friend play a show.The boat ride over is very peaceful and the islands have lots to offer! Also the boat ride back in the evening was so beautiful, you see the whole Toronto skyline lit up!Food is delicious, and a great place to bring a picnic :). Perfect...

A short ferry ride to the Toronto Islands is a great way to escape from the noise and concrete for a few hours. Walk from one end to the other or rent a bike for a quicker trip. The eclectic island neighborhood is great to walk through and views of the downtown skyline make for a great photo op.

Take the ferry to walk or take a bicycle to ride the pathways. Very nice experience and great views of the city skyline or take one of the boat rides around the islands and you will enjoy your day immensely

I have taken my boy's there since they were 2 and 4. I was a single mom for 16 years working 2 and 3 jobs but they always knew there was time for the island. The people were awesome the food was fattening but delish and the kids couldn't get enough of everything from the minute they stepped onto the...

A short ferry takes you a world away (the ferry itself is a great way to see the city and the harbour). To the east, a car-free neighbourhood of homes. To the west, an almost naturalized area, and in the middle, canals, expansive lawns, playgrounds, a wee amusement park, plenty of picnic spots. This is all tied together with broad...

Great place to visit 20 min ferry ride there are rides for the kids on the island there's places to eat there's boat rides through the canals great place for picnics I have been many times and like this island lots of walking paths

Love the islands. From the ferry ride to the bicycles for 4.Check the website for busy times, and be sure to notice the 1 hour apart returns in the evening, and off season.Be prepared for lots of walking. It is a walk to the bike rentals, but you can rent wagons near the entrance. Most of the food...
Starts off with a fun ferry ride on lake Ontario, so much to do in a small island... Amusement park, beach, maze etc...

Lots of beautiful views of the city. Lovely paths to follow. Ward's has a really nice beach. Centre island gets very busy. Only downside is the line to buy tickets for the ferry, so buy them ahead of time online.

Take a short ferry ride from bustling downtown Toronto and in a few minutes you leave the noise of the city and are greeted by a lush green peaceful place. From Early Spring to to Early Fall any day is a good day to go to the Island. Centreville attactions and amusement park is a charming place to keep the...
Love this place, have been many times, great for little ones. Very relaxing. Perfect place for a picnic.
Nice place for summer outing. Short ferry ride very nice. Recommend skip public holidays to avoid line ups to ferry.
This was a fun trip in Toronto. There were many walking paths and fun beach fronts to play in. This was also really easy to get to with multiple ferries to ride over and back.

I recommend taking some other taxi service across the lake because the ferry lines can be quite long and the ferry itself is slow.We took Tiki Taxi and it was only $2.50 more than the ferry ($10/person) but it was completely worth not wasting time in lines.Bring a picnic lunch and walk across the island to the beach...
Pleasant ferry ride to charming park where you can walk or bike or dine. Nice way to spend an afternoon.

This is perfect depending on what you're looking for. If you love a peaceful park, then you'll enjoy this. If you're more about the hustle and bustle, then you can skip it.Great views from the beach. Very beautiful.Note that you can get discounted tickets for a group ahead of time. (And then you can also skip the line...

We had an amazing day on Friday; make sure you take the ferry to Ward Island, less people and you can walk to the central Island. we walked the boardwalk a must see. they were little gardens and cottages, a smaller marina and very peaceful! Amazing views of city from the Island, enjoy a snack or ice cream at one...

We went to the island with some friends and altogether 5 kids under 10... So it was an adventure. But still it was really really nice. We went to one of the beaches, had a meal at the park (Pizza Pizza was a way more expensive there than the one near our house). There are lovely beaches, clean and with...

Took the ferry to the islands and spent a nice morning there away from the hustle and bustle of Toronto downtown. The ferry was cheap at $7.50 return and we went just after 10 in the morning midweek before it got busy. There are plenty of activities on the islands but we chose to hire a bike. Be careful, you...

This park is a romantic escape from the big city bustle. Vibrant greenery and lots of open space make a nice change from the nearby concrete jungle. A great spot for a picnic or just a walk. The boardwalk and residential areas are two highlights of the area.

This is an amazing place and a must vist for people who love nature. There are many activities too possible for kids. The water was cold at the beach otherwise it was very calm and welcoming. Most people come with picnic baskets and large group of friends. One can spend a full day just relaxing.

On a warm sunny day, don't get discouraged by the long lines at the Jack Leyton Ferry Terminal. The ferries take in a lot of people at at time and the lines quickly disappear. All the 3 ferries (Centre Island, Ward's Island, Hanlan's Point) will take you to the same island. For me, the Centre Island ferry is the best...
Awesome in summer, rides are good for small kids, but the paths and parks are nice for everyone. Frisbee Golf course is great, and I like a tea at the Rectory cafe. Urban oasis!
The Toronto Islands are certainly not a secret ... They have been a go-to haven for Torontonians forever. Join them and have a great day.

We decided to go across on the Ferry to Toronto Island for a picnic. The weather was beautiful, we took the dog and it was an extremely enjoyable to spend several hours there. It was wonderful to see the Toronto Skyline from the island. We walked down by the water and hiked the island for a couple of hours.

This was also another to-do on my first time to Toronto.There were a couple of things I wanted to achieve during my visit of Toronto Islands. 1) see most of the island and 2) stay for night photography of the Toronto city skyline.I thought that since I was going to be exploring the island on foot, I should come...

We enjoyed the ferry ride and a quiet walk on Ward's island and its two quaint residential communities. It gives a nice feeling of how nice our communities would be without cars. We came over to see the skyline, which was very impressive. If this is your main goal, do it when it's getting dark. The park itself looks very well maintained, and it is probably a very busy place during weekends. It's a nice place to get out of the city.According to the time table of the boat ride, we...

I have never seen a more disorganized entrance to any kind of activity. Once we paid our ferry tickets, we were literally "herded" into very poorly marked areas to catch the ferry to get to Centre Island. Went here on a super hot day, was incredibly busy. There were more people here than in Toronto. Hired bikes, was great fun. Waited a while for the ferry.

Take an early ferry and beat the crowds. We arrived around 09.45 and walked to the Cycle hire place on Ward island , which opens at 10.30. Mostly traffic free cycle lanes , flat and easy, to both ends of the island and the boardwalk to finish.As we returned around 12.30, the inbound ferry was packed..Great way to...

it was an ok trip (boat ride) to the islands. its a park with a relaxing view but in the end its just a park. can put too much into just a park. people can have cookouts, go bike riding etc but in the end ........ Its just a Park.

The park itself was really nice for a relaxing stroll. You can have picnics, play with kids, or go to the beaches! The line for the ferry looked really long but it actually went pretty fast, and the ferry gives you a great view of the skyline! If you have kids the garden based off the turtle show Franklin is...

Lovely setting with excellent view of the city of Toronto. Well maintains gardens with and small beach. We caught a water taxi there which is a bit more xpensive ($10) but this avoided the queues for the ferry on the journey out ($7). The ferry trip back is free.

The Island is a great getaway from the hustle and bustle of Toronto. Just a short ferry trip away, you get an incredible view of the skyline and can spend an uninterrupted day surrounded by water, yummy food and lots of activities. You can take the kids to Centerville, take a bike and travel the island or hop in a...

A great trip over on the boat with fantastic skyline photos.Odd sort of place but nice to walk around or you could spend the day on the man made sandy beach there by the pier. The view back across to downtown Toronto was the highlight for us.

I recently spent a week in Toronto. Heading out to the islands was a nice break from the museums, restaurants, and shopping of the city. A quick ferry ride away, I started at Ward's Island and made my way West. I walked, but there were plenty of folks biking. There is an amusement park and small "farm" with livestock, both...

We loved it on the islands. It is a short and easy (and cheap) boat ride from the quay.The island are extensive and nicely appointed with great beaches and water attractions. The houses on Ward Island are well worth a look.

Toronto Islands is a great mini-getaway from the city. You get an amazing view of the city without the sounds and smells of a big city.Make sure you plan in advance though as each weekend (in summer!) the ferry's get rather busy and the lines can be pretty lengthy.If you're planning a day on the island, check the...

We headed out just before lunch. Spent the afternoon wandering the islands, checking out the great views and enjoying the breeze. We took a water taxi rather than being subject to the crowded ferry.Pack lots of sunscreen. And water.

One of the most enjoyable days in Toronto was visiting Toronto Island Park!! We visited on a Thursday morning - it was 2 hours before we saw anyone else!! Spotlessly clean & beautiful, this is a great place to relax and visit!!

We visited the Toronto islands (Centre Island and Wards Island) a couple of times just to escape the pace of the city for a few hours. We were happy to walk and admire the trees and plants but there is plenty to do - hiring bikes, kayaks, Canadian canoes etc. There is a theme park, a small zoo, picnic areas...

Love Love Love this place. My second time going and I decided to rent a bike this time. Its a island paradise in GTA. I flew into Toronto island for the first time as well. There is so much to do here. Something for everyone. Add it to your list. Just a ferry ride from the waterfront for $7.50 round...

Considering this is the best attraction in Toronto I was expecting a little more from the islands. They were a little bit run down and there wasn't a whole lot to see. Mainly just grass and trees which wasn't particularly special. We visited during the day and then came back another evening for sunset which was good. Olympic island is...

Spent a day on the island when the weather was hot. Worth buying your ferry ticket online as queues were very long. Lovely views if Toronto and nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of a big city.

Have been visiting the islands since childhood and always love my experience. There is so much greenery, activity and yummy foods that you can never be disappointed. You can visit the well-maintained and clean beaches, bike along the pathways, get lost in the maze, play disc golf, pet animals or visit Centreville. Not to mention, there are stunning Toronto skyline...

The islands are one of the best things about the city of Toronto. Together, they are a wonderful gem easily reached by a short, inexpensive ferry ride. They provide a place to appreciate nature, to enjoy a swim after a walk along a sandy beach, and to explore the historic cottages on a rented bicycle. It is suitable for all...

Lovely setting lots to see and do. The day we visited it was very windy and cold so we had to cut our visit short. It's certainly a lovely area. With good facilities especially for families. There is area s for picnics as well as places selling food. You could spend a whole day here.

We have been coming to Toronto for at least 12 years now and geez, only now getting around to visiting the island! No offense, but until now, we haven't had a chance to visit this place.Really glad we did though.It was like a Seurat painting. It's a HUGE park.You can walk it from taking one of the...
I love coming to the islands and there was so much to do. Nice beaches and a great boating lake but the best was the stunning views of the Toronto skyline.
Lots to see and do with the family. Nice places to take pictures. The beach looked nice and clean but it was too cold to swim. The kids had fun at the maze and Franklin garden.

You can get off the Toronto Ferry and walk from Hanlan's Point to the Ward's Island ferry (more than 5 km). In between there are beaches, historical sights (lighthouse), a petting zoo, a maze, rental bikes, pools, carnival type rides, rental boats, food stands, disc golf, lots of trees, lots of grass and lots of space.

It is a must see if you are travelling on the sunny seasons. It has an impressive view of the city. A few food options, a nice little farm that kids will love, a small park that was not open when we went (may). The ferry is also a nice ride and very affordable.

We haven't been over to the islands in 15 years of visiting Toronto so decided to do the Toronto Inner Harbor guided cruise. You get the boat from the harborfront and it's narrated. Once the boat stops at the island you can leave or stay on. be sure to grab an island map when you disembark. There are several loo's...

Gorgeous destination for a break from every day life! Very slow pace, easy going, beautiful place. The island is clean, peaceful and easy going. Unfortunately, Restaurants are sparse and the staff is not very knowledgeable. But Activities on the island are abundant. Bicycling, water sports, beach activities, sight seeing and kids carnival activities. Nice day activity while spending time in...

The boats run over every half hour. We went on a Monday, thinking it would be jammers at the weekend ... the thinking was correct. It wasn't busy at all....We hired a bike for 4. For an hour, it was a nice way if seeing the island and was a bit of fun.We had a bite to eat...
A beautiful place to send a day. It as a nice little amusement park that is great for little kids. Just wish we had more time to spend there, we were only in Toronto for one day

The taxi and/or ferry ride was a nice time over and back. The Toronto skyline makes for great backgrounds and photographs. The park itself is beautiful and relaxing. A great place to walk jog or just enjoy the sun away from the busy downtown. Certainly a great place.
Minutes away from Downtown Toronto via Ferry across the Great Lake. Spectacular views of the city. You can rent bikes, sit and relax on the beach. Plenty to choose from for places to eat & drink.

Toronto Island is a great way to spend a sunny day in Toronto. From the ferry ride to the natural beauty of the island, it's all fun. BUT food choices are very limited and everything just takes cash. So make sure to bring some snacks and stop at an ATM on your way.

We had lunch here and it was very fun. Cleanest beach I've been to. My wife said the same thing and she is from MN. Quiet place but great for letting the kids run around and have fun (they will get tired and sleep) That might have been the best part, kids sleeping. We had fun swimming also. If only...

This park is great. I loved visiting the islands and the views of the skyline were fantastic. We rented bikes back in the city and took them on the ferry with us. It was the perfect way to get around.

My grand parents once owned a small home on the island. The home is gone, but the island still holds a special place in my heart. Take the ferry with your bicycle or rent one on the island and cruise through paved trails and boardwalks. Take a full day and enjoy a picnic or eat at one of the reasonable...

Very well kept grounds. The boat ride out was as much fun as the island itself. It has a feeling to being untouched by modern times. Most of the signs are hand painted. Very fun day. Pack a picnic, you wont want to leave!

In all honesty, I was incredibly naive to the fact that this place even existed. And when I heard about it, I initially thought "meh, it's an island park and that's it." That said, we decided to do a bike tour to see it - please read my bike tour review for more info on this - and FYI...it blew...

We visited on a beautiful spring day, hired a quadricycle, and meandered through the park. It feels like it's a world away. Some great views back to the city and over the lake, a nice café to have a coffee at. With some good company it's a great way to spend a few hours.Only tip would be to try...

This place is beautiful! Great for families or just a group of friends or family. Lots of walking so if you dont like to walk or bike this place isnt for you. Many little places to eat or grab a snack. Tons of sights to see from the Lake to the City skyline. Great place for some photos!

Toronto Island offers fantastic relaxed spot to soak up some sun and escape to noise of the city. We packed a picnic and headed over in the afternoon to watch the sunset over the city. A fantastic thing to do whilst in Toronto. Bring a bike some fun riding to be had, not to mention squirrel spotting too!
This was a great place to walk around on a beautiful late summer day. The gardens are beautiful, the beach is clean, and the views are spectacular.

Toronto Island park is one of the best things Toronto has to offer! When you're there it feels like city is miles away and you're on vacation enjoying sun and good weather.I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to spend some time away from city's noise.
What a beautiful place to visit. Love seeing the animals, the fountains, unique little houses. You can spend the whole day here.

What a lovely place for a day out! The ferry is only $7.50 return for an adult and the boats are very regular. The island is full of great greenspace as well as beaches. You can hire bikes which is a great way to see different parts of the island. There are plenty of places to eat and lots of...
I took the ferry over to the island, had a picnic lunch, and walked around. Weather was fantastic and there were lots of people riding bikes or walking.

I really enjoyed my tripped to the island. However i went unprepared for the day. The weather was beautiful and really hot. I wanted to cycle around the island but had no ID with me so was unable to rent a bike. The island itself is beautiful lots to do and see. Good for children as they have a small...

We visited Ward Island on the coldest day of our trip (68 Farenheit) and it was still a spectacular beach day. Of course the water was very cold, but that is to be expected in early June. The day was delightful.

a Party of 4 visiting from the UK, we loved this area as it was so peaceful, lovely area to walk, wildlife and plants to see, beautiful view of the Toronto skyline from the island, but beware the water is very cold :)

Lovely green environment . Very popular with families. Good views of the city from the ferry and also from the island itself. Ferry ride was not expensive and the set up well organised. Small choice of food on the island but sufficient if not taking a picnic.

Though summer this year is not as expected in warmth so far, yet it is still warm enough to enjoy strolling on the Cornish ,or setting on a bench overlooking the water watching people in canoes or the seagulls . I had chosen to take the boat to & back from the island near by. Its amazing & a must...

A really nice park with lots of options. There are restaurants, 2 beaches, a playground etc. You´ll will get a really nice view of Toronto´s skyline while at the ferry to get there. The ferry ticket is only 7CAD for an adult.
Loved this island. Lots of restaraunts, you can walk or rent bikes. Lots of beaches. Easily spent the whole day here. Ferry over was efficient, fast and cheap

When you're looking to get away from the city but don't want to drive far, you can totally enjoy a day at the beach or park right here in Toronto.The ferry is so easy to take and very affordable.I would say its a great place for families with young kids. There's lots to do in the island for...

I recommend you take half a day if not more to visit this place. It's worth it! I wish I had had more time to walk around or rent a bike or kayak. Lots of greenery, space, beach, etc. I definitely want to go back!!!! The view is spectacular!!!!
This has something for everyone. The weather was perfect and the walks great. We did have to wait a while for the ferry though

I travelled with a family member not solo.Island is a good relaxing place away from downtown. The $7.50 return ferry ride have good 'postcard views' of city skyline.Whole area easily walkable from ferry terminal through parks to beaches. Ferries are frequent, only takes a few minutes to cross.
Very nearby downtown yet lush green environment with lots of activities for all age groupsMust visit for a family..Everybody enjoyed a lot.
Went to the island on a sunny day. Nice to walk around, go to the beach and enjoy the nature. The best is that is just five minutes with the ferry so it easy to go to the island from Toronto.
Perfect for families and kids lots of green space and beach areas.Everything is very expensive on the island..

Great place to visit on a warm summer day. You can just stroll around, check out the beach, check out the gardens, BBQ in the park. Ferry to get out here can get extremely busy on the odd warm day during spring so if you can avoid those times and visit during the week you'll find it's a lot less...

You can go by the ferry and stay there the day, have a picnic or just go to one of the cafeterias. The walk, the flowers, the wood path at the lakeside, the birds, gardens, the lighthouse etc, it is easy to bike they have bike rentals, you need and ID, preferrable in individual bikes ( the carbikes almost don't...

Lots of gardens, flowers, trees, huge green area to do a picnic or bbq. You can go to the beach, fish, perfect for riding a bike, walk around and appreciate the beautiful landscape. Suitable for families, children, pets, couple and friends. Just have to pay for ferry to cross the lake.

Short boat ride over. We rented bikes and cycled over the island. Nice way to spend a few relaxing hours.Great place for families and kids too. They had a pirate ship and little kids dressed up and did rolo play with organisers running it. The ship then sailed around the lake which looked fun. I wish i was a...
Lots to see and do. Practically empty during the week. Beautiful gardens. Great for picnics. Clean beach area and washrooms.
Great place for family day getaway. We enjoyed nature and amnesties. we took the ferry to the islands. That fun too

Grab your walking shoes! This area is just wonderful to stroll or sit back and people watch. There are little eateries around the islands -- and snack shops. But mostly -- you want to go for the views. The boat taking you out is a great chance to see the Toronto skyline. Once on the islands - walk around the...
Lovely place to escape on a sunny day.Very prettyRelaxing place to walkHire a bikeHave a picnic7.50 for return shuttle

We took the Tiki Taxi ride from QueensQuay. It was a fun 15 mins ride to Toronto Islands-Centreville.It is a good place to hangout for picnics and day trips. You can rent bikes, go on the guided tour or simply visit the beach.There are ATMs, but do keep some cash handy.Good summer destination in Toronto.

Just 10mins boat ride and you are escaping from the busy and noisy downtown. The island is nice to stroll around and to enjoy the nature close to the city. It's really surprising how clean and beautiful it is. Early in the morning during the week it's the time to be there before bunches of people invade this beauty spot....

Spent the afternoon here with my wife last month. We loved it and wished we had had more time there! Very cheap ferry ride across to the islands and lots to do when you get there. We hired a quadricycle which is a fun way to get around. Wished we had a frisbee with us to try the frisbee golf...

We took the ferry to the islands and hired bikes in two separate afternoons. It's a fantastic way to explore the islands, beaches and picturesque cottages, especially if the weather is good. A great activity for all ages of family.
This was an excellent boat trip around the Islands.The guide was great, a really sparkling personality. Lots of great info about the area to share.

Toronto Island Park isn't to be missed. Take the ferry over from Harbourfront and enjoy a day riding a quadricycle and taking in the beautiful sights. You can spend the day relaxing on the beach or having a drink or snack at one of the various restaurants. On a clear day you can see Niagara Falls. We had our best...
We enjoyed a day cycling around the Island, beautiful place with stunning views of the Toronto skyline. Not to be missed.
Highly recommend renting bikes on this island. It was super fun to bike to either side of the island, and I don't think it would be as interesting to walk.

My husband, my brother and I took my 2yr old son for the day to Centre Island and we had a great time. Ferry ride over was fun, we had a picninc( there are lots of benches, places to sit and just enjoy the beautiful weather). We took my son on the rides, which he loved, went to the small...

Definitely worth a visit. If you have kids am sure they gonna enjoy to the fullest. We reached here at the spring 2016. A nice escape from the city that is easily accessible by a short ferry ride. It was just out of season when we visited (mid April) so we hired bikes in the city as everything was shut on the island (so remember to take some food with you  we packed a picnic). I really love Toronto Islands. Lots of options for the most different interests.If you're into photography like I'am, the Islands have an awesome view of the Toronto skyline.You can also take your bike with you and go for a ride in there.

It's a Relaxing ferry ride to the Islands. We started at Ward Island so that we could walk along to Central where the ferries back are more frequent. My husband had been to the island years ago. He took me to the island so i could see it for the first time. It is the most beautiful and peaceful place i have ever been.

Great boat tour that dropped off on Islands. Very beautiful and peaceful. Walked about 2 miles to Rectory Restaurant and had great lunch. Highly recommend the walk to get there. Enjoyed Islands and got back on boat tour back to Toronto. Good half day visit.
Great day outside! Beach, rides, bike rental, food, ice cream. A fun ride on the ferry across and a great day away from the city.
This is great to just relax and have some fun for a couple or for a family.Cool in the summer heat and fun to walk around and just grab a picnic or maybe see some of the vendors.

Its not just one but a collection of 3 interconnected Islands and 3 separate beaches (one on each island). The only bad thing about the island, is if you go during 'Rush' hour to get there. Line ups can be avoided if you go early. Otherwise you will wait for up to an hourSo much to do and lots of aquatic sceneryConfidently had a frizbee with us and played FREE frisbee golfWorth your time!
Had a relaxed and fun day at the Toronto Island Park. Lots of unique things to check out. It's a good place for families with children to visit.

We had great trip here in April. Everything closed but lovely as spring day gave fantastic views back to Toronto. We have great photos. Great walk along boardwalk on far side of island, because it was a clear day could see buildings in Niagara.

Taking the ferry from mainland Toronto to the Toronto Island Park is fun, refreshing, and provides a great view of the big city. I've been to the island on a few occasions and have enjoyed it every time. There are 3 ferries that run from the city to 3 different spots on the island. Lots to do and fun place for families and friends. Do not want to miss this Toronto Island. Fun all the way with fresh water to boot.

When in Toronto make sure you hop on a ferry to go around Centre Island which a nature oasis just off the Harbour Front, it also gives you a great photo opportunity to take a photo of the city skyline. Love spending the day on the island. The was so much to do and it was also very relaxing. Most Locals, seemed to bring their own food for picnic type lunches and snacks which seemed like a good idea as the restaurants were busy and pricey.

Great aspect to the city and the views are great. Take Jack Layton terminal at the harbor...TRY PURCHASING your tickets online...we got to skip the lines that way and it was GREAT. Only $7.50 CAD per adult. You'll see friends, teens, families, couples, elderly and young adults...any and everybody type of experience.. Romantic of leisurely. It's a park...a safe park...

Cheap day out - ferry only 7.50 Can dollars, return for adults 5.00 for seniors and kids. Great Park area with loads of walks. Animal friendly petting zoo and attractions for the kids. Nicde bar in the center of the park overlooking that overlooks the river running through the park. Beach area too - one part of it 'clothing optional'....

Took the city ferry across to toronto islands. Adult tickets were $7.50 per adult. Bikes and dogs allowed on the ferry. Get views of the downtown skyline from the ferry. I visited the place in Spring when the landscape was not green enough yet. It was a public holiday thus there were crowds everywhere and long wait for almost all facilities. I managed to find a quite corner and enjoyed a peaceful afternoon and took some good pictures.

Only a fifteen minute ferry ride from downtown Toronto, the island is amazing! I like this island not to far from Toronto only 5 min in the bootsNice for children and adults family or friends and couples
Escape the bustling city to this idyllic group of islands. Easy to walk end to end and enjoy the peace and tranquillity of the islands and lake

Crossing over on the ferry was only $7 return, there are beeches and plenty for kids to do (and grown ups), but take your own lunches and drinks as we thought the prices for snacks and drinks were expensive.

In town for a conference and had a day to kill. We decided to visit the Toronto Islands even though we had no children with us (heard about the Centreville Amusement Park from other Trip Advisor blogs). We came here recently on holiday and had the best time. We hired bikes in the morning to see the full island, then sunbathed in the afternoon and went walking. Aplace too relax for young and older, lots of walking, good for the health of your body. Its cool to have a fairy ride, great view of the waterfront, you will not get sea sick, (: (:. Visited Toronto Island for the day on Victoria Day (a bank holiday in May). Easy regular return ferries which only take about 10-15 minutes to arrive at the island. Nice place to go to get away from the hussle and bustle of the city. Only $7.50 return on the ferry. Not a lot open when we visited, glad we took a picnic as few food places to eat. It appears to not fully open until June. Lovely looking beaches.

Just a short ferry ride ($7.50 rtn) and a few minutes walk away from the dock and it's like you're on a different planet. Grass and trees and even a couple of sandy beaches. You take a very nice ferry to the island. I recommend renting a bike so that you can explore the whole island easily. Toronto island park is a great natural park. Easy to reach by the Toronto transit system. Go to Union station and then take a street car to Harbour front. Heavenly verdant green this time of the year (May). Great views of the city skyline from the ferry as well as the island. This is the perfect place to go on a sunny toronto day. You catch the ferry from Toronto harbour which takes roughly 15 minutes. From the island there is so much to do. The islands are nice and taken care of, especially with few nice beaches on the southern part where more tourists and visitors may be found. Very nice place to enjoy in the summer with your family or friends. Has a small beach but the water is too cold. Has a bike riders and place to do a barbecue.

Visited Toronto Island Park on a pleasant May day. Great trails to explore, and I would highly recommend renting a bike to see all the Island without an exhausting hike. I had occasion to live on my boat at Toronto Island Park. It is a wonderful place with a small farm with animals, and a small children's park with rides and food. A decent beach and lots of places for picnics and family outings. Public transportation is available from downtown Toronto.

The hidden gem. We had so much family fun. The best view of CN tower and the skyline too. Pick a hot day and go to the park. Bring a water, hat, sunscreen, sunglasses, make a small picnic. Ferries to the Toronto Islands are very easy to access from downtown Toronto. Tickets are very reasonable for round trip. We went mid-May and, while the theme attractions aren't open during the week, there was plenty of things for us to wander around and look at. I highly recommend this park!!! So cute and the ferry ride is very reasonably priced. We would definitely go again!

We found out about this through TripAdvisor and decided to check it out and were glad we did. We caught one of the frequent ferries from downtown, and walked around for a few hours. Really enjoyed the open spaces place for kids and adults to run .Great views of the city a real gem in the middle of a metropolis ,Really enjoyed the ferry ride!
You can get the ferry over to this park from Toronto for next to nothing. It's a great day out to get back in touch with nature.
A nice park, great views of the city, beaches on the outer shore, rent or bring your bike. very reasonable fares on the ferry.
Lots to see and do. This is one of Toronto's most unique and enjoyable parks. Rent a bike and see the residential area and airport and light house.

We went after visiting the CN Tower, the ferry was easy enough to find and it's $7.50 for a return ticket for one person. This has to be the perfect city park. Flat topography is perfect for biking or running around the islands. You can picnic, play ball or frisbee golf or hang out on the beach. The islands don't look that big from the CN tower but that is deceiving. There is so much to do there! We were there five hours and had to leave because it was starting to get late. Take bicycle as island is very large. You will get tired by roaming around the island. Great place to spend your whole day.

Visited this place yesterday and what can I say. I was so glad we made the trip! Such a beautiful, quiet and tranquil park. We only walked around half of it as it was so big. Only $7.50 return in spring so well worth it!

Great skyline city view from the opposite sideWalk the islands, you can almost see into peoples houses and imagine how they live there with no air pollution,no cars access,there are some great parks and trees to sit under and enjoy the no-cars islands and just BREATH

Nice place to do a picnic and great city view but it a little bit cold so bring a jacket even in the summer time.
would go back great view and location. kind of buggy at times just bring bug spray but if you like to go on hikes go
It's a really good place. Visit there when you have nice weather! Huge, peaceful and also beautiful place. You can also find bike rentals, small farm and attractions too.

I visited as part of the boat tour linked to the hop on bus tour. Friendly team on the boat with great views of the harbour and sky line. The island is great for a walk, beaches for the summer and a children's fair few for a moment of peace. Great to walk the board walk.

Somehow this one of the best hidden treasures of Toronto, because you can not realice how beautiful it can be to walk or bike all along this great park until you do it. You can explore your mind and relax while staring at Toronto's imposing skyline from here!
I suggest to visit the farm and the beach. Biking is a perfect option to discover the island. Summer should be great for barbecue.

We take the ferry over with our kids every summer, to visit Centre Island, ride bikes, have a picnic by the water and feed the ducks. Step away from the frantic pace of the downtown and hop a ferry to Toronto Island Parks. Sit on the sandy beach on the south side for a forever view of Lake Ontario. Visited the island on a buitifull sunny day, great place to relax and enjoy the wonderful views of the city.

it's great for tourists.family trips with young children and always a nice romantic picnic type of place...first for tourists it's a 10 dollar ferry ride to the island ..there is a amusement park for kids. you can bike through the island lots of fun stuff to do...you can play basketball frizbee. do picnics barbecue 's..go for walk bike rides.its a...

I love this place! There are ample amount of things to do. Not only park but you can have beach experience as well. Lot of activities to do and very happening place. A must visit place in Toronto!
Amazing view of Toronto skyscrapers from this island.You gotta maybe visit in summer to see many more activities and have more fun as you won't find many things open in winter and spring.

We had such an amazing time at Toronto Island Park yesterday. From the ferry ride to the island to Centerville for the kids, it was such a great day.
