Went on a cool sunny day in April and was surprised that it wasn't too windy or chilly and there was still some nice flowers. Amusement park looked fun for young kids. Nice bike paths, ok beach. Good place to relax. The lighthouse was nice, but kind of a walk there.
It is a nice ferry ride and the view of Toronto is great. The weather made it less pleasant. It is probably much better in the summer

We went on a pretty chilly day in late April so luckily it wasn't busy at all. We went rollerblading from one end to the other and the paths were actually pretty smooth. Beautiful park, nice escape from the city. Also the café had just opened for the spring season so it was nice to have something warm to hold.

Can't wait to visit this place again to see all the beautiful flowers and fun attractions located on the other side of Toronto just a few mins away..one need to do this trip as a part of discovering Toronto it's wonderful added experience.

Toronto Island Park is easy to get to. Simply take the ferry from downtown (about $5.50 per person). It's a great park to go and chill out with family & friends. The short ferry ride to Toronto Island is well worth it. It's amazing how remote it feels and how charming it is in the shadow of the city.

You have to take a ferry (about 10 minutes) to the Toronto Island park. There are many things to do at the park, rides, games, and of course lots of park to enjoy with the family. Highly recommended for individuals and families.

The park is really nice. I'm a bird watcher, and I got a few lifers there. The best time of year is the beginning of May. You have to get to the park via their ferry. The ferry station is in downtown Toronto, and you can rent a bike from Toronto Bike Share to get there.

The island as still partly inhabited but I was told as the leases come up for renewal the city are forcing people to move off the islands, which is a shame because it is a quiet retreat in the lake.The houses add character to the place, which has its own fire station etc. Visit as soon as you can...

If you are a photographer, don't miss it at sunset. But beware, it's colder than in downtown, even during summer. And prepare for mosquitos in the evening.

Centre Island is a wonderful escape from the city ...great place for a picnic on a summer day. Spectacular parkland to stroll through and Centerville for the kiddies. One of my favourite places to relax in the City. Spend the day if you can and put some thought into you trip there and back; to avoid the crowds. Show up early for the ferry or take a water taxi over and ferry back as it doesn't cost much more.
Great for families with children. Skip if travelling with adults only. Children will appreciate the rides, petting animals and the munchies. go on a sunny, but not very hot day.

A great place for the family. Great place to spend the day with the family. There aren't that many bbqs so make sure to get there before 10 to ensure that you secure one as they are first come first serve. The grass is usually in great shape and they encourage you to walk and play on it. There is a beach on the south side...

Cheap ferry ride (approx. $7) across to the island. If its a nice day, theres beaches and boardwalks which take you on a beautiful walk around the island. Best of all, a great view and picture opportunity of the city. Cant be missed when visiting Toronto.

Make sure you spend a day on the island if you visit Toronto with young kids. The Centre Ville attraction park is super fun for them (and they will love the Ferry boat ride to get there).Bring lunch if you can - the restaurant selection is quite slim.

A perfect place to take the kids. No kids...no problem..bring ur bikes. Beautiful with incredible view of City.

Everything about this park is unique, from the methods of arrival to what you'll see when you're there. This is something you wouldn't expect to find, like a world away from the city, while staring at the skyline of the city.

I went there just to see something different. Is a great place to go and relax swim walk.Just 5 minutes with the ferry and you have great views to city ,lake,and a small airport that located on the island.Its really worthy to visit.
Always a great way to spend a summer afternoon. If you can get over to Toronto Island at any point this summer, do it. Great place for families, couples, bike around, take a boat cruise. I'm in!

The 'Island' has many very good attractions including swim beaches, plenty of park land, a childrens amusement park, some good eating establishments etc. The ride over and back on the ferry is also enjoyable. However the extensive, paved walk/cycle paths are safe the scenery is excellent.

Just a short ferry ride away - the Toronto Islands are a great way to get away from the city but not have to drive hours. Acres and acres of parkland, with swimmable beaches. Love taking the ferry in the summer and going for a bike ride with my family. Relatively cheap - we usually pack a picnic and go for a bike ride on the islands. I had high expectations of the islands and was not disappointed! The islands are a fantastic place to visit and are just a short 10 minute ferry ride across Lake Ontario. I love the Islands! Every year we organize a picnic with friends and family. In the summer children have a blast at Centre Ville, the splash pad and the wading pool. You can take your bikes or rent one. It's a very fun place for all families and people of all ages.
Perfect view to downtown. Must be lively during summer. Take the ferry and enjoy the park! 7.25$ only.

In the peak season I'm sure this is a much better place to visit. Out of season however there is literally nothing to do other than walk and take in the nature which is admittedly very nice. I love coming to the island in the summer to just get away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. The ferry to the island gives you a nice picturesque view of downtown. I mainly bring my picnic bag and sit to enjoy the lake.

A great day to spend with family and friends. Visit the historic lighthouse or enjoy watching the birds. Walk, hike or ride a bicycle around the islands. I love visiting the islands by kayak and travelling through the bird sanctuary. Kayaks, canoes or SUPs are available to enjoy the islands by water.
There are many possibilities to this park. lots of walking, biking picnicking beautiful views of the city, it's a great place to spend a lazy day!

A trip to Toronto island can be a rewarding experience for photographers; the view to the city is a one-of-a kind and gives an unique view of the waterfront from a distance. A great place to head to for tourists and locals. Cheap 10 minute ferry ride away from downtown. You will find some of the best photo opportunities the city has to offer. Visited in April _ everything was closed and didn't even look like they were getting ready for the summer season - a little run down - even though plenty of visitors coming off of the ferry nothing open - great view however of CN tower and sky line

It almost feels like you've gone up north for the weekend but you're a short ferry ride from the busy city. Some of the attractions are a little touristy and therefore with a bit of inherent cheesiness, but it's a wonderful place to visit at least once.

Toronto Island Park is a wonderful day trip while you are in Toronto. I like to rent a bike, take it on the ferry boat and then discover the island by bike. Be sure to eat at the Rectory Cafe while you are there.
Veru fun and relaxing to walk around all day. You have crowded space if you want nosie and people but you alson have secluded spaces. I love it !

In August of 2015 myself and a friend decided to visit Toronto Island. We rented 2 bicycles but did not get too far as we are in our 70's and found it too difficult to do so we traded in our bikes and rented and 4 wheel bike (side by side bikes connected together) and two people peddle at the...
Spent a nice afternoon here in September of 2015, nice hideaway in a busy city, beautiful flowers, walking paths, kids park, waterfront and food is available. The ferry ride ove is pleasant too

Toronto Island which is accessible by public ferry at the foot of Bay Street is a wonderful spot for families, couples and singles. Cycling walking sunbathing picnics swimming is all here. Can be cool with an onshore wind.
A must do if you visit Toronto. 10 minute ferry ride across the lake, it was off season so very quiet. Lovely walks and fantastic views of Toronto.

We love the island. We have been going there almost every year since my daughter was a little toddler. Its one of the places that your young child can go on rides without you accompanying them. Nice bicycle paths and places to stop for food or picnics.Not for racing or long distance riding, just easy family riding.Dress for the Month you visit.

Prepare yourself to spending the day on the Island. You can walk the whole island, about 5 km. It's a very picturesque walk. Your date will enjoy. The ferry ride over to the island and back is definitley the show stopper. You will remember this trip for years to come.

Unbelievable peace and quiet in the island compared to the hussle of big city life. Nice to clear the head and there is alot to keep you entertained too out there. Nice to get to see the city from the water too

Before visiting Toronto Islands, I read many reviews and pretty much all stated you should go during summer.Well, I was in Toronto this weekend, it was a beautiful sunny cold Saturday and my husband and I didn't care, we decided to take the ferry boat and head to the islands. Take a ferry, prepare your camera and take a selfie with the best view of skyline of the city. Rent a bike, or sunbath on the beach, enjoy your time with your family. Tip: bring your own food

So there isn't much on the island - beaches, old yacht clubs, frolf, paths for walkers and cyclists. But that's its charm. It's a quiet refuge from everyday city bustle. Pack a picnic cause food is limited, pack you sunscreen and comfortable shoes in the summer or your skates in the winter.

I have been to Toronto island a few times in my life and I'm always disappointed with it. Especially this last time in march. It seemed very run down and kinda sad.It is nice to get away from downtown Toronto but don't think I'll be going back any time soon.I think the city should invest some money into...
This takes you away from the every day hustle and bustle of downtown toronto. Makes you feel you are not in the city but a different land. A most visit.

If you're in Toronto in the summer and need to entertain kids, Toronto Island is pretty well perfect. You arrive via ferry, which is fun in itself. You can play and picnic on the lawns, or explore the shoreline and feed the ducks. You can rent car-shaped bicycles and rove around the island, checking out the community on the far...
This is an all day trip if you really want to enjoy it. Need time for the rides. The farm. Great place for picnic.

This little piece of heaven is only a short ferry ride away: walking in beautiful enormous nature park, playing scattered games, riding a quadricycle (get there early! They sell like hotcakes). A very serene way of spending a lazy, relaxing day without going far away from the Toronto attractions. Will definitely visit again when in the area!

This is a fun place to spend the day. You take the ferry (may have a bit of a wait in line but it moves pretty quickly). The boat ride is short but very pleasant especially in the summer. Once at the island there are so many things to do - rides for children, swimming, cycling, picnicking, and wandering around....

Best thing is its so close.... Nature in the city. Ferry ride offers great city views. We take picnics as food isnt great and expensive. Take a wagon if you have alot of stuff? Bikes can go on some ferrys. Centre island is the busiest. Wards is very cool.... Start there, see the wee unique houses that inhabit this island,...

Been there today and really liked the quiet beautiful Park. I think it is quite different in the summer time because there should be lot of tourism but in spring it is just a nice chill out area. I can definitely recommend this place. Nice view of the city and a beautiful Park overall.

Visited the island at the end of the summer and then again in the fall. I was in town on business and was killing some time on the weekends. Beats sitting in a hotel room fir sure.The island has clean beaches for both family and adults. One side of the island has a clothing optional beach. another beach area...

If you are in TO on hot, humid summer day there is no better place than to spend it on Island. A ferry ride is convenient way to get there and view the city from the lake. If you rent a bike it may be easier to move with families and explore the whole island. There are several beached you...
Take the ferry and enjoy the bustle free, quiet of the islands - the views of Toronto are simply the best!

Short ferry ride away, the islands, offer an enjoyable day's outing for all ages. Centreville's rides and games, Far Away Farm, botanical garden, bike rentals, Dragon Boat races, "The Maze", beach, live events ... there is just so much to do. Visit a must when in Toronto. Something for everyone member of the family no matter the age. You can relax on the beach or stare at the beautiful flowers while sitting on a bench. We went over on the ferry and had a great time. If you have kids go to Center Island, there are lots of things for kids to do. If you do not have kids I would avoid Center Island unless you want to rent a bike to ride around the Islands. There are lots of other places to walk around...
March is still a little bit cool for outdoor activities, but it is good to visit and from island side to see the city. The ferry runs in winter schedule now.

Great place to visit! My parents took me as a child every summer, I took my children every summer and we still go to this day as adults. It is so versatile...fun, exciting, relaxing, adventurous, informative...so whatever age group you fall into and whatever the intentions of your outing to The Toronto Island Park are...you will definitely be satisfied... Guaranteed!!

It really is amazing to walk or bike through the park. Looking across its northern shores one can see the rapidly-changing skyline of the biggest city in Canada - all while relaxing in a scene reminiscent of cottage country.
We walked here for many time, and we like here. You can see many people running and walking here, it is a nice place to walk after dinner.
we go there for biking. it is nice place for outdoor activity and biking. 20 min ferry ride from Toronto which is very convenient,

Take a 10 minute ferry ride from the centre of downtown Toronto and you on an island paradise with the best view of the city. Take a picnic with you, sit on the grass, rent a bike, go to the beach or wander through the cottages and manicured lawns that go on and on. Perfect for a hot sunny Sunday...
Take a bike, get to the ferry early (or take a water taxi) and bring a lunch. Great time on a hot summer day.
My husband and I really enjoy going to Toronto Island it's a great day to get out and enjoy the beach and relax
More than little tired. Amusement park OK for very young children. Beach mediocre. Water too cold to swim. Ferry ride to island is fun and is the best part of the experience.

Nice pleasent green and relaxing environment. If you go during the week is less crowded but in the summer long weekends there is a lot of festivities happening, so depends what your are looking for just do your research.

Great piece of serenity 10 minutes from downtown. Boat across the lake is cheap and cheery.You can rent a bike and ride around the island. Awesome beaches. But be careful, a nude beach is one of them. Charming Amusement park for the kiddies. The best panoramic view of the stunning and impressive downtown Toronto skyline! Take a picture.

It's so close, but it feels like you're right out of Toronto. The island has something for everyone.

Tiding my bike down the DVP and then taking the Ferry to the Island. I have been countless times to the Island but each time I enjoy it a lot. You can take the best pictures of the Toronto Skyline from the Island. What a great view of the City.
No cars or traffic...just bicycles! A place for the family or for couples...beaches good places to eat

After a wonderful ferry ride disembark and plan your time. Renting bicycles is a good way to get around and see all the islands. Discover a small community of islanders who live on the island. A very nice place for walk, swim and nice view of the skyline of the city, during the summer months.

Growing up, it was one of my most favourite places to visit! One could picnic, enjoy rides, take long walks...right up to the beach, where one could dip one's toe (or more!)in the cold waters of Lake Ontario, and relax. Take the ferry from Queens Quay.Lovely big trees.Nice bradwalk.Opportunity to rent abike.Great for childrenhave good playground.For aduklts is better to go away from the playground and discover the beauty of the island
I try to visit Toronto Island at least twice a year. Great place to relax, sunbath, picnic or photo shoot.

Taking the ferry across to the islands is a treat for young and old. It's long enough to be fun and short enough to avoid boredom, but most of all offers a spectacular view of the waterfront as you return. Pack a picnic and rent a bicycle for a great spring or summer escape from the crush of the city....

Whenever I receive family visitors, I take them to the Toronto Island Park. Centre Island as we call it, is a Great Place to visit most any time. Spring, Summer, and Fall. Go have a picnic, ride your bike, or go for a days walk!There is a place called CenterVille...
Great place for walks or cycling. Bring your own or there are rentals available. Get some great pictures of Toronto skyline.
Great place for day trip to bike along water and through local streets, eat outdoors on patio and view the city from a beautiful perspective. Ferry rude is fast and efficient.

We love the Toronto Islands and Leslie St. spit. There are no better views, sun rises and sun sets than from the Islands. We are very fortunate to have both a park and a wilderness environment within the city. It's what makes Toronto a great place to live life.

I lived in Toronto for 7 years and still visit several times a year. Visiting Toronto Islands (it's actually a chain of small islands even though it is sometimes referred to as Toronto Island) is probably the first thing that comes to mind when people ask me about things to do in the city. I love the ferry ride and...
Nice boat ride over or you could take the water taxi. Great location for quite swimming or walking. Has a place to wash up or shower too. A must see and do in Toronto.

A cheap ferry ride gives you access to most of the islands (minus residential areas and the city airport). Definitely the best view of the Toronto skyline can be captured here. However, the rides and farm do not open until May so it's best to come here during the summer...this issue is consistent with bathrooms too.

We visited in Summer and were quite surprised how unclean and run down the place seemed. We stayed for about an hour to walk around and go the ferry straight back as it was not a place we would visit again

Vancouver has its Stanley park and Toronto has its Toronto island park. Love the little ferry trip from downtown to centre island and love how each island has its own attractions. The views back to the city are stunning and I would love to live in that little hamlet of cottages still standing at the east end. The amusement park...
My first impression was a shock when I saw the sign "walk on the grass". This is clearly liberates you... this place is nice for walk, jog, picnic!

Gorgeous to walk around, but not much to do at this time of the year when pretty much everything is closed and it is freezing! Worth going, the ferry is only 7 dollars each return! After the crowds in the city,this is a great place to unwind.Lots of open spaces and also spots to take photos of the Toronto skyline.The farmyard zoo is perfect for young children as are the rides.$$$.There is also a beach.I always take my visitors from the UK there and they are always impressed.
Hubbie and I love to wander the whole of the island during the fall..its beautiful and quiet and just lovely!
Make sure you visit the petting zoo and see the lighthouse! It would be beautiful during the summer, but is nice during the winter too.

A Peaceful haven in the heart of Downtown. A wonderful spot for a bike ride or hike. If you don't have kids and don't need all the activities in Central Island, take the ferry to Ward Island (always less busy) and stroll the peaceful lanes lined with cute cottages. There really isn't much better in Toronto than spending the day on Toronto Island. There is so much to do- I wouldn't recommend planning on spending less than at least a half day here. A great spot for panoramic views of Toronto. A short ferry ride that costs around $7 return across the bay and you are in a quiet haven from busy Toronto.

The ferry trip was quick, and it was very pleasant to walk around the island. Just 10-15 minutes from the mainland, it is so quiet compared to the hustle and bustle of the city. A great place to run/walk or ride your bike, or even just relax for a few hours. Worth the trip.

Lots of green space, centre island is great for families. I would recommend that you bring your bike (or you can rent on the island), another good thing to know is that bbqs are available to use free of charge! Just bring some charcoal.

This island has everything you need! Gorgeous view of the city from the ferry! Beautiful landscapes, well maintained. Lots to do. For kids, roller coasters, play grounds. For families, biking, relaxing at the park. You can swim at the lake! Must go

Huge queue for the ferry, but lots can fit on! Once there, you can just wander round. Wanted to play frisby golf but no where to buy the frisby's (buy them before you go). Lovely views of the city skyline

Went with my wife. Took our bikes up to Torono from Buffalo area and biked around the island after taking them on the ferry near Bay St. The beache seemed nice, and the bike paths were nicely maintained. Great place and lovely for a picnic, grab a bike for 4 and smile laugh and enjoy the views and outdoor fun
The island was a nice change from being in the city. The ferry ride to the island had lovely views and the island itself was clean and lovely to walk around.
Spent the day on the island and played frisbee golf etc. Hired a bicycle 4 wheeler and toured the island. Beautiful spot, lovely beaches, no cars, great for bikes and boats.

This Island Park is just off the city skyline on a short ferry trip across from the heart of the City of Toronto. I It is a great place to spent hours doing all kinds of things one's heart desires. We visited the park and were disappointed. The beach is small and crowded. The rides look old and the people running them were not friendly. Food is overpriced and washrooms were few and far between.
A classic summer venue with large parks a cool ferry ride over and an over priced amusement park but a great family destination

Great for families: a fun ferry ride, and a different side of Toronto. Almost rural in its quiet calm, Toronto Island Park is very spacious and safe. Grass, trees, geese. Toronto island is a ferry ride away from downtown. Once on the island, there are a variety of activities including rides for children. You can rent cycles and a 4 wheel cycling vehicle (don't know the actual name). There are also beaches on the southern side. All in all, it makes for a very nice day trip.
Take the ferry here and make sure to pack a picnic. Offers beautiful view of the Toronto skyline. But be warned, there will be many families, strollers and the like.

One of the best ways to get away from the bustle of the city is to spend a few hours on Toronto island..better known in the summer, it is totally worth a trip in the winter on a clear chilly day. .you will bump into a few locals that are more than willing to share their experience of island living....

I went to this place for a group picnic. We had a nice walk to beach and we saw lots of people having fun riding their bikes ( I wanted to that, but you got it go with the group hehe) The views were just awesome. I loved it

This amazing place has it all from stunning views of Toronto especially at night but equally in the day time. Locals and tourists are a mixed bag and the nudist beach is a rare treat these days. Was tempted but not with my body!

The park is lined with trees and it adjoins the lake. It is a favorite for dog walkers and one can encounter several of them during all times of the day. There are benches dedicated to loved pets who have passed away.

We experienced the aqua bus and travelled along the river between New York and Ontario observing the tremendous castles along the shoreline..and incredible sight to behold.

The beach and walking were nice, but everything else was pretty drab and abandoned. I assume this is due to the time of the year I visited - it was the first day the ferry started up for the season. So, from what I hear from other people, it would likely be better to visit more into the summer.
It is a very nice place, you will love to walk around & have fun and it has a perfect view to downtown to make pictures!

We've visited Toronto several times but not the Island, although we had heard tales of it offering some of the best views of the City. Getting to the island is part of the experience and it's wonderful, taking the boat across the lake and seeing the beauty of Toronto shore line and watching planes land and take off from the Island airport. One of my favourite spots in Toronto. Great park for riding bikes, walking the dog, chilling by the water. We went in November, and the bike rentals and restaurants were already closed. Be sure to check on the dates of availability.

Toronto Islands are a wonderful asset for Toronto, well worth visiting.You take a ferry to get there. It's a place for families, dates, old people...etc. It's a quiet haven away from the city. Ferry ride to the island is the best, followed by canoeing.

Great way to spend the morning and afternoon hours in Toronto. A quick ferry ride from the shore, this small place packs a lot of stuff! Excellent place to spend day with family and friends. Going by boat and having a picnic with family and friends as well as playing games is excellent. Surrounded by lake and children games park is excellent.

Take the ferry over to the island, it takes about 10 minutes and provides a beautiful view of Toronto from the harbour. Ferry runs very often so little wait time. The island is a great place to spend the day with children, family, friends... There's bike rentals, paddling boats, canoe, beautiful beaches, parks...The kids love Centreville, the rides, the farm, it's so much fun!!!

I absolutely love this park and so does my daughter. We spent a lot of hours just wandering around the park. It is peaceful and inviting. It is a nice place for families and friends to visit. I love to just lie on my blanket and look at the water.There are many activities to do in this park. I...
For a unique view of Toronto go over to the Islands.Go to the south side you wouldn't think you were in Toronto.Check out Wards island see the houses.Spend the day ferry ride over.

The ferry ride over to Toronto Island is one of the fondest memories of my childhood. The island is a fun getaway from busy downtown Toronto, where local birds line the beaches, and the paths are easy to walk on.
I had a great day spend at Toronto Island . Taking a boat and harbour front and goes to the centre island is a great experience where a family can spend

I try to get out to the island once or twice a year, either to meet with friends or to throw a round of disc golf. The ferry fare seems a little steep, but once you're on that boat, you forget all about it. Once you're on the island and enveloped by greenery and quiet, it seems like the best...
Try to go as often as possible - busier on weekends but nicer on weekdays. A getaway, fun to bike along paths, parks, beaches with few people but there are also busier amusement areas.
A beautiful peaceful way to spend a day. Lovely beaches, great walking paths and even a frisbee golf course.

Where else can you get an islan park so close to any downtown in any major city. Toronto has the most wonderful park. Take the ferry over and wander. Theres an amusement park. Great restaurant. and a nude beach what more can you want. Do yourself a favour get a picnic lunch and chill in an island park.

love this palce! every year we visit this place. barbeque, kids play or rent bike. you can also ride in the to go arounde the island if you don't want to walk. very nice palce to go to specially summer.and if we have visitors from the US, we brought them here and they love!we visited May last t...
Great getaway minutes from downtown ro, convenient and lots of fun activities do for all family. Pack a lunch, bring your barbecue gear and let your imagination go wild.

We sail often to the Toronto Islands, a great get away right in the middle of the city! Views of the city skyline at night are incredible, and the fact that there are no (a few municipal) vehicles on the island makes if feel a lot like camping. Pick any sunny Spring, Summer or Fall day (very busy on weekends so I recommend week days) and travel by way of Ferry to Centre Island. Marvellous walking and bicycling paths await you, with beaufiful scenery, trees to provide shade, picnic benches, ponds with wildlife to regail you, fun park with rides for children in summer months and beaches. Even most Torontonians don't know about the three connected islands that form this peaceful and pristine park. Take the ferry and a picnic hamper and have a wonderful day. Worth the trip over. Avoid the funfair.Beaches are nice. Wards Beach is where all the kids hang out if you fancy a party atmosphere in the summer.

Toronto Island is a great natural area, with beautiful pathways for biking and walking without worries of vehicles. The view of the city from the Island is outstanding. I am counting the days until we go back.
Going to the Island Park n the summer is an awesome thing to do whether alone or family. Clean safe and beautiful.Relax away from the city although the travel is not long.

It's beautiful is the summer but the water incredibly cold. The ferry ride is short and affordable. There are lots of families at the weekend so it's great for a summer picnic. rent a bike and go around the island. The houses are super cute and the view of the Toronto skyline is amazing from the edge of the island

This park is really worth the trip, in particular in summer where all the flowers makes it marvelous. For plants and flowers lovers! There is also a beach where you can swim but the water is really cold even in August. To reach it you need to take the ferry for a reasonable price.
Buy some food and take it along on the ferry to enjoy a beautiful tranquil picnic time away from the urban sprawl.

A short ferry trip from the city, it is great for bicycles and it offers a little bit of this and that for many.The islands have a small kiddies amusement park called Centre ville,also many beaches including a very large nude beach, plenty of places to dock a boat if you want.

A short ferry ride from downtown Toronto, and you're able to explore the islands. There is something for everyone: quiet walks in nature, a boardwalk jog, bicycling, dining, picnics, kids' activities, petting zoo, dining, boating....no cars allowed!

Spend a day on the Toronto Islands for an experience you'll never forget. I always feel as though I'm escaping the hustle and bustle of Toronto....relax, walk, enjoy the beautiful park with gorgeous, mature trees and just take in the lifestyle. Truly a jem in a city that doesn't slow down.
went kayaking with my husband and it was beautiful! the view is great, and there are so many different activities you can do.
I had a great time here.. my kids had the best time..lots of good walking food carts . Made even better that weather was good.. seeing toronto from and island was amazing sight. ..

It's quiet in the winter with nothing much going on, just a few houses and lots of trees. On the side facing the city, you get to see a great view of downtown Toronto. It is a great destination for a one day cycling trip around the island. The ambience is quite tranquil, unlike within big city Toronto. With a sunny weather great chances to get some nice tan. Very pleasant day out.

Just happened on this by accident. We jumped on a ferry and off we when. What we found was truly amazing. We walked over 20,000 steps and enjoyed so many different views. We really enjoyed the rugged area that look what I think Cape Cod would look like. It's truly a must visit!
Wonderful place! Great for quiet walks and beautiful pictures. Extremely clean and organized. Best option is to rent bikes on the mainland before catching the shuttle to the island.

Toronto Island is such a well-kept secret. An easy boat ride from the harbor front, you get some of the best views of the city. Turn inward and there are beautiful lakes, marinas and canals. I originally learned about Toronto Island Park from a Toronto native. I've since been there twice. I was intrigued, so I jumped on the public ferry that takes you over to the Island. Just a cheap ferry ride from downtown will take you to a much more peaceful part of the city. It's really quite weird to be there knowing that you're still in Toronto, very close to downtown.I recommend hiring a bike once there, I didn't and regretted it, as I walked a lot (from Centre Island ferry dock to the...

Toronto island is always a great place to visit ! The ferry is less than 10 dollars, and its a great opportunity to get out of downtown without leaving Toronto. Lots of animals there both wild and domestic and a beach that you can actually swim in Lake Ontario. A must place to visit for locals and tourists alike!
Cannot explain how beautiful and peaceful it is to visit that island. You totally forget that you're downtown Toronto... best part... there are no vehicles... love it!!

Our family loves the island! From the ferry ride across (make sure to buy your ferry tix online beforehand and save yourself an often LONG lineup), to Centreville, the beach, the green areas, the children's garden..... you can't beat a day there!
Just walking around here is a joy. I particularly appreciate the frisbee golf area. If you aren't into frisbee there are plenty of trails and other activities.

We spent a lovely day on Toronto Island with the kids. There is a ton to do and lots of open space. Centreville is great for small children and much less stressful than big theme parks. I love escaping to the Islands and just relaxing in nature. Even though it's so close to downtown, it really is a world away. It's awesome.

If it's good weather and you are tired of concrete jungle, just book a seat in one of few boats in docks and spend sometime in Toronto islands. You can grab some food, or by it there - it's up to you. I would also recommend to take a swimsuit, especially in hot days, even if you don't have a...
There is s lot going on here. A great spot to bike. There is a frisée trail. Also a walk around the shoreline. Lots to see. Kiddies park too. Need to plan your time. Some good. Best to picnic.
You can spend few hours or the entire day here. You can rent bicycles or bring your own. Enjoy the beach and wlak around until you find the view of the city, from the Island. Beautiful.

The Island Park is on several islands - about 3 miles long in total - connected by bridges. A bit waiting to get the ferry ticket and board the ferry. It was relaxed and fun walking around, riding a bike instead of walking so you have full-strength of staying all day-long. Take a rest at snack bar or restaurant to recharge you up. Fun of a day.

This place is absolutely beautiful. A nice romantic spot to take your significant other to see the sunset. Even loving here all your life you see the beauty of it better when you look at it from across the river. I spent some time just laying on the grass you'll have tourists and photographers all around snapping pictures and trying...

Went here in August 2014 on our honeymoon trip, the island is only a short ferry ride away from Toronto proper. you can hire bikes, but the whole island is easily walkable up and down. Although it is worth noting that if you are following the beaches there is a nudist beach down one end of the island. We did...

While in TO for a conference, decided to get away from the city and took the ferry to the islands ...What great views of the Toronto skyline!Many paths to walk or bike along (rentals available), neat homes and cottages to look at. Piers, beaches, an amusement park, pretty gardens ... Can take a boat ride to tour the...

Though it was the end of November and a Monday, I enjoyed my ferry ride and visit to Wards Island of the Toronto Islands. It was beautiful to walk on a trail along the beach and on the other side of the island great views of the city. It was interesting to walk past the homes and see how people...

Going to Toronto Island definitely makes for a nice story. You start by taking the ferry over and once on the island you walk through a perfectly groomed park to the beaches. You can go to a restaurant (there are multiple), take a boat tour, go into the children's carnival games section, or just enjoy a shady rest under a...

If you like see skylines you must go to the island. From there you can see a amazing skyline of Toronto. During the winter everything in the island is closed but even like this the skyline worth the visit.
Very pleasant and calm, windy, everybody should go and, can enjoy on sunny day, good for family make on weekneds
The ferry ride over decompresses the city out of the bloodstream. It's a lovely. quiet park. Good to sit and picnic, bike ride, chill. Perfect fairground for small children.
There is a nude beach here. It is not all it's cracked up to be. The paths are nice though -good for a bike ride around.

Ward's island provide. . a panoramic view of Toronto and a quiet escape from the bustle of the city. No cars just local residents riding their bikes through the snow and cross country skiing. Cross the bridge to snake island and you will see red cardinals perched in the trees. the rectory restaurant is open Wednesday through Sunday. Follow the...

This is one of the best spots in Toronto where one can take a picnic lunch and enjoy a great day. There is plenty to do on the islands as there are canals to kayak or canoe in. There are beaches for everyone including a "nude" beach if that tickles your fancy. There is a wading pool and a village...

Toronto Island Park is great for everyone. Kids love it, couples love it, families enjoy bbqs and it's great if you want to go alone and enjoy nature by yourself. I go every year with our summer day camp. Beautiful place to spend a day, and the rides are fun too.

Great fir everyone, yes even kids. There's a place there called centerville. With rides for kids and even pony back riding....with bike rentals etc... Summertime is the best time to go here. From the island you can see the city of Toronto from far distance...great picturesque.....have fun!

How many other cities have 3 islands that you can access by ferry? Going to the islands has always been special to my family. Centre Island has lots of attractions, including rides and a farm. The food choices are limited and a little pricey.The other islands, Wards & Hanlon's Point are quieter but wonderful for biking, walking, exploring nature....
If it is a warm day - a nice family outing is to make a picnic and take the ferry over to Toronto Island and walk around and have your picnic.
A short ferry ride from the main harbour, the islands are a great place to get away from the city. the views towards the city are iconic and well worth the trip.
Great views, reached by the ferry system. But lts to do once you are there. Great for Bicycling and a great place to eat. Frequented by visitors.

I had always wanted to take my children to Toronto Island, and never got the chance. I recently visited the park this summer; and was wish I had. It is a great little park with amusement rides that are entertaining for younger children and kids up to about 10. The rides are covered through the purchase of tickets. The rides...
We hired some bikes and spent most of the day on the Island. Beautiful Island with plenty to see and choices for eating and with stunning views of the city.

The islands are very close to downtown and easily accessible by ferry. Once on the islands you can walk through manicured gardens, walk through sand dunes, rent a quadricycle and much more. I would not suggest visiting the amusement park, but instead exploring the islands. The islands are beautiful and with a very quaint residential section. After visiting you will...

If you enjoy walking around a huge park, then this is the place for you. Its clean, with signs that say WALK ON GRASS PLEASE. The Toronto skyline is fabulous to see from here. Kids park is fun if you have young children.Lot a lot of to choose from food wise. So have a picnic and bring a lunch....

You can take the Hanlan's Point ferry to the clothing-optional beach or to watch the planes land at the Island Airport. You can take the Centre Island ferry to the rides at the Kid's Park. Not bad but most of parks are very similar but would still recommend a visit as I'm sure you won't be disappointed with lots to see and do. i guess there must a lot of fun in summertime

We visited Toronto in July as part of our family vacation, including Niagara Falls (Canadian side). Cute nice park, the ferry ride was delightful...If you are in Toronto and want to go beyond skyscrapers this i s a very good place to visit!

A short ferry ride from the terminal and you reach the island with lots of sandy beaches looking back at the amazing views of Toronto. Quite a few things were closed while we were there as it was late afternoon / early evening, still a great place to walk around and relax. Terrific views of the city were worth the...
Lots of fun outdoor activities and sights on the different islands. Just a ten minute ferry from the mainland!

Toronto Islands are an escape from the city that is just a ferry ride away. I recommend that you buy your ferry tickets online to avoid long line-ups at the dock. Sometimes there is a cash only line at the far left. That line moves much faster. If you go on the Wards Island or Hanlan's Point ferry, you can...
Lovely place to ride your bike close to the water and have a picnic either with family and friends or a romantic one.Place to enjoy the summer.

Just a short ferry ride from the terminal and your on an island with lots of sandy beaches looking back at the amazing views of Toronto. Quite a few things were closed while we were there as it was in September, still what a great place have on your doorstep. You can imagine all the city workers flocking here at...
A wonderfull place to relax, to walk, to ride a bike, to wal on the grass... Nice place to run out of the city mess!

I didn't know Toronto even had a beach area. So many of us at the Planet Traveler Hostel went for a picnic at the island in the middle of Lake Ontario. The cool part is you have to travel by water ferry over where you get spectacular photos of the Toronto downtown skyline.

Toronto Island Park is just across from the city, a short ferry ride across the island in the summer to enjoy a day at the beach is worth it.The hours of operation for the ferry do change in the seasons so check the hours. The ferrys do get busy, there is more than 1 so make sure you know...

The beauty sometimes are simple things. The amazing view of Toronto from island is wonderful. You don't spend much money to walk around the island and enjoy the nature, take some photos. I'd suggest stay until nights come, see Toronto at night is incredible.

The island offers beautiful views of the city of Toronto. It is also a nice escape from the city. The island offers bike rides, single or tandem style, kayaks, beautiful scenery and yummy places to eat. Although you may want to pack a lunch as the food is expensive.

This is a very special place in Toronto! An absolute gem for residents and visitors alike. It has the best views of Toronto from across the harbour. Beautiful and car free. A true oasis in the bustling city!

Three ferry routes - Wards, Centre and Hanlan's. Ward's Island features cute houses for a car-free lifestyle; Centre Island has the amusement park rides, fun for younger children; Hanlan's has a nice beach, partially clothing optional, and of course, the airport fenced off at the north end. A separate ferry or pedestrian tunnel takes you to the airport. The island...

It's just fun to go here. I like the ferry ride over-not too long and nice on a hot summer;s day. I enjoy walking the neighbourhood and looking at the cute cottages and lovely homes. An Oasis minutes from the city. It is such a jewel. The beaches are natural sand and some areas are stone, great restaurant to have your meal or snack amongst the mature trees and an excellent menu. Trails are flat and easy walking or biking. I recommend walking the streets as the inhabitants have an artistic flair which manifests in...

In late spring and early fall, before and after school holidays, when the sun is warm and you desperately need a day away, there is no better place to play hooky. So grab your partner, friend or go alone, it's fun however you decide to do it.A short ferry trip transports you from the hustle and bustle of daily...
Gorgeous vistas and great activities. Spent many a day with friends out here with food, fun, music, swimming. Highly recommended.
Toronto island park is a great place for family outings and picnics. The scenery is beautiful...lots of play areas for kids. A delightful experience for those who would love to walk.
I love spending time with family, having barbeque play some games and enjoy a lovely walk. Great to take the kids for a little outing and just have fun. Swimming, biking let the kids run around.
good price and greate value, lots to do and see and lots of fresh air - grren grass - great place foer cty bound people
Sunsets and cityscapes - go just before dusk for the best views in Toronto. Also, a wonderful place for summer strolls along the beach.
Not a bad place to hang out, with family and friends. It's a great park for relaxing and playing games.
Best day for a couple walk through the island and see the canals and all the beautiful greenery. Take your bike's if you have them.

Peaceful, beautiful place for any photographer. The walk through the village where the homes are was most attractive to me. The restaurant was really great food but overpriced in my opinion. Lots to do for everyone from theme park for kids, to canoe and bicycle rentals. The Park Spans 3 Islands and is only accessible by Ferry Boat. Its a fabulous place for the family. The fairy boat ride is only about 10 min. but it beautiful on Lake Ontario. I look forward to the boat ride. There are lots of green space to run around in. Great if you bring your bike also, you can ride for hours. swimming, have a picnic,or just relaxing and getting some...
must go,fun place ,great for the family.the view is beautiful you will have the water all over you,boats ships ,food,take your camera,your dog.kids will enjoy the place too.enjoy.

I have not visited Toronto Island in over 40 years. I remember flowers, walking trails, amusement park and animals. Because so much time has gone by I was not expecting to see the same or even better then my memory. Once again I choose this trip to spend time with my grandson and it is one of our best memories...
I combined this with a boat tour that I got off Groupon for the same price as the ferry. Great day out with kids and family on a sunny day. Don't miss the pools, the beach and the rides!

There are lots of activities & a beautiful, clean beach. There is a bike rental as well as rides for the kids. the restaurants are good with pretty views. Pedalows and canoe rides are fun. There are great seating areas & plenty of room to spread out for picnics. There are also a variety of concerts and other events.

Lovely walk away from the city for a day. Take the ferry to get there or a water taxi (tikki taxi perhaps) Once there you can enjoy the beach - a coffee or even go on a gondola if you cant make it to Italy. And they also have an amusement park for the kiddies. Very well done.

Minutes after leaving the short Ferryservice,one is surrounded by many beautifultrees and bushes and small inlaid waterways.beaches at certain locations inviteone to swim.Various pleasant and inviting restaurants ,some at waterways,are most enjoyable to rest up!!

We go at least once a year for a family picnic, and once with friends. Usually take the ferry to Hanlan's point and walk over to BBQ area. Great for a group picnic, a walk or a bike ride. Cooler near the lake than in the downtown core.Really feels like getting away from it all to take the ferry over.

Great paths and scenery - lots of picnic grounds and play areas. Boaters, walkers and bicyclists enjoy the islands - a great respite from the city.If you have young children, be careful of the Gay beach at Hanlan's Point - many gay visitors think it's ok to make out on the beach or sunbathe naked.

Toronto Island Park is an all year attraction. Cross country skiing in the winter, birding and walking in spring and fall, to swimming and water sports in the summer. It is a venue for everyone from oldest to youngest and is easily accessible by TTC and ferry. Parking is expensive in the area.
Beautiful pictures, nice beach, great park, pay a little to get there and enjoy a day.383 Clinton Toronto

Toronto Island Park is an idyllic and tranquil stretch of parkland just far enough away from the city to not feel like its in the city, without requiring really leaving. If you're a tourist, especially if there's other stuff going on IN Toronto, you might want to give it a miss, but for locals it's a must-visit locale.

I often think that big cities can be remarkably similar to each other and when you have seen one, you have seem them all...you need to search to find a really unique experience amongst all the churches, museums, etc. So I always recommend to friends visiting the city (in the summer) to go to the Islands! the Islands are a great place to go for the day to avoid the heat in the summer; there is a lovely hidden walk with great views along the lake side from Wards Island to Centre Island that is long but fairly easy or you can take your bike. You can also swim in several places, rent bikes, including quads,...

My wife and went to the Island for the day - the scenery is great, we rented 2 bikes and toured the island. You get to see Toronto's skyline from a great angle. Highly suggested for anyone who wants to go and enjoy a couple of hours of quiet and relaxation

A refreshing walk in the clean air after a ferry ride with scenic views of the city of Toronto,we had a picture-perfect day to enjoy this experience.Even more rewarding was to witness the joy our 4-year old grandson showed participating in the variety of carnival rides he eagerly took.Plentiful snacks were available for purchase at reasonable prices so the whole...
Great spot to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. You feel like you're in a small little island town! Easy to get to and lots to explore. Great way to spend a day or kust an afternoon!

The islands are one of my favourite places in Toronto. A great way to spend an afternoon. Easy to get to. Take food and refreshments because buying stuff there is ridiculously priced. Plan a day out like you would do a picnic. On a day with good weather, it really is a great day out away from the hustle and...

Its a wonderful place to experience the fall season as all the trees starts to change color as leaves are ready to fall which gives a heavenly view. you can watch the CN Tower and full city from the island and get to see mesmerizing sunset.
Very noce destination with kids. had rented a quadricycle. took the ferry to get on site - I definitively recommend the destination if you travel with kids

Definitely worth a trip. The ferry isn't expensive at all (they even have a student discount, which isn't a natural thing in canada). The view of the toronto skyline is great and the islands themselves are a beautiful piece of nature close to the city.

Old facilities makes the visit not as pleasant as it could be. The main attraction is the Toronto skyview which is beautiful and you cannot observe the city like that from any other point in there.Parks and recreation zones are wide and there are always plays to find for a good company and barbecue.

We have recently re-discovered Toronto Island through the visits of overseas friends to Toronto. I've been to Toronto Island numerous times. I loved it as a kid - going across on the ferry was always lots of fun and I looked forward to all the time. It is one of the most scenic and beautiful island I have ever visited. So close to a metropolitan city like Toronto. It has everything for every one. Rent a cycle. Go on beach. Walk, roller blade , bbq , jog, children water fountain Park, Toronto skyline, Infact it is a must view after sunset. You need to go there...

This is a city park. It requires a $7.50 round trip ferry to get there. But in this park, there is great hiking, secluded spots, beaches, a boardwalk, a fishing pier, a historic lighthouse, an artists' colony, a yacht club, a seasonal amusement park, and great views of Downtown Toronto. This is a park well worth exploring.
Always a nice place to go for a hike, have a picnic, or just sit and read a book. I've been here many times and the view is always breathtaking and wonderful.
This is a great place to take your little ones. they love the rides and the treats. we spend the entire day there relaxing. going over to the Island on the ferry is always a big hit too.

If picnic is in your mind, this place is right for you. It has a huge park that the field is covered with trees that give you the shade from the sun. If sun is in your plan don't worry you'll get it too. You just have to bring your own food.
Have been there couple of times with my friends. Always had a relaxing and chilling time there. One of the best view for Toronto's Skyline and Sunset.. !!

Only one ferry running in November so we got that one, great views of the city from the boat. Went for a lovely walk around the island along the water and back in along the road as well. There is a hedge maze and other things to see. This place is well worth a visit and would be even better...
We hired bikes and took them across on the ferry. It was a beautiful ride with amazing views of the city. The park was more or less empty but this added to the experience. Highly recommended.

A quick cheap ferry ride will get you to Toronto island and there is so much to do it will keep you busy all day a really great place - the weather is a key factor here so wait for a sunny day to get the best out of it
Biking, sitting on the beach, picnic, view of city, kayak rental, ice cream, nature... much nicer than sitting in traffic to go 3-4 hours to a cottage

Take the inexpensive, short ferry ride to the Toronto Island Park, you won't regret it! A relaxing area to get away from the busy city. It is definitely a good place, however, the time I went there is not the best. The ferry in Nov. only goes to the east-most island, which means you should walk round those islands. This is a great outing for everyone, young and old. There is something for everyone. Lovely walks, plenty of resting spots., beaches, boats to view and of course, the Rides, the farm and mini golf. Best of all is the ferry ride and the wonderful views back towards Toronto's skyline. You can soend as much or as little as you...

Located a short ferry ride away from downtown Toronto, (the ferry ride is worth the trip alone...book tickets in advance) the island park is very special. There is a kids park with rides, petting zoo, restaurants and quiet spots to watch swans, boats,etc. Great place to go whether living here or visiting.

A dreamlike place to go far from the crowd and the concrete - or rather, from the glass!It can be very chilly in the winter, but it's worth it.I have never been there in the Summer, it must be very exciting, but I really like Autumn and Winter there.
Was there celebrating my daughter's 10-th birthday. My kids loved it but also did we. Went on fun rides and a picnic.
Great trip, however it requires a ferry to get over there. But once there, there is lots to do and see: beaches, bike rentals, water sports, walking!

Visited the Toronto Islands in Oct and had an amazing experience. The complete island was in the beautiful fall colors and looked awesome. We also got a great view of the Toronto skyline from the island.

I personally love going over to the Toronto Islands whenever I can, but only in summer. Never be over in winter. It is an easy and amazing escape from the city and the ferry ride over is also part of the experience. I would recommend taking not only the centre island ferry, but also the wards island ferry also. You don't have to leave Toronto ! Toronto Islands is a great escape a short ferry ride over which is the start of the day's adventure then plenty to do once your there with cycling if you don't want to bring your bike they rent them and swimming area's campfire area's for families or groups ,kids and youth amusement park...

Great place just a 5 minute - ok maybe 10 minute - ferry ride from downtown to escape the heat and bustle of the city. Great for picnics, cycling, walking, BarBQs. There is a farm and an amusement park as well. Wonderful for the whole family

Great family fun. The ferry ride - about 10 minutes - starts the day off right with beautiful views of the Toronto skyline. Great place to visit in the summer to hit the beach. Avoid swimming in the water even if they tell you the ecoli levels are low. It's not very safe. It's very polluted.

I love the island, however it requires a ferry (not incredibly cheap) to get over there.But once there, there is lots to do and see: beaches, bike rentals, water sports, walking paths, restaurants/snack bars. Great way to spend a summer day! It is also dog friendly.

We took a trip over to Toronto Island to enjoy a bit of peace and views of the city. There is a boat that runs regularly but to be honest if you're short of time I would recommend a water taxi. It's a bit more expensive but you get there in less that 10 mins. The Island is great for...

Its nice to get on a ferry and see Toronto laying down at your back, and go to see the nature. This is a place that can bring you a contrast with the hectic metropole and it's nice when you want to see the water area. Check the ferry-times to come back. Spend an hour at the island.

I spent a glorious August day exploring the island with my partner. It is a wonderful, relaxing space with plenty to do - from promenades and parks to beaches and even a maze. We had a lovely day and would definitely reccomend a visit. It can be accessed by city operated ferries or, for a fee, you can get faster...

We visited Toronto Island in June 2015. It's wonderful day to avoid all Toronto traffic and enjoy a peaceful day on the island. We rent bicycles and ride around the park to experience the clean/fresh air in the middle of largest City in Canada. The beach is beautiful. It's my first time to sunbathe on Lake Beach.

Beautiful place with good views to the city. Rent a bike if you would like to see it all, it may seem small but it's quite big specially if you would like to stop and enjoy the places.There are catering services such as bars and restaurants.

For just the measly price of TTC ferry transfer from Union station's streetcar link, you can enjoy Toronto Island in the fall (to see fall colours) or especially in the summer--when the children can roam in the fair ground. After a few busy days in Toronto we were taken by a friend over to Toronto Island. The park was closed but it was wonderful to be able to walk along the lanes and back along the water stopping for lunch in a delightful restaurant. The small hamlet was so pretty and colourful with all the beautiful trees.

good place for picnic with family of relax,good boat ride to island and can have great view of the city
This is a great way to spend a sunny afternoon. So much fun. It's mostly a lot of walking but it's just beautiful. Strongly recommend the bikes!
You can take the kids to the amusement park, sunbath in the nude on the western beach, or stroll the leafy walks of the island homes. You really wouldn't believe that you're in Canada's largest city.

love the view and enjoyed the time at Toronto island. Great place to take your kids!!!!!!!!I am sure they will love it

This a must go to place for visitors of our city. I always recommend this to friends who's got relatives visiting. It hit me as a pleasant surprise when I first went there. Nothing that you would expect given the allures of Toronto. The ferry ride is a bonus.

If you are out for a nice day and want to see the City Sky Line, this is a great place to do this! In season there are pretty gardens, swan boats you can rent, walking trails, and just a beautiful park where you can hang out and people watch. Worth a look see!

Spring, Summer or Fall, you will not be disappointed. Rent a bike on the Island, cycle along the beach boardwalk and through the unique artistic residential area. Went twice once in summer and other time in spring, both enjoyable, make sure to plan a picnic as first time we went kinda unprepared, but still is a lovely place to walk and just get away from the city
We were there after a conference my wife was presenting at. Not much was open, it was pretty though and if you just want a long walk with pretty sights, it's pretty good.

It cannot be explained. It's an island oasis, with some of the best beaches, parks, kids activities etc in the city. We crossed to Ward Island which is the only crossing available from October. A beautiful walk across the island with lots of areas to explore from woodlands to beaches. It gives a gives a fantastic view of the Toronto skyline
Good way of escaping the hustle of the city. Quiet beaches, traffic free walks and good views. Well worth a visit.

This was a quick 15 minute ride to get out of the city. This time of the year only the ferry to Wards Island is available. Immediately take a left once you get off and you will find yourself on a beach. I attached a picture that I took from that very location.You can also head right on the...

In summer or spring, if you cannot get away from the city, at least you can get away from the noise and madness and find a quiet spot here. We caught the ferry to Ward's Island and did the islands walk round to Hanlan's Point for the return ferry. Just the best park in Toronto. Lots of open spaces for kids to run and enjoy fresh air. Views of the city are good. The ferry ride over is always exiting for the kids.

We visited the islands for a whole day and it was amazing to get pictures of Toronto skyline from the distance. We walked around the whole island and took so many photos. It was quiet and relaxing and a complete change to the mainland. One of our most memorable days.
this has become my number one place to fully relax and appreciate fish. great times here, cant wait to pop in again at the weekend

We visited the island on a lovely sunny autumn day, the ferry crossing was fun & cheap. It gave us a great photo opportunity to capture the Toronto landscape from across the water. I've lived in Toronto for over 40 years and I would recommend a visit to Toronto Island Park as THE highlight of the city. Unusual living area, bohemian. Nice walks and good restaurant for lunch or snacks. Good to visit but probably not to live there, anyway that's not possible.

The view of Toronto is fantastic from the island. The area is really beautiful and good for cycling. but there is not proper restaurant there

Whether you have kids or you're a couple or just want a getaway in the city, this is the place to go! It's always relaxing and fun for the little ones. It's always a hit with me in the summer.

This park is really an amazing place especially in summer time. A ship take you to the island within 15 minutes. Green sites. The boat ride to the island is the most exciting. There is a little farm on the island and a short walk to the beach which isn't worth seeing at all. Lots of rubbish around.

It's so beautiful place to walk, ride bicycle and just spend time. It's very organized and the people like to do picnics. You have a god view of Toronto

A lovely place to relax and to take great walks in with great views of the city of Toronto. The island is a great place to take your children to.

The park offers beautiful views of the Toronto skyline, an amusement park (Centreville), picnic area, walking trails and other options. Taking the ferry across is a highlight as you get a nice look at the downtown core. Recommended when visiting Toronto during fair weather!

This is my favourite spot in Toronto. I can come here 10 times a summer and still have fun. A fresh spot to stroll on. It was by surprise that we got here and took the ferry ride. The lighthouse adds a bit of pleasant eerieness to the experience.

Spent the afternoon here in October 2015. Weather was OK, not hot but didnt rain. Ferry over was less than $5 and they were every 30 minutes or so. This was the most memorable Toronto thing for our family. A watertaxi ride to the island, a walk in the park full of kids activities, a little petting zoo, a beer on a terrace with the best city view and view of the airplanes flying low before landing on the island airport, a boat ride back to the city.

Okay it cost around $7 dollars to across to Toronto island it great idea for the summer but i came mid autumn still okay.i was amazed to see a beachYou could hire a bike or just walkPlenty of place to drink and eat Toronto island is also good for concerts during the summer

great views with lots of attractions, the ferry across to the island was reasonable and covered the fare both to and from.

Definitely a not-to-be-missed day outing on a nice day. Skip it if the weather is bad, but on good days, there's great beaches, bikes to rent and a cool carless -- and magical -- neighbourhood to stroll through. Centreville is great for kids.

We spent one day, strolling, biking, sight-seeing and basically just relaxing on this beautiful park. The kids love the chance to play on the sand under the sun. It was a lovely outing.
Such a great time, if you can rent a cycle and adventure around, amazing for children as they have a fair ground there, very cheap for the ferry over there

A beautiful place, we hired bikes and went exploring then walked some of the island! Plenty of things to see, lovely places to eat an unmissable serene experience just minutes away from the busy city centre! Take the ferry for around $7 each return!!!

The Toronto Park Island provide a great break during summer days. We traveled with the kids and all of us ended up having a fun day out. For me one of the highlights is the ferry ride to and from the island which provides some spectacular views of the city.

We loved this place, the sun was shining and the Toronto air show was on also so could watch that also!This is a great place to explore on bikes and foot! Also there's a great little pub on the south west of centre island that's great for food!!
I took my wife for a drive on Sunday and somehow ended up there :)It is a nice quite place to relax, have a picnic and enjoy afternoon tea and home baked cookies :)

Nice day for the weather under 75 F. Place is kept clean. Meals and drinks can be expensive. Cost us all day 120. for 4 a little pricey. It is a beautiful and peaceful place to be in the summer. Great beach, fountains, trails, well kept farm animals zoo, kiddie rides.
Pretty place to visit for the day with your family. Close to downtown Toronto ferry. Lovely walks throughout

Toronto Island is a beautiful, peaceful place to get away from the bustle of the city. A quick ferry ride to the island, you can picnic or eat at one of the restaurants on the island. Take a leisurely stroll across the island or rent a bicycle for a quicker tour. The island is good for solo, couple and family...
We don't have too much time to spend. Cruising to and from island was great especially city views at night is spectacular. Must see if you are in Toronto.

Good experience. Be prepared to spend a whole day there. You can always pack your own lunch and drinks to save some money if you have a large group. I'm not sure with bikes if you can bring them with you. Check with their website.
My wife and I agree that taking our bicycles to the island was a very good decision. It seems as though this place offers something for everyone, and we look forward to returning there someday!
A place TO BE. Ferry ride to your destination. Rent a bicycle with a surrey on top. Visit THE RECTORY for fabulous fare.
Came off a boat tour just for a walk. Had the most lovely time at faraway farm. The farmer there was so nice to us. It was a great place to spend a summer day.

We took the ferry out in the morning and spent the day riding bikes and exploring the island. It might have been due to the holiday weekend but the ferry line was very long and we were glad we had purchased our tickets online and avoided the lines. Fun with the kids and keeps them distracted a bit to relax and enjoy the scenery definitely coming back!
One can spend an entire day on the island, walking, playing, lazing around. The view of downtown from the island is spectacular!

We didn't expect much when we initially decided to visit but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the island park.We first had some lunch from a pizzeria near to where the ferries drop you off. Really nice place to visit with kids . Nice when the weather is nice . Must to see when in toronto. Get the tickets s on line though
We visited this place and it was way worth the ferry ticket we paid. Large greenery with crisp air wakes up tired travellers and the day just got better.

Here you will find a little peace and quite away from the hussle and bustle of the city and all fro $ 7 return. Don't be put off by the crowds on the numerous ferries, there's plenty for room .Lovely beaches , nice walks , great views and as I said a little peace and quite .Try the...
Take the ferry across to the island and escape the city. Great to bring a picnic lunch, take your bikes over and ride from one end of the island to the other.
So close and far away from city noise. One can escape the city by jumping on a short ferry ride and enjoying island with public beach and interesting walk paths. Great view of the city.
Just loved the islands an excellent escape from the city, stunning views and beach. Take the ferry or water taxi.. We caught the air show too!

I have lived in the Toronto area my whole life and a visit to the Toronto Islands is my favourite. You need to start from the Ferry. If you are on foot go to the Center island. The short trip n the ferry gives a great view of the Toronto skyline. Once on the island it's nice to take a wander and shelter from the sun under the trees. Limited food and drink options, but if you're just staying a couple of hours it's fine.

We love the Toronto Island Park. If you have a family with small kids, you will love Centerville. It is an amusement park with plenty of rides. This is a wonderful surprise. Not many people know about the island unfortunately. It's definitely something for everyone. There's beaches, rides and balloons for the kids, and occasional concerts. Be sure to take a tour guide cruise. Is so entertaining.

This was a surprise. We got the ferry over to the centre island and after a 15 minute trip we went for a walk over to the beach. There are bikes for rent and a couple of restaurants to have some food or drinks. When we left it was misty but after a couple of hours of sun this had...
We were visiting Toronto for the first time. We loved the island. There is south to do and see there. Great for younger kids as well as the adults to be away fro a busy city life.

If its a lovely day its a great place to spend a few hours relaxing away from the city. The views of Toronto sky line are amazing. The ferry is quick and cheap. We went there with my friend just to escape Toronto downtown. It was really nice, pleasant day. Started at Ward Island a got back from Central. Nice place for families as well :) The cityview is just amazing. I reccomend!

A short ferry ride from downtown Toronto, this park is beautiful: huge lawns (meticulously kept), long beaches, many kids playgrounds, large restrooms, and everything is kept clean and tidy. The Toronto island has really something for everyone. My wife and I spent an afternoon on Toronto Island Park to kill a few hours, and we were greatly surprised by how much there was to do on the island. We could have easily spent all day there and still had more to do. There are plenty of activities for families.

On our recent vacation to Toronto we discovered Toronto Islands, it was a quick boat ride to the island that was a hidden gem of surprises. They have wonderful gardens, a theme park for families and great little places to eat while taking in the views of the Toronto Skyline.
Well worth a trip to the islands. We travelled on a rainy day which did spoil the experience a little.

I travelled here with my wife and kids on a weekday afternoon. This is set of low islands near the downtown but accessible by a short ferry ride. Get the ferry before 10.30 and you should have no trouble or wait to get on. Attractions open between 10.30 - 11.00 and by 11.30 people are flooding in. It's a nice park so you don't have to just do the children's attractions. You'll get a great view of the CN Tower from the ferry.

A beautiful place to relax, so close to Toronto. Lovely park areas and some were very secluded. We visited here on a tour of the Harbour and islands and found it to be a lovely charming and peaceful place with some great views of the city skyline

Really enjoyed visiting the island, especially the incredible view of Toronto. The beaches on the other side are great too, it's amazing to think the quiet beaches are so close to a busy city. Amazing excursion from the mainland - definitely worth the trip. I took the ferry to Central Island then walked round to the East and came back from Ward Island. The ferry did, however, take us back via another island instead of going straight to the city terminal.
A pleasant enough way to while away a couple of hours, but nothing dramatic or memorable. More of a place to relax rather than a "must see" location.

Toronto islands are well worth a visit and the ferry fare is reasonable. Fantastic views of the Toronto Skyline. This is great place for a family outing. We visited the Toronto island with my 4 year old daughter and the adults and her had an equally good time. Heading out here is a great way to get out of the city for a little bit (while still getting a beautiful view of the city). Although I would have to recommend going on a weekday as it can get pretty congested on the weeekends.

The jewel of Toronto. A place I've been going to for decades. No long drive, stuck in traffic. The island has everything. A nice beach for the kids. A pier that with a view into the horizon. Ambiance befitting of a true getaway. I would recommend a whole day just at the islands, you can catch a ferry from Queen's Quay, rent a bike, and just cruise.

Took the ferry, went to the park, rented bikes and enjoyed a lot! You won't feel like you are in a city anymore, it feels like vacation (beaches, bars, amusement park..)! Great way to experience tge "weekend life" in Toronto.
This is an absolute must do on a sunny day. Renting bikes is cheap and the best way to explore. Come prepared for spending time at an urban beach.

Great space to walk, ride a push bike, picnic. You would never know you are in a big city. A real oasis.

first day in Toronto and walking along the lovely waterfront of Lake Ontario we noticed queues for a ferry and decided to find out more. This park was lovely. Very scenic and spacious. Not to far from the downtown area and we went at just the right time when it was beginning to warm up.

Took one of the boat cruises around the island first then a water taxie to War Island to have lunch and spend the day.
Nice and relaxing, beautiful environment to unwind in. You can bring food and barbecue on the island in nice private areas.

If you have small children good luck. This place gets busy around centerville and all the rides. If your a couple enjoy walking past centerville and the screaming and go rent a bike to tour the island. Well worth the packed ferry ride.
Kids loved it! The ferry ride itself was great and the amusement park was lovely - great for younger kids especially. So many trees it's impossible to believe that you're in Toronto!
Clean park with well-maintained and clearly marked paths. The beach is also well-maintained and is a nice option for people who can't make it to the ocean shore.

Being on a Sunday in Toronto the lines for the ferry are extreme. In the evening there are no lines and you have a great sunset view over the city. Walk from one jetty to another.

Great time, we had teenagers down to a five year old, party of 8, lots to do no one got bored! A break from the City

For first timers in Toronto, and traveling with a small dog, we were looking for something to do that was accessible to our dog and this was a beautiful park. Lots to see. Great area to spend the day with friends and Family away from all the hussle and bustle of the big city. Love the old beach homes and walking paths

Such a wonderful place. Clean, picturesque, spacious. A visit here is a must. The views from the ferry across of the city skyline are just phanomenal.
Great Park, beach area. Can rent bikes for 1,2, or 4. (Cash only). Very relaxing, nice view of city on boat over there. Well worth it for a relaxing enjoyable day.

A welcome distraction from the hustle and bustle of Toronto on a hot and humid day. Great city views and good walks across the island. A great trip that makes you feel like you really left the city. Fun for kids and the whole family. There are many things to see and do that will keep everyone entertained for the day!
A lovely place to go on a warm summer day. Lots of activities to choose from -- biking, boating, beaching, walking, playing with kids....you get the point. Highly recommended!

A short (and not expensive) ferry ride away, this was a beautiful place to while away a couple of hours. Just the ticket for a hot summer day with a bit of exercise thrown in. Excellent views of downtown on the ferry, best iced coffee we've had in a while at the fast food next to the bike hire. Relaxed crowds.
