My friend and I took an early morning ferry out to the island to do our daily run. We loved the boat ride views to and from the island, as well as the scenery on the island. Well worth a visit if in Toronto.

I was looking to spend a quiet afternoon at the park and I found this park where I can be by myself. It was serene and allowed me to have me time.
A great place to picnic with the family, hang out at the beach, go for a bike ride, enjoy a children's amusement park and mini farm. The ferry ride over gives you an amazing view of Toronto.
We spent a few hours walking around the islands and loved every minute. It's such a tranquil place with great views of Toronto and plenty of things to do.

Excellent day trip, would highly recommend doing a walking tour around the islands, as most seem to just visit the attractions on Center Island. We took the ferry to Ward Island and walked the full circuit from there to Henlan Point. Lovely views, and lots of peace and quiet.

A perfect retreat when you are in Toronto, with beautiful sand and plenty of activities - both natural and organised. It's easily accessible from the city and an excellent way to spend time when you don't have long enough to leave the city.

After a brief trip by ferry, Toronto Island park offers a nice break from the city. Lots of green and space to just lie in the grass and relax, or to walk to the pier and look out over Lake Ontario. And on the way back you can admire Toronto's skyline.

We got the ferry to the island it costs about 7 dollars per person. Return a water taxi will cost you 10 dollars per person but unity can get a ferry back and don't payIt was really peaceful considering the crowds that got into the boat on a SaturdayWould highly recommend it

The gem of the city park system. Take a bike and use wards ferry then go the back along the boardwalk. You will swear you are in the country. Stop at the resto for lunch half way then ride to Hanlin island to take ferry home. DO NOT GO SUNDAY every family with kids tring to go to islands and...

Parking was $25 for the day in a nearby lot. Not bad considering the location, about a 5 minute walk to the ferry. We went on a Friday. The lineup for the ferry tickets was about 10 minutes. There was a ferry right there, no waiting. The ferry ride was only a few minutes. We chose the Ward's Island ferry,...

If you are visiting Toronto in the summertime, you must take time to go to the islands. I recommend taking the ferry to Ward's Island and walking to Hanlan's Point (avoiding Centre Island). If you had limited time or didn't want to walk, I recommend just visiting Ward's Island. Enjoy.

First of all the ferry ride was awesome. We got great views of Toronto. We got there and straightaway went for the kids amusement park. We bought a pass for the kids (ages 3, 4, and 7). They had a blast on most of the rides. It was a weekday so it made it possible for them to go on...

Took a quick ferry across the river for less than $8 CAD. Great cityview of the downtown Toronto. The island is beautifully landscaped and nicely layed out. We walked to the beach, lighthouse and went through the carnival.

Travel over on the ferry, very cheap for a return ticket, under eight dollars which is a bargain. Lots to see and do for all ages, fun fair, boating, Pirates places to eat and drink and all fairly reasonably priced. It really is a must place to visit when Toronto !

This is a great gem to bring kids to. We had no idea there was so much to do on this island and a great boat ride from downtown Toronto. We had a great day, you could spend the whole day on this island and not be bored.
we rented the 4person vehicle and rode over to wards Island - there is an AMAZING unobstructed view of the city there next to the Wards Isl. Ferry dock
What an amazing way to spend a sunny Friday. So much to discover. We especially love the more laid back and secluded ward island. Be sure to bring hour bikes so you can explore all the hidden areas!

Loved the boardwalk walking along the lakefront. Lots of park benches to take little breaks. Good car-free place to take childen for a day out and do simple but fun activities like frisbee golf, canoe/kayak or even taking a stroll.

The ferry ride and view of city skyline was nice, but the park is mainly aimed at families with children and the beach wasn't great. I wouldn't put it on your must do list in Toronto but if you wanted to escape the city it's a pleasant way to spend an afternoon.

Take the Ferry across from Toronto on Lake Ontario to the Island. Here you can walk, run, bike, picnic or just spread a blanket and relax in the fresh 'country' air. There is something for everyone. Watch the sailboats unfurl their sails and head out in to the wind... and listen to the birds chirp in the abundant foliage. This...
When you want to get out of the city, this is the perfect retreat. I liked it because I could bring a book, ride my bike and enjoy nature.

Take the ferry over to ward island, walk the length of the island stopping and wandering as you choose, the take ferry back from hanlans point. Costs around $7 each. You can take a picnic or use the lovely little cafe there. I think there is a restaurant also though not always open.

Our host + the internet generally said this was a not-to-be-missed visit. Not sure it's in my top 10 for Toronto. I think it's best for families with children under 10. For older kids it's a bit tame. We rented a quadricycle (fun but exhausting!), brought a picnic lunch, waded at Manitou Beach & stopped by the lighthouse. We departed...

From the Ferry ride over to the beach, everything at the Island was great. Chelsea beach was great for the family and clean. The park was very clean, so much to do. The bicycle rental rides are a must. Be prepared to pay too much for any food or drinks.
Thought the island park was excellent. Well set up for families and young people. Very well organised. We went on a beautiful sunny day, so were in for a real treat.

If you want a change of scenery from the big city, than the Toronto Islands can just be that place. Though be prepared for a crowd on those hot sticky summer days, especially during the weekend. A great place to take the kids, since there is Centreville, bike rental, swimming in the lake, boating, frisbee golf or just have a...
the staff were very accommodating with our senior group. we enjoyed the tour around the island in the golf cart

Its an exelent choice to do in Summer, the Toronto Island is big and it has many atractions on it, you can rent a bicycle or rent a boat, you can go to the beaches, there is an optional clothing beach if you want, perfect if you go with your friends or family.

Nice gateway from Toronto. Take a ferry boat and spend a full day just exploring the park and reading books etc. very nice place. Perfect for biking, walking and enjoying the nature so close from city.
Excellent place to see the city of Toronto, and to have a family picnic. The park has beautiful view of nature, the boats and airplanes, and the city of Toronto.

We went on a Friday which was clutch. Saw the line on Saturday morning, not a good day to go.Took a water taxi by Lake Shore Blvd and York. Best way to go. 10 bucks flat per person. Ride is quick and peaceful. Got dropped off close to the nude beach. Wasn't interested. Didn't know what to expect, reminded me...

So if you have kiddies or are in a big group, Centre Island is ideal as you can visit "Centreville" and maybe even book an event specific picnic area if you are a group of any size (This needs to be done in advance and there is probably a fee)If you are a hiking sort with kids in stroller...

The number of times Being in toronto, and I never spent a day at Toronto Island, A beautiful place that is so easy to get to, We rented bikes, very easy to do, and easy to get around, perhaps bring a lock if you wish to spend some time walking the beach. easy to spend a day here, we did...

I have gone to the Island every Summer with my children since 1984. My parents came as well. We loved the ferry ride to and from the Island; the gardens are beautiful; there are nice places to eat; the amusement park is fun for the kids and swimming areas are available. As the children got older, we rented bikes and...
Located a stones throw away from the city center, this place is a quiet oasis for couples, families, and those who want to escape from the noise of downtown

We have been here many times over the years. The ferry over is just beautiful with nice city views. The park itself is perfect for young families and very well maintained as with all parks in Ontario.

We went to the island on the ferry on a Monday morning, so it wasn't crowded, which was excellent. The island is beautiful!! Definitely worth a visit. Perfect for biking, walking and enjoying the Toronto skyline and the fantastic vistas of Lake Ontario.

The Toronto Island is a great place to visit. First you have the ferry ride which takes you to any part of the island and you can walk to Centre island which has a beautiful park and rides which are age appropriate and lots of fun for younger children. You can also have fun at the beach which is very...

Wonderful park located in the heart of Toronto. Beaches, green spaces, bike paths, pinic areas...name it, and there we go. Great place for the whole family. If you want to relax or get some exercise done, that's one of the best places to go in Toronto.

This is a beautiful place to escape the pressures of the city--great for everyone who likes nature and an opportunity to escape the pavement and cars, good for families--Centreville has rides and amusements that are laid back (there is a fee for this). One can rent bikes and boats (explore the lagoons). The beaches are fabulous.The ferry is cheap...

Hanlan's Point is a lega nude beach, no better way to relax and get that all over tan. Nice people, friendly and uninhibited. With the ferry the view is awesome. You can rent lounge chairs and there is a beer and wine stall close at hand. Great day to spend an adult time. For families there is centerville for fun...

My family and I had a wonderful day on Toronto Island. The ferry over was very quick and on time. Once on the island we walked around a bit and ended up renting bicycles. If your children are younger you can rent quadricycles where the 4 people can ride together. We took a tour of most of the island. You...

I went with my boyfriend in July. He had never been before and had no idea what to expect. It's a beautiful, picturesque park, with walking trails and beaches.I recommend renting one of the tandem bikes if you want to see the whole island and are limited for time, keep in mind that the bikes can't go on all...

Just off shore from downtown Toronto are a group of spectacular little Islands that I often describe as Toronto's Central Park - except it's not in the middle of the city. To get there you can go to The Jack Layton Terminal at Queen's Quay and take a Ferry to one of Islands. There's so much there - a children's...
great to visit when the weather is nice. Kids enjoyed centreville, the amusement park and petting zoo - and especially the ferry ride
Awesome view of the Toronto City skyline in the day and especially in the night~!Perfect place for relaxing and just enjoying the weather.Many mosquitoes when the weather is warm though.

Great way to spend the day. Ferry ride over is very inexpensive and the ferry are fairly frequentThe views coming across of the Toronto skyline are magnificent. The views continue on as you make you way around the islands.We opted to walk around the island however if you do not want to walk bicycles are available for rent....

We went to Centreville. Great place for kids Rides were great, food wasn't to expensive. I recommend getting everyone unlimited rides bracelets. Family of 4 is $120. We only got our 2 kids the bracelets and 25 tickets for the adults and we felt that we were on the sideline to much. Some rides like the Bumber boats would be...

Although we visited on Saturday of a busy holiday weekend, we beat the crowds by arriving into Hanlan - NOT Central - and walking to Central. If you already have a bike, or are on foot, as we were, this is the absolute best bet.We returned via Central which had people but was not nearly as crowded upon returning....

The Toronto Island can give you two completely experiences. A peaceful nature and cottage like getaway or, if you choose, a bustling park for city-dwellers with a kids' amusement park - Centre Island. Often referred to as 3 separate islands it is in fact just one island although each of the 3 parts are very different in character. Hanlan's Point,...

Nice place for a family visit. the fun starts from the ferry ride. than there are a lot of options at the island itself. to ride the bike, to walk or to enjoy the beach. I woulf recommend it to everyone.

The island was a great getaway for my wife and I for the day. Parking and ferry costs were a bit much to make this a multi-day affair ($15- $20 a piece). Maybe locals who live within the city limits get a discount? Still, the place was great. Peaceful with many places to sit (benches and tables), sites to see...
Take a ferry to the Islands, walk or bike the boardwalks. Get some sun on the beach. Forget you're in the city until you turn around and take in the great view of the skyline!

Caught the ferry over to the islands which cost about 7dollars return ,took some lovely photos with the city of Toronto in the background.A nice stroll along the wooden board walk which hugged the coast of Lake Ontario.The central Island was where we hired bikes for an hour to explore further in land where you could visit a mini zoo...

Brilliant way to spend a day at both a beach, nature walk and amusement park ( for kids ). From one point to another about a 2 hour walk with restaurants and little shacks to get your fill. Beaches are very clean and has a great patio to get yourself a beer, highly recommended.

I was blessed with lovely weather when I took a trip to the Toronto Islands. I didn't know exactly what to expect but I found a really magical spot, absolutely worth a visit. The ferry ride gives a nice perspective on the Toronto skyline and the Islands have many different elements to enjoy. I walked from one end to the...

You can take the ferry from Down Town, lakeshore to the island, the ride is for $C 7.5 both ways, you dont need to keep the ticket for the way back..the ferry takes around 10 mins to reach. The island is divided into parks and separate beaches, greenery everywhere and you can enjoy the skyline of Toronto.

I travelled over on the ferry the views looking back at City of Toronto were those iconic views you see in books,mags etcThe parkland is not frequented by travellers as a high priorityIt's a must do!! an oasis of nature beauty and stunning views of surrounding areas

We took a tour boat and stopped for lunch and a walk around the park, beautiful spot and my two boys 9 and 6 loved the fairground. It is not spectacular but they really enjoyed it, older kids may find it dull! But other than the cb tour you could believe you were miles from the city!

Beautiful park accessible from a short ferry ride. A nice place to go for a long walk. Gardens, fountains, and a real maze of hedges. As in, good luck getting out.A few activities but geared to little kids. Bring food if you'll get hungry, not much there but very sad pizza, dirty water dogs and the like. Bike rentals...

just take the ferry for 15-20 minutes and you'll be on this beautiful small island. The view from Ontario lake is worth it indeed. The view from the island is also great. Lots of activities on the island, always make sure you check calendar of event before you plan your visit.

Trip Advisor reviewers are absolutely right. This is a great oasis in the middle of a bustling and busy city, and admission is free, if you do not count the fare for the ferry. The ferry ride itself is a mini-attraction with stunning views of the Toronto skyline.Once you reach the Island, there are multiple options for several activities...

It was wonderful to "get away" from the city. We took the convenient ferry over (there was a line, so you may want to plan ahead). We rented bikes for an hour and enjoyed the beach. It has many beautiful views of the city and plenty of views that seem like you're not even in the same country.
Lots of places to go and relax, look at the lake and visit the animal farm. Many paths to walk on and enjoy something to eat in the restaurant!

We had a great time exploring the park. The ferry ride over is nice. Centre Island has the feel of an amusement park. We rented bikes and rode around the whole island. The bike rental was a little pricey and cash only, but we were glad to do it. Definitely a fun day though and worth taking some time to...

I had a really lovely full day on the island exploring. All the different plants, the old houses and dropping into various restaurants to try a bit of everything (it was all yummy). Stopping on a bench to admire the views of Toronto skyline, watch the wildlife and chat with good company.People actually live there! I saw a lot...

Toronto Island Park is such a place where you can spend the whole day. It is like a picnic spot where you will get everything.You can see the amazing Toronto sky line from the ferry. After reaching there you can find some rides for the kids. You can roam around the whole island, can have beer or any other...

It was not a bad experience, just be sure to pick a nice, clear, warm day. Bring bug spray and also eat before you go because the food options are very limited. The beach front is nice and there are nice views of the toronto skyline.

Take the ferry over. This is a great park for a summer getaway day - bring your bike and bathing suit. You can bike around the whole island, grab a coffee or some lunch, cool off at the beach. Or in the winter, bring your x-country skiis (if there's snow) it's great for winter too.

I found a Groupon for the ferry ride to the island. A definite highlight of the trip. We rented bikes and rode almost completely around the island. Activities for both children and adults. Nice beaches. Interesting history on the island's past. Beautiful views of the Toronto skyline. A must-do while visiting the city!

The Toronto Islands provide a refreshing escape from downtown with beautiful views of Lake . Attractions include beaches, trails, an amusement park. If you don't have anything else to do go for a visit. It is a good place to go with children. I did enjoy when I went for the fist time when my son was just 1 year...

Don't miss it while in Toronto ! There are walking and biking trails, beaches, tennis courts on the Island. There is also a small old fashioned amusement park for small kids ! And the view of Toronto is awsome. If you want nice pictures of Toronto skyline, it's the place !
loved the petting zoo, walking the beaches and exploring the gardens/ A great little Toronto oasis of greenness/ They invite you to walk on the grass

Got ferry over and enjoyed a short walk around the park. Brilliant view overlooking Toronto skyline. Many activities, mainly suited to children and families, although if I had more time would have liked to hire a bike to see more of island and other activities which were advertised but I did not see. If you have time in Toronto, this...

Toronto centre island is a must visit. What a beautiful way to spend your day. The ferry itself is a fun experience. The skyline view is the best. Good to be there close to sunset. There are lots of activities for kids during summer through fall.
Lovely relaxing place. We took a tour which dropped us off so we could spend a few hours here, We also took the little train ride around the island. Seemed to be lots of activities for kids.
Lot's of amusements for kids, great views for the lake, very good to visit if temps in city beat the upper plank. It's cool and fresh there. Good beach on the eastern side.

This park is amazing, it was the best part of my last trip to Toronto. I went there on May with some friends and rent bikes to go around the whole island. In my opinion that's the best way to visit the entire island.

the ferry ride was short, a little expensive for a whole family but on time the island itself is naturally beautiful but becareful of the goose poop. There are all kinds of rides for all ages especially little kids and family. big enough to hold several company picnics at once but small enough you feel like you and your family...

It's nice for outdoor activities in sunny days. You get there by ferry (the ferry ticket was $7 the last time I went).The park is huge and there are many activities you can do. There is even a nude beach there.

Be sure to take a ferry to see the islands near Toronto. We were in Toronto at the American Psychiatric Association meeting and took some extra time to tour Toronto. The ferry to the islands was completely different from the urban Toronto experience. Peaceful with wildlife so close to a major city.
Easy to access by ferry and a fabulous place to walk around in the winter - no salt or dirty snow! There's an excellent restaurant over there too.

A great getaway from the city and there are many things to do, including renting tandem bicycles to go around the island! Beautiful views of the city skyline and the ferries are convenient (~every 30min).

Toronto Island is probably best known as a family paradise - with Centreville and such, but not being a person with small children I tend to stay away from there. Toronto Island is a fantastic place to take a bike (bring your own or rent on the island - whatever you do don't bring a bike taxi or you'll spend...

After reading some reviews on Toronto Island, my brother and his girlfriend and myself decided to check it out. We are all in our 20's or 30's and we were not sure if the island was still going to be fun (as many of the attractions seem to be geared towards kids).Half the fun itself was the ferry ride...

Lovely place to spend half to full day, Ferry ride is a good way to feel you are leaving the stresses of home and getting away. Walking, lounging ... chatting with friends, family ... many things to do ... walk through park, great areas to take photos, small play/ride area, fun eating, bike rental, quaint church, and relaxing along beach....
Hard to believe we have access to these wonderful islands just a short boat-ride away. They are true treasures for this city! Well done, Toronto!

The park is beautiful and extensive. There is a petting zoo and a lovely rides section for children and adults can find fun there too! The boat ride is scenic and gives a great perspective of the city line. You can rent bikes, run or stroll through the grounds. This is such a great place for family and friends to...

The Toronto Parks Authority runs the Toronto Island Park area. It is a lush garden, with numerous walking and nature trails along the lake shore. The ferry from Toronto stops in one of three ports on the Islands and a walk through any of the numerous trails in the park is a great way to start or end the day....
boat trip around the island then a ferry onto the island. the weather was fantastic and the park very peaceful and relaxing.

There is 3 ferry's to take you to different parts of the island. so many things to do. There is a beach, Petting zoo, Rides more towards the younger kids. best to rent or bring your own bike to get around.. bike rentals do not open until 10 am. Didn't have time to explore the island. On the ferry ride...
loved the cruise like trip.it is like a nice picnic spot.enjoyed the place.disliked the wait for boat ride back
Lots of fund to spend at this park you can spend whole day beautiful view and kids will love the water and fresh air,

A great location to enjoy the skyline of Toronto Downtown. The boat trip from the waterfront underneath the CN tower (still a long walking distance) to the island park are very nice in a way that you can enjoy the changing view of the magnificient skyscrapers behinds you. Lots of great photo opportunities.

A short boat ride away, well worth a visit. We hired bikes when we got there which I recommend, the best way to see all of the island. Great for families or couples, you can take a picnic or go to one of the cafes and bars on the island. There are beaches too, just a very relaxed and pretty...

It was so lovely to nip over to the island and get away from the hustle and bustle of Toronto.A short hop took you back to a complete calm environment. It looked like they were only just getting ready for the season even though it was late June but well worth the ferry ride over.
We hired bikes and rode around the island, it's about 5km long. There are some really good views of the city from a variety of angles. There are some decent places to eat.
A must see when in Toronto. The boat leaves every 15 minutes. It is a nice view of the city. The park is lush with kids activities, great for picnic, walking or relaxing. Very scenic and beautiful.

Toronto Islands provided a great escape, and felt as though we weren't even in Toronto. Being on the water felt excellent, and a great place to take photographs. Although a bit crowded, the scenery and atmosphere made up for that.
Beautiful relaxing nature walk, rentable biking, amusement park for the kids and beach scenery along Lake Ontario, just a short ferry ride from the bustling city.
take the ferry over to Toronto island for a relaxing afternoon on this lovely island, took a stroll along the boardwalk. plenty to do for all

Enjoyable ferry ride over the bay then a lovely day wondering around the island. It's bigger then it looks from the city and includes a small amusement park, restaurants and a small community of eclectic houses.
Awesome park! It's a great place to relax yourself.Biking and picnic are great!Definitely a great park and no cars allowed
Highly recommended is a short ferry ride from Toronto City to this island where there are beaches and an opportunity to rent bicycles and investigate lovely gardens and vintage cafes.

We took ferry over - bikes are a good idea but you can walk it. We went to beach for swimming- clean water and good rock collecting there is food on island with refreshments and public beach with clean facilities- to save money you could bring a cooler with lunch and drinks.
Great views over to the city. Great place to take bikes or picnic, no cars to worry about. You can fish here too, we saw a giant carp being caught.
It was a beautiful location. I was there with a lot of people for an event and didn't have time to explore the entire place but I would love to return and see everything!!
Excellent for a bike ride and a stop for a picnic, especially in summer! (but be prepared for sudden rain!)
The line for the ferry is a bit too controlled, but after that, the gardens are beautiful and spacious. Rent a bike (two or three seater) and enjoy the Island.
After enjoying the hub of the city this is the perfect place to relax,it's like entering another world with magnificent views of the city skyline.So nice we visited twice.

The Toronto island (actually a chain of connected islands) is a great place for exploring. A ten-minute ferry ride takes you and a bike there, although you can also rent bikes on the island. Once there, you will find an amusement area for kids, various food options, a beach for sun and water (including a clothing-optional beach for those so...

Go early in the morning to avoid queues, no BBQ in Wards Island so bring your own or go to Center Island, other than that a fantastic place to visit. Gorgeous view of the city skyline and lovely to walk around.
A few minutes from downtown docks the islands are a place to rest, reflect or just have a great picnic.

It was a neat place, but don't take the shuttle tour. That was worthless. The center island was enjoyable and would be fun with children. The gardens were beautiful. The beaches were nice too. Plenty of washrooms and changing rooms. I read in a couple of travel guides that the residential island, Algonquin, was quaint and worth seeing. Don't make...
Gorgeous place to watch to sunset with the Toronto skyline as your backdrop! My husband and I really enjoyed it! The ferry ride there was really nice too, view was spectacular!!

Well organised boat trip,commentary very informative,views of Toronto spectacular and the boat just meanders slowly around the islands giving you the opportunity to get off if you wish to tour the islands.
Although we were here for a Nike race and Nike took over the island, I can't wait to come back and enjoy this beautiful park another visit!
A great to escape from the city on a short boat ride to an island park which provides a wide variety of choices,. Areas of peace and quiet and areas of activities for families and young people.
Excellent place to visit, with your family or by yourself. Great view of downtown Toronto, excellent to take some photos.

A great place to get away from the hustle of the city. The ferries are a short walk from anywhere and there is plenty to do, from biking, hiking, and swimming to even the clothing optional beeches. Kids can also have fun at the little amusement park

We were traveling with 9 and 15 yr old grandsons. Decided to take the ferry to central island and wanted to eat lunch there. The ferry ride was great because you got wonderful views of the skyline. When we got off we asked a staff person where to eat and he said the marina had better and more affordable food....

This is a beautiful park and a nice relaxing way to spend the day or an afternoon. Bring water or drinks with you as they are very expensive on the Island -- $3 or $4 from the vending machines. Sadly, several water fountains were broken in the park and need to be repaired.One minor complaint is the map at...
Great way to see the city skyline. Ferry trip good value at 7CAD, excellent walks and we walked from Hanlans to Ward to take in the whole island.
The view back to the city is spectacular day and night.you can walk or bike right around the island and there are lovely gardens.

Wonderful way to spend a day in the city but not in the city ! Ferry ride is quite enjoyable and the island is lovely. There are bicycle rentals that make getting around a lot of fun. Lots of areas to eat and bathrooms were clean.

Not my first time to toronto but was the first time to this Island. Amusement park for the kids, nature and a cool ferry ride over but it rained! Hard! If there is an event and rain is in the forecast don't go because you will be stuck for hours in the rain and the ferries will be loaded...I will...

column3: Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
column4: I was there in July 2011 and had an amazing time. This little island was not crowed. Everything is made to make you have a nice time with your kids. I did enjoy the view of the skyline in a very relaxed atmosphere. It was very well maintained, very very very clean. You can buy food and drinks. You can...

I went to Toronto Island park with my wife and two girls 11 and 7 and it was a nice day trip. The attractions were great my kids loved the rides specially the log cabin ride. there are ample places to relax nice beach and nicely done Franklin garden for kids.
From what we could see during the run, it was very pretty. Great views of the city skyline. Awesome views even with a plane taking off. Very clean and well kept

Toronto Island Park truly has something for everyone. An amusement park, an historic lighthouse, charming residential cottages, food stands, wonderful bike and jogging trails, birds galore, and a self-guided tree walk. Considering the size of the park and the huge numbers of visitors, the park is extremely well-maintained. The central access road/path is lined with gorgeous annual and perennial/shrub/tree beds...

Husband and I visited Toronto Island Park on a Tuesday in June. This is a nice big park. Some places with beautifully kept flower beds, water fountains, restaurants, amusement park for kids and beaches. If you live in a big city this must be heaven.
Beautiful park! I suggest you go there especially when travelling with family! Nice day out weather permitting!
We got a water taxi over and enjoyed the walk along the sea wall. The children's area and farm had seen better days and was tired and worn

Easy to get to, via a great ferry, and the crossing is inexpensive and fast.The gardens are beautiful, wonderful beaches and lovely countryside.I particularly liked the Lighthouse, the information plaques are all very good.We had a great day out there.Two small negatives, little choice of somewhere to eat and some of the washrooms are gross.

This was the highlight of our weekend. Spent the whole day on the island walking around. It has the best views of the city. We ran the Toronto Nike race on the island and it was a blast. You can take kids to the small amusement park or petting zoos or spend the day riding bikes around the island. Nice...

column3: Washington, District of Columbia, District of Columbia, United States
column4: Toronto Island Park is a good get away from the city, a good place to capture the city skyline, and is an excellent destination for families. I would recommend taking the ferry to Center Island and then exploring the area surrounding Center Island (you can also walk over to Hanlan's Point and catch the ferry back from there). All in...

We visited just before the 'season' I think, so it was pretty empty (which was a plus) but the bike rentals didn't open until 10:30, so we did wait a round for a while. We were one of only a handful of people on the boat over. We rode around the entire island in about an hour and a half....

This was a nice place to walk through. It took about 4 hours to walk from one end to the other, stopping at centre island for lunch.The amusement park is only suitable for young ones. It can be a very expensive day out. Bikes and pedal cars can be hired.
Will go back for sure to check out the island. But I ran the full length of the island and it was amazing. The ferry ride is a lot faster then you think too.

We have been several time to Toronto Island. Take or rent a bike. The best way to see the island. They have all the attractions in the middle but if you can get a bike you will be able to see all the outlying areas. The cottages are so quaint. nice spots to stop for picnic lunch, Beautiful views of...
What Inreally like about the Island is the wide open spaces to explore and visit. Great beaches, wonderful picnic areas, abundant rides for children, and plenty of space for everyone
Toronto Island is a must!!! If you want to spend a relaxing day, just take the ferry, and step in a magical park. Rent a bike, and just enjoy the slow pace...
If you want to have a nice view of the city and a nice picture you must go in the evening when it is dark. You will get a beautiful view. the parc itself is nice with a animal farm for kids.
Lovely place!!! The view of The City is awesome!!! Relax and peaceful... Worth a visit!!!It's also good for BBQ and picnick
its a heaven in the city! we spent one day here and now I see that it was a fantastic idea.. peace and happiness.....

The Toronto Island is a lovely place to visit. The experience of getting there by the ferry is of itself enjoyable. Watching Toronto's picturesque skyline then enjoying "nature" so close to the city is wonderful.
Lots to do, if you have young kids check out the kids garden , take a picnic, fun fair rides were pricy C$ 1 per token most rides 3 to 6 tokens. Ferry ride across was great.

Great for couples, romantic; families especially with young children; and friends. Frisbee golf course, biking paths are extensive, walking extensive, option to do a amusement park area which is small, cute and has been around forever with quaint inclusions like farm type petting zoo. Great for picnicking or buy food there. Have visiting multiple times.

Myself with my colleagues visited Toronto Island Park during our Business Trip to Canada.. It was an awesome panoramic view. Great place for a day trip. Too bad it gets overcrowded on weekends. However, the boat ride and the park is well worth it.

20 min ferry ride and your in cottage country. Or thats how I felt Quite, open, beaches, no cars, parks and bbq's. Rent a bike or kayak and cruise the islands in peace. Best sunset view of the toronto skyline. Perfect place to escape the city just sit in the grass and relax
Nice place to get away from hustle and bustle of Toronto. Amusement park is ok. Good for a stroll or rent bikes by the pier.

a mini escape for toronto's urban dwellers. Not exactly a destination for fun and excitement nor is it a major nature draw.

When you take the ferry to go to the Island you can see Toronto from the boat. there are a lot of trees. Fall is colorful. Is a quiet place.
Of course best time visit is in the summer months, a short ferry ride from downtown, a great place to take the family for the day and have a picnic.

Loved this little getaway. Walked from hotel during a conference and it more than relieved my boredom. Would be great for kids, couples, or solo.

Toronto Islands have all the advantages of northern Ontario without the travel! Beaches, biking, an amusement park and a haunted lighthouse. A great day trip. Take the train around, bike, blade or walk. Pack a lunch or grap a burger and sit on the beach. It never disappoints.

Brilliant place to gather and enjoy weekend with friends and family , nice view and wonderfull island .
It's always good and relaxing to go to central island park. I;ve been there many times with friends or families. I love it!

This was an amazing ferry boat ride to an incredibly beautiful peaceful island. I was sad to leave! This is a must see, take the kids to the park and rides, or take a stroll as a couple. I hired a quad bike with my partner, giggled and laughed the whole time. Loved it!

Lovely day out. Bring a picnic and swimming costume for the beach or hire a bike for the day. Great photos taken from the taxi boat of Toronto skyline. Children will love the farm animals, my favourite was the butterfly house.
There is something for everyone on the Island, we visited the zoo, the beach, took a train ride and had a nice drink. It was a very pleasant afternoon in the sun.

took the ferry to the islands, with a great view of toronto - the islands are similar to English parks in London, peaceful and quite within minuets of the city centre, took the island trolley tour for a relaxing trip around the islands and also walked along the board walk, there are plenty of cafes and coffee stops too, although...
A short ferry boat ride to the island took us to the island park. We loved the well kept gardens, luna park and animal farm. Beautiful views of Toronto.

Next time I come to Toronto I will be staying as close as I possibly can to here so I can spend all my time in this park. Avoid the concession stands--they're a rip off. Head a little further and towards where the living spaces are. Still overpriced for mediocre food and experience but far better than the concession stands.
Serene, quirky -no car neighborhood , old fashioned amusement park (not commercialized) beachesNice Ferry ride. nice bike riding.

Take the public ferry or a water taxi. This is an easy island to walk around in 3 or 4 hours. The bike rental place was busy, but lots of families were renting quad-bikes (for four) and having fun riding around the island on the paved paths - basically no cars on the island except for a handful of service...
It is hard to believe that this quiet paradise is less than 1/2 hour from downtown Toronto. It is such a pleasure to see the beautiful gardens, beach and open green space.

Boat ride was good to the park as we could get good pictures of the city.Park itself wasn't bad, none of the pools were filled , it wasn't easy to find clean picnic benches or ones that weren't broke.Was a nice walk around the park. Beach was clean as were changing facilities.
A place of peace and quiet after the hustle and bustle of downtownToronto.Nice walks and a fantastic park for children.

A lovely place to escape from the bustle of the city. We went along the boardwalk at the back of the island and practically had the place to ourselves. It all looks well looked after and is a very relaxing place to visit. The ferry was very straightforward. Only complaint would be a lack of eating places - we found...

This place was awesome, the views of Downtown Toronto from the island are AMAZING! If you like being outdoors and enjoying nature this is a must do while in Toronto. Also, rent a bike and bike around the whole island, their is a lot to see!
once you get off the ferry, run or jog to the other end of the island and rent a quadrocycle.. so much fun !! beautiful flat paths, gardens, beach, food and lush grassy areas to just relax

A nice park to spend an afternoon. Unlike most people i felt no need to rent a bike as the whole distance you can go is like 5 km which you can easily walk. The boardwalk is not accesible with the bike for 4! The water was cold but refreshing. Just a note: i don't understand why you're allowed to...

A beautiful park (i was surprised to see that Toronto doesn't have many!) where you can spend the day! You can either go to the beach or relax in the park...and it's just 7$ for the return ticket! You have ferries every 30min top, till midnight...and you have an amazing view of the skyline from the bar next to the...

We had a lovely day visiting the Islands. The boat trip was fun and gives you good views as the city disappears from you. We found that arriving at Ward Island suited us and we enjoyed the quiet walk around and down towards the lovely quiet beach there and along the water front. The rectory cafe is lovely and we...

Just a short walk from Union subway station is Queen's Quay on the harbourfront. For a few dollars you can take one of 3 ferries across to the islands which are verdant and well treed. There are walking trails, gardens, picnic sites, beaches, cafes, a beer garden, trams, an amusement park, bicycles/tandems/quadricycles, and boats to rent. The islands are a...

It was gorgeous! There were also various tours you can go on, There are also change rooms for those who want to swim in Lake Ontario. There are various Marinas, and you can fish there, too. The beach is so beautiful!

Walked the boardwalk on Ward's Island - rent bikes (1, 2 or 4 seaters) and explore all 3 islands! Centre Island ferry is always the busiest, and there is not a huge distance from end to end! Amusement Park on Centre island is for the little tykes - take a picnic lunch and enjoy.

Lines for the Aquarium were much too long so we headed for the Island Ferry. The price is right (Srs. & Students just $4.50 return) and the wait short, then just enjoy the ride and explore the beauty of the Islands. They're very well maintained with enough to do if you want to do more than just walk. My only...
The island is well kept, has a lot of amenities, nice gardens, and beaches at Lake Ontario. The view of Toronto's skyline is amazing.

Lots to do - for all ages. summer experience is gorgeous. Biking, walking, great for kids. Ferry ride provides terrific views of Toronto from the lake. lots to do when you get there. a special summer treat!!
This is my favorite place in Toronto. Don't miss the attraction park if you have kids. Rent a bike and enjoy :)

For a nominal price, you get the ferry ride, round-trip, and can spend the next few hours on the island, which is beautiful. Lots to do including beaches, biking, etc. It also offers the best view of the Toronto skyline. The lines can get a little long on the weekends, so be sure you adjust your schedule accordingly.
Lots of people but lots of space, rented a 4 seater bike and explored , lovely getaway fromLovely get away , rent a bike and explore.

Ferry ride out to the island was adventure in itself. Island well laid out with walkways, grassed areas to play, picnic benches, beaches etc.You can hire wheeled bikes for 2 or 4 people for 1/2hr upwards to explore.

A really full day out - tho check forecast before setting off - you really need a sunny day. We got the boat over to Ward's Island - you can then walk the length of boardwalk to Centre Island - this is where majority of the attractions are - and then continue onto Hanlon's Point. We visited Toronto recently and took the ferry over to the Island Park for Carabana (the annual Caribbean fest.) I love spending my weekends at Toronto Island! For $7.00 per adult you get a round trip ferry ride to the island. There are lower fee's for children, seniors and students. Every time I head to the Islands, my blood pressure drops from it's normal insanity. Kilometers of walking in trees and parkland, interspersed with sleepy cottage style homes, the Island Café, the Rectory Café, Centre Island's Family Playground, etc. If I want the beach and a view, Hanlan's has something for everyone, including a clothing optional choice! Fantastic day on Islands. I waked and my daughter cycled. The Boardwalk is certainly worth the walk, two wheeled bikes are allowed but not the quad bikes. We had a superb lunch at the Rectory Cafe
It is a Must visit if you are in Toronto for summer. Amazing nature, peaceful and very accessible from Toronto DT!

We stumbled upon this place with minimal research for our Ontario trip and we are so glad we chose to spend a day here. We picnicked and walked around, marveling at the views. The views of downtown Toronto from here are amazing. We did the boardwalk loop and got to enjoy Lake Ontario from a wonderful perspective as well. The...

Take good pictures, walk in the grass... Lunch in the middle of the park and go to the beach in other side. See how immense the Ontario lake is!Rent a Bike to walk all over the Island. Totally worth it!

I visited on a Wednesday in August with my husband and two daughters (8 and 4 yrs). We arrived around 11:00 and the ferry was packed. But the ride is pretty short so not a big deal. Our plan was to spend the day at the amusement park and the beach. We hit the amusement park first. It is a...

Every summer we look forward to taking a day trip down to Toronto for a ferry ride over to the island. We love the views of lake Ontario and enjoy renting a 2 seater bike to cruise around before stopping at the beach. Be sure to check out the light house hidden off the path.

We spent the afternoon at Toronto Island Park and were so glad we did! The ferry is quick and easy out to the island. While you can do the park on foot, I highly recommend renting bikes - for 2+ people, do the quadricycles! You'll get to see more and not get too tired.

A lovely park away from the hustle and bustle of downtown. Centreville is extremely overpriced. $111 for an all day pass for a family of four. We splurged and we were gad we did as this was our only amusement park for the summer. Lovely grounds. Just lovely!
Clean, beautiful, peaceful and wonderful value for money. A brilliant escape from the city as a place to relax and unwind. Would be fantastic for both couples and families.

Amazing views, great food, excellent place to spend a day or an evening with your family. It is amazing how suddenly you escape from the city noise to the nature.If you plan to rent a bike on the island you need to go to the Centre Island. It is great place to visit Toronto island. This place is very good for kids. We as a big family went there for BBQ and most of BBQ areas are near water which makes a great relaxing feeling while BBQ-ing.We visit this place every year and every year this place makes us to visit it again.

The Islands are only a short ferry ride away from the Harbourside ($7 each) and are definitely worth a trip. We don't have children so weren't interested in the rides etc so walked along the waterfront to Wards Island. The scenery was very pretty and we got some great pictures of the Toronto skyline. The Islands are actually connected, it is like a large island, with the ferry docking in one of the 3 places. The line ups to get to the islands from the main land, are long and confusing. The Park was very nice. Pleasant and restful.Will certainly visit again with family and friends. The boat ride was pleasant - unfortunately no long enough.

Strongly suggested to spend a summer,hot day there!you can walk and have many outdoor activities all the day long through the park!it is worthwhile to stay until the sunset to see the skyline and apprecciate Toronto from a different perspective!

We had a great time visiting the Toronto Islands. It's only a short (scenic) ferry ride away from the city and there's so much to do for everyone. We went to the amusement park and farm. Well worth spending a few hours on the Islands. Pleasant walks, beaches and gardens. Inexpensive I sail there.

Toronto Island Park was only a short ferry ride from downtown, but a hidden gem. I am from Alberta and I have family living in Toronto but somehow I have never visited Toronto Island Park until recently on the August long weekend. Lost of areas to explore by foot or rental bike. Bird watching, sun bathing, beautiful gardens, different beaches depending on your personal taste. Roads are paved and easy to find your way back. Very closed from downtown court. Amazing sunset. Retreat for artists. If you like to be close to nature and not so far for city. A place must...

we went with our 4 year old. he enjoyed many rides. food was expensive but at least it tastes good. the bracelet was worth it to not have to worry about tickets for each ride. the price of the ferry is good for both ways (i.e., pay only once for both ways). stroller was necessary as there is a lot...

Great place to escape the city and relax. Hire bikes and take a slow ride around the islands, or just relax on beach or park areas. Found a great bar in one of the marinas which was a great stop off for a drink whilst cycling
Nice family spot, beautiful nature surrounding everywhere, good for a bike ride. Perfect place to get away from city crowds, and have fun with family.
A short fifteen minute ferry from the City. Wonderful beaches, clean water for swimming and lots of shade. Many places to get away from the noisy children who dominate centre island.
Go early and spend the day. Bring a picnic lunch and enjoy the beautiful park. Kids kayaked, played on hand beach, we strolled and napped. Great way to unwind from the city.
Had dinner at the Rectory and walked the island . We had a night time view of Toronto from the ferry on our way back to the city.

I don't know how much I would have liked being in the Island Park with all the crowds on a summer day. But I did a bike tour through the Islands in the evening and it was wonderful. Beautiful views of the city at twilight and quiet rides through the parks and attractions.

Nice little get away from the crowds. $7 each for a return boat. We took the boat to wards island which is much quieter than centre island. We walked from wards to centre. Take food and drink. We wished we had taken a picnic. There is a beach on wards. Can rent bikes. Nice walks.

I brought my son to Centre Island and Centreville as I used to go there when I was a child. It is still such a great place for kids. We got him the bracelet so he could go on unlimited rides and I got 25 tickets so I could join him on a few. He played three games and won...
This is a great little get away for families with smaller children. There is an amusement park with lots of rides for the kids.
I guess I expected much more of a "Nantucket" feel to the Toronto islands. It's definitely more of a hippie / party / anything goes kind of place. It made for a very nice day to wander around.

This island is large enough that you can be in the tourist section with lots of people on the beach, or you can find a more private spot to enjoy. You should spend a whole day in the island, you won't regret. You can rent a bike and go everywhere there.

Great place to unwind and relax. Have at least a full day to walk and explore. There is a lot of greenery and immaculate parks and open grounds to stretch out. I am a local of Toronto. The Toronto islands is a very nice family get aware park especially during summer. It has a lot to offer for everyone in your family. The islands are a wonderful escape from the city, just a 10-minute ferry ride from downtown. The islands are a great place to relax, and a paradise for birders, especially in spring and...

Toronto island is probably somewhere that is best to go when the weather is warm and sunny. We went on an overcast day and there wasn't much to do. It's great if you have kids and bikes. There is a small amusement park with rides for young children. However for two young adults it was nice to see but I...
A short boat ride from the harbour, a cute little island with nice beaches. Worth a trip. You can easily rent bikes to ride around the island.

Toronto island is a must visit whilst in Toronto. Ferry can be busy during the summer. Ideal for family outings and small children there is a play area with many rides although tickets are not cheap. Plenty of food stalls and refreshments. A zoo area and a childs garden area where the kids can water the plants. Spectacular views of...

What a great place to visit. A short ferry boat ride. There's something for everyone. The zoo includes two black swans. Bike rentals. Amusement park for children. Kayaking, Swans, Canoes. Gorgeous gardens. Sugar Beach. You'd never know you were so close to a huge city. Love it.
liked the view of the city and the harbour boat ride usual fun fair animals and ice cream stuff great for kids pleasant gardens settings for picnics

You should definitely take the ferry (there are three ferries, any of them is good) to the island with your camera. The ferry fee is about $6 for adults and half the price for students and seniors. On your way to the island, you have a magnificent view of downtown Toronto skyline. When you get to the island, you can...
Its wonderful place to visit and spend a day with family. Bit crowded though, but it wont ruin your day. Fun place to be
If you make it to Toronto, make it out here. Rent a bike and bike around. Lay lazy on the beach - take your time. A wonderful piece of greenery in the otherwise quite grey Toronto.

We jumped on the ferry and crossed at 9:30, there was plenty of room on the ferry and sat $7 it was reasonable. The islands were quiet to start off with and it was easy to rent a bike (which opens at 10:30) and do a small tour. Overall a great place to relax if you don't have kids though...

We went to centerville August 24th 2014 and had an amazing time. The ferry ride to get there was fun.If you have kids between 3 and 8 years old, then this is the place for you. We liked riding on the bicycle for four - although there were five. What a great place to relax and move away from the hustle and bustle. The beauty of the flowers and other greenery made our visit there a pleasant one.

The ferry only costs $7 for adults, which includes the return fare. You can take your bike or pets with you. The views of the city are breathtaking. Fun little amusement park there for the kids and decent food options.

Much more than I expected. My lovely wife planned the day away and totally nailed it. The peaceful walks along the vividly green lawns and trees and even the afternoon thunderstorm were absolutely wonderful. We felt like kids again on the one of the park swing sets. This was the highlight of my Toronto visit. I went here not expecting much, but this is where most of our trip was spent. My family and I enjoyed our trip here a great deal ! The ferry ride over gives you a photo opportunity like no other. It is a great place for a weekend stroll or beach visit. The instant I arrived on Toronto island I started looking at house prices!!! Absolutely gorgeous and nothing I have seen like it where you can be in such a busy city and 10 minutes later in such a peaceful place. This is an excellent place for family outing's, but not quite for a couple, the journey over and back on the ferry was excellent with brilliant views of Toronto, an opportunity to take some good photo's.

There could be better places to eat but general cleanliness and layout of the island was great. Waiting in huge lines to go on the ferry was a nag especially going back. Kids loved both the bike ride and the Centreville Amusement Park. There could be more benches to sit and wait for the kids.

I am a lifelong resident of Toronto, and can say without hesitation that the Toronto Islands are one of the finest places to spend a day here in the city.Adjacent to the downtown core, the islands have always been an oasis for residents.There is something for everyone: go to Centreville amusement park with the kids, rent a canoe...

We went over on the ferry on a beautifully sunny day which was lovely. We hired bikes and rode to one end and then to the other of the island which was great and then we hired kayaks and spent some time on the water which was perfect. A great day out for couples and families alike.

Boat trip from the pier end of bay street. CAD21 for family of four. Nice and relaxing stroll. Nice photo for Toronto skyline. Can be very crowded. Opt for destination centre island. Rent a bike ( but expensive)

If you don't know which boat to take, go on the central island one. This is where the main attractions are: amusement park and small farm for kids, pier, main beach with changing rooms, restaurants and bike rentals. Our rugby squad went there for training and fun and had A great time in the sun and water. There was a variety of things to do.

Just a good idea to spend a leisurely day when you're in Toronto. The boatride to get to the island is very nice. On the island you can rent a bike (we rented a four-person bike, which was hilarious!) and tour the island. Great views of the Toronto skyline from the island!

I went on the island on February and it was pretty amazing. The frozen beach is a very beautiful sight. If you're going on the winter be sure to bring some food because the shops are closed. But yeah what a view, and all that for a small ferry fee.

loved the park and all the grounds.rides and amusement area would be perfect for little kids. Ours were 12 and 11 and were a little old for the rides they offered. Our kids loved climbing the trees and playing in the park.

After reading the reviews about visiting this place, my family and I took a trip to Toronto/Niagara Falls ON. Along the way we journeyed to the Island Parks and boy, we were not disappointed. A pleasurable play to be for both adults and children!!!

its was really one of our greatest days in toronto as a tourist , i have been there for 45 days and have enough time to experience nearly all the attractions of toronto . and me and my 14 year old dayghter found that island a must to see . i eish we had more time to go there again.

Ferry price is quite cheap and was just the start of the day. We dined at the Carousel Café and the food was cooked very well and service was good. We walked to the Queens quay from our hotel in the morning and had breakfast there. Centre Island in the summer is a wonderful getaway from the city. Just a short ferry ride from Harbourfront. It is underused in my opinion...good if you don't like crowds.
Like traveling back to the 1890s! Caution, ferris wheel is small kid size. Not the prettiest view of the Lake we saw.....that was at Port Dalauhaise (spelling?), but a nice respite.

Center Island was beautiful and well kept. Twelve of us had a blast racing each other in four-seater bikes. There is a small amusement park for kids that we did not visit, but heard good things about. The washrooms and changing rooms were clean and large.
Time with family & friends just relaxing. Great weather, great sights, great company.Wish we could have spent more time there.

When we went to Toronto Island Park on a Friday afternoon we weren't sure what to expect. We basically needed/wanted something to do for the afternoon. It's definitely a park. We went there in a lovely weather by fury . It was really lovely scene of Toronto downtown especially CN tower. We spend the rest of day in the beach with lots of sea gals. We rent four seats bike which I can recommend it to you.

Toronto Island is a beautiful place if you come prepared. There are two restaurants on the island; one is reasonably priced and the other is upscale. There is a wonderful playground for children, and scenic walkways. There were two drawbacks that prevented my giving it five stars. There were some snakes near the beautiful homes, and I am deathly afraid...

Took the ferry over and rode out bikes around the island. It is so relaxing and peaceful, it is hard to believe the bustling city is not far from you. There are many places to stop and relax, whether it is the restaurants, a park or one of the many beaches. Overall a great day and would recommend you visit...

Only a short ferry ride away from the city, this is a beautiful island with plenty of activities for children. The amusement park and animal farm are excellent for young children. The open green space is perfect for a picnic or gathering. The beaches are very nice as well. I highly recommend visiting this fun location and will definitely return!

Lovely getaway from the city on a lovely day. Renting a bike was good value and an easy way to see the island in 90 minutes. 2 years ago it was very good but unfortunately when I went last weak it was very bad.Some rides are not working not worth for money but if u like to explore the park do it don't buy day pass.For small kids less than 6 years they have rides.They have small animal farm too.

This is one of the must-sees once you are in Toronto. With beautiful shores and wast parks, it could be a full day program during summer. Plan to be there after sunset to see the unforgettable views of Downtown Toronto at night. You can go for bicycles, boats, canoues or simply enjoy the summer sun and sunbathe.

I think people forget about the fact that Toronto has an island! Wondering where you could go with young kids in Toronto? This is one of such places where you can enjoy a good family time. The atmosphere was calm and the breath of fresh air was just remarkable. I would go back again and again.

Toronto Island is a great place to escape from City Life, as witnessed by the many thousands of Toronto's citizens who descend there at weekends. We vacationed in Toronto and spent a day on the island. What a great, relaxing time we had! Loads of luscious landscape, parks and areas to relax. I visit the islands several times a year and have done so for many years; they never loose their charm. They are a nice place to escape to and relax. It's cheap to feet thereLots to doGreat picnicking areasCan rent bikesLovelyCleanLove going there

The islands are a beautiful retreat away from the city - the bike hire is rather expensive but worth it in order to visit Ward's Island and its enchanting island community. Worth the trip

A wonderful place to get away from the constant bustle and noise of the City of Toronto.The ferry goes to Ward's, Centre or Hanlans. Had a great afternoon at the island parks, weather was sunny and hot and it was busy. We hired a Quadracycle which cost $30 for 1 hour and was great fun. If you have younger children Centreville looked like fun. Be prepared to queue for the ferry at the end of the day. A good day out for everyone.

We spent the day exploring each island, bicycling, and savoring the beach. This is a delightful way to spend a half day while in Toronto. The Center Island Ferry will take you to the correct dock to allow you to walk to the bike rental place in about 10 minutes. The ferry over runs every 30 minutes but it can get very busy on a sunny day. We hired bikes and cycled round the islands for about 3 hours, had lunch and enjoyed one of the beaches. Set aside a whole day to enjoy the islands and make sure you start early.

Just a short ferry ride away from the hustle and bustle of Toronto, you step into the leafy parks and idyllic views of the park. There's beaches, lighthouses and beautiful scenic views of the city and the iconic CN Tower.I managed to spend 4 glorious hours wandering around, taking photographs and taking in the atmosphere.

I loved the peaceful atmosphere and the lovely walk. Bikes for hire were good option although we walked everywhere. Did not like the shortage of loos though!
Nice short trip by ferry to Island , great relaxing time out from the city,lots of entertainment for children

Me gusto todo el lugar, el viaje en ferry y los restaurantes del lugar. Tambien lugares para pesca y descanso .I love this especial place as it is the trip on the ferry boat, restaurantes and fishing places.Everyting is lovely there.Enjoy!

Super cool place to paddle, albeit in VERY cold water. But very beautiful place and a unique way to explore the islands. The views of the city cannot be topped.

Try the old style driving things, I remember them from when I was a kid. You can take the TTC there, check out the new streetcars and subways they are really cool. Wonderful place to relax only minutes away fron the dowtown bussle. You feel like ypu're in the coutry with beautiful view of Toronto's skyline.

An enjoyable 10-15 minute ferry ride takes you from the hustle and bustle of the city to a more relaxed and peaceful centre on the Island. Great place to get away from the buzz of the city. I enjoyed the ferry ride over and the view of the city skyline. Just take time to walk around the island. Eventually you get away from everyone a get a bit of peace and serenity

Loved the peace and scenery. Nothing opened until 11am. Pity as we didnt have time to wait. The bike hire would have been fun.
If in Toronto, worth the ferry ride over to Toronto island. Walk around and rent a bike to truly enjoy this oasis that is just a short ferry ride from the hustle and bustle of downtown Toronto.

Crazy busy on a Saturday morning but worth the wait for the Ferry! Peaceful ,green and pleasant,a good escape from busy downtown Toronto during the week. Only landed at Ward Island,liked the walks amongst the trees and enjoyed a drink at the cafe near where the ferry lands.

The Island Park was a lot of fun & we would recommend it to anyone visiting Toronto. Pack your tennis shoes and explore the island for at least a few hours. We then walked to the old distillery for some food & drinks and had a great time.
The islands were amazing: Nature, Food, Fun! You HAVE to visit if you're in Toronto! Ferry ride only 7 CAD (Cash only) and took about 15 minutes. Very nice views from the Ferry while riding over.
Very good to walk around and watch the world go by. Could easily spend most of a whole day there. Also is a lot fresher that the the heat of the city.

Good to visit if just for photo shoots, has a beach area and other attractions, well worth a visit. Good area for children.

Nice place to visit from May to September, you will take a Ferry to go there in 20 to 30 minutes, in the mean time you can enjoys the view to the skyline of the city, as well enjoy the shore of lake Ontario and the fresh breeze from the big Ontario Lake, while there you will enjoy no matter...

Toronto Island is a nice change from the busy city. Some touristic boats will guide you around the islands and talk to you about the history and particularities of the islands, but you can also walk on the island and enjoy the pleasant greener side of Toronto.

While staying in Toronto we had a free day on our hands and decided to ferry to Toronto Island. The ferry ride was pleasant and the weather was perfect. Fabulous time with our granddaughter who is 5. Lots to keep us all entertained. Ferry ride is great. Tons of park area for picnics......amusements are fun. Biking or walking make for a very relaxed time.

We sat on the beach on Sunday. People chatting, kids playing sand castles, dogs coming to sniff us out. The Toronto Islands are just an amazing gem. A great family trip on the ferry then a nice walk around the park and beaches.. visit thefarm and centreville for the kids..

I completed the 10km run on Toronto Island and it looked like an awesome place to visit. I was alone but wished I had my wife and children there with me to enjoy the island.

The Toronto Islands are just offshore from the city center and it can be reached by ferry in about 10 minutes. Just a really nice island, you would not believe it is just off a major city. cost just $7 return on the ferry to visit which is a bargain.

My daughter and I caught the ferry to Centre island and it was a very pleasant experience. I love the Island. Awesome view of the city plus you take a ferry for $7.00 dollars per person make sure you take your camera with you.

Park is very good, good place for outing with children.My enjoyed a lot. good place to be in summer

Everytime, in the summer when go to Toronto, always make a point of spending a day here on the islands. Love the view of the city from the island park. My grand-daughter loves the rides at the amusement park. So many things to do: strolling, boating, picnics, or just relax on the grass in shade or sun.

This is a perfect place for a day trip specially in the summer when the weather is nice. Many activities to do on the island. Great way to go around the island is on a bike. You can rent one for about 5-10 bucks or take your own
Great place for a day trip. Can walk and bike the paths and be surrounded by Lake Ontario the whole time. A nice change from the rest of the city.
This is probably the best thing to do whilst visiting Toronto, taking the ferry to the island. The island has a couple of small sandy beaches and it's a pleasant walk round the island.

This island is lots of fun for adults and kids alike. The ferry to the Island is inexpensive and provides a great view of downtown Toronto from Lake Ontario. Toronto Islands is a great place to go visit because its like a lil' getaway from the city even though it is technically in the city. Its like a separate getaway and the ferry ride over gives you a great view of the needle and the Toronto city landscape.
Great family place for a family outing on a warm summer day. Rides for the kiddies and a nice beach and clean water for swimming. Enjoy.
Toronto Island is beautiful and relaxing! We visited with our 3 year old son. We enjoyed the ferry ride over, walking orotund the islands, the beach, dining al fresco, and the amusement park.

My childhood lies here. Absolitely great way to go down to the city yet actually not be in the city at all, but more like facing the city from a tranquil peaceful island. Bike, classic rides, beach, even an international airport on its west side??

There is a great Ferry to take to get to the different Islands in the Toronto Harbour. They have an amusement park for the children and there is also a farm for them to visit. It is great to take a picnic lunch or you can buy food over there. There is plenty to do for all ages, young or...

I am biased in this review because I probably visit this oasis 20 times a year. It truly is a way to get away from it all, but still have the beautiful but busy skyline of Toronto in clear view. Take a ferry and have fun! Nice park, good beaches, many places where to eat during the season. Unforgettable views of the city.

In May visit the park for the Cherry Blossom season and the rest of the year for a feel of being on a walk in a forest, lake side or at the small zoo. In summer a swim at the pool or a game of tennis is always a pleasure.
We go every year...a few times per summer.... And spend the weekend on our sail boat. So peaceful....a reprieve from the busy city.

So easy to get to, it's a world away from the hustle and bustle of the city. A short ferry ride with beautiful cityline views is just the beginning. On a hot summer day, Centre Island is the perfect refuge. Lots of green space and a quick and fun ferry boat from the main city centre. If you have kids, take advantage of the Centreville amusement park. You can buy a day pass or just individual tickets. If you want to ride your bike, roller blade or scooter, there...

Take the ferry to The Islands if you want a relaxing afternoon wandering through lovely pathways and gardens. The ferry departs from downtown Toronto at the lake and the cost is very little. You will find acres of parkland and a great view of the city.
Amusement park, bikes/quadricycles for rent, heritage houses.We go there once or two times every summer
The Toronto Islands are one of the best attributes this city had to offer. Hanlan's beach is not to be missed.

The Toronto Islands park is a huge green oasis with a small residential community (Wards Island ferry stop), sandy beaches (blue flag!), boardwalks, swan boats, and more. Especially wonderful is the view from the ferry - getting there is half the fun!Bring a picnic, try the Rectory Cafe for lunch in the garden, the Island Cafe, or get a...
Travel over by ferry, lots to see and do, restaurants, rides, pools, loads of fun for the day. Pick a nice sunny day and enjoy the swimming and activities the island has to offer.
Very nice to spend time with the family. The only real greeenery downtown Toronto :) a lot of walking and a fun outdoor maze.

toronto island is one of toronto's best kept secrets - the beaches are absolutely stunning and the water is beautiful and clean for swimming in the summer. many people think the island is only for young children due to its theme park, but there is plenty to do there aside from the theme park and an excellent restaurant as well....
Rent a bike, stop for a coffee at the Island Cafe on Wards Island, bike to Hanlan's Point, go for a swim at Gibraltar beach and have supper at the Rectory Cafe. Bliss out.

This is a fabulous way to take in the Toronto skyline, get out of the downtown core and enjoy some fresh air. Take the Ferry across, bring a picnic with you and set up for the day. You can rent bikes, swim on the beach and even visit a small amusement area. If going on the weekend, go early as...

Went over a blustery spring day on the ferry. It's a fabulous ride over. But let's say you've already been walking for a while and your kids are young and they're a little hungry and what if you need a potty? Well, you probably won't be staying too long on the island, at least in March. Just sayin. The charm...

Toronto can be a busy place and in the summer, you can't always get away to the cottage or somewhere secluded. But for $7 you can take the ferry over to the Toronto Islands and get the best view of the city. I typically got 4-5 times each summer and spend about half my time at Ward's and the other...
Winderful place, a must do in the city. Just be sure to take food, as ALL bars are closed in the islands. This is no "but", just smthg to remember. Stunning views from the city, almost unbelievable.

Take the ferry from Toronto Harbour over to Toronto Island for a great day out. There are three harbours on the island however use the Hanlon's Point station to get to the sandy shore of the lake where you can bathe although there are no facilities here so make sure you take a picnic and drinks. My family and I visited the Toronto islands at Easter 2013. It was a beautiful, crisp day and even though many of the attractions were closed as it was out of season, we nevertheless hugely enjoyed ambling around. Such a contrast looking across the water to the city! A memorable day for all the right reasons and I can imagine...
This was my favourite part of the trip to Toronto. The ferry over was so peaceful and panoramic, and then the walk around the park, and the tiny cafe were awesome. Definitely would love to go again.
Park, water, boats, rides, food, sand- you name it and Toronto Island park has it all. If you ever visit Toronto, do not miss this attraction.

Very fun and relaxing time at this park. - bikes to rent , roller blading and lots of paths. Great for the kids. Restaurants are here for your liking or as many others just bring a picnic.Will make this a yearly trip for us.
Nice park for some rollerblading, or frisbee golf, or just a wander around the walkways. In the summer there are plays you can go to.

I loved the ferry ride from the foot of Yonge Street and the ride back with the spectacular view of Toronto's skyline. The ferry is efficient, crowded but calm and comfortable. Lots of action is going on to view along the way. Billy Bishop Airport on the Island has lots of landings and take-offs and the harbour is full of...
It is in the south part of Toronto, even though it was freezing cold, It was worthwhile to go there to walk, take pictures and relax.
Bike riding with family is such a great experience Taking the Toronto ferry to the island is such a great way to travel

A short ferry ride will transport you physically and mentally from the hustle and noise of Toronto to a green paradise just offshore. It an oasis of calm a short ferry ride from the center of downtown. Parks and running room galore, beaches and a small amusement Park for the wee ones - it's a great place to bring a Picnic and a book and relax or bring your bike and tour a lot further.

My husband and I spent Labor Day weekend in Toronto. After reading about the island I knew it had to be a top priority on our itinerary. It did not disappoint!We caught the fairy across at around 11AM on a Friday. We ate pizza for lunch because we just wanted something quick so we could start exploring the island....
Many nice spots for a picnic! We rented bikes and rode all the way around the island! Nice way to relax and enjoy a summer afternoon.

We were hoping to go to the island but the day we were there it seemed everybody in Toronto ws going to that island so we settled for a 45 minute cruise around the islands departing from Toronto harbour. It was beautiful, serene and looked to be a great picnic and biking spot. There are beaches and a lot of...
my favourite place in Toronto often missed the tourist trail, a real retreat from city live just a short ferry ride away

Love his place,A little community hidden away. Great place for a bike ride or long walk. Nice cafes to eat/drink in and if you have kids there's a fair with rides. If you're looking for a beach then you're in luck as there are some nice one to relax and sunbathe one.

Going to Toronto island is a big recommendation. Loads of fun and bike hire and a great beach also. There is lots to do and some really amazing views of Toronto skyline also. The view from the ferry to and back was great also. Highly recommend.

This place is absolutely beautiful like soo many other parks of Toronto/Canada but the USP of this place is the views of Toronto skyline that one gets standing there...Absolutely breathtaking and the ferry ride to the island park..unforgettable!
