really enjoyed myself even if it did rain there are plenty of things to do and its cheap enough. seems to be one staff for every visitor but I still liked to chat to each and everyone.

We have ben with a 5 year old boy. He loved it since the ferry ride. This is a great place where to spend a all day with plenty of activities for all ages. It is a place you do not want to miss to take a break

I have been to the islands several times now and I love them. They are so cute and it is nice to "escape" from the city for a little while and come to such a peaceful area that is such a short boat ride away. When I went with my SO we brought our bikes with us and rode around...
We visited Centre-Ville with a 2 year old. A ferry ride, amusement park (more for small children than teen or adults),splash areas for kids, beaches, walks, a lighthouse----what's not to like?

Toronto Islands are an amazing series of islands that form a park...waking, biking, picnics, and for those so inclined, a children's amusement park. The main island is too crowded for me...I tend to stay away...choosing instead to take a ferry to either of the two points.

Toronto island is great! Just 10 minutes away from the city center and it's like being out of the city! Beautiful beaches, huge parks.A very nice place to escape the busy city life but still in the city!

Best enjoyed on a warm day when you can wander at leisure. Centre-Ville is fun for families with young children but don't miss the boardwalk and beaches. Be sure to visit Wards Island (and eat at the Rectory Cafe) to check out the unique and quirky neighbourhood on the island. Enjoy some of the best views of the skyline while...

Just in front of Toronto is the Island of Toronto. Only a few minutes by ferry and miles away from the city. Jujst walk around or if you're Lucky with the weather, relax on the beach. Just spend an afternoon here and watch the sunset over the city

Toronto Island Park is the highlight of a visit to Toronto. It is an oasis just a short ferry ride from the hustle and bustle of the city. As you take the ferry you get a great view of the city skyline. You can walk or bike from Ward's Island to Hanlon's point (or vice versa)Ward's Island: a community...
Excellent, only short ferry ride from downtown. Island offers great ways to relax, amusement park, marina...and more.

Best seen on a good weather day. Started at Hanlon's Point and walked to Ward Island, taking in the Centre island sights along the way. Fantastoc day out for the whole family or for those just looking for a nice walk. Excellent eating facilities on the islands.

Have been to the island dozens of times as a child and now have taken my own children there when they were younger.The amusement park is really just for young children but adults can enjoy bike riding and walking the extensive trails in the park
This park is quaint beyond belief. There are homes here (not easy to come by) but it is like a state park and amusement park in one. You must take a ferry to and from. Worth a visit with the kids.

Beautiful place for a picnic, walk, or swim and sun tan. You must take the ferry from Front street dock which is located at the bottom of Yonge street.There is small amusement park for kids and adults as well.
We enjoy going to Toronto Island Park for walks and to relax. It is a wonderful place to take pictures. This is a good place to have picnics.

Taking the short ferry from the Toronto mainland to the Toronto Islands is like going on vacation. Once you arrive, you feel like you're far away from any city. Absolutely and completely worth the few minutes. Ferry Docks are at the bottom of Bay Street @ Queen's Quay; a 5 minute walk from the Union subway station. There are 3 ferry boats, 1. If you take the ferry to Ward's Island instead of Centre or Hanlan's you'll find yourself in one of the most magical places Toronto has to offer. If you want to take best pics possible with an excellent view at harbor-front, downtown and CN tower - go there. At nights beware of mosquitoes!

You take the ferry at the foot of bay st. I like to get off the ferry at Wards island and walk along the interesting streets to the back side boardwalk and along to the Rectory restaurant for a lunch. then continue walking to centre island. It is the amusement area and the ferry goes back to Bay st. Where...

One of the great treasures of this wonderful metropolis is a group of isles situated just offshore enough to create a beautiful natural harbour. Toronto Island is the best possible way to picture Toronto. You can take the best downtown shots from the ferry or from the Centre Island. you can cycle from one end to the other. Enjoy the beachs that face Lake Ontario, take the kids to Centreville ($), the amusement park, or have a picnic. There is a maze for kids to enjoy or just have a leisurely walk around the beautiful islands. Small fee for the ferry back and forth from the mainland.

You're in Toronto. Downtown. The largest and busiest city in all of Canada. A big park. You can rent bikes, walk around the islands, children's amusement park, zoo, take a shuttle "train" (vehicle), go to the beach, walk out on the pier, have a meal in a restaurant, play frisbee golf/disc golf. Very nice park, quiet. Nice views of the city, go to Algonquin Island for an unobstructed view of the city. Great...

Unique. Take a boat from the harbor (not the big, less expensive boat) for a ride through the back side of the island. There is something for everyone and its easy to spend the whole day there. It's gets hot so bring a lot of water in the summer as if you decide to bikeride
The boatride over is half the fun - but this park is a fantastic oasis of green in the city, that is great for a change of pace.

My fav. get away in the city. I love that there is something for everyone and the price of 7 dollars for a return trip makes it attainable for all. Pack a lunch spend the day, check out the clothing optional beach as my tourists and Torontonians do it is the best spot in the city and loved by the...

From the beginning of your journey, you are leaving the city of Toronto and entering the magic of the island. The Toronto Island Park is a great place to getaway maybe have an afternoon picnic, or stroll or bike ride. Great views of the city.

We took our own bikes, picnic, tennis rackets, towels (for the beach) for a full-day low cost experience. Gorgeous pathways through light forests! Free tennis! Clothing optional beach and regular beaches all around the island. Lots of concession stands, facilities, lockers, rides for kids and great atmosphere. We go at least twice every year in the summer.

You can enjoy this beautiful park nested in Lake Ontario and have a different look at Toronto from the Waterfront and look at the Skyline of the city.You can watch planes take off and land from the Island Airport as well

Toronto is a great town to visit with all the attractions to be experienced and enjoyed. However, a trip to Toronto Island is something that should not be missed. A perfect place to relax and enjoy Toronto at its best. Take a picnic and a blanket and you can have total privacy either on Hanlan's point or the rest of the grounds. No traffic, no noise but still a great view of the city.Go a weekday in May before the kids get let out from school. Its like...

We went with to the Toronto Island Park and it was a fun experience. We enjoyed a lot right from the start. We had to take a short ferry ride to the amusement park. We loved the amusement park and the rides. We also hung out on the beach and had a little picnic too right on the beach. We...

I love visiting Toronto Islands whenever I have a free day in that busy city. My parents used to take me as s kid and it hasn't changes a bit. There is lots to do if you enjoy outdoors activities. I love the swan ride. I am sure it is the same one as when I was a kid. It is beautiful on Toronto Island. The lagoons are lovely and the atmosphere is great. It is special to be so close to the city, yet feel so far away. Looking back at the Toronto skyline is a special treat.
Almost everything was closed when I visited Toronto Islands. Only ended up taking a stroll and nothing else.

I never fail to be amazed at how close you are too downtown yet how peaceful this place is. I visited on a cold, wet Saturday afternoon over Halloween weekend but still loved it. This was a refreshing place to escape the city with the ferry running at all times throughout the day. Once there you are in a place of calm where kids can run play and build sandcastles. you can relax and sun bathe as well as visit the theme park which is more designed for smaller children. we spent an enjoyable...

While the ferry taking you to Toronto Island Park has seen better days (some of the wooden ceiling planks have rotted out ...), the Island Park is well worth a leisurely visit--with or without children, for whom it would be a particularly enjoyable experience.

Hugh place with nice gardens and picknic area with nice views. It is the place for many events, including the dragon boat race in summer. Beach, water fountains, boat rides, kids play gorunds, exotic food, kids rides, nice plants and nice trails.
If you fancy some laid back peace and quiet; a picnic, sunbathing (in summer, not October), then head on over.

I went there with my friend and her 3 kids and we all had a blast.It's only a short ferry ride away from the city, but it felt like a trip within my trip.It was my first time in Toronto, and I liked Toronto Island as much as I liked the city and her people.We ended up...

This was our first visit to Toronto Island and were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful it is. We took the Island tour, it takes about half hour to get there and you can stay for as long as you want then finish the tour on the way back.The views are spectacular. We took the ferry over from the Boardwalk to the Centre Island..nice short ride.It was a sunny weekday and lots of tourists. Had a relaxing stroll to Hanlan's Point and a Ceaser while waiting for the ferry to arriveGood mornings outing and great scenic views ! try and avoid tourist season though

We took a ferry to go to the Toronto Island Park, and it was a good experience, even if in autumn is a little bit sad and empty. I enjoyed much more the park in Vancouver, which is inside the city ad gives you some fresh air, without the need of taking a ferry. Must be better in summertime...

One site which can rival Chicago! The ferry ride across the harbour is a joy - to one of 3 dockages. Once there, one can walk from one dock to another. There are beaches, great views of the city, restaurants and an amusement park. Lots of shady walking paths to enjoy on a summer day. This is my favorite outdoor place in Toronto. Spent there hundreds of hours and I keep going once a month at least.

If the weather allows this is a must visit for people visiting Toronto. Provides a stunning view of the Toronto skyline. It is calm and tranquil in most parts & then there is the kids park lol. We went on holiday to Toronto with my wife this summer and took the ferry over to Toronto Island Park and had a great time!The weather was nice and we had an ice cream, and took a double bike and had a fun ride around the island. We had a picnic and enjoyed the views.Overall, it's a nice...
Great spot for an afternoon. Spent the afternoon wandering the islands, stopped for a picnic looking at the city.
Great walking or cycling island and a short trip from Toronto. A few good food choices, small amusement park of the kids, nice beaches - one with clothing optional on far side of island.

This is the most beautiful place in Toronto. Probably the only one people can walk without interrupted by all constructions. The direction to the ferry terminal is clear. Easy access. The views to the city and the scenes of the island itself are great. The place not to miss when visiting Toronto.
A lovely get-away-from-it-all park that makes you feel the city is miles away. Perfect for a day's escape, or even an afternoon, on a sunny day, no place better.

We go to Toronto Islands all the time and almost year round to bike, roller-blade, walk, relax on a beach, boat rowing or simply for a picnic. You see lots of people canoeing too. Granted we visited out of season, but it was lovely to have a day away from traffic and noise. We walked and sat. The view of the city was lovely and a ferry ride is always good. Shame we had to pay; ferry in Kingston for Wolfe Island is free.

We went to the Islands off season and the leaves were this beautiful golden color. It made the island seem almost magical. The ferry captains were knowledgeable and funny and made the trip enjoyable. The view of Lake Ontario was beautiful.
The zoo was a lot of fun and was a great place to relax and enjoy nice and quiet quality time with my spouse.

This short ferry ride is not only cheap but provides awesome views back to the city. Walking all around the park was joyous on the late September day we visited in full sunshine. With all good reviews, I would share only my personal perspectives, I would move here just for my daughter to play more often in this park. my husbands family lived on the island at one time and we visited for old times sake. lot of walking but the ferry over is very reasonable in price and affords views of Toronto

I didn't do much more than just walk from Hanlan's ferry dock to the one at Centre Island. But it was really nice. A very pleasant place to spend time - it is deceptively large so I suggest you take a bicycle to enable you to explore it properly.

My wife and I had attended a wedding at the RCYC on Friday and returned here on Sunday for a tour and bike rental. This island is a jewel for Toronto and should not be missed. We rented bikes for one hour and were able to travel to both ends of the islands with a couple of stops. Beautiful park...

I went to the island on one of the first ferries over. I took the ferry to the island park, but I got on the wrong ferry and went to Hanlon's Point. But I was glad I did - it was very quiet and lovely. I walked back to Centre Island, which was a good hike of a few miles. I would recommend bringing food and having a picnic near Hanlon's Point.

We were looking for a way to spend the day other than the usual shopping and museum visit approach. We loved this place. Very easy to get to by ferry from the Toronto waterfront. Took the ferry out to the islands for the day. It was a cheap, relaxing day trip. We just walked around the park and spent a relaxing day on the islands. I would definitely recommend it. A great place to visit and relax. Take a ferry ride and get away from the busy streets of Toronto. The island is full of attractions. Rent bikes and tour the entire island! We did it on a nice day and it's a great way to see everything!

We took the ferry over from the Boardwalk to the Centre Island..nice short ride.It was a sunny weekday and lots of schoolgroups and mums with toddlers but they dispersed once we reached the Island so all was nice and quiet.Had a relaxing stroll to Hanlan's Point and had a beer while waiting for the ferry.Good mornings outing.
Great place to get away from the bustle of the city and relax. The ferry ride alone is a treat! Take your bike and enjoy a cycle. Or go for a swim.
A great place to relax and do nothing, but not at weekends. A low cost boat ride gets you to this lovely area, where you can just wander and relax. At weekends the locals arrive en mass.

If you are enjoying the Toronean summer, it's a very nice trip to do. You need to reserve all the day and you can enjoy it better. Almost weekends have some festival, which makes the trip worth. Don't forget suncream and food (just to make some money).

When I travel to the GTA I always find the time for a day trip to the Toronto Islands. This green Oasis is the greatest place on earth to go and walk or roller blade the day away. So close to Toronto's core, but, so far away. Rainy days are best because, no people. That opens up many quiet and...

Does any city have something like this? The trip on the ferry is amazing and quite picturesque. Fantastic picture taking opportunity from the middle of the lake as the entire toronto laksehore skyline is breathtakingly visible. Doing this trip after sunset is romantic and amazing to see the city lights. This is especially so if there is a baseball game...

One of the best value attractions in the city. Just 7CAD for the ferry over, and so much beautiful space to explore - river, parks, and beach. It was brilliant, though the bike hire was more expensive than we were prepared to pay, though some people h ad taken hired bikes from downtown over.

This is a great get away from downtown Toronto noise and traffic, I have spent countless summer days exloring the island park from the lighthouse to the boardwalk to Wards which I wish I had to opportunity to live on to greenspace GALORE!!! never mind Centerville pack a picnic go to far enough farm walk around the church step out...

The park is a nice oasis in the middle of a big city. Our hotel was beside the ferry so it was convenient to visit. The amusement park is more suited to young kids. We only went for 2 hours in the evening. Looks like a good place to enjoy a picnic.
To relax, to walk or bike around, to swim, you are really away from the city. It is quiet and beautiful here!

lovely relaxed day with gardens, barbeque areas, beaches,wildlife and even a mini theme park for young children open in summer and weekends off season. Only a 10 min ferry ride from the ferry terminal beside our hotel. great dau out

Great place to go to get out of the busy city. Lovely gardens, can hire bikes and ride around. Excellent ferry service which runs regularly and only takes about 10 mins.

Took our teenage niece there for the afternoon. Waiting for the ferry, we used the bathrooms there, not pleasant! From there on in, the island itself is beautiful! Loved the Harbour front park and the ride to Island. If you get a groupon deal it is works to be way cheaper. Excellent view of Toronto downtown and skyline from the island.

Incorporated a couple days in Toronto as part of our Niagara Falls trip and it ended up being the highlight of the trip. Spent the whole day at the Park and could have easily gone back there for another day. Downtime Toronto was very walkable and plenty of things to do. Would love to go back some day.

As a Toronto resident, I make it a point to get out to Toronto Island Park as much as possible in the summer. Yes, if it is warm you will have to do the infamous waiting line (which can take as long as an hour during peak season) but that is part of the experience. If you want to avoid...

I spent an afternoon here walking around the island, at the beaches and having lunch. We strolled around the island all day and it was amazing. We especially loved the little vegetable garden for the kids. We had burgers which were nice, too.

This is a great way to escape the city for a few hours. Ferries were nice & frequent transport to beautiful island. We Rented bikes & enjoyed the beaches all day in the sun. City skyline view from island was phenomenal

its a beautiful island where you can find activities for kids and the whole family. you can also have a picnic or eat in one of the restaurants in there. also on the ferry, you get a nice view of Toronto. i recommend arriving early cause the row that is made to pay the ferry tickets.

Wonderful island park in the lake just in front of Toronto. Lots of green grass and even a small beach in the open lake side. Perfect place to get a great view of Toronto skyline. Ferries cost 7 CAD round trip. Must go!
lovely, picturesque park with lots of beautiful flower displays and fountains. Very peaceful and relaxing place only 15 mins across the lake from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Toronto Island is always a great place to spend a nice day out as a family. The splash pad is always a favourite with our daughter as is the farm and the amusement park. The Ferry ride in is also a nice way to start and end the day.

you wouldn't think you were anywhere near a city. People were very friendly. many beaches to choose from. plenty of places to eat and drink. Wonderful

Get away from hustle and bustle of Toronto with a 15 minute ferry ride. Love the beaches and especially love to ride my bike to Ward's Island and see the pretty cottages. Nice, peaceful and relaxing place to get away from the city crowded and noise. Enjoy with family, friends and/ or love ones.

Just a cool place to rest from the city. We had a lovely boat trip around the islands, walked around and just sampled the relaxed atmosphere - this was away from Centreville of course lol
Quite comfortable to lie on the grass and do some reading~ or napping~ XDI recommend the Far enough Farm~ really interesting~The fare is only $7~

Lots to do for little kids. We were travelling with an adult group and went there to kill time while we waited for our hotel. We ended up walking around and had a good time. They have a little farm,a nd you can rent bikes. Very nice way to spend the day.

There were lots of different activities for all kinds of people. An amusement park and petting zoo for kids, restaurants for kids and adults, and lots of beautiful gardens and scenery for strolling and enjoying the beautiful summertime weather.
Really enjoyed our trip to the island, we done this on Canada Day. It was still busy but a little more quiet. Beautiful island with lots to do!
It is only $7 to ride the ferry to Toronto Islands and there is a lot of fun in store there. A great place to spend the afternoon with a fantastic view of the city.

When I first came from a country on an island, I feel as if I have to say goodbye to the beauty of it...and then I landed in Toronto as a new immigrant, and found a nice surprise: the Centre Island, also named Toronto Island.I of course enjoy the breezes on the ferry ride, skyline of the Toronto lakeshore,...

It's really easy to forget that you are next to a city with millions of residents here. Beautiful trees, flowers, and aquatic plants everywhere. My only regret is that we weren't there at night. I'll bet the view of the city is beyond belief.

We recently attended a wedding on Ward's Island at the Rectory Café. It was quite delightful. The wedding and Wedding Breakfast were held under a canopy of old-growth trees overlooking the Eastern Gap and a nearby swimming beach. It is huge park reachable by ferry, with three ferry "terminals" at three park spots. Round trip is 7 dollars and the ferry ride itself is a treat because you see the city skyline and many kayaks and small boats. The park is on the island no cars allowed, it is flat and has paved roads, sand beaches, pierce, bike...

Glorious mini trip! A lovely group of islands. I defies reality that you are only a few minutes boat ride from the biggest city in Canada.lovely boating "seascapes" I know it's a lake but its huge.great for strolling , bicycling , sitting. All kinds of bikes available for hire. Fun park for children.only hitch. Getting back at 4.30 on a...

Three ferries take you to different points on the island. In the summer its a perfect place for chilling out. Take a picnic, there are picnic tables everywhere. Lovely and flat for bikes, skates and running. Ferry timetables online and running bang on schedule.

If you want a great touristy shot of yourself in Toronto, the ferry to the island provides this, beautiful cityscape with CN Tower prominent in the background.The island itself is jam packed with things to do, personally I rented a bike and went for a ride around the island - it's far too big to see everything on foot....

Hanlon Beach was our destination. The beach was clean, water was cold. No alcohol allowed on the beach- but there are no signs to state that. Clothing optional beach was an experience I will never forget. People were very nice and non-judgemental. You need to be very open-minded if you come to this beach. Not a place to come if...

We went to the Island Park this afternoon. It was a perfect day for the trip. Warm but not hot, low humidity. The Island has a number of attractions including a small amusement park. There are walking trails, boat rentals, bike rentals, etc. The only drawback is how expensive everything is on the island -- ice cream bars for $6....

You can't do Toronto in the summer without heading out the the island for some fun in the sun. A short ferry ride from the harbor gets you to this urban oasis. Lots of great beaches, gardens, and pretty paths to explore. Hanlan's Point is a great place to lay around if you happen to be a little bit gay,...

The Toronto Ferry Docks are located at the foot of Bay Street at Queens Quay. You pay a reasonable fee, currently $7, which takes you to one of the 3 ports on the Islands. We went to Hanlans Point to check out the "clothing optional beach" :)

It doesnt matter if you have only a couple of hours, half a day or a whole day - Toronto Islands it is. Bring food and stay a whole day at the small beaches, grab lunch a bike around or just take a picture of the amazing Toronto Skyline. Yes, this is where you would have to go to do...

This is a really nice outing especially if you have children along. We went across on the ferry specifically for the beach, a short walk from the ferry terminal. What a pleasant day!Parking is difficult and there is lots of construction near the ferry terminal right now. Pay the twenty dollars for the day at the lot across Queen's...
Very pleasant ferry ride from the city at a decent cost. All types of sports and amusements as well as a clothing optional beach!
Easy to get to and a super day out to get away from the hustle and bustle of the cityBike hire is great and easy paths to follow.You can also enjoy a boat ride as well or just walk around
Picnic areas, a playground, a little amusement park, beaches, a theater etc. What else could you ask for?

I went there yesterday and it was just amazing. i go twice every year! the highlights of the island is definetly the beach! Short ferry ride over , would recommend picnic as beautiful grounds & parks , areas for bbq. There are a couple of restaurants which are nice too. Hired bike - deposit & id required , & can cycle the whole island approx 10km ? You could walk it & its really flat suitable for wheelchairs / prams. Really relaxing day...

What more is to be said, a day of fun in the sun, nude beaches, bird watching and more. It cost about 25-30 dollars per person to get there via ferry, but that also gives you great photo ops. Also the Far Enough farm is pretty fun as well.

You can take a ferry to one end of the island and return at a different ferry dock. This makes exploring/walking easy. We loved the wards island end with lots of shade and picnic areas. The Centre Beach also is good but pack your own food and drinks as prices are double on the island.
Loved these islands. the ferry was $7 return per person and you can spend all day there. We wnet over 2 days and there is lovely wlaks and it is very picturesque
Family enjoyed this place the Toronto harbour view during sunset is beautiful, I love my new home, kids are in love with this City

You don't visit this attraction the same way with young kids, with teens or as a couple! With teens last year, I went straight to the Centre Island bike rental outlet (on the opposite side from the ferry, south of the island) to rent a quadracycle (2-seat or 4-seat). Best value attraction of a really expensive city, you pay only $7 for the ferry, the view is amazing specially on the way back at night, try to go before sunset to get both day and night skyline views; was the highlight of my weekend trip to Toronto, the lights of the city are beautiful. If you have nice beaches...
For the price of a ferry ride. You can bike, car free roads, enjoy beautiful beaches and spend time at a zoo or amusement park. Family fun for sure

As good as anything in Europe or the U.S. we are so lucky to have it and is a must visit for tourists and locals. Tourists should pack a picnic and spend the day. Locals should always plan a summer visit.

We drove into Toronto with some friends and parking was very expensive ($15 - 40).Pre-booking the ferry crossing is a better idea. My family and I have visited many times (and the surrounding area too), and each and every time it's been gorgeous. If you like the outdoors, but not full immersion, then this is a great place for you.Very affordable too, though tricky in the dead of winter.

Affordable Ferry trip to the Islands.Nice picnic area, clean and quite a few activities for kids.Food is extremely pricey. Make sure you take sun-screen and hats and lots of water/juice to keep you hydrated. Staff is very friendly. Bathrooms are not that clean though.Plan on spending a full day.

I liked everything about the island! Only 7$ for the ferry over and the scenery is amazing, it makes new yorks Central Park look man made (becuase it is) small and boring. Probably the best thing though is the island has amazing views of the city as well as lots of things to do as well as take in the...

My adult daughter and I were in Toronto for 3 nights at the end of June. We took a Harbour Tour (bought tickets on Croupon) and got of at the Island. I enjoyed the wonderful green and gardens of the islands. You can go there easily by ferry. Best to go tot he Centre island so you are in the middle as distances are more than they seem on the map. Boat trip great views , take public boat , much cheaper. lovely scenery.Kids park was good value if take unlimited pass.

Set aside a full day for this attraction. Take the family out and don't forget the picnic baskets. If you're into canoeing, you'll love the serenity and the tranquility this place has to offer. When the wetter is fine, you only need to take the ferry to the Toronto Islands to get the feeling of letting it all behind you. Your treat is a good view on the skyline of Toronto and a nice park to relax and have fun. Together with a boat tour in the harbour, this is probably the best part...

Nice little trip. Ferry is $7. Island has plenty of walking paths and bike paths, lots of parks and green space and beaches. A nice family break if you want to get away from the city without getting "away" from it.

This is an enjoyable facility with things for the whole family to do - from kayaking, tram ride, bicycling, swimming, and amusements to a quiet walk in the woods. We were a party of six adults and three children and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.
Took the water taxi over, rented a quadracycle to ride all over the islands, and then swam in Lake Ontario. Quite a fun way to spend the day.
It's like Disneyland for kids!! It was clean, beautiful, and so perfect for kids under 5 years old. What a wonderful and fun place. We will be back for sure!
Nice area to hang out and bike. But rental bikes are weird (no brakes, you have to pedal backwards).
It is a pretty great place with rides and a farm, but near the dining section there is lots of geese poop everywhere and that's disturbing.

The boat trip itself is one hour and the tour guides are fun and informative in sharing the history of the islands and Toronto's waterfront development. Went here on my last day in Toronto.Travelled by ferry to Ward's Island. We followed the one sign to information but never found it. Who knew that a $6 return ferry ride could offer so much in terms of relaxation, picnics, family fun or sightseeing.Toronto Island Park is by far, one of my favourite spots to bring folks who are visiting this city. Very easy to take the ferry to Toronto Islands - quick 7-8 minute ride. You can get some great pictures of the city from the ferry.

The Toronto Island Park was beautiful and well maintained. Two of my daughters would have liked more than the one day that we spent on the island. They especially enjoyed walking the beach looking for sea glass.
Walked over the entire island. Nice boardwalk, went in the lake at the beach. Took the ferry back at night. Only problem was restaurants closed at 6:00 so eat early or bring your own food

We had a group ranging in age from 5 to 75. We had only two days to spend in Toronto. Our initial plan to go to fashion district was foiled when the shops didnt look all that appealing and lots of construction going on. I would not hesitate to recommend that you visit the island's the ferry doesn't take long and with a picnic in tow it is the most amazing place. Peaceful with a beach and nice walks or hire a bike and cycle round the islands. Take a picnic and enjoy the park.
A lovely peaceful haven just a short ferry ride ($7 return) from Toronto Waterfront. 3 ferries to choose from - out by one, walk, back by another - a great day out when the sun shines

This island is accessed by a short ferry ride ($7 round trip). It is worth spending 4-6 hours. There is an amusement park for young children, a beach, areas for boating, bike rentals, walking trails, feeding ducks (bring bread) and more.

I have been to Toronto a number of times and never even knew about this getaway island. For $4 a ferry takes you on a 15 min ride to the island and you really feel like you are waiting for Jessica Lang to pop out on a bicycle. While it is only a short ferry ride from the city, this park is a real gem. There are walking paths or rental bikes, whatever your energy level and plenty of benches to relax and watch the scene. The Toronto Islands provided a green space and peaceful waterfront that the city sadly lacks. It was a simple and inexpensive way to escape the noise and dirt of the building site that is downtown Toronto! I hadn't been to Toronto Island in many years. There is a small area called Centreville on the island that is like a small amusement park for the children. Nice place but extremely busy if you go on a Saturday. We were there on a Friday and the ferry over to the island wasn't crowded. My husband and I walked...
Gardens beautiful and beach had great views. Short ferry ride over. Lots of walking trails to choose from.

I loved the boat ride over but be warned if you go on the weekend they don't always get you back to Toronto. I paid a bigger boat $5 so I could get back. If you go walk around to where the open stage area is on the front shore and get a large boat.
A great place to come for a whole day. A lot of things to do. there is a free zoo. a lot of picnic areas, a lot of beaches and an unforgettable view of Toronto skyline..

I revisited Center Island with my daughter and niece after a break of several years. The ferry ride over was still a delight and the Island itself still had the charm of beautiful pathways, small lakes and water inlets, great city views and of course, the amusement park. Nothing has really changed is all the years I've been there except...

It was very enjoyable. Boat ride from main land to island was good with beautiful sight. As you land on the island there are maps available so that you can familiars the place. Plenty of greenery and parks. Lot of picnic tables available. Exciting rides are to go crazy. We rented cycles and went around. It was very nice feeling...

We thoroughly enjoyed our day at the islands, from the ferry ride there, to the bike ride around and the walk back to catch a different ferry home. Toronto Island is one of the highlights for Toronto and should be on the checklist of all summer travellers. There are spectacular views of the city, both day and night and during the day it is quite beautiful to walk along the board walk. If you are looking to go for a run when in Toronto, consider going out to...

A guaranteed good time! I recommend bike riding did it with my cousins and we had a blast! The island is beautiful water is so clean. You need to take a ferry to get there but it's only $7 real cheap and worth it.

What a find this was. We took the short journey across to the main island and wandered around for the day, hiring a bike , having lunch and sitting on the beach. Great place to cycle with children and plenty of safe play areas. Next time will take a picnic.

Wonderful way to spend a morning in Toronto. The Centre Island is a bit soulless, but the island becomes genuinely charming as you walk towards the Ward's Island ferry dock, where there are also some lovely cafes where you can sit and enjoy the ambiance of the place.

I spent 2 days on the island (avoiding the Nudist beach at the north of the island) visiting the fun park, old houses, and east beach where we swam and sailed model boats.The weather was in our favor and we had an awesome time, the kids fun fair was absolutely amazing with adult rides shrunken down to kids level...

I love going to Toronto Island!! The ferry isn't to expensive and departs regularly. There are several different parks you can walk through and explore. There's a couple of different restaurants that have great menu items!! The Carousel Café is a personal favorite! If you've got young kids, take them to the amusement park, which is lots of fun! Take the ferry to the Islands. Relax, enjoy the fresh air or go down to Centerville and enjoy the day. Boat trip around the Islands are possible

Catch a ferry over to the island for a days fun on the beach. Brave the queue to get onto the ferry it is worth it. There is a large park and sandy beach. A few fast food stops such as Pizza and drinks. Better to pack a picnic. You can rollerblade too if you are so inclined.

We had a lovely walk on a sunny day in the week. We had such a great afternoon on Toronto island. The ferry over costs 7 dollars per adult for a round trip and goes every half an hour. We met some locals on the ferry who said that it's not just a place for tourists, but locals go there to chill out too.We hired bikes - 8 dollars per hour-...

Toronto Island has everything for everybody. restaurants, entertaining, beaches...etc.The only trouble is getting there. The ferry gets very busy during summer. This will be, hopefully, addressed, as Toronto is planing a bridge for quick car and pedestrian access and also a tunnel which is still under construction.I spent a whole quiet and relaxing day on the island. We got the boat out to Ward's Island beach and spent hours taking in the excellent views of the city and relaxing on the beach. For the price it's a must-do in the city and we're glad we went.
we spent a day on island - first time with family and so much to keep kids active will be back and as review say its lovely park and ferry ride is great  all rounder great

With just few minutes you enter a totally different world: From the busy, dynamic and corporate downtown Toronto, which by the way has its own vibe and jazz, into a nice, quiet and laid back island and natural surroundings.The first big change is the absence of the street noise as there are no cars allowed on the island. Plan a whole day out there. Ferry boats take you there for around $7 return trip. Plan to take some pics from the boat. Once on the Islands you have 3 main islands to choose from. It is worthwhile. The exhibits are fascinating and i suggest going with a friend. I liked how inspiring the place was. Well built and run in a proper and organized fashion
We chose to go by tour boat but could easily have taken the ferry at a much reduced cost. The tour boat did not add much to the day out.

We spent the day on Toronto Island with the family.It ws the first time all of the Grand Children were with us at the same time. :Lots of room to play and run. The food was Ok but it is a great place with lots to do to keep children occupied. The ferry ride was lots of fun.

We went down to the waterfront (at the foot of Bay Street at Queen's Quay), and found the "hidden" Bixi Bike stand near the Ferry Docks (on a rise of ground, screened by some trees). Rented our Bixi Bikes, then bought tickets and boarded the Toronto Island Ferry. Doesn't matter which ferry you choose (just board the next available), although...
Relaxed, beautiful and green is how I would describe this little oasis! Only let down is the litter but other than that it's beautiful!!Best way to get an amazing shot of the Toronto skyline!
My first home was on Central Island. Visit when I come to Toronto. Such a beautiful area for couples, families, and solos.

Scenic island a short ferry ride from the shore gets you to the fun and beauty of Ward's Island Beach. Bring your cooler full of food and beer! My ex-girlfriend and I had many a great day enjoying the sand and party scene at Ward's. The water is clean for swimming and by late June, it is warm enough. Get...

Cheap ferry $7 return or something, if your looking for an enjoyable free day out, just walk the 'coastline' and enjoy the many beaches (including a clothes optional one ;) (but brisk in march tho)) small restaurant and cafe, more during summer it looked like. But still nice
Great place to play at the numerous beaches, hire a bike or carriage and view the island. Can get very busy on the ferry and it is very tourisy.

I loved the island park, Its just perfect for a day out. You can take a ferry , Its take around half an hour to reach the park and then there are so many things to do at the island.Th ebeach at teh island is just so serne and peaceful.Must visit place

My husband and I visited the island during summer time. It's a very beautiful island. Renting a bike is a good and easy way to visit the whole island. There are many amazing spots where you can take really nice pictures. We really enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere on this small island.
I loved it. But you must to pay the boat to go to the Island (pay only one way).The Island is huge and there you can see nature, play baseball or go to the beach.

A visit to the Toronto Island was suggested to us, so of course we had to go and see what the fuss was about! A real hidden paradise right in thr city. A quick ferry ride to centre island and you'll have miles of island to explore

Not many cities have something as beautiful as the Toronto Island(s)! The only problem can be the long lines for the ferries. Hopefully a bridge or tunnel will someday be built.A great place to spend all day, hiking, boating, picnicking and swimming. Bring food along with you and be prepared for a lot of walking.

Such a great place to just get away from the wild buzz of the city. I took the family there for a bike ride and a picnic barbecue, and it was a day well spent. The weather, the view, the ferry ride, everything about the place was absolutely incredible.
i always used to visit when i was a child. best time to go during sunny day. Relaxing all day. everything is so neat. just wonder more food counter should be there. perfect for picnic.

The Toronto Islands are a hidden treasure. You are a short ferry ride from downtown Toronto. During the hot, humid days of summer this is a real oasis. But there is something missing. And why are the parks empty? The Toronto Islands lack the vitality of New York's Central Park.
The Toronto Islands are just a short ferry ride from the downtown and seem like it's another world. There are three ferry docks on the island and you can walk or ride a bike anywhere on the islands.
Ensure a sunny day. Take the ferry. feed the geese walk the park.See people. talk to them . visit the animal farm sit by the fountain see the skyline.Beautious

A really pretty park with lot's of open space, benches to eat picnics and beaches to relax on a hot day, also really nice views of Toronto city. The only downside being the boat rides, we had to wait over an hour to get a ticket for the boat, then a further 20 minutes to get onto the boat. We...

We took the ferry over to the Toronto Islands one afternoon during our trip to Toronto. The ferry costs $7 round trip, and makes stops at Ward's Island and Centre Island.There is an amusement park on Centre Island (though it was closed when we went). You can also rent bikes, or hang out on the beach.We took the...
I Loved it as a kid - Now I get joy out of taking my kids there. I have young kids and pre-teens and they all get a kick out of the rides. Perfect place to relax on a hot summer day!

We took the 15 minute ferry ride across to Centre Island for $7 roundtrip, and rented bikes. The island is not large, but it has beautiful views of the skyline and out into Lake Ontario. Quiet places to watch birds and see the many flowers and flowering trees that begin blooming in early May and last all summer.There's one...

This is a great place to spend a day walking, having a bike ride or picnic. The ferry ride is about 20 minutes. Personally the island could use a few more concession stands. The beaches are clean here and there are many places to bbq and have a nice picnic. Be sure to catch the dragon boat races that take...
This is really the best place in Toronto for relaxing, picnicing, playing with your kids, riding bikes and jogging.... really special place....
YOu will experience different type of toronto if you go and see the island. they even have a nude beach....

Pack a picnic, bring a frisbee or a bicycle. It's a nice way to get out of the city without having to drive. Each time I go there I feel like I've gone to heaven - you can still see Toronto, but from a happy green place with children playing and ice cream and a water fountain and no cars....

It was April 1st, 2013 and windy. Nothing counted except being in love with a handsome, intelligent and friendly gentleman while discovering a beautiful beach with a small playground. Running or walking around the island will make you hungry. Check out the schedule prior to your trip so you can enjoy a nice meal at the local restaurant that we...

Had a Saturday afternoon to explore the Toronto waterfront and noticed a ferry running to the Island. $10.00 for a round trip ride to a lovely island with a small theme park, places to eat , nice beaches, boat marinas, etc. Make sure you go to the back of the ferry to view the Toronto skyline on the ride over....
What a lovely little community this, beautiful homes, lovely walks and brilliant views of the City. highly recommended!
Some very beautiful spots and nice beaches, places to walk and more. Centre Island can be the spot for the fun, touristy types, but the smaller islands are like oases in the city.

Worth the ferry ride over to the islands. It's basically an all afternoon trip. Great views of Toronto, nice beaches, and don't miss the tram/bus ride around the island. Just a nice place to hang for a day.

living close to toronto on various occasions, toronto island is, without a doubt, one of the loveliest things to visit in toronto, in my opinion! the views from the island of the toronto skyline are unparalleled. taking the inexpensive ferry ride is instantly relaxing and soothing, and offers so many beautiful views for folks of all ages. and once you're...

I have lived in Toronto for my entire life. The Toronto Island Park is the first place I would suggest to someone visiting Toronto. The ferry across Toronto Harbour is a short but fun ride. Go early, as the ferries can get quite crowded on a nice summer day. The island has a small amustment park called "Centreville" and a...

This is a hidden gem in Toronto. Forgo the midway (Centreville) and rent a bike or canoe. Enjoy the beaches, the gardens, the fountains. There are plenty of spaces to be alone with your thoughts, or people watch. We go several times a summer and truly enjoy it. The ferry ride alone is a must to anyone visiting Toronto.

I just would like to say,it;s a wonderful place,the creator creates it by his own hand.it;s wonderful scenery will attracts the nature lover. Children,adults and seniors all will lost in natures beauty.

We spent half-a-day wondering around the islands. If you're looking for some peace from the city, this is the spot for you! Although we visited out of season, the kids enjoyed exploring the various lanes and looking at the view of downtown Toronto.

The Toronto Islands are like an oasis in the large city of Toronto. The parks are still very natural and offer lots of indigenous plants and wildlife. Since you have to take a short ferry ride to get there, it really feels removed from the bustling downtown area. A wonderful place to stroll and relax.

Toronto Island Park is a busy place in season. It is busy because it is so central to the action - only a short ferry ride away from downtown. There are some lovely beaches, interesting marinas and get-away spots in the region, but the park itself is unremarkable.

It has now become a bit of a tradition to take the ferry over whenever I am in Toronto to stroll around, have lunch, snap some great photos and just breathe. I have experienced winter, spring and fall to date...looking forward to summer!
OMG, I love this small island was bit cold though but really enjoyed it. best time to visit would be after may.
i visited it in april, nothing was there and it was very cold, the best part was the picture because you can see toronto city from there and take very good pictures
It's not really busy during the week so its great for riding your bike around the island. The Franklin Park is really cute for kids. The beach is nice. Other then that nothing really to see.
It feels like you are miles away from the city. However from several points you can look back and see a spectacular view of the city. Nice beach. Nice restaurant -the Rectory. Lovely experience.

Taking the feery over is the first fun experience get there is like a day away from everything whole new little world.Ride bikes eat your picinic lunch walk around enjoy feeding the ducks.Just a nice peaceful day

I had the chance to visit Toronto Island with my 16 and 2 year old. The ferry ride over was I guess you would say nice but the view was out of site of the skyline. We took the 5 min ride over and walked around until we found a playground that my 2 year old enjoyed! Next time I...

If you are visiting Toronto or a local that has not made the trip to Toronto Island...you're missing a gem. Toronto Island is a wonderful parkland with a tremendous view of the city.
