I like everything about the Toronto Islands. They make Toronto a great city to live in, visit and enjoy.
Nice to take the ferry and visit the Island Park. Always something going on. Great views of the surrounding area.
A little piece of heaven close to the city but seems far from noise. This island is one of the few places where cars are not allowed. It also has nice beaches.

Pros:- Easy escape from the hustle of city life- Really pretty, lots of greenery- Riding your bike on the boardwalk is amazingCons:- Terrible restaurants- Really busy on weekends- Wish the island was a bit bigger

I don't usually rate the destinations in my own city, but TripAdvisor has just asked me to.I go to the Toronto Islands all the time in the spring and summer, either hopping the ferry or paddling there by sea kayak from the Harbourfront with the Harbourfront Canoe and Kayak Center.The ferry is quite reasonable and a nice ten...

If the weather is good, this trip is a must. Line up for the ferry will be long so be prepared for it. If kids are small, there is an amusement park and other stuff to be done over there. Beaches to cater to all people. Even a beach for people who like to be in the birth suit. Enjoy.
went on a sunday afternoon,it was nice and relaxing,good getawayit is very peaceful there,although we were there on a busy day.
Good place for a picnic within the city. It is also great place for kids to play with the sand on the beach or the play areas within the park. very good place for families to spend quality time.
Very joyfully and pleasant outdoor active experienceYou can spend hours walking from one end of the island to another

This tranquil little island is a gem to find. If you visit in winter, wrap up as it is freezing cold. In summer, you can enjoy cycling or walking the island. We ate at the Rectory Cafe, which was wonderful. Very short ferry ride to and from the mainland.

Most Torontonians don't really appreciate how unique a space this is. Take kids to the park, go for a long walk, rent a tandem bike, go to the beach, go to the nude beach, go rollerblading without a ton of traffic... The list of activities is endless. The biggest hint is to pre-purchase your tickets during the week to completely...
Take a blanket, and pack your picnic basket. Nothing better than a day on the island. Be sure to rent a bike and check out the whole place ... like the whole place.

A great escape! Delightful day out from the city, especially when it's hot. Try to go in the week, as the ferry and the islands are really packed at weekends. We hired a cool 2-person trike with a canopy - sit back and relax as you pedal, a lovely way to get around the park. There are very nice cafes.

You take a reasonal priced ferry over to the island that in it self is fun for the kids....you can go to the amusement park or jus walk around the island! There are beaches ( even nude beaches) you can rent bikes on the east side of the island their are pretty cottage like homes. You don't half to walk...
So much to do here in the summer...haven't tried visiting in the fall though. Nice little oasis in busy Toronto.
A few minutes ferry ride away from downtown Toronto takes you to a lovely scenic island, nice to escape the city and relax... however the facilities and attractions are a little outdated/ 70's style.
I go there all the time. I come from Nova Scotia and I love the ocean and here in Toronto it is as close to the ocean as I can get.

Tired of the big city and its light, noise, pollution and crowd. Come here for a day of relaxation amongst nature. This is a very beautiful park covering the Toronto Islands. It encompasses a theme park for kids, several beaches and other attractions. There is much to do for everyone here.You get the tickets from the harbourfront and then...

Great place to stroll; enjoy the Toronto skyline from the lakeside; a wonderful picnic spot for family and friends; rent a bike and tour the islands; spend a day at the beach in the city away from the city; enjoy the ferry ride; a low budget day.
This amazing park is only a stones throw from downtown Toronto by ferry. It is a quiet place and thus I enjoy going there if only to get away from the hectic life in Toronto.

Beautiful park to visit, there are lots of great walking/biking trails. It's perfect for anyone that wants to get a breathe of fresh air away from the city, while literally being a few kilometres away from the downtown core. It's a large place so if you're planning to do some walking, wear comfortable shoes and pack some snacks and water.
Hard to believe this is toronto. Beautiful park setting. take the fairy ride across to the island. Many people camp there but you can just take a picnic away from busy Toronto downtown.

Every time I have visitors I head to Toronto Island Park. The city can be so overwhelming; especially for out-of-towners and friends from Britain. It's a 15 minute ferry trip over and the sense of peace and tranquility when you get there makes your day.I always head to the Harbor Cafe before coming home. Simple but good.An oasis...
Great place to spend the day. Go to the beach, bring kids to the craft and garden areas, have a picnic or go to the restaurant.
was amazing to walk around scenery is amazing and the beach was fantastic to walk along the only thing was the price of hiring the bikes for an hour 40 dollers is a bit to much
Away from the city, the park is a nice place to relax, play some sports and have fun with family and friends.
Never knew there was a beach like that in Toronto! And the dragonflies! Crazy there were so many. Totally terrific for a summer afternoon.

Whether or not you are a first-time visitor to Toronto or not, the 12-minute ferry ride alone across Toronto Harbour to "the Island" (actually three interconnected islands: Wards, Centre and Algonquin) is worth the $7.00 (return fare is included). You are now a refugee from the city's air and noise pollution. The immediate spa-like soothing of the senses as tonic...

So lovely to come here summer or fall. It feels so wonderful to leave the city behind and view it from the tranquility of Toronto Island. I love birdwatching here. Lots of migrants to see. One unfortunate thing is that the flights from Tor Island Airport make it impossible to enjoy birdwatching or walking at Hanlan's Point. A great disappointment.

A trip to Toronto Island on the ferry is a must when visiting Toronto . You can take a picnic lunch and spend the day. We biked around the island, picnicked on the shore, and played in the water. Such a great place to stop. There is no fee for the island, but you must pay for the ferry ride...
Best view of the Toronto skyline, just a pleasant ferry ride from the docks at the foot of Yonge Street. Children's amusement park and rides. Scenic lagoons and nice beaches.

The islands are a neat place to visit, short boat ride over. Has a nice little beach, boat house, bike rentals etc. Excellent views looking back over to the city. Nice place to play ball, jog, relax, picnic away from the crowds.

Take the Ward's Island Ferry, visit the cottages / homes.Swim on the outer beach at Ward's and then walk or Bike to the west end.a few restaurants for lunch along the way. AVOID Center Island.Leaving Hanlan's Point back to the mainland. Western beach is GLBT and naturist friendly, not particularly family friendly.

Lovely ferry ride across at a very reasonable fee. Lots to explore and beautiful beautiful grounds and beaches. Rent bikes for a great way to get around or bring your own. Eating choices are fair but picnic is the way to go.
NIce beaches and quiet getaway. The ferry ride line up can be a bit annoying in the hot sun, but overall its a good way to spend the day.
Whenit is hot the ferry takes you to the island, lots of green, walking for those who like it, simple restaurants to keep you fed and gamens galore
Great beaches for swimming. No cars! Great cafe with good music. Wonderful place to watch the fireworks. Feels like the city is a far away place, but with a great skyline if that's your thing.

If you're staying near the lake, walk to th efoot of Bay Street and take the Ferry over. If you have a larger group, consider taking a water taxi fom York Quay, one block west of Bay. The island is divided into 3 sections, Ward's island, on the east side, has most of the residents. Centre Island has the children's...
Love going to Toronto Island park! It is another world away from busy downtown Toronto and is only a short and enjoyable ferry ride away.

We asked our bartender for suggestions on what to do in Toronto and this was the place to be.When we turned up to get our tickets, the rest of Toronto seemed to be in agreement. Unfortunately this meant queues about 3 metres long right out onto the street, in the boiling hot sun. So far as we could see,...
Spent a lovely afternoon walking the island. Hadn't been there for years. Hard to believe you are ten minutes from downtown. Worth a visit, even if you live here.
A good place to walk, do a picnic and hangout with your partner. Also has a nice view from Toronto and the lake.
It was a treat to cycle in a park so late in the season to find the pathways clear, the grassy areas clean and the washrooms open and in excellent condition.
I Definitely reccomend this park for couples or families with little ones, its a park so youll expect what you will expect community park but they have a farm and etc....

Liked: Peaceful, we packed a picnic lunch and headed over for a picnic and walk. we also rented bikes.Dislike: Wait for ferry time, to wait then have the ferry totally full and have to wait for the next one. But I guess that is just public transit :)
hey that was really fun. the beach was really cool becuase you can go kiteboarding adn there are lots of boats and sea doos. the girls are not too shabby eighter
Though it is winter, accessible still by the Ward's Island Ferry. Great walking and overall calmness!

I enjoyed the the transfer by ferry and the view on Toronto form the island.It is a very quiet and green place. There are also spots where you can make a picnic in the tree's shade near water with the view on CN Tower.It was quite windy and cold in the evening so take a backpack with a...
I love the Islands - the ferry, the beaches, the sunsets, the cottages. And the view of the city!!! It's an escape to a different world.
Take your time, enjoy. It is a nice enjoyable environment, not crowded, amazing view. Ferry can be crowded at times though so be ready. Lots to see.

This was such a great place to go. When you are not in a hurry and just want to stroll and walk and have a picnic, this is the place for you. This place has amazing views of the city skyline. The ferry ride over was a little crowded but nothing to get bent out of shape about. The ride...
Offers a great view of Toronto, great place to take children and enjoy a wonderful day out! Lots to see and do!

Not much has changed from when I went to Centre Island, to now, when I bring my own children. That's what makes it so special. It's not overstimulation like most theme parks. Just lovely easy going rides, and a train that travels through Centreville. There's a nice splash pad in the summer, and the ferry ride to and from the...
Beautiful. Relaxing. Peaceful. A great place to walk and enjoy the fresh air. Playground and park for the kids.
toronto island is worth the trip if you want to take it easy or go on a romantic walk. also great for kiteboarding.

While you may wait a long time for a ferry on a warm summer weekend, Toronto Island is an oasis in the concrete of Toronto.Moreover, the beaches on Toronto Island are always open for swimming. Bring a lunch or try one of the restaurants. A great little diversion.
This is the best place to have a day out of Toronto yet you're only 10 minutes away. Lots of fun and activities and the best view of Toronto's sea front.

We had a wonderful day exploring - ferry ride to and from and a wander around, then we decided to rent a 'bicycle built for two' and take a ride around the island. We enjoyed the walk out on the pier and looking over the water. Hard to believe we were so close to the city - it felt a...

This is one of the most beautiful places around Toronto. The short Ferry / boat ride gives a lovely view of Quen's quay and Lakeshore area. Then, the beautiful amusement areas and restaurants and park are fun place to enjoy with friends or family or as I enjoyed a co-workers' corporate get together.

Whether you want to visit the amusement park area or just walk along the peaceful shoreline, this is a great place to visit. You can bring your own picnic lunch or purchase food there. The trip over and back on the ferryboat is an added bonus.

There is lots to do and the ride over is cheap and fun. Great views of Toronto from the island. Lots of activities for the kids in the summer and the amusement park is lots of fun and fairly reasonable. Food is a bit sketchy at times but there are a number of options.It is worth several visits to...
A short walk to the ferry, take Hanlan's point, not nearly as crowded. A 10 minute walk to the beach side and wow a huge beach with every thing nearby. HINT; take lots of drinks and snacks.
I really liked Toronto Island and was very impressed. The views are breathtaking and whole island is clean and very aesthetic.
Kids love the Ferry Boat ride to the Island... Spent many years going to while my children were growing up. We have had a lot of good memories and pictures.

Toronto Island is a very popular park. Everybody likes it and I can understand why  this area is well maintained and picturesque. To get there you have to buy a ticket to a ferry ($7) which cruises every 30 minutes. Once youre there you have a lot of things to do. You can rent a bike, skate, make barbecue...

I spent my last day in Toronto relaxing at Toronto Island Park, i took the ferry across and was totally amazed by this place, what a great place to visit. You had the best of everything here, the large grounds have lots of space for families to have a picnic, there is a childrens amusement area, a beach to relax...

this is a ferry ride from downtown toronto which is great by its self the park offers great walking paths u can take bikes or rent bikes when u get there lots of places for picnics there are lots of places to eat should you chose there are beaches for swimming also amusements for the kids and a nice petting...

Wow what a place, we went there during the week and the place was empty! We had the beach to ourselves, was amazing the only negative was seemed to be a lot of flies around which got a bit annoying. Whilst on the islands, we also hired some bikes and went from one end to the other and was very...

This is a $5 (Canadian) Ferry Ride to a wonderful island in the middle of Lake Ontario. I consider it my Top Attraction for Toronto for value! You can go to the beach, there's a kids petting zoo, there's a small theme park with rides for the kids for a fee. All we did was to walk around and enjoy...

The Island is wonderful - lots to see and do, with beautiful walking trails and views of the city skyline. But NEVER go there for a festival or concert! Since you have to wait for the ferry, you'll be stuck there for hours,,,

I really enjoyed the Islands, pretty much covered all of them. There are a lot of interesting spots to visit, like Gibraltar Point Lighthouse, and the views are terrific. Plan to spend several hours and bring a picnic lunch unless you don't mind waiting in line and paying inflated prices at the food concessions. The only drawback of the Islands...
We only had time for the ferry trip but we were in Toronto out of season and things closed down before we arrived for the year. I think it would be lovely in summer?
A really great way to spend a day in the Summer. A nice park with things to do with the children. Good range of food and actives on offer. Nice to take the boat across from the main city.
an escape from the noise of the city, serene and a good place to walk around. The only downside for us was the waits between ferries, but that was our fault for not planning better

What a beautiful place to go to relax and just 10 minutes from the city. The sound of the water on the beach is so relaxing. The view we had of Toronto is terrific. I recommend this little island park to everyone who goes in that big city and have some time to visit and relax. What a "great" day...

Most children and adults that are young at heart like a visit to Toronto Island Park. It is a fun trip on the ferries that serves as the only way to get to the island. On a sunny day it provides a great view and photo opportunity of the Toronto downtown skyline. The park has an amusement ride area all...

the ride on the ferry gives a great view of Torontothe park is too wide for walking but bikes can be rentedif you are on foot stay in the center part where the restaurants arevisit the top of the pier into Lake OntarioCenterville is great if you have children with you

We visited the CN Tower on a sunny day and, although it was busy and it took a few minutes to get our tickets, we were into the speedy elevator and up in no time. There are two levels to visit. The first option is the main deck that everyone goes to and there two levels- a completely enclosed level...

This truly was a nice park! Very scenic and such a cool, chill place. Had fun just walking around the park. We visited one of the restaurants there where they served iced cream and other little snacks and it was good. Nice place to spend the day if you just want to relax.

A short ferry trip across to the island. So beautiful and paceful when we got there, a lovely long walk. Trees were a stunning Autumn colour a lovely place. However, when we visited, a few places closed. Our son visited a couple of weeks earlier and a lot more places open.

This is perfect for people seeking a getaway from the city for a few hours. The islands are reached by a 10 minute ferry ride. Only 1 terminal is open during the Winter at Ward's Island. Although a lot of the attractions are closed at this time there is still plenty to see on a nice walk, bike ride or...

Just a 15 minute ferry ride from Toronto, this series of connected islands is a quiet slice of small town life. For a $7 ticket, you get a short ferry ride with great views of the skyline. On a chilly October day, only the Island Cafe was open for business, but we enjoyed walking around the quiet roads and taking...

a short ferry ride away from the hustle and bustle of the city Toronto Island Park helps the stress ease away.great to walk, ride a bike or keep fit by running or swimming. a truly relaxing place with great views of the city. Tour the whole island from the beautiful houses, beaches, even the lighthouse and take a break...

Ward's Island is inhabited by permanent residents. They seems extremely friendly as a group of us, went to take pictures, do some acrylic painting, and eat in local cafes.It's worth the trip on the Ferry.... but wait until Summer approaches and it's warmer.

I went there just after the beginning of the winter, so on one hand everything was closed so all you could do was walk and enjoy the views, on second hand not too many people there.The walk was nice, around 3-4 hours to go to the other edge of the island and back (in the winter the ferry only...
Great view, wonderful venue. Ferry over and bring a pick nick. Can be dark at night, bring a light and consider the weather.

Getting there with the antique ferry while enjoying the receding Toronto skyline is already half the fun. Visiting in October at the prime of the fall foliage season, with rides closed walking around the island was sheer joy for us. It is definitely worth a visit of a couple of hours even in the off-season.

Went over just before the Winter ferry season kicked in. Most facilities on the island were closed but bikes still available for hire.Was sunny and warm while we were there but the wind was blowing (and rather chilly) on the far side from Toronto. Good spot to visit (but I would expect it to be very busy in high...

We visited in October but I guess this beautiful location really shines in summer. Although we thoroughly enjoyed the boardwalk and beaches it must be absolutely stunning on a warm summers day. The ferry ride over was quick, cheap & easy and there are a couple of cafes open in the winter months, especially the Rectory Cafe which deserves a...

whilst staying in torronto and visiting the normal attraction, we were advised by locals to visit Toronto Island Park a good value for money day out. It was easy to find the terminals as there are three points of departure across the lake in toronto each will take you to different points of the island so you don't have to...

In our week-long trip to three different cities, this was my absolute favorite few hours of the trip. We rented bikes for a very reasonable price, and comfortably cycled around the island. They have a great map that makes it easy to get around. I would recommend coming into the main part of the island. If you don't rent bicycles...

Been there twice, amazing place with gorgeous view of Toronto Skyline for photographers. It's always something to eat, to drink, to do and to see there! You can take a water taxi or go there by boat, it's always fun to be on a boat with such a view of the Toronto. Great place. Definitely recommend going there.

Toronto Island offers great beaches to relax in, and the cycling experience is great, level land enjoying the perfumes of gardens, while admiring people's homes and their gardens. Peaceful and calming. The ferry boats ride is a great experience. I have been going to the island on-and-off for 40yrs. Always a great time
Kinda dumpy, not well tended but a decent walk nonetheless. Like many parks, this place has that dog park feeling and you do not want to sit under a tree.

It is very commercial on one hand, on the other you can walk around and find very quiet corners to look at the lake, go into the water for a swim at the beaches or read a book in the grass. Wonderful view of the city-silhouette of Toronto, especially at dawn. The ferry-boats are included in the city-ticket of public...

It's a nice and close-by escape from the buzz of the centre, with a lot of green, quiet paths, picnic areas and a little amusement park for very small children. There's also a small farm with animals. It's a nice visit if you want to be in the nature, but don't expect too much to see.

It was a nice boat trip over and the gardens are quite nice and it's a great place to go for a bike ride but there was nothing open other than 1 cafe when we visited in late September. They said there was a casino there which we thought might be worth a look but could only find a big...

We took the ferry over to the Island. This was very good.The Islands are really peaceful. The trees, flowers and wildlife beautiful. Take a picnic, sit and enjoy the stunning views. Great place to take some fantastic photos of the Toronto skyline.

We took the ferry over and spent an afternoon on the island. Although alot of the attractions were closed for the season, the gardens were still beautiful. We rented a tandem bike and explored the island that way - fun!

When family from ouit of town comes to visit, I like to take them on the boat tours around the idland and then get off, go for a nice walk and see Toronto skyline from a short distance. No one has ever been disappointed. Lots of nature like birds, children laughing and playing...feel good day

This was return visit to Toronto for us and was number one on our family's list of things to do again. This beautiful, traffic-free environment is a great place to unwind. Rent a bike and explore.The east end has some delightful houses and there are several beaches along the southern lake shore, as well as plenty of places to take...

The toronto islands are quite idyllic, and nice during our off-peak visit (apparently it's ridiculously busy during the summer). You pay for the ferry to take you to any of the 3 docks on the islands and its worth renting a bike, or bringing your own. The beaches are nice and you get great views of the toronto skyline as...
If the line ups to get a ferry are very long consider a water taxi instead for about $8-10 each instead
It's a nice place to visit but could be so much more, seems to be undercatered for tourists - no where decent to eat, limited entertainment for kids, best thing were the tandem bikes!

Wile we visited in September after Labor Day, much was closed down. We found the islands peaceful and serene - I'm sure unlike what the summers must be like. If its a nice fall day and you're looking for a quiet walk, this could be ideal.

an absolutely adorable place to go with family. the day we went we were pleasantly surprised the admission to the ferry was free because of a company advertising their products as we proceeded to the island the company had a beach party which included free giveaways. I came back with bags, a water bottle, a picnic set, and sunglasses

Haven't been for a while, but sure miss it. Loved to take the kids, rides are just enough and the park is just beautiful. You can take a picnic or buy food there. A really nice get away from the big city and not that far!!
We had a great time (family group of 5) on the Islands. It is a short and easy ferry ride and then there are many activities. We chose cycling and can recommend that.

Quick easy trip on the ferry gets you to a world away from the noise, people, traffic, and concrete jungle! And lots of things to do, or not, including dining choices! Check it out for a break from the concrete jungle.

It was so good we made it a second time, early, to get breakfast in the marina of Center Island facing the Toronto skyline. The round trip with the town ferries is 7 CAD each and it leads you up to delight ! I dont speak about nature, cleanliness of the place, wild animals... Perfect !

Since the park is an island, a visit is more of a trip than just a brief visit. It's a place you visit for part of a day - not just a stroll through. The view of the downtown buildings is quite beautiful from the island/ferry - especially at sunset!

For a $7 ferry ride (round trip), this is very worthwhile to visit. Several places to eat on the island or you can bring a picnic basket and eat in the grassy areas. Has beach areas to enjoy the water and trails all over the island to walk around and enjoy the scenery. Plenty to do and see for most...
Beautiful oasis on the edge of the city. Cheap ferry crossing and lots of space to walk around in the fantastic parkland.
We spent several hours on the island and enjoyed the ferry ride and the peaceful atmosphere.The beaches were lovely and there were some amazing trees.

I had been to Toronto in fall/winter but never in summer, so on our July trip we hopped on the ferry and headed out to the island with the locals. Lots of families, couples, kids, bikes, picnic baskets, and the like headed out to ride around the island, enjoy the beach or the amusement park, and escape the city on...

We had a great time in TO toward the end of our honeymoon, but one of the great treats was to pop on a ferry for $7 each (return fare!) and explore the Toronto Islands - especially on one of the quadricycles from the bike rental place. Beautiful scenery at dusk, and some interesting history highlighted here and there (Babe...
Great place to spend a day. Walking, biking and beaching available. The Rectory cafe on Ward's island was very nice.

This was our first visit to Toronto Island and were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful it is. We took the Island tour, it takes about half hour to get there and you can stay for as long as you want then finish the tour on the way back.The views are spectacular. There are so many different views as you...
Loved wading in a rockwall-protected swim area, the pretty park-like environment and the quick but pretty boat ride over, especially coming back in twilight.
If only it was a bit warmer. Nice place to stroll, hang out with friends and bring a picnic lunch or dinner.

The views from here can't be beat! Take a picnic with you, and make sure you go on a sunny day to enjoy it. Lots of walking paths (or biking if you bring yours or rent one) as well as a restaurant to eat at.Great for people of all ages!

Had a wonderful respite from the city during the Toronto International Film Fest, by taking the ferry across the lake to Wards Island where you can enjoy hiking, biking, sitting on the beach, watching the sail boats, a picnic, and the best views of the Toronto skyline....just lovely and not to be missed.

We were on the harbour cruise that stops at the Island, so we got off and had a look around. There is more there than we had time to do. At the theme park the rides seemed to be mainly aimed at families with little kids, so we just looked around and had an ice cream before getting back on...

I was surprised how quiet it was on the island, just a short ferry ride from this bustling city. Renting bikes on the island is easy but they may not be the easiest to ride--bring one from the City that you like or be flexible. Great place to photograph the Toronto Skyline.

We went to Center Island for just $7, and spent half a day in there. The areas are great. Very clean a lot of nature, nice surroundings and play grounds. It was great for my 1yr. old was running all around. The only bad thing is that the bicycle rentals were somehow expensive. We ate at Carrousel and it was...

I took a boat ride through my City Sightseeing Toronto Tour to the Toronto Islands. The boat ride once it begun was outstanding and I got to see the three islands. Each are unique and beautiful in their own way. One was particularly crowded on the day of my tour. Learned a lot of people flock to the islands during...
We went in late September so everything is closed. It's a pretty island but other than that not much to see. We are from BC so it was disappointing in comparison

We really enjoyed the calm on the island, and really loved seeing the small animal farm. The animals are well looked after, and the farm itself is clean and tidy. There are lots of picnic tables and BBQ, lots of green space and flowers. It's a refreshing break away from the city. Just an fyi, you can bring a bike...

We were recomended to go there and we went on our last night. It was a very nice trip, the ferry wasnt expensive and the island is very nice, we had lunch in a restaurant there and the food wasnt very good but the staff was friendly
Enjoyed the ferry ride out to the Islands. Bike and boat rentals available. Great walking and quaint restaurant, The Rectory.

It is not a good idea to go there when you dont like kids, because there are running and screaming here everywhere. And one important advice - take your own food with you - restaurants on the island are quite expensive and the quality of food isn't very high.
The Island is a good place to take the family. We enjoyed the ferry ride, the nature on the Island, the restaurants, and we rented bycicles, which was a very cool experience.

We spend like halfday here .... It's better go at afternoon so you can see the daylight and night view of skyline of Toronto .... Don't forget to eat funnel with vanilla ice cream strawberry on it because you get tired walking allarround park .....don't miss it !!!!!! Happy journey

Scenery we took the visit Toronto tour bus and this hour long visit was included in the itinerary . We took this boat trip from the harbour we were very lucky to have a sunny day as the day before it was raining cats and dogs we took nice photos
After taking the Island Ferry I felt I was miles away from Toronto. Very relaxing. Looking back across the lake in the evening at the Toronto skyline was breathtaking.

Liked being on the boat that took me to the Island and back. It is well worth spending a day on the Island - the plants are great and there is so much to see - and you wouldn't believe that you're just off downntown Toronto.

Just a short ferry ride from Downtown Toronto brings you to a lovely tranquil island. About 4 miles long so good opportunity for walking. In many places feels like being by the sea (though obviously it isn't - it's a lake!). They even have the odd "beach" (one for naturists). Some fantastic views over the water back to Toronto, limited...

We go cycling on the Island several times per summer. One of the favourite ways of spending a Saturday or a Sunday. Parking at cherry beach, cycling to the ferry or the taxi, getting off at Wards island, enjoy a cappuccino and desert at the Island Caffee, cycle to a beach pass Center island, picnic, sunbathe, cycle all the way...

Excellent place for day out and a picnic. Gets busy at the weekends, especially when the amusement park is open. I have always gone on a quieter day. Bikes for hire and there are swimming beachs, some for optional clothing!Great views of Toronto and CN tower and on the other side of the island of the lake.

this is a nice day trip as your take a ferry from downtown toronto (Bay st)... this can be called an easy escape from the city.. the city has the cheapest ferries while there are other companies offering similar service and claiming that the city service takes 3 hours wait time... that's not the case....

Take one of the three regular ferries that cross to different parts of the island - go out on one, have a pleasant day out walking around the island, and return on a different one. Great views of the city. Several places for snacks and meals. There is also a fun area for kids and boat hire.

Because I have not paddled to the Toronto Islands for about 17 years, I decided to finally visit this unique part of Toronto again. After parking the car at Cherry Beach, we carried the canoe several meters across the beach. A lot of people decided to make the most of the nice weatherthere were plenty of windsurfers, sailing boats, yachts...

The park is beautiful to walk or cycle through. The lighthouse was very interesting, I only wish it was open. Had an unfortunate issue with my knee, but was helped out by a very friendly park employee who drove me to the ferry dock. We will definitely go again and perhaps stay in one of the B&B's. Loved it!

The islands are lovely to walk through. The lighthouse was interesting (wish it had been open). Had an unfortunate episode with my knee but was assisted by a very nice park employee who drove me to the ferry dock. Will definitely go back again and perhaps stay in one of the B&B's. Loved it!

You feel like you've left the hustle and bustle of the city, and yet it is still in view. Centreville is just super for younger kids and the rest of the island is wonderful for a walk or bikeride. Feel your blood pressure fall as you board the ferry and enjoy your day 'away from it all'. One of my...

Quick ferry ride to the park. Lots for the kids to do, with a beach, small water/amusement park. You can take a bike ride around the entire island. Good idea to bring a picnic because both restaurants are very expensive. About 10 buck a sandwich. A small ice cream sunday cup costs 5 dollars!

Would recommend highly. Lot's of great memories of the ferry and the island. Better in summer for biking and walking. Enjoy the oh so close escape from city life. Fun for the whole family and an inexpensive outing.
Nice to escape the noise of the city for a couple of hours. Great place to take photo's of the city skyline

what a perfect getaway from the busy cemented city....a short ferry ride and you are surrounded by beaches, not a car in sight! where you can while away the day eating icecream, reading in the sun, going to the kids amusement park...spectacular!

Came to the film festival and had a day to myself. The ferry ride was cool, the view on the city worth the trip, but it's when you get to the island that you see the real beauty.I didn't have time to do and see everything and the amusement park was closed, but it was like a little green...

You know youre in for an adventure the moment you set off on the ferry to the islands. For me, visits to the toronto islands are a must in the summer. Whether its a relaxing day in the sun, a picnic, fishing, a date or that iconic skyline shot from one of their rented canoes, the islands offer an oasis...

Many take advantage of being away from the city bustle while still close to the city. Access by boat. The shores are stunning and many activities like sailing, swimming, sun bathing, sight seeing and more...

Beautiful island which provides with lot of activities for children, teenagers, adult & senior citizen. What I liked most was people coming as family & having good time with their children. People also came in groups and were having fun with bar-beque & games being played. I and my friends rented bicycles and moved around island. It had lovely small...

The islands are a perfect getaway from the city. From the quaint cottages of Ward's island, the boardwalk, the Centre Island attractions to the spacious open parkland ending at the clothing optional Hanlan's Point beach. Something for everyone. Take a picnic and go for the day. It's a different world just minutes from downtown.
Beautiful park. Took the ferry. Tried a quadracycle. Good fun! After sept long weekend and on a weekday not everything open. Still a beautiful place to visit and a great contrast to downtown Toronto.

We loved the ferry ride. Was $7 for both ways.We enjoyed renting a double bicycle, and explored the island on both sides. Beautiful views of the lake, the greens, and there are alot of families picnicing there. Very family oriented place.
Spent the day at Toronto Island Park in July and it is certainly a beautiful place to spend a hot summer day.

We went with our 7 year old daughter and the little amusement park was the perfect speed for her. The cost was around $35 and it was very reasonable for the value provided. Beautiful setting to wander around and enjoy the pretty scenery back to the city of Toronto. There was a darling little mini farm, very historical. Wear comfortable...

I love the Islands, love the layout, the atmosphere, the quirky cottages, the view across to Toronto's skyline - its just so different when you leave the bustle of the city and go across to the Islands. There is lots to do there, great for children and adults alike. Its a must visit if you go to Toronto.

Cheap ferry $7 over to the islands. Pretty views of Toronto. Bike or canoe (I hired a canoe) available at reasonable cost. Easy to navigate around and lunch at the cafe nice too. One word of advice is that Centreville (the small theme park for children) closes early in the season so check before you leave.
This oasis of fun on the lake is brilliant for the kids and parents alike. The ride across on a water taxi only adds to the pleasure and there is plenty to do.

Worth the ridiculous lines for the ferry or the extra money for the water taxi, this is a great place to spend the day on a 'floating central park' just within reach of down town. You can rent bikes, splash and cool off in the little pools, play in the small amusement park, or just stroll around. You really do...
This beach is fine but bland. there are no special features to it. It's clean and tidy so good for children.

Toronto Island park is built to bring joy to its visitors of all ages. accessible mainly by ferry, and not at all by road, it blends meadow, woodland, and more organizsed play areas in one large island. A special attraction for youngsters is "Centretown" where rides comes in all sizes, to suit even the smallest bodies. A great day out...

OK, this may sound sad. We stayed on the Toronto Islands for a week and visited this Cafe/Restaurant 11 times! There isnt much choice on the Islands but this place has a coffee stop, restaurant and bar so met all of our needs. The food was good, there is plenty of choice and the coffee, beers, burgers and Ginger Mojitos...
Excellent, weather very hot! Spent all day on the beach, water very cold, but refreshing, beaches quite stoney, food expensive, but we took our own food and drink - great day!!

The view of the Toronto Skyline ,fresh air!A very unique perspective.this is a place for biking,walking strolling or picnicing.there are enjoyable activities suitable to a host of interestsAn ideal way to enjoy the park is with a group of friends

I have been going to the island for my whole life but my pattern of use has changed quite a bit now that I have a family. As a kid we always went to Hanlan's Point to the beach and then worked our way over to Centreville Amusement Park then home from Centre Island. Well, Hanlan's point now has clothing...
Lovely parks, nice beach and easy to reach by ferry. Didn't visit Centreville but it looked good for small kids.

Everyonevlovevthe Island. It's small quaint, easy to get to and a great place overall to walk, stroll, rollerblade, cycle and of course sail. The island offers everything from eating, drinking, bathing etc. owned by most of the city, its holds it's reputation for cleanliness and well manicured lawns and parks. Only minutes from the dock you can spend the day...

We stopped at St Lawrence Market (close by) to get everything needed for a picnic lunch - that worked out really well. You can take either the ferry ($7) or a boat tour to get there. The boat tour is not worth it if you pay full price - but there are 2 for 1 coupons readily available (from Ontario...

Grew up in Toronto, and remember fondly of my parents taking me to the island, Took my 3 year old on day off. First, all the parking is gone and is replaced by condo towers, you have to pay $15 to get parking, and the ferry (costs $7/person). Before you are on the island, you are down $40 cash, no...

A lazy afternoon spent wandering around the Island easily makes you forget you are minutes from one of the world's busiest cities. The beaches are beautiful and the vista from the pier on the far side of the Island is remarkable. Great place for a picnic or a family outing, too. Food tends to be a bit pricy, though.
Despite the crowds from Labor Day, we loved visiting the Island - renting a double bike and riding around. :)

Nice getaway. Good beaches for kids to take a swim.In the central area the food is not great. However, there is a little island cafe on the western side of the island that is sublime.Make sure you get the right ferry as the island is long - I recommend Wards Island more than the central area for a...

Toronto is a big and hectic city. Although the street level buzz feels good there are a lot of queues and some pushy people. Althoguh there is a queue to get to the island there's enough space to relax, unwind and enjoy the beach.

Took the ferry over for $7 return and enjoyed the lake, parks trees and watching all the families , complete with their children and dogs enjoying themselves, so close to the city - its another world but so different. Beaches for the lake and big white geese, lakes, paddle pools, boats, bridges, gardens, flowers, big trees and grassy areas, cafes....
A fun place for kids. Lots to do from an amusement park and splash pad to bike rentals. A really fun way to spend an afternoon!

We took a tour of the harbour which had an option to stop at the islands, we spent a few hours on the island which was very enjoyable. It was a sunny day so we walked around the island exploring and ended the day with a game of mini golf before rejoining the boat tour. Would reccommend taking a picnic...

The Toronto Islands are a lovely place to go for a picnic, walk, jog, bike ride, or rent a canoe. In summer has a small amusement park for little kids, bike rentals are available, there is also a restaurant and food for sale. The best part is the fantastic views the trip over and back provide of Toronto (the price...
I use to come here with my family every summer, its the best place to be. There is rides, games and a petting zoo... oh how i miss this place.

Beautiful get-away accessible from Toronto harbour by ferry. Lots to do on Centre Island, including the unique Centreville amusement park which is great for younger kids. You can take bikes over on the ferries and all islands are linked by bridges. Bike and canoe rentals available on the island as well

We try to make an annual trip to the islands with our 2 children (6 & 8). The best way to explore the beaches, paths, splash pad, pier, gardens, and Centerville is by bike. We take our own bikes on the ferry and then are able to travel the paths and cover a lot of ground. The beaches are a...
first time to travel here - took ferry to Ward's Island and then walked all around the islands - took many, many pics and just truly enjoyed the atmosphere! A wonderful day trip.

Its a great place! Avoid in the winter!!! It's really breathtaking in snowy conditions hit the ferry isn't very frequent... We had to sit it out in minis temperatures in an old bus shelter waiting for the ferry! In summer! The place is amazing! Hire a push bike and just venture out, take a picnic etc

Definitely worth a visit, no cars allowed and the ferry to it is only approx Cad 8.00 return. People very friendly and many places for decent food too but we just had a nice little picnic on one of the many beaches.

My husband and I were visiting from the US. I have been to Toronto once before and enjoyed taking a bike ride around the island.We arrived via Centre Island and walked down to the bike rental. We rented two cruisers and headed over to the airport portion of the island. Stopped for a quick drink and then biked over...
Perfect for small children, lots of kiddie rides/no traffic, etc. We went with a 2 year old and she enjoyed the rides, animals and just walking around the park!

This was my absolute favorite part of my 4-day leisure trip to Toronto.We took the ferry to Ward's Island, walked along the beach and boardwalk on Lakeshore Ave, sat on some stones on a little jutty in the park to the west of the Centre Island Dock path, and watched the sunset over the city. (go to google maps...

We had a free evening so grabbed the ferry to Toronto Island. What a great getaway that is so convenient to the city! We had a great meal on the island and relaxed with some wine, then a quiet hike to view the amusement park and sights. Ending it with a scenic ferry ride back to the city. I'm so...

Took the Ferry over to Ward's Island then walked to the Rectory Cafe for a romantic dinner. Walked over to the beach area at Centre Island and then through the amusement park (although closed) and took the Ferry back from Centre Island. It was beautiful and relaxing, but I wish we would have gone over earlier so we could have...

After a quick ferry ride across the bay to Toronto Island, we found ourselves walking along well-maintained flower gardens, open fields of grass, play areas for kids, and some surprisingly nice beaches.The island has a rural appeal, which feels strange when you can look across the water to TO's skyline. Some really nice walking trails, a boardwalk, and some...

My husband & I visit Toronto Islands every summer - we typically sail over from Port Credit. We've been there over night, visited for a day, and loved it every time. The islands have their own rhythm, so much slower than the rest of the city. The short ferry ride from Queens Quay takes you to a place that feels...

The place is beautiful and has a very nice entertainment structure. The boat ride to access the island is very pleasant. The beach is very nice and all over the island you will find picnic tables for public use. Food there is a little expensive, and for that I reccommend taking something to eat from home. Plan to stay there...

This place is a real treasure. It is easy to get there, it is very clean, and very well kept. The beach area is nice and clean and there is place next to it with restrooms, food and drinks. The views of Downtown Toronto from the ferry are incredible. Make sure you bring a camara with you.

Hop on the ferry at the base of Bay Street in the heart of Toronto and get transported to an island community. Unique is the cottage feel of the homes - which is my favourite part. There are beaches and amusement for kids as well. The ferry ride gives you a wonderful view of the Toronto City Centre.
a nice non touristy thing to do while your there ..the ferry ride was $7 dollar or something close to thatgreat toronto views from the ferry/islandpark is nicesome stuff for kids over there too

There is a road that goes round the island. On this road near an airport there is a spot where you can catch all the skyline of Toronto. Truly breathtaking view.Also there are nice beaches where you can swim. Including a "optional clothing" beach.

Hard to believe a place so beautiful lies just a a couple of miles and a 15-minute ferry ride from downtown Toronto. On a solo day trip to Toronto to sample Porter Airlines (great airline by the way), my focus was squarely on Toronto Island Park for my day there. I took the ferry to Ward's Island to sample the...
There's various ticket sellers on the harborfront all offering similar tours around Toronto Islands. It's a fun trip, simply choose which boat you prefer :)

Centerville park is great for little ones. Its nice that we can rent bikes. Kids love the Franklin park. Love the open space. Make sure you carry lots of food because it can be expensive to buy on the island.
the ferry fare is not expensive and the sightseeing there is great, there are beaches, great lakeview, amusement park but only for children fun, good place for bicycle

My daughter wanted to visit the island during our stay in Toronto. Was a great idea. The ferry was very inexpensive. I believe $7 round trip. The islands were so beautiful. Lots of places to just sit and relax. Amusement was great for younger kids. Restaurants was fantastic... good prices. Store was ok. Bring your suntan lotion! Dont forget like...
we went there on a sunny morning, the farry is a nice 10 moments ride. very nice place to take a walk around and maybe even have a swim.
Take a tour of the island on the mini trains. We had enjoyed seeing the islands and then going to the parts we wanted to visit again after the tour had concluded.

There is something for everyone in Toronto Islands. Three ferries will take you to three different spots of the islands. You can use one to go and another one to return.Ward island has a community of small houses. Centre Island the most popular has a small amusement park, a mini zoo, some restaurants and access to some beaches. Hanlan's...

A nice way to experience a bit of Toronto. Well priced and nice attractions such as gardens, beaches, walking trails.. There is a little amusement park that can be enjoyed by children. Something for everyone.

column3: Haddon Heights, New Jersey, United States
column4: Took the ferry from Toronto to Toronto Island Park. It was beautiful! We loved every minute we were there. The beaches were lovely. We had a wonderful walk around the island. If we are there again, we would definitely rent bikes so we could see more of the island. We had a nice lunch at Shopsy's. Definitely worthwhile and was...

A quick escape from a busy downtown core with a little bit to do for everyone. Rent a bike, play volleyball, enjoy the beach, visit Centreville for the kids, have a bbq, or just enjoy the view from the park.
We had a nice picnic with the grand children and they had a lot of fun building sans castles We walked fromWard Beach to Center Beach on a nice boardwalk

Take the ferry from Toronto over to the Toronto Island Park. The park is vast with even an amusement park and mini farm there which is very good. The beaches are clean and well maintained. Certainly worth doing if you are in Toronto.

There is just so much or so little to do on Toronto Island, the choice is yours. We are a family of four with 2 young children, there is fairground rides, splash pool, children play areas, a beach and a walk around a children's garden, (see attached photo). There is also the option to rent a boat or bike to...
i dislike nothing about it, i was totaly relaxed and enjoyed my hole experience i give it two thumbs up
The Toronto island park is very nice for the everyone. The boat trip is nice and don't cost a lot. The view of Toronto's skyline is simply breathtaking.

Beautiful garden island, a short ferry trip from the city, very child-friendly, and giving fabulous views of the Toronto skyline. Loved the quadricycle hire! Excellent contrast to the bustling city. One of the best experiences in Toronto.

This is a wonderful place that has to be the envy of other cities on lakes such as Chicago. Went on a rainy time but had a great time walking and renting bike for two to get around. Beautiful landscaping and great to walk among the cottages where people live on the island. View of Toronto from the Islands is...
Really liked the shot ferry hop, decent amusement park which always cost more. But the great park is really hard to beat.
Very nice park, nice family atmosphere. The boat trip to the park is very good, and you can get a good view of Torontos skyline from here.

The nice part of the trip starts with the amazing views of the Toronto skyline as the ferry leaves the city and approaches the island. So don´t sit in your back while in the ferry, stand up and grab a good spot in the front or in the sides and have your camara ready to shoot some great pictures. After...

To get to this tiny island you have to take the ferry and yes there is a $7CAD fee for the ride! We notice people bring backpack, picnic baskets, strollers, bikes, rollerblades all to escape the city life! And I can see why! Excellent beaches with peaceful surroundings and long walks! There are food in the areas such as burgers,...

Such a beautiful park which captures your attention. When you are in there, you become very calm and you are free to think and wander. The way the trees sway with the breeze and the birds chip with happiness makes this place a little piece of heaven. I love to be here either to relax or play with my kids....
A short ferry ride and you can forget that you are in a big city. Although Centre Island is the best known and most frequented spot, the boardwalk at Ward's Island is a peaceful retreat.

We try to visit the Toronto Islands once a year. This time the lineups were so long that we had to wait for a second boat on both trips. I believe the ferry capacity being lowered is responsible for the problems.

This park feels like is degradating and that the conservation is not going well.The workers feels like are not happy there and that is not good for the organizations of therides.There are a lack of good food options.The rides are just a few and some of them are closing.There is a looming future for this park...

The family included two boys (7 and 5) headed to the island on a beautiful Sunday around 10am. The lines for the ferry was incredibly long so I wish we had set out earlier. Once you arrive at the island we walked over to the amusement park and the kids had a great time riding some rides. We ran short...
Ferry over tot he Islands and spent an afternoon strolling about the island. Hire a bike if feeling energetic. Great views of the city sky line.
We had a wonderful time at the water front. There are a lot of activity on the waterfront and a family can really enjoy a couple of days.

My wife and I have been visiting Toronto Islands for many years and I always recommend it to anyone visiting the city. With no vehicles, the roads are perfect for walking or riding a bike. Bring your own on the ferry or rent one there (you'll need ID to rent one). Apart from the huge park, there's Centreville for the...

We were going to rent bikes at the stand on the island and came across the Bixi stand on the way to the ferry. SO GLAD we rented these bikes. $5 each for 24 hours and could be returned to any Bixi stand in Toronto. Three speeds made it a breeze going "off path" to get around pedestrians on the...
It is a must do in Toronto. Rent a bike or canoe, or both. It is very pleasant. The ferry is also fun.
The Park is not as clean as Toronto with litter on the beaches. The restaurant is also not too clean. The food was reasonable but the service was poor and slow.

I have been many times before as a kid and with my own but usually wento to Centreville which is great for small children but instead we decided to bring our bikes and check out the beach etc. We biked around the island all day, played at the parks, had a swim and then stopped for a beverage at a...
take the ferry to this island and relax any time of year; you can cycle or walk and have a picnic at your leisure

It was very hot and we were looking for something cool and relaxing to do. We took one of the small tour boats (NOT the large ferry) to get to the island. The 30 minute trip was very interesting as the guide pointed out landmarks and told stories.The island(s) is amazing. There are so many things to do and...

If you stay in Toronto more than a day or two, the Toronto Island Park is a nice place to visit. A big park with trees, grass and beaches without cars. The skyline view of Toronto is. Spectacular.In order to get to Toronto Island you'll have to take a ferry that costs 7 CAD return ticket (Jul 12). In...

Great for a trip out of the busy city during the summer. Still, it all seemed a bit American/theatrical scenery. Terrible service by kids working the pizza/ice cream booths.I recommend renting the bikes, to get to see the island in no-time.

Take the ferry across to the island and you've had a great little trip, theres endless places to walk, eat, picnic, boat, swim and even a nude beach at Hanlins point. The kid section in the center is just priceless for families...fresh air, the lake, the trees, the peace...what more could you have minutes from the city.

Taking the ferry to Toronto Islands was a maybe on our itenerary but we are so glad we went. The ferries to Centre Island ran every 15 minutes or so and it was a pleasant short ride. The island is awesome - great for picnicks and barbecues, beach time, walks or bike rides or just relaxing in the huge park....
Quite and serene. Don't count too much on the restuarant at the island. Should you need to go to beach just close the city, here is the one for you

We rented a bike (2 seater) and explored the island. We also took a dip in the lake. The gardens are also beautiful and the views from the island are nice. It was a nice change of pace after a few hectic days in the city.
Great place to take kids, or go for a walk, or a bike ride. We took the boat ride out there, which is a good way to see the skyline.
Take the ferry over and explore the island. There's a small amusement park for the kids, beaches to explore, parklands all over and the best view of the Toronto skyline can be had while on the island
The ferry ride provides you with a wonderful view of the downtown skyline. Centre Island amusement park is a place for the under 10 set.

I liked everything in the park. It was part of the package tour that includes a hop on hop off bus tour, the island park tour, Niagara Falls tour and the ice wine factory tour. It was a value for money tour package which we didn't feel shortchanged.

Where else but Toronto do you take a ferry, which builds anticipation for the gem of the island that Toronto Island Park is?! What an escape to beautiful gardens and fun for every generation. Picnics and BBQ's are just enhanced by the backdrop...

A great escape on a hot summer day. Take your bike, a swim suit and a picnic lunch. Choose the Ward's Island ferry which you get at the foot of Bay Street on Queen's Quay, at the west side of the Harbour Castle Hotel. The Entrance to the Toronto Island ferries is behind the hotel. Just follow the crowd and...

$6 can get you a round-trip ferry ride to Toronto Island and back. You'll feel like you're far away from the city...and if you have access to a bike, TAKE IT! There's no better way to get around the island than pedaling...you can get a return ferry from any of the other ferry docks on the island (Hanlan's pt, Toronto...

In the past, when I visited Center Island I got trapped in Centerville Amusement Park with my kids and didn't see much else of the island. In this last visit, I walked over the little overpass and entered an amazing park. It is so lovely! Beautiful gardens, tennis courts, beaches with swings right on the sand, pools of water, great...

We spent out last on Center Island and it was a perfect way to reflect on a wonderful week. We strolled the paths after renting a quadricycle and riding from one end to the other. This is a workout, but on a very hot and humid day the cover provided us shade and the seats supported our backs. Plus it...

What a wonderful place this would be for a family reunion! Take a cooler and picnic, relax all day. Beach, you can ride your bike, ride the rides at the amusement park..walk on the pier, sit and enjoy the quiet and the scenery.

Things to do...first take the Water Taxi from outside of the Sobey's Pier ($20.00pp and worth every penny) We used the water taxi and by-passed a 2 hour line up at the pier. We arrived at the island in literally 5 minutes, and simply returned by regular ferry. There was the East Indian Festival going on so the air was...
Lots of benches & tables, but especially, lots of big trees & shade. Great place to relax.
You must visit Toronto island on your visit to Toronto for some tranquility. Just a short ferry ride away, but lovely hiking, views, beaches and hippy-style cafes and cottages.

Great day out, so much to see and do.The kids loved the theme park which was quite old fashioned but great with no flashing lights and just fun!!I wish we had taken a picnic as the gardens would have been lovely to sit in. The beach was lovely with safe swimming for kids.We will be back here...

Over the years I have regularly visited Toronto Island. Both by ferry and on my boat.I never can get over how lovely and peaceful it is for being so close to a big city. It is essentially car-free so it is a walkers, runners, bikers, bladers paradise.Water surrounds you, not just the lake but inlets that are great...

A short walk from downtown Toronto and a pleasant ferry ride makes one forget they just came from a major city. A great city park getaway from the business of downtown. The park has plenty of walking paths, picnic areas, places to grill, and beaches. Center island is definitely more of a kids / teenager area with rides, petting zoo,...

Always a great place to spend a summer day. Centreville is a great place to take the kids for a safe amusement park with the old style flair.Plenty of walking trails, bike paths and places to picnic and relax and enjoy the benefits of an island free of cars and pollution yet only a ferry ride from downtown Toronto.

Oodles of open spaces- brilliant as it faces onto the lake where the breeze always blows- great in hot weather. Lots of things to do for kids. Good places to eat. Very often have special events on. Short ferry ride only a fees dollars and adds to a good day out.

A pleasent boat trip across to the island & you can spend a great day walking through the many gardens & childrens play area's. A great play area with water fountains, the kids had so much fun jumping in & out of it.Might be a good idea to bring a swimming outfit for the kids & a towel. Go...

We went over for the afternoon, and the trip was Greta. We headed straight for the rides, and the line ups were all very short wait times. The ticket prices for a family of 5 were not bad, cheaper than larger amusement parks, but still not cheap. You can bring your own food if you want to save a couple...
toronto islands are great! if you have the chance, just go

We took the ferry to the Hanlan's Point entrance, as the Toronto Parks website states there is bicycle rental there. THERE IS NOT! It is in the middle of the island, so you'll need to take the Centre Island ferry if you aren't bringing a bike.Aside from that snafu, we walked the length of Hanlan's Point and stopped for...

column3: West Kirby, Glannau Mersi, Deyrnas Unedig.
column4: We took the ferry boat ($7 return) and had a very pleasant time by the cool of Lake Ontario walking along the boardwalk.Views looking back at the city make great photos.

Well, there are other parks in Toronto that are much better than this one and less run down, but this one is alright and better suited for very young kids. If looking for theme parks, try MarineLand or Wonderland in Niagara Falls and Vaughn, respectively. Greater rides and more space and services.
Nice to have a place to escape from traffic noise. Getting there costs a bit but worth it, I guess

It's amazing that only a stones throw away from Toronto's downtown core you can escape to this amazing park. If you have a bike bring it or rent. This will allow you to explore a little further than if you were on foot.
Nice walks and picnic areas. Great view of the city.
The island is huge. It has beaches, a farm for kids, lots of bike paths, park benches, wash rooms, marinas and much more. Loved it.

After the hustle and bustle of the city we found this a lovely place to spend the day.At a very reasonable cost on an enjoyable ferry ride we found this a lovely place to spend the day. The hustle and bustle of the city seemed a million miles away! It has something for everyone from lovely gardens to a...

Toronto Island Park is one of the places to visit. It is scenic and the beach doesn't even look like it is in the city of Toronto. If you want to relax with a loved one or go with your kids, you will have a full day of excitement.

We have not been to the Toronto Islands for a long, long time and it has not changed much which in this case is not a bad thing. There is plenty to do, from just taking a stroll along the shore and staring at the great Toronto skyline, to the little animal farm, to the kids Centreville play area. I...
Too many people in Can Day. Ferry is over crowded. The ice cream in the park is too pricey! $5 for a cone. Not many thing to see. I won't come back again.

What an amazing little getaway from the hussle and bussle downtown Toronto. If you go during the weekday, you are more or less guaranteed to have the island to yourself. Take supplies with you as there are no more than 2-3 shops near one of the drop off points.You have the beauty of the beach, park and lake (for...

I liked Wards Island for its cottages and it would have been nice to stop by and eat some healthy food instead of the burgers and fries. Bring sunscreen and don't miss the last ferry, whatever you do, as there are always lineups! The ferries lead to Centre Island, Ward's Island and Hanlan's Point- the latter being where a clothing-optional...

Starting with the ferry ride everything about a day on Toronto Island is fun! The ferry ride offers great views of the city. The island has beaches, a boardwalk, a farm, amusement park, lighthouse, and restaurants.We really enjoyed the farm which had a variety of animals- goats, pigs, horses.The landscaping around the island is very well done, ranging...
I host international students, and they always come back very happy after a day at the island. It really is a gem; I should get back there myself soon!

The islands are a neat place to visit, short boat ride over. Has a nice little beach, boat house, bike rentals etc. Excellent views looking back over to the city, nice place to play ball, jog, relax, picnic away from the crowds. My partner took the ferry over and it was one of the nicest part of our Toronto visit....

From the ride across on the ferry, to the walking and biking and regularly stopping (to soak up the great views back across the city) This is a MUST DO for any Toronto visitor (at least on a great weather day)..Make sure you wander the streets in the part of the island where there are houses... hippy dippy types...

We stumbled upon this beach on the way to Centreville Amusement Park. Our children wanted to go so we went after our day at the park was nearly over. It's really nice. I was expecting the smell of algae, pollution, and a dirty beach but no, it was quite clean. Good for small kids as the water is so shallow....
I really nice alternative to busy city life and it's only a quick, cheap ferry ride away to the island

The park wasn't open when we were there but there was huge amounts of preparation work going on for the opening the following week. We got a bit lost and asked a member of staff for directions,lo and behold it was only another Glaswegian we had found and spent the next hour chatting. What fantastic views of the Canadian Geese...

Escape the city and go to Toronto Islands! Ward, Center and Handlan's are only a 15 min ferry ride away from downtown but you feel like you are far away from the city . You pay about $3 for the ferry ride and don't pay on the ride back. Most go to Center island for family activities but I prefer...

This is a pretty set of islands. There are flowers and fountains everywhere. There is lots to do and see. There are bikes of all shapes from 1-6 people. There is an amusement park for kids, canoe and kayak rentals, boat rentals, and a good restaurant or two. There's also lots of concessions stands for those who simply want to...

First day in Toronto and the temperature was 30 degrees C, so rather than sweat it out sight seeing we headed for the islands for a relaxing stroll in the park and lie on the beach.Only down side is some of the washroom and changing facilities were a bit grotty particularly away from the main strip in Centre Island.

Our friends from Toronto took us here. Not much to do except walk around the island. Can also rent bikes. If you want to get away from the crowds or go to the beach this is the place for you. 10 min. ferry ride from downtown. Many families having picnics here.
Great place to get away, altho I dont recommend it for public holidays as everyone else has the same idea and it can get quite busy lol

the ferry ride is pleasant and short, you get to see Toronto from another perspective (especially at night with all the city lights). take your bike, escape for the day. it almost feels like a mini-vacation.

First of all, the ferry ride over was a bargain at just $7 for a two way ticket. As a tourist and photographer, I shot my best photos of the skyline from the ferry and took several other people's pictrures that will probably end up on their Christmas cards.

To get to Toronto Island, you have to take a ferry that costs $7.00 per person. We were in line with LOTS of families and LOTS of strollers waiting for the Center Ferry (if you want to avoid the large throngs of children, take one of the other two ferries - we took the Hanlan Ferry back and there were...
Particularly great for families, nice for a walk along the beach or enjoying a picnic in the park and only a 7 minute journey over..

Didnt have all that was advertised such as the tram tour, the maze. However, lots of fun things for children. Attractive flower beds and fountains for the adults. We spent an enjoyable half day there. Cost $7 each to get there on ferry which I consider to be an entry fee as there is no other way to get there.

Loved the family atmosphere here. We took our 1.5 yr old for half the day to see what it was about. I think we did it right by heading over in the morning. Lines were super long in the afternoon. There was a lot to see and do. You have lots of choices, if you bring a picnic you don't...

My husband and I visited the park on a relatively comfortable, overcast July weekday. It is a nice change of pace from the city hub-bub. The ferry ride is short, less than 10 minutes. Despite the previous reviewers' suggestions, we took the Center Ferry and managed with the throngs of children just fine. We did not really do any amusement...
Great place in Toronto for the entire family fun is what to expect at the Island park
Escape Tours pleased to offer customized Ontario, Quebec tour packages with flexibilty. Begin your tour when you want.

This is a great placd to go and spend some time outdoors. There are a few motorized vehicles and it's great to walk or bike the island. There are bike rentals if you're a visitor, which gives you access to numerous beaches mandatory and clothing optional. There are also great views of the city on the ferry ride, and once...

This place could be so much better with a little TLC and investment. We visited on a beautifull hot sunny day which helped but the toilets are disgusting and buildings run down. It reminded me of a tired old seaside town in the UK. Toronto city authority need to pull their finger out, splash the cash and make this the...
Easy trip over to the Island on the Ferry. Get there early before the crowds if its a warm day -- there is not much shade to stand in while waiting to buy your ticket.
An oasis in the city. Close to downtown but serene and lots of places to explore. Great for kids with amusement park, petting zoo, etc.

Toronto Island (Ward's Island) absolutely blew my mind. I never expected this existed steps from downtown. Stepping onto Toronto Island (Ward's Island - I must be specific about that!) feels like you've just arrived in some seaside village, or some lost country getaway. The whole place feels lost in time, the houses look weather-bathered, and the beach makes you forget...

Love to all parts of t.o. island and when I take the Ferry I feel like I have left the city. Lots places to walk, bike, water. 1 restaurant -- nice, not always great but nice. little fast-food place in summer -- hey makes u feel like home.

Love the area, especially the signs that tell you to walk on grass. :-) My friends who visit from Europe think that it's the best thing since in many places in Europe they have signs that ask you to stay off the grass.

Whether it is to lounge on the beach, frolick in the water, cycle in the sun, sneak down to the "clothing optional" beach or to simply walk around, the Island is a fantastic day out for grown up and children!
Relaxing. Beautiful. Beaches, farm, amusement park, picnic tables, gardens, restaurants. Worth the ferry trip (which is only $7 round-trip). Great views of the Toronto skyline.
Fun place to relax . Different venues for different populations. 7.00 round trip ferry. nice day trip

My wife and I visited Toronto Island Park on June 23, 2012. We watched the dragon boat racing and the stage performace. We also rented a two seat bycycle and rode around for sightseeing. Then we had our picnic onder the shade of a big tree. Very clean and beautiful. Lots of visitors but orgnized very well. Taking the farry...
Easy ride over on the ferry. Spent the day at the island biking and having a picnic. Plenty of things to do for those that want to be outdoors. I would highly recommend it.

I have been going here since my Grandfather took us as kids. It's a great place to spend the day relaxing and having a picnic etc. The kids get top go on the ferry over and it gives really nice view of downtown Toronto - esp. at sunset. Enjoy!

It was a very nice expereince on Halloween evening. Small houses and narrow streets on this "isolated" island. I had the feeling that this is not anymore the huge and busy Toronto. From the harbor was a wonderful view on the skyline of Toronto. It is a must when you are in Toronto, ferry is cheap and fast.

We found out about the island towards the end of our stay. It is a must to visit. Took a trip by a ferry to the island and were told they would pick up every 45 minutes (they didn't turn up but another ferry company took us back for free - unfortunately can't remember the names of any of them)....

Beautiful place, theres something for anyone of any age. I highly recommend renting a four person trolley vehicle to drive around and explore the island. The petting zoo and carnival area is great for little kids. Rated 4 stars because food and entertainment is expensive.

Toronto beach is clothing optional. It was a very hot day in June so the line to get the ferry tickets was very long, about a 30 minute wait. Another 10 minute wait to get on ferry. Once on the island, the walk to the beach is close to a mile. The beach was nice but had some sort of...

From the minute you board the inexpensive ferry you leave behind the frenzy of the city and you're on your way to a quiet island. The only intrusion is the nearby city airport. You get a marvellous view of the city scape.

The ferry ride to the island is short but is part of the island experience. We took a slow walk along the coastline of Wards Island to the pier and Manitou Beach and onto Gibraltar Point Lighthouse which is full of history. Toronto Islands are a favourite place for picnics by Toronto citizens which we witnessed as many alighted the...
Just a nice ferry ride over, see Toronto from a different perspective.Very relaxing
Get away from it all, and spend the day with kids, friends, and a picnic.

Although the Islands are only 20 min ferry ride from the Toronto, they are ages away.This large area can serve many tourists a day and yet not to have an overcrowded feel during the weekday.The best way to explore the islands is by renting a bike from the Toronto Island Bicycle Rental and paddle to both ends of...
