It is 750 metres long. It occupies the southern 1/3 of the total length of the beach starting at the lifeguard station at the...
Beautiful Views of Toronto. Nice to explore on bike or foot. Nice boat ride over

Great short (and v.cheap!) ferry ride to the Islands - a great way to spend a day walking, at the beach, having a picnic or playing at Centerville. Hubby's company always has a Families Day on Centre Island every year and the kids always look forward to it. Would go there more often if I lived nearer. Great Yacht Club...
Nice and quiet on a tuesday. Nice respite from the city.

We enjoyed the ferry ride to the island and rented bikes while we were there, it was an enjoyable afternoon. My kids (9 and 11) were a little too old for the amusement rides but looked like fun for the smaller kids. My kids favorite on the island was Rommy the yellow lab who enjoyed catching balls thrown into the...
This was a fun afternoon. Tookthe ferry over and then hired bikes. Avely ride along the boardwalk by the sea, pretty houses and great views back over the lake to Toronto
Beautiful and relaxing! The boat ride was great and spending a day in such a special place was wonderful!

Definately worth taking the time to visit the islands when in Toronto they're a great way to spend a day - we go the the central island, then hired a quadricycle to explore. From the ferry across the islands you get fabulous views over the city - it's really good value for money as well at $7 for return fare.

Torornto islands is a great place for a walk or biking day out.Take a picnic.head to the beaches over there.Little kids love centreville...you will see alot of smiling faces..Look for points of interest ie the little church, the school. The little community on wards island.... A nice Ferry ride..you can great pictures of Toronto from over there and on the...

We only spent the day at Hanlons clothing optional beach.There were a few couples there but mostly men there to voyeur. The gays were also a problem with a number of them fondling each other with public displays of erotic behaviour.There were even some couple there remaining fully clothed for the duration - it is clothing optional, however...

I love going to the Toronto Islands - it's a nice escape from the city, with a wonderful view of the city and lovely place to bike ride / picnic. I'd avoid center island tho and stick to the quieter Wards / Hanlan's point.

After so many times beeing in Toronto one weekend decided to check Toronto Island wi th my daughter. What a nice surprise it was! Beautiful huge trees, nice walking paths, great beaches, biking path, little village looks like it was from feary tale. Very much worth visiting. I will go again this summer.

i've always loved the island - I've been going there every summer for 40 years - Open green spaces, no traffic to speak of - bicycle rentals or bring your roller blades - great paths and if you have wee ones Centreville is a much better option than the chaos of Wonderland - it's a lovely place to spend a...
A great and relaxing time outside of the hustle of the city.
From the ferry ride to a full fun packed day and the ferry back again, i cannot say a bad word about the trip. Great family day out and something for everyone
it's nice and clean a nice place visit and walk around

This is a nice little getaway that is quiet and has a decent beach. However double check the dates for when the attraction park is open. It is closed a lot before June. You are better off bringing the food with unless you don't mind spending quite a bit at the island's pricy establishments.

Toronto Island is an oasis from the hussle and bussle of the city. It is a great place to spend at least a half to a full day. You easily catch the ferry at the foot of Bay and Queen's Quey which runs frequently. There is a nominal fee for the ferry ride over to the island. It's a great...
Good to walk and set at one of the beaches and have a nice picknic

A brief ferry ride to Toronto Island Park takes you to another world where there are no cars but lots of gardens and birds and quiet. This place is lovely. People come to picnic and swim in the lake and enjoy the small amusement park and pet the animals at the farm or ride bicycles. The gardens are especially nice...

Brilliant for a day out, but avoid weekends if possible* - that's when everyone takes over bikes, bbq's, boats and children. After walking the boardwalk and cycling, we enjoyed just chilling out with books for the rest of the day.*It's murder if you don't have a bbq of your own, the smells give you bad hunger pangs!
Nothing special however a nice trip out for half a day

This is the quietest space in Toronto especially during cold season when no citizen take the ferry to go to the Islands. Be prepared to walk a lot and take with you some water as there are no bar/restaurant open during winter.
Very relaxing, was a little discouraged at the lack of open food facilities when we were out there, only the one cafe open with limited food options. Suspect it was because it was off season.
From a nude beach to a amusement park to a noncommercial bird sanctuary, the islands have something for everyone. Truly a life saver for urban Canadians.

As a longtime resident of Toronto I have been taking the ferry back and forth to the Toronto Islands for several decades. It's a ritual of not only summer, but spring and early fall as well. The Islands - consisting of Centre Island, Ward's Island and Hanlan's Point - are a lovely urban getaway only a short ferry ride away...

There's a boat that takes you to 3 different places on the island. For turist, I recommend to go to Centre Islando Ferry Dock Station, which is in the middle of the island. I walked in direction to the Hanlan's Point Ferry Dock, the other station to the boat. In this walk, I could see many gardens, the pier on...

This island is great for families, couples or just going solo! Ideal for picnics, just watch out for the goose-droppings that little the sidewalks and, I'm sure, the grass. It is really pretty - has an amusement park for kids, a choo-choo that goes around the island and even a little farm! I would advise people to bring their own...

Toronto Island park is an oasis in the city, great place to spend an afternoon in the summer. There are activities for everyone, beaches, parks and amusements for the kids, and food and drinks. The cost is currently $7 for return trip on the ferry, whether you are going to Centre Island (where most people go and activity central), Hanlan's...
The ferry ride offers stunning views and the park is marvelous! Fabulous way to spend a sunny afternoon with the family!

We were only in Toronto for a short time and only had a small window of opportunity to visit Toronto island. There were masses of young families with their enormous buggies and trolleys being used as battering rams. There was also a walk "organised" by the RSA pumped to be purple brigade - who are they? They seemed to be...

To have this amenity in their city?I loved my visit,it was easy to catch the ferry over to the island ,a mixture of tourists and locals going there.With so many people visiting you would expect it to be crowded but each had their own plan,whether to visit Centreville with children to experience the rides ,to use the bikes to view...
The best place to spend a hot afternoon in Toronto. My group of Spanish kids loved the beach, and just walking on the grass

Easy and quick ferry over to Centre Island and you can explore in various directions. I suspect we went to the quieter part as we weren't really interested in the amusement park. A nice few hours out!
lovely boat trip out to here - complete peace and tranquility but almost slap in the middle of Toronto
great for a quiet picnic, amusement park for young kids. Lots of walking / skating roads.

Took the ferry over ($7 return each) to Centre Island. Rented bikes for close to 3 hrs and cycled round all the islands. we went average paced, and probably included about 1/2 hr of 'photo stops'.Beautiful pathways, parks, green space - ideal for a picnic. Homes on the east end of island are quaint, beautiful and interesting. Airport, beaches...
This is my favorite place to take friends and family visiting the city. Lots to do, but a bike is a must unless you plan on sticking to one area of the Island.Bring a picnic and make a day out of it.

The island is a grand place to relax in the city. There is something about a boat journey that is inherently relaxing and then you are free to wander out to the beach, through the inland waterways and along the meadows.
Perfect for bike riding , excellent for picnics and just a great way to spend a day , Spring , Summer or Fall .

We started our Canada Holiday on Toronto Island and it was great! We rented bikes for everyone so we can see all of the island. Beautiful place and so quiet. Ended at the little Island Cafe with beers in the sunshine! What more can you want!
Always a treat to go to the Islands. I also love to attend St. Andrews-by-the-Lake Anglican services when I can. Very laid-back but welcoming service.

The islands are 836 acres of beautiful parkland on which to cycle, walk, rollerblade and see beaches, fountains, gardens, and you can canoe the inlets or play one of the best frisbee golf courses available, picnic or visit The Rectory restaurant for lunch. You would never know you are in a big city when you are in this little piece...

We enjoyed the Ferry ride over to the island. It was crowded but the people seemed happy and excited. The ride was interesting, scenic and short. The place was big and had lot's of green space for picnics and other outings. There was a small amusement park for the kiddies. You could bring your own bike or rent some of...

beautiful ferry ride over -- great for walking a couple miles on pretty safe roads with great views. Nothing much to do unless you want the nude beach -- there is another beach and plenty of barbecuing, but we were travelers who did not want to pack a picnic, I expected to find cafes and little quaint shops --- not...

Lush, peaceful and plenty of beach space. Nude beach to one side and bashful beach to the other side with bike rentals, limited food, and sites such as quaint cottages and bridges. Also a little kids amusement area too.

Great for families. Small amusement park for young children, a petting farm and beaches. There is also a clothing optional beach if you dare. Would be a nice place to have a picnic. There are also several bars and eateries on the island. Adults are $7 each to board the ferry over.

Easily the city's best park, it is in essence an island with several square kilometres of well-maintained parks and beaches. The $7 return journey on the ferry provides stunning views of the city. Make sure you bring or rent a bicycle.
Very nice to get out of the city and walk. Many families picnicking. Very busy on a hot summer weekend. The rectory restaurant is a little gem.

Nice place to take your family. The boat ride across the water was the BEST for me; I LOVED being able to see the Toronto skyline from the boatride. Have your camera ready! -- it's probably going to be your BEST VIEW of the city. When you arrive, the park also has a pier that overlooks the other side of...

My family and i loved this park, which is a great escape from the city and a family oriented place to hang out. We rode one of those four person bicyles and had a great time. Nice landscaping. Great views of the city. Nice ferry ride.

The ferry ride itself is an attraction not to miss in Toronto. It's always nice in the weekends, especially in the summer, when there's always something going on.The best thing is to barbeque or chill by the Toronto skyline side of the Islands at twilight... you'll never forget that sight.
Take the ferry to the Islands. It was definitely worth it. We rented bikes on one of the islands and rode all around.

It's like going to the cottage, but just minutes from downtown. Take the Toronto Island Ferry (the ferry docks are on Queen's Quay at the foot of Bay Street - BEHIND the hotel) and take the Centre Island Ferry to the island. Great walking (lots of shade, which is wonderful on a hot day) and biking. There are bicycles and...
A Toronto Gem. Fantastic way to spend a sunny afternoon with young kids.

For a relaxed stroll and beautiful unhurried ambiance, this is the spot for a gorgeous summer picnic. Regular ferries get you there and back, with no particular agenda other than to unwind on these lovely lakeside walkways and secluded spots.

The trip out of downtown Toronto to this peaceful island retreat is worth it. We rented a tandem bicycle, they could take better care of them (the front tire went flat half-way through the rental) but it was still a lovely day. It was very nice to go on a week day as I imagine it would be more crowded...

I love Hanlans for its long walks but Wards Island is my absolute favourite...clean beach not crowded, interesting homes, clean washrooms, very quiet and peaceful like being in the country...no cars or vehicles...bring your own food and beverages as outlets not available...take the Wards ferry and not Centre Island

I love going to the island, but I do feel that it is missing some flare. The ferry ride, patios and Centreville are great but it does not have the wow factor. I do miss the little tour shuttles that had names, they were great to get around the island.

We took the ferry over to the Island and walked around then had lunch. Visited the Far Enough Farm which is under threat of closure which would be a pity. The day was lovely and weather fantastic but we had not left ourselves enough time to do very much as we had not known what to expect. You can hire...

I won't repeat all the details from others reviews, and everything I had read before visiting held true. The only thing I will add is that we did not realize the bike shop on the Island closed at 5pm. We still had over an hour to explore which was plenty of time for us, but to really see it all...

Since Ontario Place has been closed down than Toronto Island appears to be the only waterfront getaway worth checking out without leaving the City of Toronto. Make sure you get to the ferry dock early as looked what happened the other weekend with thousands of people lining up for hours to board the transportation to the island. There is lot's...

Although the ferry terminal is a little bit dated and dingy (surely something could be done to make it a bit more tourist friendly?), the ferry ride was lovely and the islands themselves are beautiful to walk or bike around.

This park provides many activities for families and solo-travelers alike. The cost is $7/round trip by ferry with many travel times. On the island, you can swim at the beaches, walk/bike the many pathways, play disc golf, go to the amusement park, or just relax.

Hop on the ferry right next to the Westin Hotel, (btw ferry price has gone up from $6.5 to $7) a quick 20 minutes ferry ride will get you to the central island. Beautiful view from the edge towards CN Tower/Rogers Centre/ Downtown toronto. I took the route from the central island, to the Chelsea beach, then headed towards the...

The view of the Toronto skyline is amazing from there and the park is a nice gem but nothing special. You have to walk quite some time 30-40 mins to get to the beach on the other side and in between is an amusement park and not much else. If you go with children this might be great but other...
Great escape from the city - if only something could be done about all the goose poo. Hard to put down a picnic blanket.
Was surpirsed how much there was over there. Nice boat trip acorss and back and my daughter loved the rides over there. Take a picnic or use one of the BBQ's over there.

Toronto Islands are spectacular, just a short (15m) and cheap ferry ride over from the Toronto ferry docks. When leaving, if you want the best view of the city, you want to be seated on the right side of the ferry. Once there, you've got a good variety of things to do, even in the off season when many things...

If you want a break from the city, grab a ferry over to the Islands and you will think you are in the countryside. Could easily spend a day wondering round or going to the beach on a hot day! Bikes for hire as well.
I really enjoyed going to the amusement park for the day last June. It's strange, you take the ferry and you don't feel like you're in Toronto at all! Nice place for families.

It is worth going! To get their go to harbour front downtown and buy tickets to get a fairy boat and it will take you to Toronto Island. Their are alot of cool things like a beach all the way at the end of the island, picnic benches, an amusement park etc. Its very relaxing for any purpose.
Beautiful day, and walk was easy and sights of Toronto across water were fantastic.

Just a short ferry ride from downtown Toronto rests one of the city's true gems, Toronto Island. I'll admit that it wasn't until a few years ago that I'd ever even set foot on the island. But when I finally found out all that it had to offer, its now become somewhere I visit regularly every summer.To get to...
It gave us the opportunity to bond with our family from the States. I like the sceneries and the recreation. Inexpensive outing.
We have our annual reunions here. Great place for all of us to meet up. Centerville close for the kids, grandkids. We always have a great time!

You can take the ferry from downtown to the center islands. There are bike rides available on the island for 2-6 people. There are also beaches and a small amusement park that are open in the summer. The view is fantastic and fun for all ages.
Always fantastic! Toronto Island park is a treasure. Waiting for the ferry can be a hassle--long line-ups on beautiful days, but so lovely on the other side.

For Torontonian's Toronto Island Park is a summer time must go outing for family, friends and visitor's! Everyone should visit the Island if they are visiting Toronto, and Everyone who lives here should go at least once in the Summer. I do :)

I lived here over a year before making it over to the island but was glad I finally did. Great place to relax, bring or rent a bike, check out the nude beach if you dare (don't worry there are other non-nude beaches as well) Find one of the little restaurants and enjoy the day.
It is easy to get over to Toronto Island via the ferries. What a beautiful place!

It was sunny, but cold. Great views of the city when you get there. Ferry is reasonable. Rent a bike--it's a good way to see the island. Even though the ferry acts like it is three separate places, it's just three different stops on the ferry--bike-able to all. The amusement park wasn't open, but the farm was--the swans were gorgeous...

On the ferry over to Centre Island, you can sit near the back and watch as the Toronto skyline in its entirety unfolds before you. These are the views, complete with a perfectly visible CN tower and the Rogers Center below, that come on postcards. So, if you're looking for that perfect picture, pray for a clear day and take...

Great place for family or company picnics with wide open space away from the city its a great island park the but the Centreville amusement park is overpriced and outdated suitable for small and younger children with the only ride that my children and ourselves enjoy is the LOG FLUME RIDE and like most if not all amusement parks the...

The ferry ride over to the island is alot of fun for the kids. Once there, you will have plenty of places to run around in the park areas. The kiddie ride attractions are so much fun and the kids will have a terrific time! Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the fun and water area too for the kids.
Just a nice peaceful spot,away from traffic and noise- not for vacationers,but great for locals.

I would suggest anyone who's new to Toronto, take the fairy and check out the Island. It's really scenic and at Hanlan's point you get an amazing view of the Toronto Skyline (for that I also recommend Polsen Pier at sunset - gorgeous views).The only fail for the Toronto Island is they haven't really developped it. They could have...
This is an amazing activity, it was just beautiful and you could also see Toronto's skyline.
Within reach of the city, but a lovely break from the hustil and bustle. Lovely beach.

Wide open spaces and the lake meandering through the spaces makes this a very pretty place. Also, some of the best views of the city are from the island. Food isn't great so bring your picnics, but a very pleasant place to spend an afternoon and the parks, rides, beaches, flower beds are well maintained.

we whent thier last summer to see what it was like. We come from a water front town and wanted to see what it was like in a large city to be on an island , It was great the boat ride over the park is large ,clean great walking paths great place to have a BBQ,picknic, or restraunt,We are...
Take a short boat ride and enjor the wonderful island parks, go camping, swimming, biking, or just walk among the trees. Great sunset, with excellent photo ops with the toronto skylinebehind you.

This day trip was the highlight of my week in Toronto. I rented a bike on the mainland. I bicycled around the entire Island. It was srping and the cherry trees and other flowering trees were budding. Lots of birds and not so many people. 3 people on the beach were I took a rest from my bike tour. The...

The Toronto Islands are at once an insight into an alternative lifestyle to the expensive city on the other side of the ferry dock and an escape to a stunning park with beaches, promenades, bike paths and food. Those who live on the islands do not appreciate gawkers but they tend to tolerate guests who can witness a cozy neighbourhood...
We love the beaches, a great place to hang out for the day.

This is a nice area and a great place to spend your entire day complete with a picnic basket and all! The kids will definitely enjoy all the rides. Every year they also have many different things happening here. For e.g.: the dragonboat races. They are really fun to watch. (and participate!)Lots of great places to take photos too....

I like going over to the Islands, especially in the summer. You can take a bike over and quietly pedal around the Island. There are nice beaches to swim at, lots of greenery and places to relax. Also some of the best views of the downtown skyline. I feel like I've had a mini vacation when i go over.
Who needs a cottage? The island is a great and cheap one day vacation. Families, couples or just on your own there so many ways to spend day here. A must see.
We did not have much time to explore - Nice landscape - it was alright place to be.
Great place to go to get out of the city for awhile

Highly recommended destination for visitors and locals alike if the weather is good. You get on the scenic short ferry ride and end up in another world. Take a picnic basket, or bikes, and make a day-long adventure of it. A relaxing getaway.
You can get fantastic views of the city, like a good postcard besides a perfect place to have a BBQ PARTY, the small zoo is cute and you can get too pure air.
It's been several years (2007) since I made this trip, but it's worth a nice Spring/Summer/Fall day spending it on the Toronto Island Park.
great place for one day trip if u can find parking spot. will do it again.

Be warned that it's cooler than the mainland, made the mistake of going out on a warmish easter weekend, but the island was quite cold. Went again on the May 24 weekend when it was scorching and had the best time. It's nice to stay out and watch the sun set over the city. Good photo opportunities too.

We visited Toronto Island during a nice day of last March. The island offers a big park, with many trails to enjoy by foot or riding a bike. The best is that is very close to downtown (about 15 minutes), there is a ferry that offers only a service to Wards Island (during March), at a cost of CAD 6.50,...
There is so much to do here. Anything from relaxing, to all kinds of activities, water sports, cycling, and volleyball
Nice walk, bike ride, beach, clean, old house's, the grill restaurant great food, water cabs, bar, its a vacation nearhome without an airplan cost. I recommand!
Seems like a pain but in the summer, take the ferry and go over. It feels like the country, and there's beaches, a small amusement park, and bikes to rent. Fun fun fun.

The Toronto Islands are a great respite from the city. Just a short ferry ride away from Queens Quay, you'll find a beautiful park. Skip the amusement park (if the kids let you) and head for the beach. (There's even a nude beach, if that's your kind of thing!) Get lost in the hedge maze. Look for the haunted light...

Very relaxed and tranquil setting .Toronto has an extremely nice waterfront area.I have often explored these areas by boat.Considering I spend most of my summer in cottage country i still explore Toronto Island Park even though I have been a resident of Toronto for 55 years.
In March, you can take long walks & hardly see anyone else. Beautiful trees -- see the tree tour that identifies them,-- and view of the city and lake, plus waterbirds, turtles, etc.
It is understated and beautiful. It isn't hte sort of get away where you feel as though everything is manufactured to get more money out of you.Perfect place for a picnic or walk. The zoo is great.
Very easy to access via the scheduled boats. A wonderful walk around the island!

It's a great place to escape the city. Rent a bike and just go around the island. There are a few number of beaches on the island you can choose from. Peaceful and safe place for walk with the family, few facilities in the winter, but very enjoyable.

Toronto island has something for everyone! Just a short 10 minute ferry ride from downtown to one of three stops. Ward's Island is home to the quaint community of cottages and modem homes all interconnected by paved paths. (There are no roads for cars!) A great place to explore. Great place to relax any time of year. Bring your bikes, blades or just go for a walk. Pack a picnic basket and find a quiet spot of green away from Centreville to read the paper, take a nap, enjoy being away from city life without really leaving. Best views of the cityline.
Toronto Island Park is a place to take the kids, a significant other, friends, or just to enjoy on your own. There is nothing like it.

Bring bikes, pack a picnic and catch the ferry for a nice day away from the downtown...that's close to downtown. There's lots to do, or as little as you like if you're hoping to just relax. Plenty of picnic space and a little beach time make it almost like a mini-vacation away.
This is one of the best places to relax or do something. I was attached by one of the wild swans that roam the park but it was probably my fault.
a gorgeous place to go and take your bikes,kids,dogs,picnics-so close to the city yet an island away-

I love the ferry ride over to the island and the simple pleasure of strolling when you get there. Its an amazing getaway in the heart of the city.

Toronto Island park is excellent place to visit and it has a lot of natural beauty to offer and gives a good view of toronto downtown. easy way to explore is to get a bicycle and explore this wonderful place. in summer you can do camp here overnight and can enjoy food with wine. overall very good experience
The best spot for a sunday afternoon during summer or even a cool winter day! very relaxing, love to take the ferry, great view of To!

First of all, the ferry ride over is great. You can see the city skyscape.You have the choice of three different ferries(Ward's Island, Centre and Hanlan's Point).You can rent bicycles,row boats, stroll and just plain relax.
yet a world awaysome interesting fishing and good birding

My favourite thing to do here is take your bike (or rent one) hop the ferry and ride around the island finishing with lunch or ice cream cones. This place has something for everybody: busy and empty beaches, bikes, canoes, tours, etc. camping here for one night was awesome! as well as the light house ghost story.overall, you can make it whatever you want it: a fun, loud, crazy trip, or a calm, relaxing, romantic one.
Love the Island as a park experience - the amusement park wrecks that though, so if you're going to ride your bike and enjoy nature, perfect. Leave the rides for the Ex
Beautiful place for a walk with great views of Toronto.

This is a nice way to get out and enjoy the outdoors without having to drive far out of Toronto. Bring yourself food/drinks for a picnic. The ferry ride is lovely and cool even on the hottest days.And the Park - you can do a lot or do nothing and have a good time.
I loved feeling away from the city. A nice way to relax bring a book or just go for a picnic or a nice walk it is so calming

A great day out for the family and/or solo. Take the ferry to the islands and detach from the husstle and busstle of Toronto. You can rent bikes and go through the whole island or simply walk. It is a wonderlful peaceful place and yet has fun spots to interest the younger generation. It is great that it is open for special events. Wish I could afford to go more often. Now I am a senior and the budget is tight.
Great place in Summer, lots of people to watch etc...

Enjoy the entire day exploring this multi-island park. It's pictureque with great views of the Toronto skyline. Rent a bike and enjoy the day. Bring a picnic lunch. You will need your own boat or take the Island Ferry.

For kids Centre Island is a lot of fun. For adults there is a long ways of roller blading and/or biking you can get in. There is so much beauty on the island. Toronto has a great set of parks and recreational areas, which makes the Toronto island a rarely visited spot. Beautiful grounds. Amusement park fun for the younger ones.
A respite from the city. Picnic spots, playgrounds, a clothing optional beach (Hanlan's Point), a small amusement park.. Popular for cycling. Take the ferry to the park.
a great place to spend the day ,very relaxing lots to do or nothing depending on what you want
..just don't miss the last ferry back like we did!

My children and I spent many days and weekends at Toronto Island this past summer and I have to say that it was time very well spent. Toronto island is great for day trip with the kids.  You get to ride on a ferry to the island (a short ride - enough for kids to find it fun without getting bored).  At the island there is lots to do.  There are rides and carnival games (a bit expensive) or you could spend time at the sandy beach....
Awesome view of Toronto Island from my room.Been @ the Park a few years ago - Inviting and lots to do

I grew up in Toronto and Centre Island (and Wards Island and Hanlan's Point, etc..) has always been a unique haven just a few minutes ferry ride from the bustling downtown core of Toronto. there are lots of shade, bikes for rent, and enough space for everyone. getting there is very easy.

Toronto Island is great, but not small. Please do not imagine you will walk with your small children the whole length of the islands...it is big. The sail over to the island is worth the trip to the Park. Have lunch at the local resturant or take a packed lunch.
Could run aground, probably not serious, and a different style so close to downtown.  Great stay.

Toronto Island Park is a really unique spot in the city. On a hot humid summer day, the is,and will Always be a few degrees cooler, and a cool breeze. The island is a beautiful place for a picnic, for walking around, for sunning on the beach, and there are a few good places to eat, too! Great get away from the city, fabulous views of the city, peaceful park, lots of walking

The annual trip to the islands was always a favourite with our kids, from the ferry ride to get there, to the ice-reams on Centre Island and the rides at Centreville. And the long walk from end to end guaranteed a good night's sleep for everyone.

I'v visited Toronto many times in the past 30 years, with my husband, friends, babies, young children and teens, and going to the Islands on the ferry is always the highlight of the trip. ...and you like cityscapes, this is the place to capture Toronto's skyline. I went to Ward's Island, because that's the only place the ferry visits in the winter. Nice place to take the children in the summer. I was there for the air show and it was very windy and cold. Grandson had fun by the marina on the island.
nice place to picnic or rollerblade great in the summer the ferry trip over is nice way to see the skyline of toronto
This is a great place to visit with the kids, it's quite an adventure for the little ones, but food can be pricey and nos so good, so we always take our own picnic and treats.

Toronto is a pretty jammed city. Toronto Island offers the mini escape from the city with large open space where one can easily find peace & privacy. Great place to go for walks and roller blading without fear of being struck down by cars!

Lots to see and do on the island, but it's best if you have a bicycle because it's a big island. Beautiful trails, beaches, parks, and wildlife. Not a lot of entertainment.. exactly what you'd expect at Toronto waterfront. Had a lovely day but basically the surroundings were what could use a pick me up. Felt like a day at a regular park rather than amusement park.

It's great for a leisurely day for getting outside for a walk .Good for the kids.
Car free, can get away from the craziness of kiddie land and find lots of private, quiet spots... even a nude beach on the NW side

It is a wonderful place. The boat trip over is lovely. We spent ourlast day here and it was the hottest day we had. Boy were we gladto be there. It was hard to believe we were just a short hop away from the city. I would recommend anyone visiting Toronto to go there.
I love going here, only a short distance by ferry from the heart of the city. The only time it gets overwhelming is when the have the big events going on but most of the time this place is awesome.
I love going to the island on weekends in the summer. My boyfriend and I love to ride our bikes. It's cheap and sooooooooo relaxing. I just got so nostalgic thinking about it :)
Lots to do - very relaxing! Lots of special activities.

Only a short boat ride from central Toronto these islands make your perfect "sunday in the park". Here's something for everybody, but most of all there's the view to Toronto's impressive skyline. Make the trip. Spend a few hours. Enjoy it. And then go back to the hustle of the city
Take a slow ferry ride to a ideal location away from the hustle and bustle. Great views and very nice ambiance.

awesome view from the downtown - always cooler in the summer than downtown. nice place to bring the kids

Toronto Island as a whole is a like a little slice of tranquil in the busy city. The park is lovely, with plenty of sitting areas and trails. Definitely worth a visit... not to mention that the views of the city while you're on the ferry to the island are magnificent
Really enjoy coming here starting with the ferry ride which never seems to lose its appeal. It's a great place to come with your family especially with a picnic lunch.
Fun place to wander about and escape from the crazy city.
A fun way to spend a sunny day with the kids, great place to bike, picnic, or roller-blade. Centreville is a fun place for little children from 1 to 6.
Great for disc golf, a picnic with the kids, rollerblading or a bike ride.

The park is a quiet place for relaxing and walking on all but weekend days. If you have time during the week and want something like that, take the ferry over. One of the highlights is the ferry. Its always fun and worth a trip over and back.

Many cities have parks in their centres - but an island park? This wonderful escape to a lovely green oasis shouldn't be missed. Best in the summer when families from this multicultural city picnic and play, paddle in canoes and visit the small old fashioned theme park. The ferry rides there and back are just a bonus.

This is a great place to go cycling, to walk, to swim, and just to get away from the hubbub of downtown T.O.
Loved walking the island, but the massive increase in canada geese these last five years had really had a negative impact for those wishing to picnic on the once beautifully manicured lawns.

I have visted Toronto Island every summer for the last 10 years. My favourite times to go are in mid June and late August. Very tranquil and feels like you are in another city completely. Take your time, pack a lunch or buy it there...take your bike, bring the kids....LOVE IT!
A short ferry crossing well worth a visit in summer or Autumn. Loads on animals to see at the farm great for children a few rides too. Lovely area to sit and take in the atmosphere.

Lots to do for the whole family. Cycling, amusement park, etc..

I hate all the cars in Toronto, it's such a great city but it's not super walkable or even good for cyclists. Just minutes from the city, a nice little park to go to in the summer. Take the ferry

I have lived in Toronto all my life and the Toronto Islands are one of my favourite destinations. The cruise was very nice, but would have been even nicer if it was not in November, but spring of summer would have been better.

Great "daytrip" from "mainland", it's nature-meets-city, with awesome views of Toronto's skyline.The park itself is well kept, you can rent bikes and quadricycles, as well as enjoy an amusement park and go to the beach.It makes for a great break from the crazy Toronto city life.

This is a place to chill out with your family, friends or whoever. Definitely make a trip on a one summer day and you will not regret it. Make a walk to the Ward island and catch a boat from there. Lovely little park , more for small childrenTake a walk along the harbour and get the best boat deal from the venders but dont pay return as the ferry back is nice and free

Toronto Island is this city's warm weather playground , a delightful oasis just a short ferry ride from downtown. Here you will find acres of shady picnic grounds, playing fields for all manner of games, bike and boat rentals, a charming amusement park just for the kiddies, and several beaches, including a clothing optional area. Almost like Narnia - a totally unexpected enchanted place, just a few minutes ferry ride away from a mayor city, full of quiet nature. Ideal for a bike ride without cars. A great spot to take the whole family. Lots to see and do. I would highly recomend renting or taking your bikes. If you feel really ambitious you can also take your kayak over from Cherry Beach. Its a short paddle and a great way to work off a few pounds.

Didn't have a ton of time to explore much of the island, but it was clean and provided a very peaceful place to visit during my recent trip. Great views of the city and the lake. If you want to take a break from the city to relax, this is the place.
